         FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024
         National Transportation Safety Board Amendments Act of 2024
      
   
   
      Public Law 118-63
      138 STAT. 1025
      118th Congress
      May 16, 2024
      [H. R. 3935]
      AN ACT
      To amend title 49, United States Code, to reauthorize and improve the Federal Aviation Administration and other civil aviation programs, and for other purposes.
   
   
      Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,
      <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                id="HF9B5CD1EBB1E4392866EC919C27FCE4C"
                qb-display-quote="yes"
                section-type="section-one">
         1.
         SHORT TITLE; TABLE OF CONTENTS
         <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H9F78DB103C694E9CAFF9BC2AC4DA1596"
                      qb-display-quote="yes">
            (a)
            Short title
            This Act may be cited as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">
                  FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024
               .
         
         <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H89A40C577D83401E98504159242159DE"
                      qb-display-quote="yes">

      <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                id="H5B84932971174B3489F28E4FCE1247B0"
                qb-display-quote="yes"
                section-type="subsequent-section">
         2.
         DEFINITIONS
         In this Act:
         <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                     id="H355C8F9993FD49C991344D10A911A100"
                     qb-display-quote="yes">
            (1)
            Administrator
            Unless otherwise specified, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">Administrator means the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration.
         
         <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                     id="H0B514F4E2A2B419C944DD0559C28DE26"
                     qb-display-quote="yes">
            (2)
            Appropriate committees of Congress
            The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">appropriate committees of Congress means the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives.
         
         <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                     id="H4B9E6DD8C3A044C3A0A18DEECFEDA9E3"
                     qb-display-quote="yes">
            (3)
            Comptroller General
            The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">Comptroller General means the Comptroller General of the United States.
         
         <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                     id="H55A039BC685B4699864A1EE4781FD4EA"
                     qb-display-quote="yes">
            (4)
            FAA
            The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">FAA means the Federal Aviation Administration.
         
         <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                     id="HF0155B99BFB24191A503757DF8950E93"
                     qb-display-quote="yes">
            (5)
            NextGen
            The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">NextGen means the Next Generation Air Transportation System. 
         
         <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                     id="H2C4270072D3840DCBDDF59678A87B033"
                     qb-display-quote="yes">
            (6)
            Secretary
            Unless otherwise specified, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">Secretary means the Secretary of Transportation.

              style="OLC">
         II
         FAA OVERSIGHT AND ORGANIZATIONAL REFORM
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HF31D82A63E354D53B73480CB335AF737"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            201.
            FAA LEADERSHIP
            Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H3A6DC6D9F4CC4F83881DE89BF00225E4"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               in subsection (a) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">The Federal and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">
                     In general.—The Federal; and
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HED59564A367448C8A779661A6A226D5F"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H8EBA29800FFD496998192C64E0C68B8E"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HCADD28EA98764509AB61E5C294400236"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Administration leadership
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H050221B56999403A8217E6BCD8AA9B18"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Administrator
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H08E8511A4807408FB720B1A801D49DE8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           In general
                           The head of the Administration is the Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HFDB16542E5B649CCB259AE45AC18BD32"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Qualifications
                           The Administrator shall—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9792E0575D0C47AA919ECF544CA48E37"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              be a citizen of the United States;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD9293BBB91384D819B5EDE73B8A1554B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              not be an active duty member of the Armed Forces;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7483CB604B314E7C9BC23D2AEF61B707"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              not have retired from the Armed Forces within the 7 years preceding nomination; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC03069DAD8894659A9E6D105F5CCCFE7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iv)
                              have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCE7CE5A6D26B475EA4054E5BF57D4708"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           Fitness
                           In appointing an individual as Administrator, the President shall consider the fitness of such individual to carry out efficiently the duties and powers of the office.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6A323547B38F46EC9D7D412F236227FE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           Term of office
                           The term of office for any individual appointed as Administrator shall be 5 years.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H1239C5F151554E4784B6A2E882E2B41A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (E)
                           Reporting chain
                           Except as provided in subsection (f) or in other provisions of law, the Administrator reports directly to the Secretary of Transportation.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H279D0DA452BA4611A9A846A36EE88510"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Deputy Administrator
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H1CD25C1BFE924AB787B200B4A047104A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           In general
                           The Administrator has a Deputy Administrator, who shall be appointed by the President.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB6099CCF3FC249F49EDDCE23488498A5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Qualifications
                           The Deputy Administrator shall—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC2FD6E987A124ABC85939A310478ED69"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              be a citizen of the United States; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7DA736C34CFD46B7A835870F6FC24A19"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              have experience in organizational management and a field directly related to aviation.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H603F281CFEAE42719C6B0BBD049BF622"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           Fitness
                           In appointing an individual as Deputy Administrator, the President shall consider the fitness of the individual to carry out efficiently the duties and powers of the office, including the duty to act for the Administrator when the Administrator is absent or unable to serve, or when the office of Administrator is vacant.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H608C867F9EDF48838E08F50B493941C3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           Reporting chain
                           The Deputy Administrator reports directly to the Administrator.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8B295995708F4CAD945C559ACA376087"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (E)
                           Duties
                           The Deputy Administrator shall carry out duties and powers prescribed by the Administrator.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HED975EAB84BC49C198C4D40FADAB0C79"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (F)
                           Compensation
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H58AF39B7FBE84B68925D21B1E22A1187"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              Annual rate of basic pay
                              The annual rate of basic pay of the Deputy Administrator shall be set by the Secretary but shall not exceed the annual rate of basic pay payable to the Administrator.
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H71182F8C33444ACBB4A23D08B7BF8E48"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              Exception
                              A retired regular officer of the Armed Forces serving as the Deputy Administrator is entitled to hold a rank and grade not lower than that held when appointed as the Deputy Administrator and may elect to receive—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA46AB1BC07A24CDAB2D89E618768B2AA"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 the pay provided for the Deputy Administrator under clause (i); or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5777A7AAAF9942C2A4171E67AA17DB95"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 the pay and allowances or the retired pay of the military grade held.
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1A49748CD1EC4A11BB62EB80B2CA3C02"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              Reimbursement of expenses
                              If the Deputy Administrator elects to receive compensation described in clause (ii)(II), the Administration shall reimburse the appropriate military department from funds available for the expenses of the Administration.
                           
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6593673AB0724DE09732F7EF8E792AA7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Leadership of the Administration defined
                        In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">leadership of the Administration means—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF8D3027FB496455EA30EED77BC9F661A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           the Administrator under paragraph (1); and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H1FED9216255C4651BAAC3B612E215912"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           the Deputy Administrator under paragraph (2). 
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H2EDE47B9A1304F61AF127798CCEC0CEA"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            202.
            ASSISTANT ADMINISTRATOR FOR RULEMAKING AND REGULATORY IMPROVEMENT
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H8F452B6AB1444810948FE3E59BADA4CA"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement
               Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by striking subsections (c) and (d) and inserting the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HCA97F33FE50842889A327D2AF0F81624"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HE858B253D9E14C28BDD9B960B478553E"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement
                     There is an Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement who shall be appointed by the Administrator and shall—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA7234ABAB3F941DE8CC0E8FD146B7506"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        be responsible for developing and managing the execution of a regulatory agenda for the Administration that meets statutory and Administration deadlines, including by—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H24CE8775DFD0488CA6C2F27756750475"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           prioritizing rulemaking projects that are necessary to improve safety;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HEBE0E21EA1244D09A0B75564E788033D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           establishing the regulatory agenda of the Administration; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD82375A465634BD58D6BC3D505AE43EC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           coordinating with offices of the Administration, the Department, and other Federal entities as appropriate to improve timely feedback generation and approvals when required by law;
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC6CE4CD564094D6BBFC734D1C6BFB99F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        not delegate overall responsibility for meeting internal timelines and final completion of the regulatory activities of the Administration outside the Office of the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H42E863EFAA814EAD94F502868E9D8B65"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        on an ongoing basis, review the regulations of the Administration in effect to—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF2468C94C6A34D228073DEBB34FB5BF3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           improve safety;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3CC0E9643EBE43438DEB8CA511356213"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           reduce undue regulatory burden;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE9072B71D1CE470F9AB5D5A08F02DD44"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           replace prescriptive regulations with performance-based regulations, as appropriate;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9613DF6388AF4D018A2E0809E7591CE1"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           prevent duplicative regulations; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H1225D7E692D34631B1CFB3AB68DA4EEF"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (E)
                           increase regulatory clarity and transparency whenever possible;
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H13AE1BAD764B44158D14E275E045783B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        make recommendations for the review of the Administrator under subsection (f)(3)(C)(ii);
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE5E2136A156C4CAEB29A9C05B115BA75"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        receive, coordinate, and respond to petitions for rulemaking and for exemption as provided for in subpart A of part 11 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and provide an initial response to a petitioner not later than 30 days after the receipt of such a petition—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF6F9DCB13F4E4E75BF39CA1D7D4F6072"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           acknowledging receipt of such petition;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H94C3339358884EC0A00E30B21479F842"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           confirming completeness of such petition;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0AD2E2E2B0484FF0AAE17434D6D54186"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           providing an initial indication of the complexity of the request and how such complexity may impact the timeline for adjudication; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3B513E6F3D144A258181DD03F277CAF4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           requesting any additional information, as appropriate, that would assist in the consideration of the petition;
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD63B673422794FA4A13EEBEA8BE7ADF4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (6)
                        track the issuance of exemptions and waivers by the Administration to sections of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and establish a methodology by which to determine if it would be more efficient and in the interest of the public to amend a rule to reduce the future need of waivers and exemptions; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H631AEF6F6AF744238468FD77B83E83AB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (7)
                        promulgate regulatory updates as determined more efficient or in the best interest of the public under paragraph (6).
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H6E6C118475144D58B0D9CB1B856FB0B1"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     [Reserved].
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H3D6425E2C1F74861A2E85FEF4C54F67F"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Systemically addressing need for exemptions and waivers
               Not later than 30 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement of the FAA shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives on the methodology developed pursuant to section 106(c)(6) of title 49, United States Code (as added by this section).
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H30E8B82745CB4F0C8F7DF0A3CC977298"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            203.
            PROHIBITION ON CONFLICTING PECUNIARY INTERESTS
            Section 106(e) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows: 
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="H6E9E42E152DF4DD688A90ADBAF2D90D9"
                           style="OLC">
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBF46C5C2B1AA4ACF8DC11275C46CB213"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Prohibition on conflicting pecuniary interests
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF03E7CF8C77647B58B714299F9DAC5BF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The leadership of the Administration may not have a pecuniary interest in, or hold a financial interest in, an aeronautical enterprise or engage in another business, vocation, or employment.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEBB93036F12E401C90EE127D3570955F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Teaching
                     Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the Deputy Administrator may not receive compensation for teaching without prior approval of the Administrator.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H79F96C3F1E704F65846D4F6678AF9122"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Financial interest defined
                     In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">financial interest—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2E74625D545A4BE39C6A121E0737EEDB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        means—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5CACE108F4AE4C27BC9D81296FD31760"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           any current or contingent ownership, equity, or security interest;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7E793F74DCCE400D9E0B4944578D5959"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           any indebtedness or compensated employment relationship; or
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB69B673F88B64CE2BC9877F4FBCED967"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           any right to purchase or acquire any such ownership, equity, or security interest, including a stock option; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC4BD847BC325452A9B97DBD0B624E3D5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        does not include securities held in an index fund.
                     
                  
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H8D8DBC8A5E2E40CE958DAA6D76CAEEC8"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            204.
            AUTHORITY OF SECRETARY AND ADMINISTRATOR
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFABEA20BA41445719AB3D84D231B5A89"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Section 106(f) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H946B82C764C141718047509A15F191C3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in paragraph (1)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF2F6B2986EF643F0925CF4318CA4B343"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">paragraph (2) and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">paragraphs (2) and (3);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD9D385E5EE024C64AAB2DF4186D17007"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Neither and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">In exercising duties, powers, and authorities that are assigned to the Secretary or the Administrator under this title, neither; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H82CF92177ADD4C57A1424DE6D2199DD2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">a committee, board, or organization established by executive order. and inserting the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H9556A6EBA64D4BF7B7E2749E76929399"
                                    style="OLC">
                        a committee, board, council, or organization that is—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5C985EAEC0C04519900B1479AA0D18A0"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           established by executive order; or
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD6154096E56744DA8FE623C95D136D74"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           not explicitly directed by legislation to review the exercise of such duties, powers, and authorities by the Secretary or the Administrator.
                        
                        ; 
                     
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H0250FCB821A1442F8330219A36E0D72B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  in paragraph (2)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HECD2849391F14BA190B7FD1E1B619A6A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     in subparagraph (A)(ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">the acquisition and all that follows through the semicolon and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">the acquisition, establishment, improvement, operation, maintenance, security (including cybersecurity), and disposal of property, facilities, services, and equipment of the Administration, including all elements of the air traffic control system owned by the Administration;;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB3A8375D253845D1A25CA950478B40ED"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     in subparagraph (A)(iii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">paragraph (3) and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">paragraph (4); and 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H29481302E0B246BA853CD358A1014E79"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     in subparagraph (B) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">civil aviation, any matter for which the Administrator is the final authority under subparagraph (A), any duty carried out by the Administrator pursuant to paragraph (3), or the provisions of this title, or after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">with respect to;
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H722607FFC73743F0BB1C46976C717B2D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  in paragraph (3)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAAF3479A96044966972FEC961FECEBF0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     in subparagraph (A)—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE597B942BD8A418F82D412BDB6CCDBA7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">In the performance and inserting the following: 
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="HF538ADAC88714141BA937A613F01DBE4"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2692A31572C94EFB894632946321AA8E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              Issuance of regulations
                              In the performance
                           
                           ;
                        
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4DBECEED0F834C3AA21F1BA3A08A1A67"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">The Administrator shall act and inserting the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H05B9DB5D1BBC4C1BAB9357CC2910B24B"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE7D62365464B40EC930B40E2FD4E3A4A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              Petitions for rulemaking
                              The Administrator shall act
                           
                           ;
                        
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H04ECFA626894417284CC8A93063FB44C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iii)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">The Administrator shall issue and inserting the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H3E8AC738CFD24F2FB7C8ABFD27C23FBB"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBF8EF50128184AC39507868A29A604F7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              Rulemaking timeline
                              The Administrator shall issue
                           
                           ; and
                        
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H77643F2443104EDA94F95345A0097940"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iv)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">On February 1 and inserting the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H0F3A52816DD34A2483E2FC77A3F5089B"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1A973A70E56545798C24A434183A5D22"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iv)
                              Reporting requirement
                              On February 1
                           
                           ; and
                        
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H74A490C5D5F94EE2BAB1255586BF6FB3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     by striking subparagraphs (B) and (C) and inserting the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H3C17212916014A6597C80D6E7534187D"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H84CE890E4B68485884961B06E04A9F05"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Approval of Secretary of Transportation
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7A426B2E514B4F599D51D77F4F6AB894"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              In general
                              The Administrator may not issue, unless the Secretary of Transportation approves the issuance of the regulation in advance, a proposed regulation or final regulation that—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD20A92FE8F4B4A9DBD21481DACDE0DDF"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 is likely to result in the expenditure by State, local, and Tribal governments in the aggregate, or by the private sector, of $250,000,000 or more (adjusted annually for inflation beginning with the year following the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024) in any year; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6CF905C46B904E36AB1AED8113195CB3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 is significant.
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H47EFA767861E43A1A4AB11A8A162D945"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              Significant regulations
                              For purposes of this paragraph, a regulation is significant if the Administrator, in consultation with the Secretary (as appropriate), determines that the regulation—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3811529FE95A4909BD4E3F770F2030C6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 will have an annual effect on the economy of $250,000,000 or more (adjusted annually for inflation beginning with the year following the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024);
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFE61527A5F57430F84CD39202C9C484E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 raises novel or serious legal or policy issues that will substantially and materially affect other transportation modes; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H93E4A55C7B7047D6A99834E7CAA480F0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (III)
                                 adversely affects, in a substantial and material way, the economy, a sector of the economy, productivity, competition, jobs, the environment, public health or safety, or a State, local, or Tribal government or community.
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4DEAEA21410E4708A111E8CD1519F136"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              Emergency regulation
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5A37B3C9AE214ED9816C56D49F907434"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 In general
                                 In an emergency as determined by the Administrator, the Administrator may issue a final regulation described in clause (i) without prior approval of the Secretary.
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1604E005B93D48E2AD39E814BB337088"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 Objection
                                 If the Secretary objects to a regulation issued under subclause (II) in writing not later than 5 days (excluding Saturday, Sundays, and legal public holidays) after the issuance, the Administrator shall immediately rescind such regulation.
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDE48489BD41F4D2C8BB6B4E333E1C46B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iv)
                              Other regulations
                              The Secretary may not require that the Administrator submit a proposed or final regulation to the Secretary for approval, nor may the Administrator submit a proposed or final regulation to the Secretary for approval, if the regulation—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0012BD44AF184899A5DC5BC850374953"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 does not require the approval of the Secretary under clause (i) (excluding a regulation issued under clause (iii)); or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE665813A379C4C4D980522CB3276E461"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 is a routine or frequent action or a procedural action.
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H460D804DB6C441DBA6BBCA48203FE71E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (v)
                              Timeline
                              The Administrator shall submit a copy of any proposed or final regulation requiring approval by the Secretary under clause (i) to the Secretary, who shall either approve the regulation or return the regulation to the Administrator with comments not later than 30 days after receiving the regulation. If the Secretary fails to approve or return the regulation with comments to the Administrator not later than 30 days after receiving such regulation, the regulation shall be deemed to have been approved by the Secretary.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA586FCADBC634F63A7E33FD80BF7D5E7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           Periodic review
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1D632D860DCB4BFAB405B3BDF1214280"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              In general
                              For any significant regulation issued after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, in addition to the review requirements established under section 5.13(d) of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, the Administrator shall review any significant regulation 3 years after the effective date of such regulation.
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDBA317B56FE54CF0BFD313EE8A5979D9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              Discretionary review
                              The Administrator may review any regulation that has been in effect for more than 3 years.
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEA7B792A2E8B45C0BA56F58437504481"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              Substance of review
                              In performing a review under clause (i) or (ii), the Administrator shall determine if—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC0469ABE5D7C491FBA2BAB3C7A9D6C06"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 the cost assumptions supporting the regulation were accurate;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5C9315B717FE4D0984490687DFB596D7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 the intended benefit of the regulation is being realized;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCBCA0F2B48CF45AEB51B323B3F2D0217"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (III)
                                 the need remains to continue such regulation as in effect; and
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8706A4011E6B48D88770BDA909067949"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (IV)
                                 the Administrator recommends updates to such regulation based on the review criteria specified in section 5.13(d) of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations.
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB9BB14008A8B45D3B124FE08BE859979"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iv)
                              Review management
                              Any periodic review of a regulation under this subparagraph shall be managed by the Assistant Administrator for Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement, who may task an advisory committee or the Management Advisory Council established under subsection (p) to assist in performing the review.
                           
                        
                        ; 
                     
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H91C6F055249A48F2BFD074D7CFFCC782"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  by redesignating paragraphs (3) and (4) as paragraphs (4) and (5), respectively; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7A3071CB53244C9895742EC06C20E35B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  by inserting after paragraph (2) the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H584BC9BE2FAE4263BD09E7D3E3E1AF52"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF176D3380D06434890A29F9F8E318D57"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Duties and powers of the Administrator
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H339EA350A98C4085A34C001132CE8887"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           In general
                           The Administrator shall carry out—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCBD51F39FA114EC586135E4E0BB32196"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              the duties and powers of the Secretary under this subsection related to aviation safety (except duties and powers related to transportation, packaging, marking, or description of hazardous material) and stated in—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H367E0D5E183F4BFA815E752E9535C28B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 subsections (c) and (d) of section 1132;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H637AE7698F3A4ECD9EB34DF267617212"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 sections 40101(c), 40103(b), 40106(a), 40108, 40109(b), 40113(a), 40113(c), 40113(d), 40113(e), 40114(a), and 40117;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H20938912A94140A7BB0F32E9247773E8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (III)
                                 chapter 443;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6018D17B09164FD5B028FF6D461A3BC0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (IV)
                                 chapter 445, except sections 44502(a)(3), 44503, and 44509;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H17295150DC914595ACC73BF6742BBF44"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (V)
                                 chapter 447, except sections 44721(b) and 44723;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H517F30AE128B4F30B5F039D37A392ED6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (VI)
                                 chapter 448;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBB428EB0E0F7404CBCA746985824B527"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (VII)
                                 chapter 451;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEA588348B8BF4583A5B1AD1ED2227A57"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (VIII)
                                 chapter 453;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB9133CC1D282449AAC492CD742BE3F8E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (IX)
                                 section 46104;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9636476E331B4B0EAF07CD9689960996"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (X)
                                 subsections (d) and (h)(2) of section 46301, section 46303(c), sections 46304 through 46308, section 46310, section 46311, and sections 46313 through 46320;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD40E92754F6041AE963B8CBFCC953FFB"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (XI)
                                 chapter 465;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD7F0313FB69A4994827A938633CF17E1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (XII)
                                 chapter 471;
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6DC78F305F9E4934B2C4184F138277E0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (XIII)
                                 chapter 475; and
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBE61BEEC8CC7467287A86FA6F77F1EA5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (XIV)
                                 
                                    chapter 509 of title 51; and
                              
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3DE15292E41941A5A5CA9620B44A1887"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              such additional duties and powers as may be prescribed by the Secretary.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCB6713DAD0C6445F9538E06048286804"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Applicability
                           Section 40101(d) applies to the duties and powers specified in subparagraph (A).
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H02B4E2B46CE4464FAED49FD0E80A249E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           Transfer
                           Any of the duties and powers specified in subparagraph (A) may only be transferred to another part of the Department if specifically provided by law or in a reorganization plan submitted under chapter 9 of title 5.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H98EE324E86A94F37BDC455F07AD419AB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           Administrative finality
                           A decision of the Administrator in carrying out the duties or powers specified in subparagraph (A) is administratively final.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA917474174D24E17BD84BE0BFF2632D7"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Conforming amendment
               Section 106 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (g) and inserting the following: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HDC6ACDA7AA30440BB89E39FB5487E7E9"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H4B36A95A786A40568F95BE826E3E493F"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (g)
                     [reserved].
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFADCA90B765D43E6AA888107CB6D4C33"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Preservation of existing authority
               Nothing in this section or the amendments made by this section shall be construed to restrict any authority vested in the Administrator by statute or by delegation that was in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of this Act.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H7B284C5EF2894CAC9158A71FCDE7BDCF"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            205.
            REGULATORY MATERIALS IMPROVEMENT
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H9F090A15861E4C5683A7A620CA6ADBDC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Internal regulatory process review
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6B3C5DFB3B964FEFAA2D602C20BF36ED"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H87ECAF35EA314C1382EAC8F87919809E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Review team
                     The Administrator shall establish a regulatory process review team (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">review team) comprising of FAA employees and individuals described in paragraph (2) to develop recommendations to improve the timeliness, performance, and accountability of the development and promulgation of regulatory materials.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF622AA34190045DC9836B48E15F2BE4C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Report
                     The review team shall submit to the Administrator a report with recommendations in accordance with the deadlines specified in paragraph (5).
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF6CC01E1402347AA857981D4C72279D7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Other members; consultation
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFBCAA8CBA7D84AAEB2A470AA7CA2DDDB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     In general
                     The review team shall include at least 3 outside experts and or academics with relevant experience or expertise in aviation safety and at least 1 outside expert with relevant experience or expertise in improving the performance, accountability, and transparency of the Federal regulatory process, particularly as such process relates to aviation safety.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H934223EEDC084CB5BE31D27DAC3DDD8F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Consultation
                     The review team may, as appropriate, consult with industry stakeholders.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE5CA39CAC9C2403786C9F83411C9FEBE"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Contents of review
                  In conducting the review required under paragraph (1), the review team shall do the following:
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEBCF9A40FA4141718CFA71B9AB9B3668"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Develop a proposal for rationalizing processes and eliminating redundant administrative review of regulatory materials within the FAA, particularly when FAA-sponsored rulemaking committees and stakeholders have collaborated on the proposed regulations.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H05DEC323439A46649739A838526F3D95"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     With respect to each office within the FAA that reviews regulatory materials, assess—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H23935AEC51AB4B3491DF48A0E831841E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        the timeline assigned to each such office to complete the review of regulatory materials;
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBEEDB39A86D74AC4BC9A156A1D3E6336"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        the actual time spent for such review;
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H055808870BAC45FC845B747C4B5EEE92"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iii)
                        opportunities to reduce the actual time for such review; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5A31E797F9C544C68AC43FE42B157165"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iv)
                        whether clear roles, responsibilities, requirements, and expectations are clearly defined for each office required to review the regulatory materials.
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCCFB857761844CE19C5644FC378B1D3E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     Define and document the roles and responsibilities of each office within the FAA that develops, drafts, or reviews each kind of regulatory material in order to ensure that hiring reflects who, where, and how the employees of each such office function in the rulemaking framework.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBB1DF63542C14423B15B5154EF2F2D44"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     Describe any organizational changes or the need to hire additional FAA employees, if necessary, and take into consideration whether current positions are staffed, to reduce delays in publication of regulatory materials.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5A96235246FD4F1B8E5A3EA4A5C1481C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     In order to provide the public with detailed information on the progress of the development of regulatory materials, identify reporting mechanisms and develop a template and appropriate system metrics for making publicly available on a website a progress tracker that updates to show the major stages (as determined by the Administrator) of the development of regulatory materials as such materials are initiated, in progress, and completed.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD6BB9248B840437888F28A349CF60103"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     Consider changes to the best practices of the FAA under rules governing ex parte communications, including communications with international validating authorities, and with consideration of the public interest in transparency, to provide flexibility for FAA employees to discuss regulatory materials, particularly for such regulatory materials related to enhancing aviation safety and the aviation international leadership of the United States.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H837E496FA17A4EA8965327CD01622BE6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (G)
                     Recommend methods by which the FAA can incorporate research funded by the Department of Transportation, in addition to consensus standards and conformance assessment processes developed by recognized industry standards organizations into regulatory materials, to keep pace with rapid changes in aviation technologies and processes.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H657BCAE3E56748C58727FAC58F7C8792"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (H)
                     Recommend mechanisms to optimize the roles of the Office of the Secretary of Transportation and the Office of Management and Budget, with the objective of improving the efficiency of regulatory activity.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H45ECB5D179AE44E8B394340F55B14DC9"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Action plan
                  The Administrator shall develop and transmit to the appropriate committees of Congress an action plan to implement, as appropriate, the recommendations developed by the review team.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H105B874354924DF3907BBE6FE6B6379B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Deadlines
                  The requirements of this section shall be subject to the following deadlines:
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD0F056B5C3E4420A93A23E0D573F28EF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this section, the review team shall complete the evaluation required under paragraph (1) and submit to the Administrator the report of the review team on such evaluation.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF07AEF7E1641436F8416C6D6031D67B0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Not later than 30 days after the date on which the review team submits the report under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall develop and publish the action plan under paragraph (4).
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H15CD8F9FD41B4E79AD1568188943C17D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  Sunset
                  The review team shall terminate upon completion of the requirements under paragraph (5).
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3C7570166911475298ACC7D890030440"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  Administrative procedure requirements inapplicable
                  The provisions of subchapter II of chapter 5, and chapter 7, of title 5, United States Code (commonly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Administrative Procedure Act) shall not apply to any activities of the review team in carrying out the requirements of this section.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2839A224237D4A409993480B24EA1BAB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (8)
                  Regulatory materials defined
                  In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">regulatory materials means rules, advisory circulars, statements of policy, and other materials related to aviation safety regulations, as well as other materials pertaining to training and operation of aeronautical products.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFE407C4CC3FC4214A9A0484F71A73ADA"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Review of non-regulatory materials
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H23D2D93CA80B4BDD8B45326E6CC2B4E7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
