                  (2)
                  by inserting after subsection (c) the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HFB53E8A0CB29487C9C1FE4E9A5B3BCEC"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H6BF03D773C974FFBB3F6808A07141E2A"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Non-compliant airports
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H753587D040494B9D914F248D3B2E9FFC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           The Secretary shall include in the plan a detailed statement listing airports the Secretary has reason to believe are not in compliance with grant assurances or other requirements with respect to airport lands and shall include—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB54F2C06353043CFBE76DEDE197B6A46"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              the circumstances of noncompliance;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7F9E284EAFDD4DC6AE9FCBFD89EBA7AC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              the timeline for corrective action with respect to such noncompliance; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H23DD7BF0CD9D4E708D3D7CD5DE4F2B08"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              any corrective action the Secretary intends to require to bring the airport sponsor into compliance.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC95D4418452646ADA14A33F4E7D2FDF1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Listing
                           The Secretary is not required to conduct an audit or make a final determination before including an airport on the list referred to in paragraph (1).
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"

         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H10C037202EE74ADF9FCCA8FD7D7DCA20"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            220.
            SAFETY AND EFFICIENCY THROUGH DIGITIZATION OF FAA SYSTEMS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H77D4BBCAD2C1475D895B001E54143392"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H0D40531819F74D2D914B9C0258F13BDC"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  identify, at the discretion of the Administrator, not less than 3 processes of the FAA that result in a certification and require paper-based information exchange between external entities and the FAA or offices within the FAA (such as an aircraft certification, aircraft registration, or airmen certification) or authorization, an exemption, or a letter of authorization; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2F288AF632C44994802AE1B8DA0ED522"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  initiate the digitization of such processes.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HBBA622650B6741D8A968D09B1F801382"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Requirements
               In carrying out the digitization required under subsection (a), the Administrator shall ensure that the digitization of any process allows for—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9676EBB79D68400098B26605C74D9026"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  an applicant to track the application of such applicant throughout the period of submission and review of such application; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB44B3CBAA6964691BCF1B12686CE1B64"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  the status of the application to be available upon demand to the applicant, as well as FAA employees responsible for reviewing and making a decision on the application.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H7F514BC8778B491DB22403CB09BB4046"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Briefing to Congress
               Not later than 2 years after the date on which the Administrator initiates the digitization under subsection (a)(2), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the progress of such digitization.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD1B6231DDC1A40AD8B3718DD6A8E82C3"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Definition of digitization
               In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">digitization means the transition from a predominantly paper-based system to a system centered on the use of a data management system and the internet.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H2CB4204E698F4CD59246F7DE13CFB8EB"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            221.
            FAA TELEWORK
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HEC989B03FDED4C64A8EBD27B3E81BD88"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               The Administrator—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H40774DD5A17D4C4391D9454FEC12F2D2"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  may establish telework policies for employees of the FAA that allow for the Administrator to reduce the office footprint and associated expenses of the FAA, if appropriate, increase workforce retention, and provide flexibilities that the Administrator demonstrates increases efficiency and effectiveness of the Administration, while requiring that any such policy—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H94D4B050D9A44D84BB07ED504B68F01A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     does not adversely impact the mission of the FAA;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H43E850C917B24CA59D8B11FAEE48AE5F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     does not reduce the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H310A19622020430DB68016D509338C7F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     for any employee that is designated as an officer or executive in the FAA Executive System or a political appointee (as such term is defined in section 106 of title 49, United States Code)—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H82B49BA2853A480687892FDB0E3EE081"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        maximizes time at a duty station for such employee, excluding official travel; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB6BF29958F574102849F88302AD11CB8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        may include telework provisions as determined appropriate by the Administrator, commensurate with official duties for such employee;
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7CDCAE2D70124ADF8599F99022BB4A92"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     provides for on-the-job training opportunities for FAA personnel that are not less than such opportunities available in 2019;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H513763D170654F67948F41AEFA3CDC7A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     reflects the appropriate work status of employees based on the job functions of such employee;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H77EC46A06A13435BBB54DD46ADBA7F61"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     optimizes the work status of inspectors, investigators, and other personnel performing safety-related functions to ensure timely completion of safety oversight activities;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H13E114E9C245422EB6E14E550F8EE7B6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (G)
                     provides for personnel, including such personnel performing work related to aircraft certification and flight standards, who are responsible for actively working with regulated entities, external stakeholders, or other members of the public to be—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE5E35C46677B4B7E9A6A7A12C4BFFA50"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        routinely available on a predictable basis for in-person and virtual communications with external persons; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H614812E5CAE7444F9CACCE8E0AB57B17"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        not hindered from meeting with, visiting, auditing, or inspecting facilities or projects of regulated persons due to any telework policy; and
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7066027EBA2A44789CF9011FA7DF8E26"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (H)
                     provides opportunities for in-person dialogue, collaboration, and ideation for all employees;
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H102A928F29004604A7D7D269876A5985"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  ensures that locality pay for an employee of the FAA accurately reflects the telework status and duty station of such employee; 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF5E933AC22D442359307E92D5D61E3CB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  may not establish a telework policy for an employee of the FAA unless such employee will be provided with secure network capacity, communications tools, necessary and secure access to appropriate agency data assets and Federal records, and equipment sufficient to enable such employee to be fully productive; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCC126DDAD04241C58CA099E21AF52447"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, shall evaluate and address any telework policies in effect on the day before such date of enactment to ensure that such policies meet the requirements of paragraph (1).
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HB1ADF40B8E1E4FA7B810B3AE7273844B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Congressional update
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and 1 year thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on any telework policies currently in place, the implementation of such policies, and the benefits of such policies.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H9614CF8A60AF4A04924ED31EC88CFF9D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Consultation
               If the Administrator determines that telework agreements need to be updated to implement the requirements of subsection (a), the Administrator shall, prior to updating such agreements, consult with—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H905E5D2663554F6C8FF48CD9C16C261F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  exclusive bargaining representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9337CF3E2D364FAFA5D102977EE973BB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  labor organizations certified under such section as the exclusive bargaining representative of airway transportation systems specialists and aviation safety inspectors and engineers of the FAA.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H43F2918800AB42F9B96F17E769010200"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            222.
            REVIEW OF OFFICE SPACE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFFFABDE799C542ACBF89C601F230571B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               FAA review
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4ADF5482FB0F4EDABEBFD9619E718F29"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Initiation of review
                  Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall initiate an inventory review of the domestic office footprint of the Department of Transportation.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB1EABBE302C449ABB69172C9B46A45D3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Completion of review
                  Not later than 30 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall complete the inventory review required under paragraph (1).
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HC090106A4E214E8F8E794B3EFAE88282"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Contents of review
               In completing the review under subsection (a), the Secretary shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE49B9D38A0954C8484A1DA1854CD7204"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  delineate the domestic office footprint, as determined appropriate by the Secretary;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB14636635D8E46A1B133401DB7FA6C05"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  determine space adequacy related to—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAF0E5B0F8CCB4D7BB5C84784B5889741"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the Architectural Barriers Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 4151 et seq.) and the corresponding accessibility guidelines established under part 1191 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5E769D8923184D39BE76D6732CBFE06C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12101 et seq.);
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA8EB2CC23B814E2996070D18A726E4C0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  determine the feasible occupancy of such space, and provide the methodology used to make the determination;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD7BE328AD1E849119EF78C0AE4A22B3C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  determine the number of individuals who are full-time equivalent employees, other support personnel, or contractors that have each such unit as a duty station and determine how telework policies will impact the usage of such space;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC39EEAF2A87A4C3DB695793CED362888"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  calculate the amount of available, unused, or underutilized space in each such space;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD399775255B04397B64F03CD1A204372"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  consider any lease terms for leased space contained in the domestic office footprint, including cost and effective dates for each such lease; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB901C584F724478699636FD827CC77B6"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  based on the findings in paragraphs (2) through (6), and any other metrics the Secretary determines relevant, provide recommendations for optimizing the use of office space across the Department in consultation with appropriate employee labor representatives.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H178511185242470B94B9676E8D0D4FA5"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Report
               Not later than 4 months after completing the review under subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a final report that proposes opportunities to optimize the domestic office footprint of the FAA (and associated costs). In compiling such final report, the Secretary shall describe opportunities for—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF01D73BB84F74ECA9F56A474BF8E6308"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  consolidation of offices within a reasonable distance, as determined by the Senior Real Property Officer of the Department of Transportation, from one another;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H11609DC594B54E89B079EA30A9A04510"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  the collocation of regional or satellite offices of separate modes of the Department, including the costs and benefits of shared amenities; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H11EA993347DF43ABABA06C8E343C1466"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  the use of coworking spaces instead of permanent offices.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H59A31CB065134D77AF0C906D934D4C72"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Domestic office footprint defined
               In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">domestic office footprint means buildings, offices, facilities, and other real property rented, owned, or occupied by the FAA or Department—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H83B99DC87DB14D34BF99AF7735407F37"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in which employees report for permanent or temporary duty that are not FAA Airport Traffic Control Towers, Terminal Radar Approach Control Facilities, Air Route Traffic Control Centers, and Combined Control Facilities; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H839C4D1668FF46E6BAC910E6B11C0988"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  which are located within the United States.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H7938B151E9B54C909E6A9D67E88409EC"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            223.
            RESTORATION OF AUTHORITY
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H46D103F488CB418CACC18566F0873C32"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               
                  Chapter 401 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 40118 the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H3A8522C9FE554F2B8911F7C94D2744D3"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAF6F18ABBC7F4FBE904CAC17EFF639C4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     40119.
                     SENSITIVE SECURITY INFORMATION
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H5EA13201AF2E444C88F3286BF95C10A1"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Disclosure
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9FD7E7F4D5784289BC1CC3CCA99C2D2C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Regulations prohibiting disclosure
                           Notwithstanding the establishment of a Department of Homeland Security, the Secretary of Transportation, in accordance with section 552(b)(3)(B) of title 5, shall prescribe regulations prohibiting disclosure of information obtained or developed in ensuring security under this title if the Secretary of Transportation decides disclosing the information would—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA3EABB91A54C408D82F59473A042CD5D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              be an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H511D8FB9F535441DB1A8416CB2CB8844"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              reveal a trade secret or privileged or confidential commercial or financial information; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEE7762280674425C80AEFEB566E6CBC1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              be detrimental to transportation safety.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2BAB4B814EB64057B4ADFB988E44CC54"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Disclosure to congress
                           Paragraph (1) shall not be construed to authorize information to be withheld from a committee of Congress authorized to have such information.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H55E5AF307FE84A7588CE7295E13FCF7A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Rule of construction
                           Nothing in paragraph (1) shall be construed to authorize the designation of information as sensitive security information (as such term is defined in section 15.5 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations) to—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2752B1EA2E7C4B2C991AB63728338EF0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              conceal a violation of law, inefficiency, or administrative error;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0FD2518FE14E4E93B7FA18037337D29F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              prevent embarrassment to a person, organization, or agency;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2C6AA63C822049CC8FA4F971D778DB6E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              restrain competition; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE8E8B7449977415E8D187402948BC84A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              prevent or delay the release of information that does not require protection in the interest of transportation security, including basic scientific research information not clearly related to transportation security.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H04CEA0406D64427AA780B1BECA1A90A3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Law enforcement disclosure
                           Section 552a of title 5 shall not apply to disclosures that the Administrator may make from the systems of records of the Federal Aviation Administration to any Federal law enforcement, intelligence, protective service, immigration, or national security official in order to assist the official receiving the information in the performance of official duties.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HE01B48B1DFD646839F6AD51D9D305DA6"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Transfers of duties and powers prohibited
                        Except as otherwise provided by law, a duty or power under this section may not be transferred to another department, agency, or instrumentality of the Federal Government. 
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H79BD5D01A19044269B4721BEB66D60C4"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Effective date
               The amendments made by this section shall be effective as of October 5, 2018, and all authority restored to the Secretary and the FAA under this section shall be treated as if such authority had never been repealed by the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254).
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H757E762CDBC0441193783ACFCFEE3CBF"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Conforming amendment
               The analysis for chapter 401 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 40118 the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HF49FC7BC5FFF4607872C10394BA86534"
                              style="OLC">
                  
                     40119. Sensitive security information.
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H0CAEA5E64BD44D09812D22A3F145297A"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            224.
            FAA PARTICIPATION IN INDUSTRY STANDARDS ORGANIZATIONS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H78961843C9344229AECD8ECA5A1800DF"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               The Administrator shall encourage the participation of employees of the FAA, as appropriate, in the activities of recognized industry standards organizations to advance the adoption, reference, and acceptance rate of standards and means of compliance developed by such organizations by the Administrator.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H986205D181754E038AFA1E10E436395D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Participation
               An employee of the FAA directed by the Administrator to participate in a working group, task group, committee, or similar body of a recognized industry standards organization shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H46CBB9C7D7004CB2AD21EF5583050F0D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  actively participate in the discussions and work of such organization;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H304F4223EE51404FBC85910F2A703D12"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  accurately represent the position of the Administrator on the subject matter of such discussions and work;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H96405EF22BC6450B8823981DAD87CED5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  contribute to the development of work products of such organization, unless determined to be inappropriate by such organization;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4E55A864BE7D4F99A9B81B4410A19ACF"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  make reasonable efforts to identify and make any concerns of the Administrator relating to such work products known to such organization, including through providing formal comments, as may be allowed for under the procedures of such organization;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H49EA1BAFD08F4A03BD24B265BC77DAF1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  provide regular updates to other FAA employees and management on the progress of such work products; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8A82205B2361430EBCC0FC65F323930F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  seek advice and input from other FAA employees and management, as needed.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD60EB42812C244FA847FDEC7A795FC88"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Recognized industry standards organization defined
               In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">recognized industry standards organization means a domestic or international organization that—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H25A7D4BF0773416DBB2A525F0D3ED75E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  uses agreed upon procedures to develop aviation-related industry standards or means of compliance, including standards or means of compliance that satisfy FAA requirements or guidance;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCBD2B97C4F4F4E0F99BE9128AE23121B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  is comprised of members of the public, including subject matter experts, industry representatives, academics and researchers, and government employees; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBF8DF8606F464958B386A1D22A6D2E08"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  has had at least 1 standard or means of compliance accepted by the Administrator or referenced in guidance material or a regulation issued by the FAA after the date of enactment of the Vision 100—Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act (Public Law 108–176).
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HA5511CE84A054BD582A92EC2464E3E97"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            225.
            SENSE OF CONGRESS ON USE OF VOLUNTARY CONSENSUS STANDARDS
            It is the sense of Congress that the Administrator should make every effort to abide by the policies set forth in the circular of the Office of Management and Budget, titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">Federal Participation in the Development and Use of Voluntary Consensus Standards and Conformity Assessment Activities (A–119).
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H11B178AAD7904149A5D66F4BB5B8DE61"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            226.
            REQUIRED DESIGNATION
            The Administrator shall designate any aviation rulemaking committee convened under this Act pursuant to section 106(p)(5) of title 49, United States Code.
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H175651667E544150AC47EE0DA04F466A"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            227.
            ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES FRANCHISE FUND
            Title I of the Department of Transportation and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1997 (49 U.S.C. 40113 note) is amended under the heading <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">Administrative Services Franchise Fund by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">shall be paid in advance and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">may be reimbursed after performance or paid in advance.
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H678DBA61B9104447BEBB7C77E2F985BE"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            228.
            COMMERCIAL PREFERENCE
            Section 40110(d) of title 49, United States Code, is further amended—
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HB314E931DA534BE58D55B3A2D43FCE8A"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">and implement and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">, implement, and periodically update;
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H911AFD52B72C408DAD9221712EC16726"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               in paragraph (2) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">the new acquisition management system developed and implemented and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">the acquisition management system developed, implemented, and periodically updated each place it appears;
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HD88A8646BD714E9081B59898A37C60D5"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (3)
               in paragraph (3)—
               <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7AB6C5FB0B5E42B09B90F558BDC8B3B3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (A)
                  in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)—
                  <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H24F7D2AC49D0460FB9482D20BBF60A2B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (i)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">new; and
                  
                  <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H55DCF63C9F664FFDB7874E3858DF0990"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (ii)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and implemented and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">, implemented, and periodically updated; and
                  
               
               <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H23D5668D71FD4155B240951F8B1110C4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (B)
                  in subparagraph (B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Within and all that follows through <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">the Administrator and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">The Administrator;
               
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H09950C59BDCE434CBFD7B4B9F97BFD27"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (4)
               by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5); and
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H9B9D36459300417C8DFD928A1AAE05CD"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (5)
               by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H70A54DF568D34328B0C0310B35EBD61D"
                              style="OLC">
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H12A3B62F7E6F45AB830246A788C06D99"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Commercial products and services
                     In implementing and updating the acquisition management system pursuant to paragraph (1), the Administrator shall, whenever possible—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE479AA31F8794F809EA8107B757C11F8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        describe the requirements with respect to a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services in terms of—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAF69B6EB48FD4658961C4A3337645C69"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           functions to be performed;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA3B744F4D4354878BE26641DEEAE3435"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           performance required; or
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF3F1F0E6C68947CCB50E814D6B66B946"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           essential physical and system characteristics;
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB39C4F1A2ED4443B9E69B3662ADD86CF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        ensure that commercial services or commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, ensure that nondevelopmental items other than commercial products may be procured to fulfill such solicitation;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H75D3EC981A1A47299E25DF666CC9140A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        provide offerors of commercial services, commercial products, and nondevelopmental items other than commercial products an opportunity to compete in any solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE68C1F74069F45EEA6C6F73275AF47F3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        revise the procurement policies, practices, and procedures of the Administration to reduce any impediments to the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA5A69A36304049239909DA7089D01DFE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        ensure that any procurement of new equipment takes into account the life cycle, reliability, performance, service support, and costs to guarantee the acquisition of equipment that is of high quality and reliability resulting in greater performance and cost-related benefits; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H536F913356014123881E3437F22EE422"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        ensure that procurement officials—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFDC3F25E02C548EC8E0027DBE502DEA5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           acquire commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products to meet the needs of the Administration;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1E9ECDAB5251429AA40E6C5FDB8860FB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           in a solicitation for the procurement of supplies or services, state the specifications for such supplies or services in terms that enable and encourage bidders and offerors to supply commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, to supply nondevelopmental items other than commercial products;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBF1CB7835BDC4B76A0917B30BD5C5F9F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           require that prime contractors and subcontractors at all levels under contracts with the Administration incorporate commercial services, commercial products, or nondevelopmental items other than commercial products as components of items supplied to the Administration;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H434F4E26849943E996266F7C47474DF8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           modify procurement requirements in appropriate circumstances to ensure that such requirements can be met by commercial services or commercial products, or to the extent that commercial products suitable to meet the needs of the Administration are not available, nondevelopmental items other than commercial products; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBDE0FBCF44D54972AB24871D8A7EA0B9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (v)
                           require training of appropriate personnel in the acquisition of commercial products and commercial services.
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H1E25B840BAAE4648A1C521B6602076A7"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            229.
            ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION STEERING COMMITTEE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD30F76420EF74CE398E741AF9C029D7A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Establishment
               Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Advanced Aviation Technology and Innovation Steering Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Steering Committee) to assist the FAA in planning for and integrating advanced aviation technologies.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE76F6CDBCAF04E32815D9B0FEBEBDDEA"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Purpose
               The Steering Committee shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H187DA3B67F5546C5906E6C439CBCD5C0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  create and regularly update a comprehensive strategy and action plan for integrating advanced aviation technologies into the national airspace system and aviation ecosystem; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H12C5D8FB9C394111A4D99ECE9AC2EAFF"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  provide direction and resolution for complex issues related to advanced aviation technologies that span multiple offices or lines of business of the FAA, as needed.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H00B9C0982FD44BB28B5C797F4483E77C"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Chair
               The Deputy Administrator of the FAA shall serve as the Chair of the Steering Committee.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HB264BB642D6D414CA25B4A772F9B4C6B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Composition
               In addition to the Chair, the Steering Committee shall consist of the Assistant or Associate Administrator, or the designee of such Administrator, of each of the following FAA offices:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H78C1D70A9CB8449B885361905662ACEB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Office of Aviation Safety.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB112959EE1E54516918397315ECAAB07"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Air Traffic Organization.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA243D013CCE5458BA42AE9760F89D320"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Office of Airports.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5E38006CC56044AA84FD0260595B327C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Office of Commercial Space Transportation.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H447DD800C9974893A71AE02A76A49A80"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Office of Finance and Management.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE41423E17B6E428587837466651A656A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  Office of the Chief Counsel.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HFA9BBB3A4554497FB368B3D4905BC0FA"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  Office of Rulemaking and Regulatory Improvement.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB0355C4A2AE948D5BA21A91FDDF37AF8"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (8)
                  Office of Policy, International Affairs, and Environment.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2F2578664A6C45C4BA9FBE9079A6C6F9"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (9)
                  Office of Security and Hazardous Materials Safety.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H36AFB41F1E2D4824ABBBDB6CCFAD3966"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (10)
                  Any other Office the Administrator determines necessary.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H0C02A1DA095A41A78020A98D89C32AAF"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            230.
            REVIEW AND UPDATES OF CATEGORICAL EXCLUSIONS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HBE18D508EDBB4D78BC45745E6D353110"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Review
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall identify each categorical exclusion under the jurisdiction of the Department of Transportation, including any operating administration within the Department.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H64F4BE630D164AD8BB6C74E91A69E331"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               New categorical exclusions for airport projects
               Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H13092B740BDB4816B223F20E937A31DD"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  review the categorical exclusions applied by other operating administrations identified in subsection (a); and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5D1B8AF795E743F99DCD543080FE74D3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  take such action as may be necessary to adopt, as relevant and appropriate, new categorical exclusions that meet the requirements of section 1508.4 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations, from among categorical exclusions reviewed by the Secretary in paragraph (1) for use by the FAA.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HBB23980DC2DC4AD48B74C3C22EF4E8E4"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            231.
            IMPLEMENTATION OF ANTI-TERRORIST AND NARCOTIC AIR EVENTS PROGRAMS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H03BE955EC23846059C599302F7103FF3"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Implementation
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H156846A71DCC407BB629BBAD5103D379"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Priority recommendations
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator shall—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAA67DEE81E31426A9AC17B9BF7F06556"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     implement recommendations 6, 13, 14, and 15 as set forth in the Government Accountability Office report entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Aviation: FAA Needs to Better Prevent, Detect, and Respond to Fraud and Abuse Risks in Aircraft Registration, (dated March 25, 2020); and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H03AD2FA032A7429792593D0E0BCD979D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     to the extent that rulemaking is necessary to implement such recommendations, issue a notice of proposed rulemaking pursuant to the rulemaking authority of the FAA.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB2FC9933C95B42D9A16286A7219CBF6B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Remaining recommendations
                  The Administrator shall implement recommendations 1 through 5 and 8 through 12 as set forth in the Government Accountability Office report described in paragraph (1) and, to the extent that rulemaking is necessary to implement such recommendations, issue a notice of proposed rulemaking pursuant to the rulemaking authority of the FAA, on the earlier of—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDB0330F84EA24125A3CB407339C69253"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the date that is 90 days after the date on which the FAA implements the Civil Aviation Registry Electronic Services system; or
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3F1BDD7AEAC14117A1EBF86F0E94C1E2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     January 1, 2026. 
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H31C02D6D2A90461E82464D5A3F53501F"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Reports
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H13C1CA5A8BD74C9FB8A850A9AA4D8CE5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Priority recommendations
                  Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Administrator implements the recommendations under subsection (a)(1), the Administrator shall submit to the Committees on the Judiciary and Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committees on the Judiciary and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives, and the Caucus on International Narcotics Control of the Senate a report on such implementation, including a description of any steps taken by the Administrator to complete such implementation.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4487703E99EC466282BB0A39C012CFDB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Remaining recommendations
                  Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Administrator implements the recommendations under subsection (a)(2), the Administrator shall submit to the Committees on the Judiciary and Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committees on the Judiciary and Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives, and the Caucus on International Narcotics Control of the Senate a report on such implementation, including a description of any steps taken by the Administrator to complete such implementation.

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
