                     integrate safety data from unmanned aircraft system operators, as appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE03F823945C74432AB203AACB75E9383"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Implementation
                  In carrying out subsection (a), the Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5C1B4486B4A840E2805C06BD6F35F7E4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     prioritize production-ready configurable solutions over custom development, as appropriate, to support FAA critical aviation safety programs; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4D31D4582647415D9D9DCEA6C2EC0730"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     ensure that adequate market research is completed in accordance with FAA acquisition management system requirements, including appropriate demonstrations of proposed solutions, as part of the evaluation criteria.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H328DA315851A4344B71BBBB11592CD23"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H55B6A8FB11284947A2E9A979188E6795"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     to require the Administrator to share confidential or proprietary information and data to safety inspectors for purposes of enforcement; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H308AD398D9A442EE8387DF07D47E6842"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     to limit the applicability of section 44735 of title 49, United States Code, to the Aviation Safety Information Analysis and Sharing Program.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H96DCF432FC8A42A0AEC51829B9F2E8E4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Briefing
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and every 6 months thereafter until the improvements under subsection (a) are made, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the progress of implementation of the Aviation Safety Information Analysis and Sharing Program, including—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0B742B85B38749B19F474C51AB753661"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     an assessment of the progress of the FAA toward achieving milestones for such program identified by the inspector general of the Department of Transportation and the Special Committee to Review FAA Aircraft Certification Reports;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC02C278CE9C94D4D8B55967FDF84123A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     a description of the plan to use appropriate deployable commercial solutions to assist the FAA in meeting such milestones;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5E87B176DE7F4D819DBFD4AFA589B7C2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     steps taken to make improvements under subsection (b); and 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H42A7CB31EACB4D4886CE8A3B5D306042"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     a summary of the efforts of the FAA to address gaps in safety data provided from any of the industry segments described in subsection (b)(6).
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HE019FC6D0C9F4A8CBF68988F3A60FE4E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               349.
               INSTRUCTIONS FOR CONTINUED AIRWORTHINESS AVIATION RULEMAKING COMMITTEE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2FC4F660D3E9419AA3D698B390D48DF6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Administrator shall convene an aviation rulemaking committee to review, and develop findings and recommendations regarding, instructions for continued airworthiness (as described in section 21.50 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations), and provide to the Administrator a report on such findings and recommendations and for other related purposes as determined by the Administrator.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE508ABEED0994EF3B5B4F48821CFCEB4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Composition
                  The aviation rulemaking committee established pursuant to subsection (a) shall consist of members appointed by the Administrator, including representatives of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9ACC8334F2DD493F97DB2D70EE50BB54"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     holders of type certificates (as described in subpart B of part 21, title 14, Code of Federal Regulations);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1FD7957CB654488894F8F0AC73148715"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     holders of production certificates (as described in subpart G of part 21, title 14, Code of Federal Regulations);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6D77B9DBE44B4FC7B47C442722682A46"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     holders of parts manufacturer approvals (as described in subpart K of part 21, title 14, Code of Federal Regulations);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H321FA056A64A470BBE063991D9AB1CDE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     holders of technical standard order authorizations (as described in subpart O of part 21, title 14, Code of Federal Regulations);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4BF0D7EB94524E0295BFAB5E772C7109"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     operators under parts 121, 125, or 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H529A86FC88384AF8BC86C87D561A2D3F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     holders of repair station certificates (as described in section 145 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations) that are not also type certificate holders as included under paragraph (1), production certificate holders as included under paragraph (2), or aircraft operators as included under paragraph (5) (or associated with any such entities);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H07AC324A367249D5BEFC4756BE43BB42"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     the certified bargaining representative of aviation safety inspectors and engineers for the Administration;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE6719B263249416D8B6F55D1797DCB78"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     general aviation operators;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDC1E88E8BC1A4A29A7A2324B4345FAFA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (9)
                     mechanics certificated under part 65 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H35A5B73A342C462F89A5890013CAF8E6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (10)
                     holders of supplemental type certificates (as described in subpart E of part 21 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H264797154BDB4F5B9B6CB39F36EADD13"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (11)
                     designated engineering representatives employed by repair stations described in paragraph (6); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3845FF64707E441A9D165CC02442AF8A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (12)
                     aviation safety experts with specific knowledge of instructions for continued airworthiness policies and regulations.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H450951DA173C406BA3C6DF78015AE73D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  The aviation rulemaking committee established pursuant to subsection (a) shall consider—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6DA250C5D40543FBBE3FA083137792D4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     existing standards, regulations, certifications, assessments, and guidance related to instructions for continued airworthiness and the clarity of such standards, regulations, certifications, assessments, and guidance to all parties; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDB14EC660218475EA4B3BEF4E6DE9F88"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the sufficiency of safety data used in preparing instructions for continued airworthiness;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H59973A9A47804B8680DFFD08711F189E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the sufficiency of maintenance data used in preparing instructions for continued airworthiness;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5E38048CCF9B406CB623DA04AB3C9CA5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     the protection of proprietary information and intellectual property in instructions for continued airworthiness;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H06088E5CB12F4E468BEF35EBB1E31B24"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     the availability of instructions for continued airworthiness, as needed, for maintenance activities; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H61B9B69A26174C3D9331C32B3EA87F26"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     the need to harmonize or deconflict proposed and existing regulations with other Federal regulations, guidance, and policies;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2852AC495CC543BA9A1CCAADBAA74D0C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     international collaboration, where appropriate and consistent with the interests of safety in air commerce and national security, with other civil aviation authorities, international aviation and standards organizations, and any other appropriate entities; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB76407EEC9DD47A883357E960F1DB10F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     any other matter the Administrator determines appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB6C0DF433476410D98B3B0DFD1FC65BA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Duties
                  The Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2322656539DA4C43B10DC3E70C695FAB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a copy of the aviation rulemaking committee report under subsection (a); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFA2C0F8EFFF543A8890C52F724F60D61"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     not later than 180 days after the date of submission of the report under paragraph (1), initiate a rulemaking activity or make such policy and guidance updates necessary to address any consensus recommendations reached by the aviation rulemaking committee established pursuant to subsection (a), as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H900D22F0B20646C7AF6A519BE4140E37"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               350.
               SECONDARY COCKPIT BARRIERS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF5FC323E6BC74B938A96B8CF16C09063"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall convene an aviation rulemaking committee to review and develop findings and recommendations to require installation of a secondary cockpit barrier on commercial passenger aircraft operated under the provisions of part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, that are not captured under another regulation or proposed regulation.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDE39B79027764229BC499F0543161947"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Membership
                  The Administrator shall appoint a chair and members of the rulemaking committee convened under subsection (a), which shall be comprised of at least 1 representative from the constituencies of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H20B72F53AB5C46308ED5809DDFEE3B6E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     mainline air carriers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1E79AE23BC394584B9DFA86B479CDACD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     regional air carriers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE0D20A5201A548AD8A60C4FFCEAC265E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     aircraft manufacturers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H944F76267DE147A4BA91EF0D2BA30022"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     passenger aircraft pilots represented by a labor group; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9EA213D9D03D4D9C80846F30FF454443"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     flight attendants represented by a labor group;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H24EBEDB1950946FBA45603A7E7F69E66"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     airline passengers; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4B1039CC86A44547B542F1697A8A4250"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     other stakeholders the Administrator determines appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6660905F269C4E189BA9B091E29E7F36"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  The aviation rulemaking committee convened under subsection (a) shall consider—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC0E88DD8308D407E9EA36652F0E379CC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     minimum dimension requirements for secondary barriers on all aircraft types operated under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H589973D452574B03B97E92015B9BCC14"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     secondary barrier performance standards manufacturers and air carriers must meet for such aircraft types;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBC13C491667B452DA9E95B8BE5CB2DC5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the availability of certified secondary barriers suitable for use on such aircraft types;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEDC6DC3508954EBBAA4E880F0C9A4F25"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     the development, certification, testing, manufacturing, installation, and training for secondary barriers for such aircraft types;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAD87A4DDEE1245418D7EF12858636288"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     flight duration and stage length;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H402010025858409AAD640FB7B875538B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     the location of lavatories on such aircraft as related to operational complexities;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H37DA0633C4FB4555ABB0B6347BA47768"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     operational complexities;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE8E08323F44A4297A02421087F04D046"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     any risks to safely evacuate passengers of such aircraft; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H47FAA676135A4E6DB188AC72CC279562"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (9)
                     other considerations the Administrator determines appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H466EEB8DEABB49A186D9955C513FE9FC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Report to Congress
                  Not later than 12 months after the convening of the aviation rulemaking committee described in subsection (a), the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report based on the findings and recommendations of the aviation rulemaking committee convened under subsection (a), including—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF6E4B19DBF5E4DBC8CFA9EE61D2B6B3B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     if applicable, any dissenting positions on the findings and the rationale for each position; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB1CB5E55BF3F48939553F414A6E5A6B8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     any disagreements with the recommendations, including the rationale for each disagreement and the reasons for the disagreement.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC76B5E3A7D8948729F78B6532F18E7EB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Installation of secondary cockpit barriers of existing aircraft
                  Not later than 36 months after the date of the submission of the report under subsection (d), the Administrator shall, taking into consideration the final reported findings and recommendations of the aviation rulemaking committee, issue a final rule requiring installation of a secondary cockpit barrier on each commercial passenger aircraft operated under the provisions of part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB35546CD38BC4EC183728DE1109B48B7"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               351.
               PART 135 DUTY AND REST
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H481EE50D9FF044418C5B9F9BF34C6F32"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Part 91 tail–end ferry rulemaking
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall require that any operation conducted by a flight crewmember during an assigned duty period under the operational control of an operator holding a certificate under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, before, during, or after the duty period (including any operations under part 91 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations), without an intervening rest period, shall count towards the flight time and duty period limitations of such flight crewmember under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB5C0FB3E986B4643BE5B7F68AD961F47"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Record keeping
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall update any Administration policy and guidance regarding complete and accurate record keeping practices for operators holding a certificate under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, in order to properly document, at a minimum—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD97977B7FDB4476C8E0531128401CE58"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     flight crew assignments;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0A3BC33771154B958EFCC92DC1EF2EC0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     flight crew prospective rest notifications;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5941B82ABBAA4869A98BF80AAB3C0B6F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     compliance with flight and duty times limitations and post-duty rest requirements; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2F81EDAA7EF4410E8FBF14FFDDF3D2FB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     duty period start and end times.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6EAAF6C391B6420588CBEE2011804C1A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Safety management system oversight
                  The Administrator, in performing oversight of the safety management system of an operator holding a certificate under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, following the implementation of the final rule issued based on the final rule titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Safety Management Systems, and published on April 26, 2024 (89 Fed. Reg. 33068), shall ensure such operator is evaluating and appropriately mitigating aviation safety risks, including, at minimum, risks associated with—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEDF8B824153E412A8BF4761CFD63D3AD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     inadequate flight crewmember duty and rest periods; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE90916C446EF420BBED5D5E6CB63FD6C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     incomplete records pertaining to flight crew rest, duty, and flight times.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB9673536DEF54095B841F1DDFA5612D0"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Organ transportation flights
                  In updating guidance and policy pursuant to subsection (b), the Administrator shall consider and allow for appropriate accommodations, including accommodations related to subsections (b)(2) and (b)(4) for operators—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H35C2F7EBAAC74E0B8E70D10AC5CB5E2E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     performing organ transportation operations; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3E1859B695A445E3880CBAD402646BEA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     who have in place a means by which to identify and mitigate risks associated with flight crew duty and rest.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H2BA1E4359DF44621907340EB21D36FD8"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               352.
               FLIGHT DATA RECOVERY FROM OVERWATER OPERATIONS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA7F32104AD824F5F9F9B26BE74FA58F2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Flight data recovery from overwater operations
                  
                     Chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H79B9035432EC4D7E9A4DD065EA350AB5"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HA866A1568F724D0892BB88D173368122"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        44746.
                        FLIGHT DATA RECOVERY FROM OVERWATER OPERATIONS
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H178B758190FA42369288075881D30E8C"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In general
                           Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall complete a rulemaking proceeding to require that, not later than 5 years after the date of enactment of this section, all applicable aircraft are—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H282EDD93F6054FB29D62B580AD82C219"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              fitted with a means, in the event of an accident, to recover mandatory flight data parameters in a manner that does not require the underwater retrieval of the cockpit voice recorder or flight data recorder;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDBE6703E9CA14E3DBF5ABAD04E73FD3E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              equipped with a tamper-resistant method to broadcast sufficient information to a ground station to establish the location where an applicable aircraft terminates flight as the result of such an event; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBDEAC4376ECB4AE29786EBEA1D991E6D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              equipped with an airframe low-frequency underwater locating device that functions for at least 90 days and that can be detected by appropriate equipment.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H72959BBF5D474EADAF3C13B8962D9D71"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Applicable aircraft defined
                           In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">applicable aircraft means an aircraft manufactured on or after January 1, 2028, that is—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDEA1D003E2C7420D8B3DD6E090FD57B4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              operated under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H66A827D03EA24123A1DC94B362CDA4D8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              required by regulation to have a cockpit voice recorder and a flight data recorder; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7F50318087664D36AEE8BBBE9C1A23B1"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              used in extended overwater operations.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H227566D438E1433B98293DB8CB0C54C1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HFB45D714DF884B349DF185C9E61118A1"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        44746. Flight data recovery from overwater operations.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H310FBC8ABEAF4385AB5DDC634F6F110B"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               353.
               RAMP WORKER SAFETY CALL TO ACTION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H81F920FFDE0D4EC3AFDA692C336B4A28"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Call to action ramp worker safety review
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall initiate a Call to Action safety review of airport ramp worker safety and ways to minimize or eliminate ingestion zone and jet blast zone accidents.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7FC98CCB444B4B488AA0263D3850079D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Contents
                  The Call to Action safety review required pursuant to subsection (a) shall include—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDC3FEA9E1F644AC79D49CD5554C15234"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     a description of Administration regulations, guidance, and directives related to airport ramp worker safety procedures and oversight of such processes;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7F638778830A4D3C9061A68F34E03336"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     a description of reportable accidents and incidents involving airport ramp workers in 5-year period preceding the date of enactment of this Act, including any identified contributing factors to the reportable accident or incident;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD35A8F2F82474CA88DCC2E81DEC6DEE2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     training and related educational materials for airport ramp workers, including supervisory and contract employees;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H15E01603DF9849E599A7C106B2088497"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     any recommended devices and methods for communication on the airport ramp, including considerations of requirements for operable radios and headsets;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDBE0E4CA6E1E48BB87A78F38E9E00D52"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     a review of markings on the airport ramp that define restriction, staging, safety, or hazard zones, including markings to clearly define and graphically indicate the engine ingestion zones and envelope of safety for the variety of aircraft that may park at the same gate of the airport;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB02A6DF177904728A6BBFD1FA7C06B07"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     a review of aircraft jet blast and engine intake safety markings, including incorporation of markings on aircraft to indicate engine inlet danger zones; and 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA40BBDB315BC4EAB9EEBBC4460C9D00E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     a process for stakeholders, including airlines, aircraft manufacturers, airports, labor, and aviation safety experts, to provide feedback and share best practices.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HEC6D5E1BFC6545BBAFCA68FF9355D8DE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report and actions
                  Not later than 180 days after the conclusion of the Call to Action safety review pursuant to subsection (a), the Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H622191BCEF16440988D5E140D64836CC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the results of the review and any recommendations for actions or best practices to improve airport ramp worker safety, including the identification of risks and possible ways to mitigate such risks to be considered in any applicable safety management system of air carriers and airports; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF9B25BFC57B74CC0BDA89D8F05675363"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     initiate such actions as are necessary to act upon the findings of the review.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB4CB47301905485BAEBAC2B029CC9962"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Training materials
                  Not later than 6 months after the completion of the safety review required under subsection (a), the Administrator shall develop and publish training and related educational materials about aircraft engine ingestion and jet blast hazards for ground crews, including supervisory and contract employees, that includes information on—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H654CA9140EDE493E860D7EFB44623C51"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the specific dangers and consequences of entering engine ingestion or jet blast zones; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5AEE744A44E449A7AAB2F14CE2AF1670"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     proper protocols to avoid entering an engine ingestion or jet blast zone; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE6B1E0A7F77D430CA553A2FDB548B368"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     on-the-job, instructor-led training to physically demonstrate the engine ingestion zone boundaries and jet blast zones for each kind of aircraft the ground crew may encounter.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAB359A13E7EB4630B83716A52BE83535"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Consultation
                  In carrying out this section, the Administrator shall consult with aviation safety experts, air carriers, aircraft manufacturers, relevant labor organizations, and airport operators.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE0FE65D40B254D82968027FC57B41500"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Training requirements
                  Not later than 6 months after the publication of the training and related educational materials required under subsection (d), the Administrator may require any ramp worker, as appropriate, to receive the relevant engine ingestion and jet blast zone hazard training before such ramp worker may perform work on any airport ramp.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC74CD38FEA624F9BA5E2CDE2EED81498"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               354.
               VOLUNTARY REPORTING PROTECTIONS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB7F94A0ABE7A4DBAB045F04162C0D878"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 40123(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1)—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H51B7D483FCCF45DBBC644C1C4F20BDEE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">, including section 552(b)(3)(B) of title 5 after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Notwithstanding any other provision of law; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H296E0D5DB305426C9772908AF9201C78"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">or third party after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">nor any agency.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE26F5D0380534CA0871025CE53729D7D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Review of protection from disclosure
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall review and update part 193 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and review section 44735 of title 49, United States Code, to ensure such laws and regulations designate and protect from disclosure information or data submitted, collected, or obtained by the Administrator under voluntary safety programs, including the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0FE89670504C43E79D75D263EFA46995"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Aviation Safety Action Program.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H55C3D8CA8D7145FC8A4E59EA61969F96"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Flight Operational Quality Assurance.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDD0A1C4C230D44C980EE61BE5799C200"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Line Operations Safety Assessments.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H30AF26D4EE20486DB147F9560F773359"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Air Traffic Safety Action Program.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEE7CEB08F93B4580A341767FD87CFBB8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Technical Operations Safety Action Program.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF43A851989A5400AA471EB3E7E164BC0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Such other voluntarily submitted information or programs as the Administrator determines appropriate.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H03D7D4A8E23C447DA04BE1B2FD7633E8"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               355.
               TOWER MARKING NOTICE OF PROPOSED RULEMAKING
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE962C68C0D144CFC8B057BC67473AC5C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking to implement section 2110 of the FAA Extension, Safety, and Security Act of 2016 (49 U.S.C. 44718 note).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H17939FD55FF640948C740866B6FFDA9F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Report
                  If the Administrator fails to issue the notice of proposed rulemaking pursuant to subsection (a), the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress an annual report on the status of such rulemaking, including—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7A315937D6E64F9181EEDC0899AD04B5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the reasons that the Administrator has failed to issue the rulemaking; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H93061B75742342EFBCB635FB19A48096"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     a list of fatal aircraft accidents associated with unmarked towers that have occurred during the 5-year period preceding the date of submission of the report.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA441D33D12CD47F78A65382F946935D9"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">

                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               357.
               EDUCATIONAL AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H030F1A8909AB444587C6FCFAB5D7E4A7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 40104 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after subsection (b) (as redesignated by section 356) the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H476E9714699145A49F3392813F5D52BF"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HE2FC0D382A524BA2B9ECAE91631DE748"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Educational and professional development
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFA2E771135AA472C85B32444B1D0C794"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           In carrying out subsection (a), the Administrator shall support and undertake efforts to promote and support the education and professional development of current and future aerospace professionals.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB8F339571E944FCF82B926AD0448D6F2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Educational materials
                           Based on the availability of resources, the Administrator shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFAADC360A9E4412498A6F72492AC0911"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              develop and distribute civil aviation information and educational materials; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE104D7A44749414C868CD7A8B50B1414"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              provide expertise to State and local school administrators, college and university officials, and officers of other interested organizations and entities.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4CF338F799E547428A4F25F7CEDB5324"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Content
                           In developing the educational materials under paragraph (2), the Administrator shall ensure such materials, including presentations, cover topics of broad relevance, including—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAD534F8D83C44338A439365A37FB07FE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              ethical decision-making and the responsibilities of aerospace professionals;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0A64D35E600F437A96A417C238FB491E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              managing a workforce, encouraging proper reporting of prospective safety issues, and educating employees on safety management systems; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H18BEF8C136484F768CDAA80A4A13F6FC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              responsibilities as a designee or representative of the Administrator.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6CC4CBFC7F074F8A929BDB6596D171C9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Support for professional development and continuing education
                  The Administrator may take such action as may be necessary to support or launch initiatives that seek to advance the professional development and continuing education of aerospace professionals.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4F7403704B4340AF8673B602757C863E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               358.
               GLOBAL AVIATION SAFETY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFCCE7D6C99154427BBB294D9C44ADCD9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 40104(d) of title 49, United States Code, (as redesignated by section 356) is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA48C8F8C342841D48A0207FBB5DEE88C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in the subsection heading by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           and assistance
                         after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           International role
                        ;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB5D1A2C7FBB8498CBF1AB5F3AB773CFC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">The Administrator and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">In carrying out subsection (a), the Administrator;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC0AC4A76183E4A8E8AFD67B6DBA57E96"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (4); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H59FB3232FE33486CB15E35D506C8B68E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     by inserting after paragraph (1) the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H500F0E135F55473FBC5549B5A89F80F9"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA84C932241BB44D7997E192DDDF26232"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           International presence
                           The Administrator shall maintain an international presence to—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAC81B1C637784E7BB7308F081C390C9A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              assist foreign civil aviation authorities in—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE901D190F2F342588AF7F93CF3FE9C85"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 establishing robust aviation oversight practices and policies;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8CAB05E524C147E7A2B0877A84871D05"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 harmonizing international aviation standards for air traffic management, operator certification, aircraft certification, airports, and certificated or credentialed individuals;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA380FCB54EED447D8879DE6DA699E5B8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 validating and accepting foreign aircraft design and production approvals;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HFB10F8CA58E445DFB30CA984D96F619E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iv)
                                 preparing for new aviation technologies, including powered-lift aircraft, products, and articles; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9516977764B74BD08F69A09BB0D17733"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (v)
                                 appropriately adopting continuing airworthiness information, such as airworthiness directives; 
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3930121855474AC0AE8B3F28059A0778"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              encourage the adoption of United States standards, regulations, and policies;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H88AF8B82001A42C49BD8D400A72AB07C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              establish, maintain, and update bilateral or multilateral aviation safety agreements and the aviation safety information contained within such agreements;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H22889C3414104FC98C9AD27E5588979B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              engage in bilateral and multilateral discussions as required under paragraph (5) and provide technical assistance as described in paragraph (6);
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H33EB4CA26CB0443BBA6E31F8043F54F0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              validate foreign aviation products and ensure reciprocal validation of products for which the United States is the state of design or production;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H424E1E0F23CE4AB4B8CB43099EAD0230"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              support accident and incident investigations, particularly such investigations that involve United States persons and certified products and such investigations where the National Transportation Safety Board is supporting an investigation pursuant to annex 13 of the International Civil Aviation Organization;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H07188A8B584440C5B0BE45C9908DC66E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (G)
                              support the international safety activities of the United States aviation sector;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H130996BB422A4207A9C140302A29CE2B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (H)
                              maintain valuable relationships with entities with aviation equities, including civil aviation authorities, other governmental bodies, non-governmental organizations, and foreign manufacturers; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8A60F84B0958415D873B56BC2ADDF53D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              perform other activities as determined necessary by the Administrator.
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1B3D9DECF8A44D708C7E8997BC3F10FD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Review of international field offices
                  Section 40104(d) of title 49, United States Code, (as redesignated by section 356) is further amended by inserting after paragraph (2) the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H95424861CD1A41FEB6788BBFEE399DA9"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4390E4D0627A4DA882B64389811F16BF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        International offices
                        In carrying out the responsibilities described in subsection (a), the Administrator—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF5F9AB4FD8E14CB4A44194D675B67971"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           shall maintain international offices of the Administration;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H540E39890A5245458EC5E37B2FD8B432"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           every 5 years, may review existing international offices to determine—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE94822CD18564ABBA41D2C31B28A75AA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              the effectiveness of such offices in fulfilling the mission described in paragraph (2); and 
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H876D8086DDE341BBBD483EEECBB7D3A0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              the adequacy of resources and staffing to achieve the mission described in paragraph (2); and
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCFF3CDCF796D468F9C4F138A3944F787"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           shall establish offices to address gaps identified by the review under subparagraph (B) and in furtherance of the mission described in paragraph (2), putting an emphasis on establishing such offices—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0248907F6D91455387F81639AE0691DE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              where international civil aviation authorities are located;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAC42F0067DF445D1BDBA3869043BA101"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              where regional intergovernmental organizations are located;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0D2F28140A5F432B9AAC095851CA5271"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              in countries that have difficulty maintaining a category 1 classification through the International Aviation Safety Assessment program; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC586D52832FB4ECCBF19B8F3CEFD3DF5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iv)
                              in regions that have experienced substantial growth in aviation operations or manufacturing.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7A347785BAD34FF6BF6F5A28F6E1855D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Bilateral aviation safety agreements; technical assistance
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H09CAF64652EA47F485F342837F26CABA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Establishment
                     Section 40104(d) of title 49, United States Code, (as redesignated by section 356) is further amended by adding at the end the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H338F3E06CF384B418D2857073274D9A6"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H233977F6D1A243DA9808031B8893A29F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Bilateral aviation safety agreements
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB2BFF6E27D0E44F5A1F15C4E3B15C5D5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              The Administrator shall negotiate, enter into, promote, enforce, evaluate the effectiveness of, and seek to update bilateral or multilateral aviation safety agreements, and the parts of such agreements, with international aviation authorities.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H807715367178436CAE2C07C75C275802"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Purpose
                              The Administrator shall seek to enter into bilateral aviation safety agreements under this section to, at a minimum—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0F5133B29DE24C9C9362C41C2E1B1577"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 improve global aviation safety;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD9F47895F40447679B0CF719509CA4DB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 increase harmonization of, and reduce duplicative, requirements, processes, and approvals to advance the aviation interests of the United States; 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9E998644B18B4BE88559BA69A1513162"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 ensure access to international markets for operators, service providers, and manufacturers from the United States; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H593ADF86243D477282F0CA9350ACE8FA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iv)
                                 put in place procedures for recourse when a party to such agreements fails to meet the obligations of such party under such agreements.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6EB232D27C8A4711964C71218F4CF934"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              Scope
                              The scope of a bilateral aviation safety agreement entered into under this section shall, as appropriate, cover existing aviation users and concepts and establish a process by which bilateral aviation safety agreements can be updated to include new and novel concepts on an ongoing basis.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD438593EFB144924B6122BF4406F1E8F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Contents
                              Bilateral aviation safety agreements entered into under this section shall, as appropriate and consistent with United States law and regulation, include topics such as—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF558B42022564E6087B2585E525F2573"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 airworthiness, certification, and validation;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H470848A248434D54B630BE039B70220A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 maintenance; 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H922E1A95E08B41498B79E82F0DBB12EB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 operations and pilot training;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H05AD0CA75C5D47CD8DF6453E4440E555"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iv)
                                 airspace access, efficiencies, and navigation services; 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H48F64DACF19E4E7AB4B458DF74B0D0B3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (v)
                                 transport category aircraft; 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HAFAD3E0FF21A4ADF8B10731E3400A08D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (vi)
                                 fixed-wing aircraft, rotorcraft, powered-lift aircraft, products, and articles;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA39135BAEBBE4BAFADE7100029F7D350"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (vii)
                                 aerodrome certification; 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H73D17A0895C947138E11E253FEB20A30"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (viii)
                                 unmanned aircraft and associated elements of such aircraft; 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE9400807B55542B5B65BC328FCA05BB4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ix)
                                 flight simulation training devices;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC9C33B295ED04E078A50ED31535B8944"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (x)
                                 new or emerging technologies and technology trends; and 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8008FAA0DA024E959B38CA6E590A95ED"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (xi)
                                 other topics as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC2FCAC2C0DA54B3F999D5C8A3E03E68F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              Rule of Construction
