                                       id="HAF8BF79DAD5449B09635DFAEBB9C83FD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              is driven by an algorithm designed to eliminate nuisance alerts; and
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBDF9DF8E128548A18957F76448D5F4EE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (III)
                              is operational during all flight operations.
                           
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H953A37E77B014F97928AC5E3A438C481"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (vii)
                           codifying and uniformly applying Living History Flight Experience exemption conditions and limitations.
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9BE48188694B40D9BCF1854C23DEC71A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Membership
                        The aviation rulemaking committee convened under subparagraph (A) shall consist of members appointed by the Administrator, including—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC766B043E7D745E68288A79C63E6967E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           representatives of industry, including manufacturers of aircraft and aircraft technologies;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDAB15F545757453F80C24EF642F4BE1A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           air tour operators or organizations that represent such operators; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H409F153DED9340A0A665E750E88421F3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           aviation safety experts with specific knowledge of safety management systems and flight data monitoring programs under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9924ECF8923B4F339AFD89FD82D83A78"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        Duties
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6971337E13FD427EAF136DB0DB87A3EA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           In general
                           The Administrator shall direct the aviation rulemaking committee to make findings and submit recommendations regarding each of the matters specified in clauses (i) through (vi) of subparagraph (B).
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7F69E0DABA6C4A31BEEC7410BF6AE38F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           Considerations
                           In carrying out the duties of the aviation rulemaking committee under clause (i), the Administrator shall direct the aviation rulemaking committee to consider—
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H701FD97C10B84AB69B9732C0296A0F09"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              recommendations of the National Transportation Safety Board;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H1E131F7031B7462F92FBE1CACBD76F4D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              recommendations of previous aviation rulemaking committees that reviewed flight data monitoring program requirements for commercial operators under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB90ECC7FD64441128A74B7CC7C6678C1"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (III)
                              recommendations from industry safety organizations, including the Vertical Aviation Safety Team, the General Aviation Joint Safety Committee, and the United States Helicopter Safety Team;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB1EC9C673C4947F080EBB54A323B4DAA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (IV)
                              scientific data derived from a broad range of flight data recording technologies capable of continuously transmitting and that support a measurable and viable means of assessing data to identify and correct hazardous trends;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5DCEF1C97F124B199237AFF9A8A7E20F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (V)
                              appropriate use of data for modifying behavior to prevent accidents;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB8DD5FA8693A48F69A41846D2F47A601"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (VI)
                              the need to accommodate technological advancements in flight data recording technology;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA4D7D7E1E5FA48A8A779C1028949C4AB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (VII)
                              data gathered from aviation safety reporting programs;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5ACB729D9E3E406097B8DFB03FBA9402"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (VIII)
                              appropriate methods to provide effective terrain awareness and warning system protections while mitigating nuisance alerts for aircraft;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H23E6B1DC19C14E298A7F7A36B41B10D8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (IX)
                              the need to accommodate the diversity of airworthiness standards under part 27 and part 29 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4591951358FE4B9E9AC3BAC05548CE54"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (X)
                              the need to accommodate diversity of operations and mission sets;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H72CFD0FFD975443FBAA2E28B6EE3B216"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (XI)
                              benefits of third-party data analysis for large and small operations;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA1A63C26F33D4DA0AD27EB93014FD1AC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (XII)
                              accommodations necessary for small businesses; and
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H21E9A6D4C77C4CDDB2FF66B9373D291E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (XIII)
                              other issues, as necessary.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H62549C3411814E8D859BEFBC524CC67B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        Reports and regulations
                        Not later than 20 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report based on the findings of the aviation rulemaking committee.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6EB47E29BF7441D7B8776C2AE0168126"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Rulemaking required
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7AA3A045735C47118885BF38851057C6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        Notice of proposed rulemaking
                        Not later than 1 year after the date the Administrator submits a report under paragraph (2)(E), the Administrator shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking establishing increasing safety regulations for commercial air tour operators based on the recommendations of the rulemaking committee established under paragraph (2).
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4B334BE6FF3F49308526E5D933937E6B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Contents
                        The notice of proposed rulemaking under subparagraph (A) shall require, at a minimum—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC4257FC0572842938352B46DFF64E602"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           the adoption of pilot training standards that are comparable, as applicable, to the standards under subpart H of part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations for commercial tour operators;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H709AAB19897547CAB361C5DA00F102B3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           the adoption of maintenance standards that are comparable, as applicable, to the standards under subpart J of part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations for commercial tour operators; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H96C7B45F8B344513BBEC470C6DCCBF3D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           that beginning on a date determined appropriate by the Administrator, a helicopter operated by a commercial air tour operator be equipped with an approved flight data monitoring system capable of recording flight performance data.
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD3A9777E99FC463E92D892198920DB4C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Final rule
                        Not later than 2 years after the issuance of a notice of proposed rulemaking under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall finalize the rule.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0D4D09798573490980CFBDD1F687011C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Safety requirements for sport parachute operations
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4D9CD11A7E5C4CAE9B4C10B23FBD7979"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Aviation rulemaking committee
                     The Administrator shall convene an aviation rulemaking committee to review and develop findings and recommendations to increase the safety of sport parachute operations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3B5E303383A74328872CC5C3BC55DC0B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Contents
                     This aviation rulemaking committee convened under paragraph (1) shall consider, at a minimum—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0E40065EFFB947FA92344628BC0EFFE2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        potential regulatory action governing parachute operations that are conducted in the United States and are subject to the requirements of part 105 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, to address—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7D93808F0969420A864585CC9056CDBD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           whether FAA-approved aircraft maintenance and inspection programs that consider, at a minimum, minimum equipment standards informed by recommended maintenance instructions of engine manufacturers, such as service bulletins and service information letters for time between overhauls and component life limits, should be implemented; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H28D22174BF1D456DA562C884B7C1FD91"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           initial and annual recurrent pilot training and proficiency checks for pilots conducting parachute operations that address, at a minimum, operation- and aircraft-specific weight and balance calculations, preflight inspections, emergency and recovery procedures, and parachutist egress procedures for each type of aircraft flown; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H57510F18FDE5447FB74EB2333886B7B5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the revision of guidance material contained in the advisory circular of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Sport Parachuting (AC 105–2E) to include guidance for parachute operations in implementing the FAA-approved aircraft maintenance and inspection program and the pilot training and pilot proficiency checking programs required under any new or revised regulations; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC7F7BABCEFA64CABBD1EBB5CDDE4C73F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the revision of guidance materials issued in the order of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Flight Standards Information Management System (FAA Order 8900.1), to include guidance for FAA inspectors who oversee an operation conducted under—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB9649C10F52A48C2B8A93D3CC1C40C86"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           part 91 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF702F90D30EA4C03B793B030677D3489"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           an exception specified in section 119.1(e) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations. 
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H71D4FC29DDC842CBA7CF4FEBD08EA750"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Membership
                     The aviation rulemaking committee under paragraph (1) shall consist of members appointed by the Administrator, including—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA76EE7A8CCEE4F648851492CB893D1E2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        representatives of industry, including manufacturers of aircraft and aircraft technologies;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB000497772BE4F509AB0C6A526252FB4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        parachute operators, or organizations that represent such operators; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB01146FCA470476194509A021AE1E48A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        aviation safety experts with specific knowledge of safety management systems and flight data monitoring programs under part 135 and part 105 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H721DFF922771409DACD6D189B571D626"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Duties
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDE340CFD66CB44DB9D1F2678130EE714"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        In general
                        The Administrator shall direct the aviation rulemaking committee to make findings and submit recommendations regarding each of the matters specified in subparagraphs (A) through (C) of paragraph (2).
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H65416163581D4F1386439138B7AAA711"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Considerations
                        In carrying out its duties under subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall direct the aviation rulemaking committee to consider—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H39F56B13E4E54533B3872CE33C7AC947"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           findings and recommendations of the National Transportation Safety Board, as relevant, and specifically such findings and recommendations related to parachute operations, including the June 21, 2019, incident in Mokuleia, Hawaii;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H523C8C6382B8466E9AF68B044BD6C1D2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           recommendations of previous aviation rulemaking committees that considered similar issues;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9EE018F2EE444BC6A62CD4BA3BE8E9FF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           recommendations from industry safety organizations, including, at a minimum, the United States Parachute Association;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDF8D9CD7C4554FD797073BA95F207971"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           appropriate use of data for modifying behavior to prevent accidents; 
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2C154EB5B79447F1BB10F162B7D91C88"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (v)
                           data gathered from aviation safety reporting programs;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD2AF745C049247B78B87B8BC40700FB8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (vi)
                           the need to accommodate diversity of operations and mission sets;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4020B814A1D04007ADCB3036FEF156C8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (vii)
                           accommodations necessary for small businesses; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H47F6F6442E3845979EF9D80289D4B3BB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (viii)
                           other issues as necessary.
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H25E505B3AD8E4179B0521A38055A75E9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Reports and regulations
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H26B32C1F000C48839CCE596B5E299524"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        In general
                        Not later than 36 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report based on the findings of the aviation rulemaking committee.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9E26EAD182C54F2483CB56A1143A20EE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Contents
                        The report under subparagraph (A) shall include—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2B12566D68AD4B97AF37AA885D1C2EFB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           any recommendations submitted by the aviation rulemaking committee; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAFE6EE29A12248619E1ADDEA84F2F289"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           any actions the Administrator intends to initiate, if necessary, as a result of such recommendations.
                        
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE945677AA3D9499AA7C77F5FEC354219"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3AC71C7E70A845269B1945F2E01B3150"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Air carrier
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">air carrier has the meaning given such term in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1F6AB81D4A4F4D2C91AFD7D09398CA69"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Commercial air tour
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">commercial air tour has the meaning given such term in section 136.1 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8A38D51D163A43259C135445504D8F0E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Commercial air tour operator
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">commercial air tour operator has the meaning given such term in section 136.1 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5D29049DB1B94DDFB22D28AF99E43BBB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Parachute operation
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">parachute operation has the meaning given such term in section 105.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation).
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H745268B007344F18B7B6FA1A1959BD1F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               364.
               HAWAII AIR NOISE AND SAFETY TASK FORCE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4E3EEAD64272407CB9DBA0F79FE23473"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Participation
                  To the extent acceptable to the State of Hawaii, the Administrator shall participate as a technical advisor in the air noise and safety task force established by State legislation in the State of Hawaii.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6AA3A0E6232345A39B98D52263E89B20"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Rulemaking
                  Not later than 18 months after the date on which the task force described in subsection (a) delivers findings and consensus recommendations to the FAA, the Administrator shall, consistent with maintaining the safety and efficiency of the national airspace system—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4AE667E0B7FD42F7BCAE4575D91EC893"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     issue an intent to proceed with a proposed rulemaking;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7134233115884F428826672864756FA3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     take other action sufficient to carry out feasible, consensus recommendations; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF23EB8818B524B6983852C61254CC5C8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     issue a statement determining that no such rule or other action is warranted, including a detailed explanation of the rationale for such determination.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H255B7E9FB007427F8F38E2DE85FDCCD3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  In determining whether to proceed with a proposed rulemaking, guidance, or other action under subsection (b) and, if applicable, in developing the proposed rule, guidance, or carrying out the other action, the Administrator shall consider the findings and consensus recommendations of the task force described in subsection (a).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6F0918D0116B402BA6F0893ECAC4ED2E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Authorities
                  In issuing the rule, guidance, or carrying out the other action described in subsection (b), the Administrator may take actions in the State of Hawaii to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF8E90320C6384E56B28849B9F1437714"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     provide commercial air tour operators with preferred routes, times, and minimum altitudes for the purpose of noise reduction, so long as such recommendations do not negatively impact safety conditions;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0191F9B96FC54EEF9CB66795CC65D23D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     provide commercial air tour operators with information regarding quiet aircraft technology; and 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H00F5AFDC1A5A45B4BE9E4D1700A91644"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     establish a method for residents of the State of Hawaii to publicly report noise disruptions due to commercial air tours and for commercial air tour operators to respond to complaints.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDB2BC1132ACE4D73B1A1F6B4AFB0B5E7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed as providing the Administrator with authority to ban commercial air tour flights in the State of Hawaii for the purposes of noise reduction.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF7F0AB796D934AB5A057D5993067DC3B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD2B2AA8333104F429E41B0415DCF006D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Commercial air tour
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">commercial air tour has the meaning given such term in section 136.1 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H61DD3E8BE59147359FFED720D31B56C3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Commercial air tour operator
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">commercial air tour operator has the meaning given such term in section 136.1 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HFC6555C5C29A4D0CB906C2FAAD53FCB0"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               365.
               MODERNIZATION AND IMPROVEMENTS TO AIRCRAFT EVACUATION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7493A51DF13A4775801E5B8D289B173D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Study
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H642C6357D2EF4DE0AA2A7A2CB19392AF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall conduct a study on improvements to the safety and efficiency of evacuation standards for manufacturers and carriers of transport category airplanes, as described in parts 25 and 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0CD5A05F356640AD8B5A012F6E2B499D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Contents
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8502522EA2AD41A4A5F3BACB6FB9B79F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        Requirements
                        The study required under paragraph (1) shall include—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4416CCFCAA434004A423A2E3486DDFE8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           a prospective risk analysis, as well as an evaluation of relevant past incidents with respect to evacuation safety and evacuation standards;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H20F911E41BF3455DBCB6782B5D7002E2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           an assessment of the evacuation testing procedures described in section 25.803 of such title 14, as well as recommendations for how to revise such testing procedures to ensure that the testing procedures assess, in a safe manner, the ability of passengers with disabilities, including passengers who use wheelchairs or other mobility assistive devices, to safely and efficiently evacuate an aircraft;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H628CB9A7548E40098DB80129FCEFACCD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           an assessment of the evacuation demonstration procedures described in such part 121, as well as recommendations for how to improve such demonstration procedures to ensure that the demonstration procedures assess, in a safe manner, the ability of passengers with disabilities, including passengers who use wheelchairs or other mobility assistive devices, to safely and efficiently evacuate an aircraft;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA7985284D6594DD8AB881C860B5C8BC6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           the research proposed in National Transportation Safety Board Safety Recommendation A–18–009; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H10BC62D03501499DB5312C184AD09FCC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (v)
                           any other analysis determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H049D10F6A0C34D8CBDE58A7BB899C9AF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Considerations
                        In conducting the study under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall assess the following:
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4EC2AF0A802C4675BA0A6A15D869DEA9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           The ability of passengers of different ages (including infants, children, and senior citizens) to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H54BF5E3F57D6414B8EF95096BCE8C77B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           The ability of passengers of different heights and weights to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC335E9B4745D49858582827E17A5534B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           The ability of passengers with disabilities to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBD8B696384B44A8095962E213F8BAF36"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           The ability of passengers who cannot speak, have difficulty speaking, use synthetic speech, or are non-vocal or non-verbal to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H871BFBDB1FCF493D84BC3F2B2BF366E3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (v)
                           The ability of passengers who do not speak English to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5F3764D89C8B4416B8556CEB81CCC609"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (vi)
                           The impact of the presence of carry-on luggage and personal items (such as a purse, briefcase, laptop, or backpack) on the ability of passengers to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDF563C2A8E474C9EA912FE6FB3195416"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (vii)
                           The impact of seat size and passenger seating space and pitch on the ability of passengers to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4EC96D3FF0644705ABA41E3473BCA4EF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (viii)
                           The impact of seats and other obstacles in the pathway to the exit opening from the nearest aisle on the ability of passengers to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF85C71C0ECFC4E9A8D04F4D9F302B35F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ix)
                           With respect to aircraft with parallel longitudinal aisles, the impact of seat pods or other seating configurations that block access between such aisles within a cabin on the ability of passengers to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H76D379EDE04A4CCBAB6C38BA9D9DCC82"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (x)
                           The impact of passenger load on the ability of passengers to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB112F122283A4C7A976F803580AA65C4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (xi)
                           The impact of animals approved to accompany a passenger, including service animals, on the ability of passengers to safely and efficiently evacuate a transport category airplane.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE55952BFD293425497D6DFDAC3ED4F4D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (xii)
                           Whether an applicant for a type certificate (as defined in section 44704(e)(7) of title 49, United States Code) should be required to demonstrate compliance with FAA emergency evacuation regulations (as described in section 25.803 and Appendix J of part 25 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations) through live testing in any case in which the Administrator determines that the new aircraft design is significant.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8947161B85F3457DA267F86A1AFFFA06"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (xiii)
                           Any other factor determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE7E0DF417D074C49BB58AFB606B36DAF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Definitions
                        In this paragraph: 
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCF32389EC3884FE5915A07FEA9E9E2D8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           Passenger load
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">passenger load means the number of passengers relative to the number of seats onboard the aircraft.
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0AF2495DADA24ACEA52B40A9DB57D3D4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           Passengers with disabilities
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">passengers with disabilities means any qualified individual with a disability, as defined in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                        
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H07B661C431924C22BFEB94D8DBAFA63C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Aviation rulemaking committee for evacuation standards
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB4295E38805748E888F18203843FB408"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 180 days after the completion of the study conducted under subsection (a), the Administrator shall establish an aviation rulemaking committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Committee) to—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H571718ED5266400A95A3F1EB61F42ADE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        review the findings of the study; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2CE7D1114FF3440990028CC7E4D667C5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        develop and submit to the Administrator recommendations regarding improvements to the evacuation standards described in parts 25 and 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFE4B79FB429D4CDAB9CB3F8B11D29AAA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Composition
                     The Committee shall consist of members appointed by the Administrator, including the following:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H746E41CE679A4E02B75529D5739CF2A9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        Representatives of industry.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5E79BED7F6C4498E93D5815DA6113B9A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Representatives of aviation labor organizations.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H48CCA7868E284584B36590E9A9BF0B9B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Aviation safety experts with specific knowledge of the evacuation standards and requirements under such parts 25 and 121.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H17AD69F8EF404DFFBAB9CF789F14CC8E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        Representatives of individuals with disabilities with specific knowledge of accessibility standards regarding evacuations in emergency circumstances.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF6189EC79E72439D8798CAD4591E2FD0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        Representatives of the senior citizen community.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H82F24DA972084272BABF2A677C94529F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        Representatives of pediatricians.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6D140C796C9B4C67BB46C85F450B49F8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Considerations
                     In reviewing the findings of the study conducted under subsection (a) and developing recommendations regarding the improvement of the evacuation standards under subsection (b)(1)(B), the Committee shall consider the following:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAAEA43135C1846F2AB46720089BFDEFC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        The recommendations made by any prior aviation rulemaking committee regarding the evacuation standards described in such parts 25 and 121.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H704996253E0948969F996DAC1BC27851"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Scientific data derived from the study conducted under subsection (a).
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H422E5ECED9FD450183277AEF287744FF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Any data gathered from aviation safety reporting programs.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB83D5610545741C6A4D2C653E16B222B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        The cost-benefit analysis and risk analysis of any recommended standards.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H06488E32A0EA45F39D5F6E5E2ACA9246"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        Any other item determined appropriate by the Committee.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3EDFF28FCB9E48549E7B19C384A43C03"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report to Congress
                  Not later than 180 days after the date on which the Committee submits to the Administrator the recommendations under subsection (b)(1)(B), the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H91C98C282D5049D4A60BEA63D2070F60"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the findings of the study conducted under subsection (a);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H53A3CBA3ED7749669BA52A2D8B3C421F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the recommendations of the Committee under subsection (b)(1)(B); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE4279A795E1D47128BDF9A1DF5EDB8DF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the Administrator's plan, if any, to implement such recommendations.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H740D503396E0409AB1AEB9324530D5B2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Rulemaking
                  Not later than 90 days after submitting to Congress the report under subsection (c), the Administrator shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking to implement the recommendations of the Committee that the Administrator considers appropriate.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HFEE324C1B5F44D5CAC55FC14CD46830D"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               366.
               25-HOUR COCKPIT VOICE RECORDER
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE3D00B858F61466FA7AB9CD477D8A660"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0AE0A154207849D58F4F9479CE021ACD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Cockpit voice recorder for newly manufactured aircraft
                     A covered operator may not operate a covered aircraft manufactured later than the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act unless such aircraft has a cockpit voice recorder installed that retains the last 25 hours of recorded information using a recorder that meets the standards of Technical Standard Order TSO–C123c, or any later revision. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H67B0A9E67B8C4B95A28667F7984377D3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Cockpit voice recorder for covered aircraft
                     Not later than 6 years after the date of enactment of this Act, a covered operator may not operate a covered aircraft unless such aircraft has a cockpit voice recorder installed that retains the last 25 hours of recorded information using a recorder that meets the standards of Technical Standard Order TSO–C123c, or any later revision. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD298629E00404AC48F4B825BBCB784B9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Prohibited use
                  The Administrator or any covered operator may not use a cockpit voice recorder recording for a certificate action, civil penalty, or disciplinary proceedings against a flight crewmember. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8809044256B7410BB850A84945F721CA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Rulemaking
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3CF0F1C51278464C8CB99A92ADFC8C3C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     issue a final rule to update applicable regulations, as necessary, to conform to the requirements of subsection (a)(2); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE25C03D503DA484797A5171403666E3C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     issue a rule to update applicable regulations, as necessary, to ensure, to the greatest extent practicable, that any data from a cockpit voice recorder—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA2002B0ABDDC49A5A349E2B9786BC6B1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        is protected from unlawful or unauthorized disclosure to the public;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBAD924CB6100455C862B455411CC0D2A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        is used exclusively by a Federal agency or a foreign accident investigative agency for a criminal investigation, aircraft accident, or aircraft incident investigation; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4C9E885B4EF546C093F1521A850F39BB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        is not deliberately erased or tampered with following a National Transportation Safety Board reportable event under part 830 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, for which civil and criminal penalties may be assessed in accordance with section 1155 of title 49, United States Code, and section 32 of title 18, United States Code.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H005ED65575754822B20EB0CED4BCF707"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Savings clause
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed as rescoping, constraining, or otherwise mandating delays to FAA actions in the notice of proposed rulemaking titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">25–Hour Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR) Requirements, New Aircraft Production, issued on December 4, 2023 (88 Fed. Reg. 84090).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA3E2C6EB92424692B1E13B8700D265BA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to affect—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1C7B45D064D5466791F5036487B10941"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the confidentiality of recording and transcripts under section 1114(c) of title 49, United States Code;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H23B7EF731B0C4014A98D3FE5F986ADAF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the ban on recording for civil penalty or certificate under section 121.359(h) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H943E27D84FC84FAFB23FF5EB75772F49"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the prohibition against use of data from flight operational quality assurance programs for enforcement purposes under section 13.401 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7A2606A80D904181BC470C8C6B8FD158"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H090B7F4E0B104983BE313558B8509BF6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Covered aircraft
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">covered aircraft means—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5349900B6B45407F8EE49875E81C009A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        an aircraft operated by an air carrier under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEAE96A1BC45540B48FE5DB9D9893CEF0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        a transport category aircraft designed for operations by an air carrier or foreign air carrier type-certificated with a passenger seating capacity of 30 or more or an all-cargo or combi derivative of such an aircraft.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE226F4FC20384F6295526CEBD9F9481C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Covered operator
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">covered operator means the operator of a covered aircraft.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA5D8EF3543D941A0AED61895C386790B"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               367.
               SENSE OF CONGRESS REGARDING MANDATED CONTENTS OF ONBOARD EMERGENCY MEDICAL KITS
               It is the sense of Congress that—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE19C1975F11F49B1B1EBA6646963E553"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  a regularly scheduled panel of experts should reexamine and provide an updated list of mandated contents of onboard emergency medical kits that is thorough and practical, keeping passenger safety and well-being paramount; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1151E69CE8CB43DF8ECD63445C4479E5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  such panel should consider including on the list of mandated contents of such medical kits, at a minimum, opioid overdose reversal medication.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HECB35AAD3267484D8BF158678C05FF97"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               368.
               PASSENGER AIRCRAFT FIRST AID AND EMERGENCY MEDICAL KIT EQUIPMENT AND TRAINING
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1714AE9DE1AD4AFDB3EA24BDB79BF87D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking regarding first aid and emergency medical kit equipment and training required for flight crewmembers, as provided in part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, applicable to all certificate holders operating passenger aircraft under such part.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2286752A8BA445198181372D8D433934"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Considerations
                  In carrying out subsection (a), the Administrator shall consider—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H352027A7039949CE82A8E3897BADF163"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the benefits and costs (including the costs of flight diversions and emergency landings) of requiring any new medications or equipment necessary to be included in approved emergency medical kits; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H582C2276E51E41F59A39F64447CBE448"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     whether the contents of the emergency medical kits include, at a minimum, appropriate medications and equipment that can practicably be administered to address—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD3A2573EBB4547FFA33B239E7F9A26B4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the emergency medical needs of children and pregnant women;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H206C4030FC024600812BFFE4199C537A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        opioid overdose reversal;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H65E1D4061D56486CB86B17CED8FE0050"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        anaphylaxis; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H453C293F6E974DBE81B64B42ED746BA4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        cardiac arrest; 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEF5ECF2E33A242D5BF39FB8D251AECC3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     what contents of the emergency medical kits should be readily available, to the extent practicable, for use by flight crews without prior approval by a medical professional.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HEA9E1977192341FA820C0B345C1A3745"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Regular review
                  Not later than 5 years after the issuance of the final rule under subsection (a), and every 5 years thereafter, the Administrator shall evaluate and revise, if appropriate—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFD208908DD15495FB3CECAC9A326D440"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the first aid and emergency medical kit equipment and training required for flight crewmembers; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA5E276C573734B12B58C3F7225611A3B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     any required training for flight crewmembers regarding the content, location, and function of such kit.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H613C8BF77D6340B6BBCFDD38BA9F9BC6"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               369.
               INTERNATIONAL AVIATION SAFETY ASSESSMENT PROGRAM
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFD91132288BA46788AAABF1439D41650"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Aviation safety oversight measures carried out by foreign countries
                  
                     Chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H1EFEEAB3E7B54A7A92271521F3201133"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HF3B0C2D9C660474FBBBDEA78508C8E98"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        44747.
                        AVIATION SAFETY OVERSIGHT MEASURES CARRIED OUT BY FOREIGN COUNTRIES
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HD6F4BE604C6C414DA20967AB5DC72577"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           Assessment
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2BF97A51B1D649D791CDB9030B55B451"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              On a regular basis, the Administrator, in consultation with the Secretary of Transportation and the Secretary of State, shall assess aviation safety oversight measures carried out by any foreign country—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE855DD9D37E346A2B7BFCF7A4F26B59E"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 from which a foreign air carrier is conducting foreign air transportation to and from the United States;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HDA50443212D74CBC891A538D8538FD20"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 from which a foreign air carrier seeks to conduct foreign air transportation to and from the United States;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7E72BF3C4FD84B2CAE064C8DA622499E"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 whose air carriers carry or seek to carry the code of a United States air carrier; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE7FD9612874E4077A35AC94902E72935"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9C34E2D9F04D480C873690A25AC98EBC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Consultation and criteria
                              In conducting an assessment described in paragraph (1), the Administrator shall—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H419AD8EBEC68475A8299A678F944FFEF"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 consult with the appropriate authorities of the government of the foreign country;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H45C970B8226C43DB92F96EB2AD9DE8C3"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 determine the efficacy with which such foreign country carries out and complies with its aviation safety oversight responsibilities consistent with—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H07149476DFF74D1BAC2A96A9CB5FBE99"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    the Convention on International Civil Aviation (in this section referred to as the ‘Chicago Convention’);
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H42AAE323651F4185A80D6EE4ED065B10"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    international aviation safety standards; and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H73A5405F30B942A99CD963B8B4EF1A70"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    recommended practices set forth by the International Civil Aviation Organization;
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H1DC1C55D0FF74DE99397AF08825F6061"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 use a standard approach and methodology that will result in an analysis of the aviation safety oversight activities of such foreign country that are carried out to meet the minimum standards contained in Annexes 1, 6, and 8 to the Chicago Convention in effect on the date of the assessment, or any such successor documents; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H63DD7C026B0E43339CA3A15810AA73CE"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 identify instances of noncompliance pertaining to the aviation safety oversight activities of such foreign country consistent with the Chicago Convention, international aviation safety standards, and recommended practices set forth by the International Civil Aviation Organization.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H332392E921094526B8B843995D18719C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Findings of noncompliance
                              In any case in which the assessment described in subsection (a)(1) finds an instance of non-compliance, the Administrator shall—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H67B55E66DA234990BBCA750BEE2C5035"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 notify the foreign country that is the subject of such finding;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HF17ACF15955F4D05A5B2B5C82DBA3566"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
