               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H83033ED5CBBF4B508B2E269230BC058E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (h)
                  Definitions
                  The definitions set forth in section 40131 of title 49, United States Code (as added by this subtitle), shall apply to this section.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD249811E901643AD92F75712E77C1574"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               396.
               GAO REPORT ON CYBERSECURITY OF COMMERCIAL AVIATION AVIONICS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCBB597E6C4FA4920B02E6F89337CB183"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Comptroller General shall conduct a review on the consideration, identification, and inclusion of aircraft cybersecurity into the strategic framework of principles and policies developed pursuant to section 2111 of the FAA Extension, Safety, and Security Act of 2016 (49 U.S.C. 44903 note). 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC438233985304EA688FF4EF75EC7FF22"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Contents
                  In carrying out the review under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall assess—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD276CC33D08D42BF8442E299D5F0E125"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     how onboard aircraft cybersecurity risks and vulnerabilities are defined, identified, and accounted for in the comprehensive and strategic framework described in subsection (a), including how the implementation of such framework protects and defends FAA networks and systems to mitigate risks to FAA missions and service delivery;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H582164E8CEEE48AF97E6A13292FF28FF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     how onboard aircraft cybersecurity, particularly of aircraft avionics, is considered, incorporated, and prioritized for mitigation in the cybersecurity strategy, including pursuant to the framework described in paragraph (1);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEFC96B45CFEC41499F10E129B1DAD35F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     how the Transportation Security Agency and FAA differentiate and manage the roles and responsibilities for the cybersecurity of aircraft and ground systems;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H73713D0391B84DB78257DF77896AE2AA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     how cybersecurity vulnerabilities of aircraft and ground systems are considered, incorporated, and prioritized for mitigation in the cybersecurity strategy; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H401D3F858DE5412E8217648C132BE9A0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     the budgets of the parties responsible for implementing the strategy framework for aviation security, as identified in subsection (a), to satisfy mitigation requirements necessary to secure the aviation ecosystem from onboard cybersecurity vulnerabilities. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H492F99A2F71243F7B19C0E2ABC31537E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report required
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit a report containing the results of the review required by this section to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3AA65EF3336E4695B3F7A6ED72935A0B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the appropriate committees of Congress;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC01CF9D709D247A3BEE5F29FB8F5BECB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H21C1683D23AF4F078C7BDCA4DD008105"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate. 
                  
               
            
         
      
      <title id="H1D9B9EED0EEF4543BBC777BB7D8E1BF5"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         IV
         AEROSPACE WORKFORCE
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HA32FFC007D4C4B7395D66031D34B6711"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            401.
            REPEAL OF DUPLICATIVE OR OBSOLETE WORKFORCE PROGRAMS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H64281E8191A74CC9865003BB75C0F480"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Repeal
               Sections 44510 and 44515 of title 49, United States Code, are repealed.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H14FEFDC552F74C4AB9610AD666DAADF1"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Clerical amendments
               The analysis for chapter 445 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking the items relating to sections 44510 and 44515. 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HFCEC5E40782F4011ACBE52C05745FA73"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            402.
            CIVIL AIRMEN STATISTICS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2C2ED87B22F44D66B45537815209655B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Publication frequency
               The Administrator shall publish the study commonly referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">U.S. Civil Airmen Statistics on a monthly basis.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA77F44CE779F4D63AF8075890C4ACD7D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Presentation of data
               The Administrator shall make the data from the study under subsection (a) publicly available on the website of the Administration in a user-friendly, downloadable format.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H27DF2630687B4577957E2612F8A9AEB6"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Expanded data criteria
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall ensure that data sets and tables published as part of the study described in subsection (a) display information relating to the sex of certificate holders in more instances.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HB1741E33A71D4D5EA60AA3844D92FED1"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Historical data
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall make all previously published annual data from the study described in subsection (a) available on the website of the Administration. 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE81AA0E7A9A04821A4610E45A96DAEB6"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            403.
            BESSIE COLEMAN WOMEN IN AVIATION ADVISORY COMMITTEE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HF245BD8D775E4C8489929F4DCF3A1C89"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Establishment
               Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall establish the Bessie Coleman Women in Aviation Advisory Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Committee).
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H1B2F530B7AE6494FB621EF8E6BBB5E8E"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Purpose
               The Committee shall advise the Secretary and the Administrator on matters and policies related to promoting the recruitment, retention, employment, education, training, career advancement, and well-being of women in the aviation industry and aviation-focused Federal civil service positions.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HAF0FA4A969784A909DF7D451BFF3E737"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Form of directives
               All activities carried out by the Committee, including special committees, shall be in response to written terms of work from the Secretary or taskings approved by a majority of the voting members of the Committee and may not duplicate the objectives of the Air Carrier Training Aviation Rulemaking Committee.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H3058419D41B2436A90E8336B78032699"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Functions
               In carrying out the directives described in subsection (c), the functions of the Committee are as follows:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H125432BFF2B649D1A6FFFB360CB79F7E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Foster industry collaboration in an open and transparent manner by engaging, as prescribed by this section, with representatives of the private sector associated with an entity described in subsection (e)(1)(B). 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H584E164E70314B94854D3078EB1011B1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Make recommendations for strategic objectives, priorities, and policies that would improve the recruitment, retention, training, and career advancement of women in aviation professions.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB267004C17AB48F6B53B93550C71AD74"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Evaluate opportunities for the Administration to improve the recruitment and retention of women in the Administration.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H175C75F3889346ACA364502FEDF06CEA"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Periodically review and update the recommendations directed to the FAA and non-FAA entities produced by the Advisory Board created pursuant to section 612 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) to improve the implementation of such recommendations.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1C25C53E49F0466A80AA4B4EB37FB276"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Coordinate with the Office of Civil Rights of the Department of Transportation and the Federal Women’s Program of the FAA to ensure directives described in subsection (c) do not duplicate objectives of such office or program.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H0B0136EA47264FC298238DF6E5E80176"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Membership
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8274C62CEF274B69857F25E343C54E20"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Voting members
                  The Committee shall be composed of the following members:
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD7780BDCEEC54FD490801B23EE81EFC8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     The Administrator, or the designee of the Administrator.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H62C8C045B6D44BC7AD0A54EC6D6435C8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     At least 25 individuals, appointed by the Secretary, representing the following:
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5BEB04CBB9DA4A128C3D3057CFD5F8EF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        Aircraft manufacturers and aerospace companies.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8A41107EB5424EDFBAD34D0BC471C7EE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        Public and private aviation labor organizations, including collective bargaining representatives of—
                        <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA729CEF39D35452E941A58B9F2F10B56"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (I)
                           aviation safety inspectors and safety engineers of the FAA;
                        
                        <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7FCB8B6673F241A7B72572FB57F8C7D8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (II)
                           air traffic controllers;
                        
                        <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF213E6AC69B647DAAAD3517A1FACDA79"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (III)
                           certified aircraft maintenance technicians; and
                        
                        <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDA116562C81A4A25B279EDA7DD201E9F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (IV)
                           commercial airline crewmembers. 
                        
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0AFCF346196D4E25864E2616B46DDB8D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iii)
                        General aviation operators. 
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0174259753924CC3811AF9F3256F6312"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iv)
                        Air carriers.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H35014BFC11504FB2BCF05A2EB707F9AE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (v)
                        Business aviation operators, including powered-lift operators. 
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H71D58FA723054DA98398CFD819FE2E24"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (vi)
                        Unmanned aircraft systems operators.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2E4898C6770143EA852D91E6DC2F4D4C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (vii)
                        Aviation safety management experts.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDA500F6D67E4415D94B37BE568F48FB1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (viii)
                        Aviation maintenance, repair, and overhaul entities.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5B41043F78C547C9B249C259902F080F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ix)
                        Airport owners, operators, and employees.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H65398A7848304F6C87819637837DB5C4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (x)
                        Institutions of higher education (as defined in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001)), a postsecondary vocational institution (as defined in section 102(c) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1002)), or a high school or secondary school (as such terms are defined in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801)).
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H89FFCB16424445AAA2F3BBA9AF26BEB7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (xi)
                        A flight school that provides flight training, as defined in part 61 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, or that holds a pilot school certificate under part 141 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H69DB84EEB9D8442AA8DBD823610DC7BD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (xii)
                        Aviation maintenance technician schools governed under part 147 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H74395615C4CD470AADABFE23F62751A2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (xiii)
                        Engineering business associations.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1A74AFF2F7524E63A76077EAD6CA4078"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (xiv)
                        Civil Air Patrol.
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6B779BD05BD8439FA707FA41F1538520"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (xv)
                        Nonprofit organizations within the aviation industry.
                     
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9D988D0DF36342F6B4E909DF6D08995A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Nonvoting members
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7CC9A1AF345648ACA47D823CA4D20F7D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     In general
                     In addition to the members appointed under paragraph (1), the Committee shall be composed of not more than 5 nonvoting members appointed by the Secretary from among officers or employees of the FAA, at least 1 of which shall be an employee of the Office of Civil Rights of the FAA.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD4E2F016206149949BF76914BB9B83F2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Additional nonvoting members
                     The Secretary may invite representatives from the Department of Education and Department of Labor to serve as nonvoting members on the Committee.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBFEC14C1FD24426983A97D26D8C5A4DC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     Duties
                     The nonvoting members may—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE22B5B08EEA24307B929A37984C21439"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        take part in deliberations of the Committee; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H947C3DB0AE4746768CD00B7E1AC62478"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        provide subject matter expertise with respect to reports and recommendations of the Committee.
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0094C73C8779499DB1EF159587C3AD61"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     Limitation
                     The nonvoting members may not represent any stakeholder interest other than that of the respective Federal agency of the member.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H39E37F4CE7C44EB09A1F680BFD6DC8B7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Terms
                  Each voting member and nonvoting member of the Committee appointed by the Secretary shall be appointed for a term that expires not later than the date on which the authorization of the Committee expires under subsection (k).
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBE19E24F27674E14A179010F6E30B213"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Committee characteristics
                  The Committee shall have the following characteristics:
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA13F220E9BA940139E7663A1AC26D0FF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     The ability to obtain necessary information from additional experts in the aviation and aerospace communities.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9BA465D541BA462BB17198442D8B4A32"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     A membership that enables the Committee to have substantive discussions and reach consensus on issues in a timely manner.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H047AD020C16D481CBCEEC87DF3EB0CE7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     Appropriate expertise, including expertise in human resources, human capital management, policy, labor relations, employment training, workforce development, and youth outreach.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5BFDEFD1910E43FCAC62114A5E0C732F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Date
                  Not later than 9 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall make the appointments described in this subsection.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H38A3F23D42754152B87294221C1BD51E"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (f)
               Chairperson
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H91551A9CCAA1425FACC856026A4FE6A2"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  The Committee shall select a chairperson from among the voting members of the Committee.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF3CA82FA14BF43E683E8A249F76DC16B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Term
                  The Chairperson shall serve a 2-year term.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2B77CCD256B14192A75091F40E8BB30A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (g)
               Meetings
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBAD064021EE74BD3941670ED9A126613"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Frequency
                  The Committee shall meet at least twice each year at the call of the Chairperson or the Secretary.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H953FBEAEBAD54BF58E62018E1DE222E6"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Public attendance
                  The meetings of the Committee shall be open and accessible to the public.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3E12E0E2D26B48E0A57FA3CA5E96C367"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Administrative support
                  The Secretary shall furnish the Committee with logistical and administrative support to enable the Committee to perform the duties of the Committee.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD10AE74F118F465AAE156D8D415C26C8"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (h)
               Special committees
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7D3B3040FC9140739AC8D7310FCE673B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Establishment
                  The Committee may establish special committees composed of industry representatives, members of the public, labor representatives, and other relevant parties in complying with the consultation and participation requirements under subsection (d).
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H33606EDE3B8047399E63E81589225CE1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Applicable law
                  
                     Chapter 10 of title 5, United States Code, shall not apply to a special committee established by the Committee.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE8E12DEC91414212812295F3F6EB4949"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (i)
               Personnel matters
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H25751C82CED14CC5B0C035FBB3B902EA"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  No compensation of members
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB0FF26A684F14BECA0363D55934389A5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Non-Federal employees
                     A member of the Committee who is not an officer or employee of the Government shall serve without compensation. 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD66BDA370A31415A8F9036018492F4B8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Federal employees
                     A member of the Committee who is an officer or employee of the Federal Government shall serve without compensation in addition to the compensation received for the services of the member as an officer or employee of the Federal Government.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC359F4F329E447A981CEAE041223DF44"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Death or resignation
                  If a member of the Committee dies or resigns during the term of service of such member, the Secretary shall designate a successor for the unexpired term of such member.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFF36F5220675430D9756D38040E77F30"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (j)
               Reports
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8C199CDC9A344EE39491A39CA0B40690"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Task reports
                  The Committee shall submit to the Secretary and the appropriate committees of Congress annual reports detailing the completion of each directive summarizing the—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAD6FFF252A0E4D6797B0BCE7AC1B2C85"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     findings and associated recommendations of the Committee for any legislative and administrative actions the Committee considers appropriate to improve the advancement of women in aviation; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3C6C6D7D3AE847F68BD1E4F6B1D4C638"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     planned activities of the Committee, as directed by the Secretary or approved by a majority of voting members of the Committee, and proposed terms of work to fulfill each activity.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HFAF89E3F2F404E299804398AB9DE15E7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Additional reports
                  The Committee may submit to the appropriate committees of Congress, the Secretary, and the Administrator additional reports and recommendations related to education, training, recruitment, retention, and advancement of women in the aviation industry as the Committee determines appropriate.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA3CEC36E262C4A36AF17A0349FDC82A5"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (k)
               Sunset
               The authorization of the Committee shall expire on October 1, 2028.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H2EEAAB1675024D01A29550F6ED6A86C0"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            404.
            FAA ENGAGEMENT AND COLLABORATION WITH HBCUS AND MSIS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H4CF1C1B91685439CB918CC4D68F9D42E"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               The Administrator—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H259B6B191BF748298968665A3D305142"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  shall continue—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFA2923EFB90D4E1D93F48CB469D3C3A3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     to partner with and conduct outreach to Historically Black Colleges and Universities and minority serving institutions to promote awareness of educational and career opportunities, including the Educational Partnership Initiative of the FAA, and develop curriculum related to aerospace, aviation, and air traffic control; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H68C77989BC1A448CB3718D98CE3B6A42"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     operation of the Minority Serving Institutions Internship Program; and
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H393D14A7B364450D95F8B2D4AB593D04"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  may—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC42720D63C8545E19F37BA0AE2CCF167"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     make internship placements under the Minority Serving Institutions Internship Program available during academic sessions throughout the year; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2B79808CA8CF4C6E94ABFA307FCDAAFE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     extend an internship placement under the Minority Serving Institutions Internship Program for a student beyond a single academic session.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H52AD4DFB91F342F08C722E3C56AC2968"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Program data
               In carrying out the Minority Serving Institutions Internship Program, the Administrator shall track data, including annual metrics measuring the following with respect to such Program:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF1CAD03C1ED943F184E4407DB68C5CD4"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  The total number of applicants.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1EE3B13E95BF446F8E0CD6664FF1D4AA"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  The total number of applicants offered an internship and the total number of applicants who accept an internship.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB11AAF04351441BAB4298FA1D877ED35"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  The line of business in which each intern is placed.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H499A76732DAF45F5BC3B127359430C3D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  The conversion rate of interns in the Program who are hired as full-time FAA employees.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H3B1C7D213A734FB4B5B8F6F6E0C4F5F6"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Minority serving institution defined
               In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">minority serving institution means an institution described in paragraphs (1) through (7) of section 371(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1067q(a)).
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H39F6FFB743504D0387AC145D5A10B1FE"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            405.
            AIRMAN KNOWLEDGE TESTING WORKING GROUP
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H73F89FF518764BC4A4D207666BC5CACC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Working group
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall task the Aviation Rulemaking Advisory Committee to establish a working group to assess and evaluate the appropriateness of allowing a high school student, upon successful completion of an aviation maintenance curriculum, to take the general written knowledge portion of the mechanic exam described in section 65.75 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, at an FAA-approved testing center.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H0079FAE4019D48059C56A86166C37152"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Report
               Not later than 18 months after the Aviation Rulemaking Advisory Committee tasks the working group under subsection (a), the working group shall submit to the Administrator a final report with relevant findings and recommendations. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H017210AD12014DE48720B9513A85D207"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               High school defined
               In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">high school has the meaning given such term in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H8D497B7E44C04C4999F2134ECDCEE62A"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            406.
            AIRMAN CERTIFICATION STANDARDS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H4AA82978EDA14FC49F5CF4460641EDD6"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               The Administrator shall use the Aviation Rulemaking Advisory Committee Airman Certification System Working Group (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">Working Group) to review airman certification standards and ensure that airman proficiency and knowledge correlates and corresponds to regulations, procedures, equipment, aviation infrastructure, and safety trends at the time of such review.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H00B0845BF7024EB2AD8F9F22369016FE"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Duties
               In carrying out subsection (a), the Working Group shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H425E647BBF8149E0ADE0C979293A4DDB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  obtain industry recommendations on maintaining and updating airman certification standards, including guidance documents and airman tests;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H780D7E3FA25E4F369359947C5DD9D182"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  ensure tasks carried out by the Working Group are addressed and completed in a timely and efficient manner; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H27FB93F3016D4C0FB010F23EBA5317D2"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  recommend to the Administrator a means by which the FAA may communicate to industry the process for establishing, updating, and maintaining airman certification standards, including relevant guidance documents, handbooks, and airman test materials.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H7A738D43DDD548ADA83A5EE156870A33"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            407.
            AIRMAN’S MEDICAL BILL OF RIGHTS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HF931B627739044BB8944D14F066E1DB8"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8A4D6A583B0B461ABDE2E09E1932D61D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Development
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall develop a document (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Airman’s Medical Bill of Rights) detailing the rights of an individual before, during, and after a medical examination conducted by an Aviation Medical Examiner.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4A9CF4F852144566AA09D271891613C3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Contents
                  The Airman’s Medical Bill of Rights required under paragraph (1) shall, at a minimum, contain information about the right of an individual to—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H805F5D5CC6D14DF78A334B2851D5D531"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     bring a trusted companion or request to have a chaperone present for a medical examination;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA036F34CFB464B058DD76AF8CAB44012"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     terminate an exam in accordance with guidelines from the Administrator for appropriately terminating such exam;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H334CFF3BD3374F929FE6A0E17ACA0FD6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     receive medical examination with respect and recognition of the dignity of the individual;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB1B2E2FFDD694718A8611C4B68F35230"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     be assured of privacy and confidentiality;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1C01674566894912BB459C090E0C0E16"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     select an Aviation Medical Examiner of the choice of the individual, as long as the Aviation Medical Examiner has the required designations;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE8130F7BAEEE4498A63F2DE35E884010"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     privacy when changing, undressing, and using the restroom;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H467332D156084162B392D591B0573B02"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (G)
                     ask questions about FAA medical standards and the applicability to the current health status of the individual;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H38EBAE0ABB354248A12E97135CE162D0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (H)
                     report an incident of misconduct by an Aviation Medical Examiner to the appropriate authorities, including to the State licensing board of the Aviation Medical Examiner or the FAA;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H25E191AC2BA14485BE8010FD6E82EA4E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (I)
                     report to the Administrator an allegation regarding alleged Aviation Medical Examiner misconduct without fear of retaliation or negative action relating to an airman certificate of the individual; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4A590E61355744C4B7ED83791FCDE0DB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (J)
                     be advised of any known conflicts of interest an Aviation Medical Examiner may have with respect to the medical examination of the individual.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H849D3D32DCBF4BE095DCEF5C94AF714B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Public availability
                  The Airman’s Medical Bill of Rights required under paragraph (1) shall be—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBF27157106264CB3B980017B4489A87A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     made available to, and acknowledged by, an individual in the MedXpress system (or any successor system);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8033EE2156254A4E9FE614DAB4FB5EBD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     made available in a hard-copy format by an Aviation Medical Examiner at the time of exam upon request by an individual; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1CD3B14EB1DA4AA6BD58431422412FDA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     displayed in a common space in the office of the Aviation Medical Examiner.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA12DB4A8D812445B9BC83A1EECACF42F"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Expectations for medical examinations
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H840AD56C5B3E4142B094B81A6792F530"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall develop a simplified document explaining the standard procedures performed during a medical examination conducted by an Aviation Medical Examiner.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H502777859261474287A133B4A115D229"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Public availability
                  The document required under paragraph (1) shall be—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H55411D53A07441CE80CF901E84B64691"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     made available to, and acknowledged by, an individual in the MedXpress system (or any successor system); 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB5ACF60D16FE4C488B49A483C5C4079C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     made available in a hard-copy format by an Aviation Medical Examiner at the time of exam upon request by an individual; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCA54BC6E06B143D9A1F2C3F569CDC80B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     displayed in a common space in the office of the Aviation Medical Examiner.
                  
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HEC5DDA0DA6BD44DBB103A3D28121DF6D"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            408.
            IMPROVED DESIGNEE MISCONDUCT REPORTING PROCESS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE823764575AD47B9B01F9BCF3EE4191C"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Improved designee misconduct reporting process
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5AC74BF5A22D4A2AB9A839F028F969F7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish a streamlined process for individuals involved in incidents of alleged misconduct by a designee to report such incidents in a manner that protects the privacy and confidentiality of such individuals.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H017886164B94420EAB381FB5E9DA53E7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Public access to reporting process
                  The process for reporting alleged misconduct by a designee shall be made available to the public on the website of the Administration, including—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7C87DCFBEE18440CB7497B9EFDABF046"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the designee locator search webpage; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFDBCF2CBE1194872B88AA869F53A9F92"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     the webpage of the Office of Audit and Evaluation of the FAA.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBF11E36CD8174B30A92E40DD14E932D5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Obligation to report criminal charges
                  Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall revise the orders and policies governing the Designee Management System to clarify that designees are obligated to report any arrest, indictment, or conviction for violation of a local, State, or Federal law within a period of time specified by the Administrator.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3F0E3FA3B0044E969987509E081882CD"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Audit of reporting process by inspector general
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H475D764F4F6240458B6A06841BCBADCD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     In general
                     Not later than 3 years after the date on which the Administrator finalizes the update of the reporting process under paragraph (1), the inspector general of the Department of Transportation shall conduct an audit of such reporting process.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H72AF885EA3C8490488FE679F4C5C91A9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Contents
                     In conducting the audit of the reporting process described in subparagraph (A), the inspector general shall, at a minimum—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA871537E56624A0CAB8DEF021B3B1F6C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        review the efforts of the Administration to improve the reporting process and solutions developed to respond to and investigate allegations of misconduct;
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBEFA6AAC92464E4082A32220962F8874"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        analyze reports of misconduct brought to the Administrator prior to any changes made to the reporting process as a result of the enactment of this Act, including the ultimate outcomes of those reports and whether any reports resulted in the Administrator taking action against the accused designee;
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA69BAF9F2EBC40AE915B859544A3ED01"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iii)
                        determine whether the reporting process results in appropriate action, including reviewing, investigating, and closing out reports; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7B346252A9E547828A29D1CC4A8E9B8D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iv)
                        if applicable, make recommendations to improve the reporting process.
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCC1D387093C04D79B45BB9C24E682B98"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     Report
                     Not later than 1 year after the date of initiation of the audit described in subparagraph (A), the inspector general shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the results of such audit, including findings and recommendations.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H677A0E33D6E946A28D40B26F0EBF0532"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Designee defined
               In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">designee means an individual who has been designated to act as a representative of the Administrator as—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6595528DA4A345ABACA60C6C00E0F63F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  an Aviation Medical Examiner (as described in section 183.21 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations);
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HEAD4F2B8369F4995BF71F2B0C8239A76"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  a pilot examiner (as described in section 183.23 of such title); or
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H72D83509211C40438FB135FF07A4668B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  a technical personnel examiner (as described in section 183.25 of such title).
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HB1363BC3A46B40BAB72209BB07E71344"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            409.
            REPORT ON SAFE UNIFORM OPTIONS FOR CERTAIN AVIATION EMPLOYEES
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HEBB53A7CC2044C9BB84E17B05985A479"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               The Administrator shall review whether air carriers operating under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and repair stations certificated under part 145 of such title have in place uniform policies and uniform offerings that ensure pregnant employees can perform required duties safely.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6E6CE01637CE473289A9444B5BC6BE9E"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Consultation
               In conducting the review required under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consult with air carriers and repair stations described in subsection (a) and employees of such air carriers and such stations who are required to adhere to a uniform policy.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H0F0F5B6BD71D41C79CEF88EAAF520CAF"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Briefing
               Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the results of the review required under subsection (a).
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE348E0FE79E9446E9A27B3AF2F7B4540"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            410.
            HUMAN FACTORS PROFESSIONALS
            The Administrator shall take such actions as may be necessary to establish a new work code for human factors professionals who—
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H76B2AC61EC2F47DDAAE6BEFC1BF031A3"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               perform work involving the design and testing of technologies, processes, and systems which require effective and safe human performance;
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H14F87E0832B249618777C34F500B8DCB"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               generate and apply theories, principles, practical concepts, systems, and processes related to the design and testing of technologies, systems, and training programs to support and evaluate human performance in work contexts; and
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H8B4F536003DF4A3DBC593A66FEA44E78"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (3)
               meet education or experience requirements as determined by the Administrator.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H326869D437AA4F5590235F359F001E7B"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            411.
            AEROMEDICAL INNOVATION AND MODERNIZATION WORKING GROUP
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H1153AD0B29364F42B4F2FCAA2F85E951"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Establishment
               Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish a working group (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">working group) to review the medical processes, policies, and procedures of the Administration and to make recommendations to the Administrator on modernizing such processes, policies, and procedures to ensure timely and efficient certification of airmen.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H538F2540F490497D900A82A7B036C716"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Membership
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H654DD70908E445CC905D88D80F1E3832"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  The working group shall consist of—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD9E7332372484EB7815B3B11D0E209B1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     2 co-chairs described in paragraph (2); and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H97285E003EAB46C084EA0C7C73818A6B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     not less than 15 individuals appointed by the Administrator, each of whom shall have knowledge or a background in aerospace medicine, psychiatry, neurology, cardiology, or internal medicine.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA7A97B6651F3459199971760AEFB5F0F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Co-chairs
                  The working group shall be co-chaired by—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2C4578F911F64EC2888C55CA963F1B2A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the Federal Air Surgeon of the FAA; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H036B547C46D243339AC30ACF551C87EA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     a member described under paragraph (1)(A) to be selected by members of the working group.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H628B412803A842B48308142DEEF29FAC"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Preference
                  The Administrator, in appointing members pursuant to paragraph (1)(B), shall give preference to—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDA871E8FE3E34BF3A691C6B6765BFBB9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Aviation Medical Examiners (as described in section 183.21 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA4756CEA1A7B4546B130BC9B346FB3B5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     licensed medical physicians;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4AFB772DF42449F6AAD7F64780B58344"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     practitioners holding a pilot certificate; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD165E78C356D4E5199509F66E3D5A3C7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     individuals having demonstrated research and expertise in aeromedical research or sciences.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6BDAC4F6EE0343728078270B29BA1EC8"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Activities
               In reviewing the aeromedical decision-making processes, policies, and procedures of the Administration in accordance with subsection (a), the working group, at a minimum, shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HEF66A5B091874A7A9734EF25AF20D3E5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  assess the medical conditions an Aviation Medical Examiner may issue a medical certificate directly to an individual;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H75F99084D9BD414A952EB92A5433B934"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  determine the appropriateness of the list of such medical conditions as of the date of enactment of this Act;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HFD5CF6D69FD24B5D9F6008D0B9A6A7B0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  assess the special issuance process;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD190FFAACE32470882DF23D84134AFCD"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  determine the appropriateness of whether a renewal of a special issuance can be based on a medical evaluation and treatment plan by the treating medical specialist of the individual pursuant to approval from an Aviation Medical Examiner;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H22175CEAF6BA4BA6927C7CCBE1A63C44"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  evaluate advancements in technologies to address forms of red-green color blindness and determine whether such technologies may be approved for use by airmen;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HFFAB4F9074A646F3BD7652AD1330A1F2"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  review policies and guidance relating to Attention-Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder and Attention Deficit Disorder;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE850111EACA2451184A722933DACB05F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  evaluate whether medications used to treat such disorders may be safely prescribed to airmen;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF6E60C8A01184365ADED802AD3F988E7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (8)
                  review protocols pertaining to the Human Intervention Motivation Study of the FAA;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H660EB2626BD94CA7A1EF48AA5516FF69"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (9)
                  review protocols and policies relating to—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA4232E318F0F4EE4B623D1C993587B37"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     neurological disorders; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBE3318A2E00C4C839D55A320A838C07B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     cardiovascular conditions to ensure alignment with medical best practices, latest research; 
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H21D279D09847458BA5DDA22EA9A26C56"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (10)
                  review mental health protocols and medications approved for treating such mental health conditions, including such actions taken resulting from recommendations by the Mental Health and Aviation Medical Clearances Rulemaking Committee;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3D6BE53D88234073A9F1B1D22559AFCD"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (11)
                  assess processes and protocols pertaining to recertification of airmen receiving disability insurance post-recovery from the medical condition, injury, or disability that precludes airmen from exercising the privileges of an airman certificate; 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H47CF17B70D054991A02A6E3363DA5C89"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (12)
                  assess processes and protocols pertaining to the certification of veterans reporting a disability rating from the Department of Veterans Affairs; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8798E2CA77124BAF80CDD31C4DEDACBD"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (13)
                  assess and evaluate the user interface and information-sharing capabilities of any online medical portal administered by the FAA. 
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6A2771F5E540443B9F8F0473CA25A4B3"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Aviation workforce mental health task group
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5C9FC78273E94192843F5C64C0AB8241"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Establishment
                  Not later than 120 days after the working group pursuant to subsection (a) is established, the co-chairs of such working group shall establish an aviation workforce mental health task group (referred to in this subsection as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">task group) to oversee, monitor, and evaluate efforts of the Administrator related to supporting the mental health of the aviation workforce.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB506A0B78EE9437CA26DD086B8B8A1EC"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Composition
                  The co-chairs of such working group shall appoint—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H970DD94D1DF34DC5A59482DA011D9DE5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     a Chair of the task group; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF9719831B8E0449F8D779ECDDD736C2B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     members of the task group from among the members of the working group appointed by the Administrator under subsection (b)(1).
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2DC9514CF724444AAB5A62DDD45F3B1F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Duties
                  The duties of the task group shall include—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H56B6A8B7A3AE4D438C2D713889B5399F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     carrying out the activities described in subsection (c)(10);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H124E0E0A759E4B78B82BEF46B17E82EA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     soliciting feedback from aviation industry professionals or other licensed professionals representing air carrier operations under part 121 and part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and general aviation operations under part 91 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H67B36153DCA84FBABC9FDED4FEFF67E0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     reviewing and evaluating guidance issued by the International Civil Aviation Organization on aviation workforce mental health; 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBBB8666CC1D1405DB0FCCBD7A2F6761D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     providing advice, as appropriate, on the implementation of the final recommendations issued by the inspector general of the Department of Transportation in the report titled, <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">FAA Conduct Comprehensive Evaluations of Pilots With Mental Health Challenges, but Opportunities Exist to Further Mitigate Safety Risks, published on July 12, 2023 (AV2023038); 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD9EB609920B042448186F3777598E148"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     monitoring and evaluating the implementation of recommendations by the Mental Health and Aviation Medical Clearances Rulemaking Committee;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H48DDB65CE8FE4878B26CE1F1B5BF1F86"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     expanding and improving mental health outreach, education, and assistance programs for the aviation workforce; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1D4DFE5495154005AB6B1B78763A6805"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (G)
                     reducing the stigma associated with mental healthcare in the aviation workforce.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1176AE9279744F2C9CE2AC4A2DB9D257"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
