               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H0D8541C9CC9B4E279498524766DA0308"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Considerations
                  In developing the plan under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall consider—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H686BF28F120149239027EFA5C21E145A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the resources needed to support an increase in the total number of developmental air traffic controllers enrolled at the FAA Academy;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB180812F50AC4A329B5FF8C35859558C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     the resources needed to lessen FAA Academy attrition per fiscal year;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE7E77A224C77440088AD194997435B82"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     how to modernize the education and training of developmental air traffic controllers, including through the use of new techniques and technologies to support instruction;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF402519265564434B35AEE953E4A8911"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     the equipment needed to support expanded instruction, including air traffic control simulation systems, virtual reality, and other virtual training platforms;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA4057A6AE9004AE992BD101482CFAE78"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     projected staffing needs associated with FAA Academy expansion and the operation of education platforms, including the number of on-the-job instructors needed to educate and train additional developmental air traffic controllers;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H33972948D9F14AD78FAA2B14619BB4DA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     the costs of expanding FAA capacity at the existing air traffic control academy (as described in paragraph (1)(A));
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H57CF53066FCB4C2BB1A2CE89845F975F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (G)
                     soliciting input from, and coordinating with, relevant stakeholders as appropriate, including the exclusive bargaining representative of air traffic control specialists of the FAA certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H23B65D5867E84B928C44018E725D1563"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (H)
                     other logistical and financial considerations as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA71A771219D0440CBFB4F2800EB079D2"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Report
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the plan developed under subsection (a).
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD834877AB49D47A0BAFEB6F752BCB0AC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Briefing
               Not later than 180 days after the submission of the plan under subsection (b), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the plan, including the implementation of the plan.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H710C51E9B0F946678EB75386FFBF67B5"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            440.
            IMPROVING FEDERAL AVIATION WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H610D04D4D9B844359965706845561C45"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Section 625 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) is amended to read as follows: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H8AF12013BFD441349312C88B3748B602"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H84E46CF1E303497B85E9398D72F280C3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     625.
                     AVIATION WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HDF5118F2609342AEAEFA897C4B881B5D"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        In general
                        The Secretary of Transportation shall establish—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H837CE17470B44C0EA6E67A34503DBBEC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           a program to provide grants for eligible projects to support the education and recruitment of future aircraft pilots and the development of the aircraft pilot workforce;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAE719DB0227D4CDFACD116BCEE266266"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           a program to provide grants for eligible projects to support the education and recruitment of aviation maintenance technical workers and the development of the aviation maintenance workforce; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H67BC8139AD844F268E937D0687443AF6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           a program to provide grants for eligible projects to support the education and recruitment of aviation manufacturing technical workers and aerospace engineers and the development of the aviation manufacturing workforce.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H61C19D271AD946C88F32E5E7915901E4"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Project grants
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAA5B435F28B14B03B8C3F0BE1CAC7D13"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           Out of amounts made available under section 48105 of title 49, United States Code, there is authorized to be appropriated—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H49261BE21EB74500BE20186D1F0B5DA8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              $20,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028 to provide grants under the program established under subsection (a)(1);
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5EEF81C1BE9B4DF3838B0CECDB944FD9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              $20,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028 to provide grants under the program established under subsection (a)(2); and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3DFBF14BA2FA4E80B6F8732DDCA11D76"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              $20,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028 to provide grants under the program established under subsection (a)(3).
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCB54D40F8E0549E7A911260BED8EEAA3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Dollar amount limit
                           In providing grants under the programs established under subsection (a), the Secretary may not make any grant more than $1,000,000 to any eligible entity in any 1 fiscal year.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H216A6454DC3E4AC9963371DEFFD04F61"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Education projects
                           The Secretary shall ensure that not less than 20 percent of the amounts made available under this subsection is used to carry out a grant program that shall be referred to as the ‘Willa Brown Aviation Education Program’ under which the Secretary shall provide grants for eligible projects described in subsection (d) that are carried out in counties containing at least 1 qualified opportunity zone (as such term is defined in section 1400Z–1(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD987609C7EE149FAABD13B1FDF69FBC7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Set aside for technical assistance
                           The Secretary may set aside up to 2 percent of the funds appropriated to carry out this subsection for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028 to provide technical assistance to eligible applicants for a grant under this subsection.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4382A04C87864C83A90CF831A5E6EFA5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Consideration for certain applicants
                           In reviewing and selecting applications for grants under the programs established under subsection (a), the Secretary may give consideration to applicants that provide an assurance—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HABC7D636DC704540BE6D0BFCD803D5FA"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              to use grant funds to encourage the participation of populations that are underrepresented in the aviation industry, including in economically disadvantaged geographic areas and rural communities;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H016B8622782B4B70A8B1EB04E78A692A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              to address the workforce needs of rural and regional airports; or 
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H48204C16F6494029A8BA2F602C197E02"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              to strengthen aviation programs at a minority-serving institution (as described in section 371(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1067q(a)), a public institution of higher education, or a public postsecondary vocational institution.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HC3BDBD228065486986432ECE58F5351E"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Eligible applications
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9BFB01FDB9894A5B856D605B5BFB2090"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Application for aircraft pilot program
                           An application for a grant under the program established under subsection (a)(1) may be submitted, in such form as the Secretary may specify, by—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H969DBBDE8EF34AC69D5E635A4CB5E3E7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              an air carrier (as such term is defined in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code);
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5EF99A32AFAD45F18CA326958D7106E0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              an entity that holds management specifications under subpart K of title 91 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBEB8E7E00983451A8523203F508EDD06"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              an accredited institution of higher education, a postsecondary vocational institution, or a high school or secondary school;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2EE960E461584679BD79E7C78D2AB802"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              a flight school that provides flight training, as such term is defined in part 61 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, or that holds a pilot school certificate under part 141 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H263FEAF3F4814CFFB1FE4109945A9B9B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              a labor organization representing professional aircraft pilots;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2556E95C4EC14E20A78040F484DCD086"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              an aviation-related nonprofit organization described in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 that is exempt from taxation under section 501(a) of such Code; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4EE1881852744167A6ACE9E9E252564A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (G)
                              a State, local, territorial, or Tribal governmental entity.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1744561EA45544C3AC2FB536010F6188"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Application for aviation maintenance program
                           An application for a grant under the program established under subsection (a)(2) may be submitted, in such form as the Secretary may specify, by—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA79798183A6F432B9F2C0F8C04128E2A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              a holder of a certificate issued under part 21, 121, 135, 145, or 147 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H92976B37721C46ACA0D9A89C0B58B4A0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              a labor organization representing aviation maintenance workers;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H57F63F25DB66493E84A115F5206BA535"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              an accredited institution of higher education, a postsecondary vocational institution, or a high school or secondary school;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H927EDB4D0EE94C51894EA4D301B6D722"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              an aviation-related nonprofit organization described in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 that is exempt from taxation under section 501(a) of such Code; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0C2E71EBB4C2403A85A83D0AC9F0EF39"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              a State, local, territorial, or Tribal governmental entity.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4CB19BFEF8FA44F5A62369F5732EC237"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Application for aviation manufacturing program
                           An application for a grant under the program established under subsection (a)(3) may be submitted, in such form as the Secretary may specify, by—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H04686F4C56174CB3B88D57B64D7B5DB8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              a holder of a type or production certificate or similar authorization issued under section 44704 of title 49, United States Code; 
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H80BFCFE825234DA6AFE4C777D0526757"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              an accredited institution of higher education, a postsecondary vocational institution, or a high school or secondary school;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF2D0F6CA6848433DB6F4A88C13F1C7B1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              an aviation-related nonprofit organization described in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 that is exempt from taxation under section 501(a) of such Code;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB223198575D14183AA564DF5BF214D41"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              a labor organization representing aerospace engineering, design, or manufacturing workers; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H87A969574E114410B5B0AAC54297A8F2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              a State, local, territorial, or Tribal governmental entity.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H0CB6D587885D4DD6AFEB8CF0971D2494"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Eligible projects
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAC43F0EA93F64DCCB22341A1A5F344D9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Aircraft pilot program
                           For purposes of the program established under subsection (a)(1), an eligible project is a project—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H983D25B2C4DE4AE0A2BDD8246CB146E0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              to create and deliver a program or curriculum that provides high school or secondary school students and students of institutions of higher education with meaningful aviation education to become aircraft pilots or unmanned aircraft systems operators, including purchasing and operating a computer-based simulator associated with such curriculum;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE0A73C09986744CEB043D881CDFB45E6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              to establish or improve registered apprenticeship, internship, or scholarship programs for individuals pursuing employment as a professional aircraft pilot or unmanned aircraft systems operator;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0DCBA5ED9BB3417588665A3E0762781C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              to create and deliver curriculum that provides certified flight instructors with the necessary instructional, leadership, and communication skills to better educate student pilots;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H05C8C20CBFB643B2B40DD7CF63C1E548"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              to support the transition to professional aircraft pilot or unmanned systems operator careers, including for members and veterans of the armed forces;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H795E120E32194D65A71D1475AF9831D1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              to support robust outreach about careers in commercial aviation as a professional aircraft pilot or unmanned system operator, including outreach to populations that are underrepresented in the aviation industry; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3E9BAB89036E4160A01C163B3D78B8A9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              to otherwise enhance or expand the aircraft pilot or unmanned aircraft system operator workforce. 
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2DE7E77C704C4FE48B078520B548E0DB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Aviation maintenance program
                           For purposes of the program established under subsection (a)(2), an eligible project is a project—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5A0A92D21A574F1A90E908A34D433C7F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              to create and deliver a program or curriculum that provides high school and secondary school students and students of institutions of higher education with meaningful aviation maintenance education to become an aviation mechanic or aviation maintenance technician, including purchasing and operating equipment associated with such curriculum;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA63EEA10BAA34E23BC4260F9944BEC55"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              to establish or improve registered apprenticeship, internship, or scholarship programs for individuals pursuing employment in the aviation maintenance industry;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD62EA529DDB74E71A041E6ED159D9763"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              to support the transition to aviation maintenance careers, including for members and veterans of the armed forces; 
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8D1F70EDB2EE4D78BD822B07BF453007"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              to support robust outreach about careers in the aviation maintenance industry, including outreach to populations that are underrepresented in the aviation industry; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6F95D21D0A1447D18E10A6124A507D23"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              to otherwise enhance or expand the aviation maintenance technical workforce. 
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H49346AD5617E438ABD91FB36E08D5882"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Aviation manufacturing program
                           For purposes of the program established under subsection (a)(3), an eligible project is a project—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF1762C7268964E42A2218BFE4EF70EC7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              to create and deliver a program or curriculum that provides high school and secondary school students and students of institutions of higher education with meaningful aviation manufacturing education to become an aviation manufacturing technical worker or aerospace engineer, including teaching technical skills used in the engineering and production of components, parts, or systems thereof for inclusion in an aircraft, aircraft engine, propeller, or appliance;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1FF772D4BBC642918618F9F292EC6C42"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              to establish registered apprenticeship, internship, or scholarship programs for individuals pursuing employment in the aviation manufacturing industry;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3D334522AE2948F283EDB8615551A35E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              to support the transition to aviation manufacturing careers, including for members and veterans of the armed forces; 
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7EAE9D39E90147049EB0BE3DA000CFA0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              to support robust outreach about careers in the aviation manufacturing industry, including outreach to populations that are underrepresented in the aviation industry; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCB678EEEC9334D9B8229B7DEC7425DAE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              to otherwise enhance or expand the aviation manufacturing workforce. 
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HBBFE16BBF5AE4295AB72330E867E255E"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (e)
                        Reporting and monitoring requirements
                        The Secretary shall establish reasonable reporting and monitoring requirements for grant recipients under this section to measure relevant outcomes for the grant programs established under subsection (a).
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HD964FC67C2074AA687B7D5BB35D364ED"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (f)
                        Notice of grants
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE4C08A1FA69243D2AE8CC9C904470BB5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Timely public notice
                           The Secretary shall provide public notice of any grant awarded under this section in a timely fashion after the Secretary awards such grant.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2E24D6937FF243178BF500A1B172E83D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Notice to Congress
                           The Secretary shall provide to the appropriate Committees of Congress advance notice of a grant to be made under this section.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HDA4CFD3583D44F1BA3007C2C5A441E8F"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (g)
                        Grant authority
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6998C077EEB24B04AADE2B33D1C273B3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Limit on FAA authority
                           The authority of the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration, acting on behalf of the Secretary, to issue grants under this section shall terminate on October 1, 2027.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBB0F52C86F744CD2BAADEA59BAA4E9A5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Nondelegation
                           Beginning on October 1, 2027, the Secretary shall issue grants under this section and may not delegate any of the authorities or responsibilities under this section to the Administrator.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H231722FB52D5493F8115768547AC94C1"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (h)
                        Program name redesignation
                        Beginning on October 1, 2027, the Secretary shall redesignate the name of the program established under subsection (a) as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Cooperative Aviation Recruitment, Enrichment, and Employment Readiness Program or the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">CAREER Program.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HFBAFCECE2A44416AAC4C88CCF8ECAD98"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        Consultation with Secretary of Education
                        The Secretary may consult with the Secretary of Education, as appropriate, in—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H56EDE5F88AD14858858AC7F5396769DE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           reviewing applications for grants for eligible projects under this section; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H57A2F8B2ECE14667B4A66F846224059B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           developing considerations regarding program quality and measurement of student outcomes.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H702D351061FE430F83363D24A9CB1C40"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (j)
                        Report
                        Not later than September 30, 2028, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the administration of the programs established under subsection (a) covering each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028 that includes—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H512FCAD1F9B84735B74C68D8ED79726F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           a summary of projects awarded grants under this section and the progress of each recipient towards fulfilling program expectations;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5E9EF0B0464D46CEBA34A5C2E413E95D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           an evaluation of how such projects cumulatively impact the future supply of individuals in the United States aviation workforce, including any related best practices for carrying out such projects;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H03EDD2B5397840C9B0FED524979A7DC0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           recommendations for better coordinating actions by governmental entities, educational institutions, and businesses, aviation labor organizations, or other stakeholders to support aviation workforce growth; 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H45D15E4A747E42709DCCE9A82B675D5A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           a review of how many grant recipients engaged with veterans and the resulting impact, if applicable, on recruiting and retaining veterans as part of the aviation workforce; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0991DB777A1644D19C92783431B117C5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           a review of outreach conducted by grant recipients to encourage individuals to participate in aviation careers and the resulting impact, if applicable, on recruiting and retaining such individuals as part of the aviation workforce.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H3A7768727B8943A3BD7D2D6DA1D017B1"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (k)
                        Program authority sunset
                        The authority of the Secretary to issue grants under this section shall expire on October 1, 2028.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H468A81C8C1344B32B2BBA039339892B5"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (l)
                        Definitions
                        In this section:
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1776DD6669004492B0477053FFBE3AE7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Armed forces
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">armed forces has the meaning given such term in section 101 of title 10, United States Code.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0E1A26B42BD44F8F8B60B8D3D837F2D4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           High school
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">high school has the meaning given such term in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801)).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H507338BD6B0C41A6B382945447517B4D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Institution of higher education
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">institution of higher education has the meaning given such term in section 101(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001(a)).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA8793BB556EB4AC5B9E8462A7B01DCD9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Postsecondary vocational institution
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">postsecondary vocational institution has the meaning given such term in section 102(c) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1002(c)). 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8A66F59490BE4D00AFA23401324C9103"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Secondary school
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">secondary school has the meaning given such term in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801)).
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6B56CA827F3E4E8BA4C0AF30E5D74315"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Effective date
               The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect on October 1, 2024. 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H5BD82FB2BF844C62B6B9C9DFB590F119"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            441.
            NATIONAL STRATEGIC PLAN FOR AVIATION WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA20FD6CBD6AD48EFB16D7BDBBF583D36"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               
                  Chapter 401 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H7BF6A7AAB5844E83A4926647BFCAED09"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H165471BE98C7425E8B0B5CAE685C5848"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     40132.
                     NATIONAL STRATEGIC PLAN FOR AVIATION WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H7DE550FC89534BB8AAB9BCD29DD2A18D"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        In general
                        Not later than September 30, 2025, the Secretary of Transportation shall, in consultation with other Federal agencies and the Cooperative Aviation Recruitment, Enrichment, and Employment Readiness Council (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">CAREER Council) established in subsection (c), establish and maintain a national strategic plan to improve recruitment, hiring, and retention and address projected challenges in the civil aviation workforce, including—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H23B4024E7E4D4902AD055815D436DF87"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           any short-term, medium-term, and long-term workforce challenges relevant to the economy, workforce readiness, and priorities of the United States aviation sector;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAF09F4FC870642109D84008BE35C196A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           any existing or projected workforce shortages; and 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7360073C8F344914956D3F0F18D9AF41"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           any workforce situation or condition that warrants special attention by the Federal Government.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HE954571E2D064C7F87AA8D3BC1E8FB32"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Requirements
                        The national strategic plan described in subsection (a) shall—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBD555AF0BD5D4F3F8FE5357ECF49B906"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           take into account the activities and accomplishments of all Federal agencies that are related to carrying out such plan;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2D8AE09463B143A7A16772FEF398FF56"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           include recommendations for carrying out such plan; and 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAFE3089A1C484D1CB06F680C8F7EE9BF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           project and identify, on an annual basis, aviation workforce challenges, including any applicable workforce shortages.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HED9F4B9681C141A7ADB52BF3BF182789"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Career council
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB35A5DA945964156842FC91CF8080E81"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Establishment
                           Not later than September 30, 2025, the Secretary, in consultation with the Administrator, shall establish a council comprised of individuals with expertise in the civil aviation industry to—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6AF61A6A3183470BBD3192FDBAADA736"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              assist with developing and maintaining the national strategic plan described in subsection (a); and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE345DCBA536248DBB98B9BEDEBCAD60E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              provide advice to the Secretary, as appropriate, relating to the CAREER Program established under section 625 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018, including as such advice relates to program administration and grant application selection, and support the development of performance metrics regarding the quality and outcomes of the Program. 
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H234B59CDB6F541C185EC0D28C7D457B2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Appointment
                           The CAREER Council shall be appointed by the Secretary from candidates nominated by national associations representing various sectors of the aviation industry, including—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC0905D76128B43F59DBEFFC9336CA176"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              commercial aviation;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA69E192C6AB74AA0905A11CC14091922"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              general aviation;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5DEA907450524B2FA0363A8EEAB54F86"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              aviation labor organizations, including collective bargaining representatives of Federal Aviation Administration aviation safety inspectors, aviation safety engineers, and air traffic controllers;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4A1C52865A7B407983BF32580B1CFDC8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              aviation maintenance, repair, and overhaul;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H50CC2D9F3CE34572920A8C5E07B8DAA9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              aviation manufacturers; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEFDF4B7F1ADA49F7AD1484A95CF2C3F5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              unmanned aviation.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H466B5080957D4713B4338F8531CC7143"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Term
                           Each council member appointed by the Secretary under paragraph (2) shall serve a term of 2 years.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HA93A8B089383476FA92BAB3275677A23"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Nondelegation
                        The Secretary may not delegate any of the authorities or responsibilities under this section to the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration.
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H84DA5AC38EFF4AC2AB5BBEB960B50142"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Clerical amendment
               The analysis for chapter 401 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H4F92CFAE795E4B2CA7E5B90CD31A48E5"
                              style="OLC">
                  
                     40132. National strategic plan for aviation workforce development. 
                  
                  .
               
            
         
      
      <title id="HA3C4178074F94614BCA7436F08BCC22E"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         V
         PASSENGER EXPERIENCE IMPROVEMENTS
         <subtitle id="H1DE72D356D93472EBFD19382EF51368B"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            A
            Consumer Enhancements
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H922549D7AD294F5296AFC432A9A4DDE6"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               501.
               ESTABLISHMENT OF OFFICE OF AVIATION CONSUMER PROTECTION
               Section 102 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HAB5F163769BE4B27960328656001F8B5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in subsection (e)(1)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4A8DB92A875F43EE830A348375DA9C4E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">7 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">8; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0AE7DD1B62D642B1A6ADD61E8204AC5B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     in subparagraph (A) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and an Assistant Secretary for Transportation Policy and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">an Assistant Secretary for Transportation Policy, and an Assistant Secretary for Aviation Consumer Protection; and
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4112DD326D214070A99693FD8399F2BC"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H6911279A530940998A14D842C4937301"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H28574643A72140B7A7DE122D9541A022"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (j)
                        Office of Aviation Consumer Protection
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB5A1B29ECD1846608ABF8D258B1B88BD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Establishment
                           There is established in the Department an Office of Aviation Consumer Protection (in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Office) to administer and enforce the aviation consumer protection and civil rights authorities provided to the Department by statute, including the authorities under section 41712—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA17E0DD3A7DC43AF8F1AFED5664518A0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              to assist, educate, and protect passengers; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA2A8E69FF5364E108DAC50FCD94DF5F1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              to monitor compliance with, conduct investigations relating to, and enforce, with support of attorneys in the Office of the General Counsel, including by taking appropriate action to address violations of aviation consumer protection and civil rights.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H46B445653C5843609E8F68DCA95B4AE3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Leadership
                           The Office shall be headed by the Assistant Secretary for Aviation Consumer Protection (in this subsection referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Assistant Secretary).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4B1233E030A74D5295D3F8FB68EA54E2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Transition
                           Not later than 180 days after funding is appropriated for an Office of Aviation Consumer Protection headed by an Assistant Secretary, the Office of Aviation Consumer Protection that is a unit within the Office of the General Counsel of the Department which is headed by the Assistant General Counsel for Aviation Consumer Protection shall cease to exist. The Secretary shall determine which employees are necessary to fulfill the responsibilities of the new Office of Aviation Consumer Protection and such employees shall be transferred from the Office of the General Counsel, as appropriate, to the newly established Office of Aviation Consumer Protection.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H25F4ACEA39D94D5E99243331CF721385"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Coordination
                           The Assistant Secretary shall coordinate with the General Counsel appointed under subsection (e)(1)(E), in accordance with section 1.26 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation), on all legal matters relating to—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEF3CCA4BCAC241A3B85D3F606306DFE7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              aviation consumer protection; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB5EF3A39EB0C4F57B197888B866DCE03"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              the duties and activities of the Office described in subparagraphs (A) through (C) of paragraph (1).
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC773E8D8708C4B9CB04016221C8EAD95"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Annual report
                           The Assistant Secretary shall submit to the Secretary, who shall submit to Congress and make publicly available on the website of the Department, an annual report that, with respect to matters under the jurisdiction of the Department, or otherwise within the statutory authority of the Department— 
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAF86856CB6EA4961B8F852AE539A6A33"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              analyzes trends in aviation consumer protection, civil rights, and licensing;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD4F6C7D462694BD19958E75D7DC4515C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              identifies major challenges facing passengers; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD2EB1FE8BF5240D1AED68FA11E1707DA"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              addresses any other relevant issues, as the Assistant Secretary determines to be appropriate.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA913F2CA22CB44B19770273D3790089D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (6)
                           Funding
                           There is authorized to be appropriated $12,000,000 for fiscal year 2024, $13,000,000 for fiscal year 2025, $14,000,000 for fiscal year 2026, $15,000,000 for fiscal year 2027, and $16,000,000 for fiscal year 2028 to carry out this subsection.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H1DC8BE5A3CFD4929AD8220FB283E71C1"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               502.
               ADDITIONAL WITHIN AND BEYOND PERIMETER SLOT EXEMPTIONS AT RONALD REAGAN WASHINGTON NATIONAL AIRPORT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8D2205F4FEB049D2B3F3AF210DC82468"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Increase in number of slot exemptions
                  Section 41718 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HE89E1AFCAA454715BF10D60E1B190F42"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H7179AB1907664584A3C795483227263A"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        Additional slot exemptions
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4E3A2FF324184AC68AD937D27D796FCA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Increase in slot exemptions
                           Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, the Secretary shall grant, by order, 10 exemptions from—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD9792C6FB951476B8195650694ACFFD3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              the application of sections 49104(a)(5), 49109, and 41714 to air carriers to operate limited frequencies and aircraft on routes between Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport and domestic airports located within or beyond the perimeter described in section 49109; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H726CF4E7985B48F2BDB51517917D1422"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              the requirements of subparts K, S, and T of part 93 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H43AC4EC4DF734F2A93A719F685275CD9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Non-limited incumbents
                           Of the slot exemptions made available under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall make 8 available to incumbent air carriers qualifying for status as a non-limited incumbent carrier at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport as of the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H663ADBD715D14C978F935A589AE0498C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Limited incumbents
                           Of the slot exemptions made available under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall make 2 available to incumbent air carriers qualifying for status as a limited incumbent carrier at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport as of the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1CC270E1BCCC4D1282FD33E90A08175C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Allocation procedures
                           The Secretary shall allocate the 10 slot exemptions provided under paragraph (1) pursuant to the application process established by the Secretary under subsection (d), subject to the following:
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8F389E2D23654DE0AA13535386774A4E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Limitations
                              Each air carrier that is eligible under paragraph (2) and paragraph (3) shall be eligible to operate no more and no less than 2 of the newly authorized slot exemptions.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4BFDA163EC4945288C1379CAF2982966"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Criteria
                              The Secretary shall consider the extent to which the exemptions will—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H30C1CA5CF9384E27B0E5B3D46FA89359"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 enhance options for nonstop travel to beyond-perimeter airports that do not have nonstop service from Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport as of the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024; or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H76F9D450A88441CF9507D1BF7BDE0DFD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 have a positive impact on the overall level of competition in the markets that will be served as a result of those exemptions.
                              
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEE2A7EE297F44AE49FFFC4F118A0412E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Prohibition
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9082117538FD4EDDA0B4FA90CD81340D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              The Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority may not assess any penalty or similar levy against an individual air carrier solely for obtaining and operating a slot exemption authorized under this subsection.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4014736F4AC146FFAB4B89FE8AD0831E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Rule of construction
                              Subparagraph (A) shall not be construed as prohibiting the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority from assessing and collecting any penalty, fine, or other levy, such as a handling fee or landing fee, that is—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H95F05653603B4D2BB80293EE7B65F2EC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 authorized by the Metropolitan Washington Airports Regulations;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H454C5D3EEC9B4DA0A518272393A94AFB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 agreed to in writing by the air carrier; or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2D348F50C00D4886838B373ECF809908"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 charged in the ordinary course of business to an air carrier operating at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport regardless of whether or not the air carrier obtained a slot exemption authorized under this subsection.
                              
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H79ADF406A7904872A13FB2DB42367645"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Conforming amendments
                  Section 41718(c)(2)(A) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6FC060B3D401410B99DE91C42A39E47A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in clause (i) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and (b) and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">, (b), and (i); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H759370E83A664D4BAE105CC32A698D3C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in clause (ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and (g) and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">(g), and (i).
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF970DEBE31B245D89894AFC4503673DC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Preservation of existing within perimeter service
                  Nothing in this section, or the amendments made by this section, shall be construed as authorizing the conversion of a within-perimeter exemption or slot at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport that is in effect on the date of enactment of this Act to serve an airport located beyond the perimeter described in section 49109 of title 49, United States Code.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC3A07B32681947A7A9202B584FD5A6E2"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               503.
               REFUNDS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0CBE6FC194DB4CC0875D86CDACEE1819"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 423 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 42304 the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HA3587E6EC3F64562BC36AE887FE952FF"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H41B66CC8497A40E2AB2711F2900A357B"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        42305.
                        REFUNDS FOR CANCELLED OR SIGNIFICANTLY DELAYED OR CHANGED FLIGHTS
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HC630DA7C0D97416C92FF49B1B8AE6B7F"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In general
                           In the case of a passenger that holds a nonrefundable ticket on a scheduled flight to, from, or within the United States, an air carrier or a foreign air carrier shall, upon request as set forth in subsection (f), provide a full refund, including any taxes and ancillary fees, for the fare such carrier collected for any cancelled flight or significantly delayed or changed flight where the passenger chooses not to—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
