                                       id="HBC561E42C2674EAAAE3A16163B959743"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              fly on the significantly delayed or changed flight or accept rebooking on an alternative flight; or
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H13453789DF204ACBA78F8B22EAB4F5C8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              accept any voucher, credit, or other form of compensation offered by the air carrier or foreign air carrier pursuant to subsection (c). 
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H704E2AF73CD744C2951C7BF1837415E9"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Timing of refund
                           Any refund required under subsection (a) shall be issued by the air carrier or foreign air carrier—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3242518CB6B84DBB8E5C647CDB8D5F92"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              in the case of a ticket purchased with a credit card, not later than 7 business days after the earliest date the refund was requested as set forth in subsection (f); or 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD5FEE5EC8CD1476F928141034AF5A05D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              in the case of a ticket purchased with cash or another form of payment, not later than 20 days after the earliest date the refund was requested as set forth in subsection (f).
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H031010B3343B4EBF81202D23F320CD2B"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Alternative to refund
                           An air carrier and a foreign air carrier may offer a voucher, credit, or other form of compensation as an explicit alternative to providing a refund required by subsection (a) but only if—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H30375C303C9E41B98A2B49F614D3457B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              the offer includes a clear and conspicuous notice of—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7DBFCE5764B44FBEAE034F2DCEE29358"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 the terms of the offer; and 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H036A698452F94AB49BF9226327E2ADF4"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 the passenger's right to a full refund under this section; 
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H051E9EF8EDDE448DAC38BF1F8373F91E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              the voucher, credit, or other form of compensation offered explicitly as an alternative to providing a refund required by subsection (a) remains valid and redeemable by the consumer for a period of at least 5 years from the date on which such voucher, credit, or other form of compensation is issued; 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA3AD4F1FE1664A6C8084998EF7C40308"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              upon the issuance of such voucher, credit, or other form of compensation, an air carrier, foreign air carrier, or ticket agent, where applicable, notifies the recipient of the expiration date of the voucher, credit, or other form of compensation; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB79042AFCC9E4C6EA6E92E8F77F1C774"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              upon request by an individual who self-identifies as having a disability (as defined in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations), an air carrier, foreign air carrier, or ticket agent provides a notification under paragraph (3) in an electronic format that is accessible to the recipient.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HC6AE0C361890486C9DDCEF67CF469351"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Significantly delayed or changed flight defined
                           In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">significantly delayed or changed flight includes, at a minimum, a flight where the passenger arrives at a destination airport—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9DC350DA6861467785025231C8EBD29C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              in the case of a domestic flight, 3 or more hours after the original scheduled arrival time; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HFF65067F8298487E8FBA131A8E309D7E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              in the case of an international flight, 6 or more hours after the original scheduled arrival time. 
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H4119A7BBD0EC47F786BEB8A40CA3A250"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Application to ticket agents
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H142CD64C32334779B6BDED0E72CFB8D3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary shall issue a final rule to apply refund requirements to ticket agents in the case of cancelled flights and significantly delayed or changed flights.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H715D70491B264E5693A38794231073DC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Transfer of funds
                              The Secretary shall issue regulations requiring air carriers and foreign air carriers to promptly transfer funds to a ticket agent if—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H2EF62C31D43A4CB09AB20DC329EDA39F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 the Secretary has determined that the ticket agent is responsible for providing the refund; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HC9ADCDC945A1415BB9203F7AC6122AA0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 the ticket agent does not possess the funds of the passenger.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD8741C86A84C4EFFA104A3ADC0536590"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Timing and alternatives
                              A refund provided by a ticket agent shall comply with the requirements in subsections (b) and (c) of this section.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H4941BD8F432F4023B0BBC4C2EB4CAEEF"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (f)
                           Refund
                           An air carrier and a foreign air carrier shall consider a passenger to have requested a refund if—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0E1336277EE344F1AF41C06FB246F013"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              a flight is cancelled and a passenger is not offered an alternative flight or any voucher, credit, or other form of compensation by the air carrier or foreign air carrier pursuant to subsection (c);
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE931E77E84334CC89F34EED0A58A5357"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              a passenger rejects the significantly delayed or changed flight, rebooking on an alternative flight, or any voucher, credit, or other form of compensation offered by the air carrier or foreign air carrier pursuant to subsection (c); or 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H75A3534DE0414C0C8B93B6B579FD8179"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              a passenger does not respond to an offer of—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HD63C9108E4C048BA9F02ACA3610F7BD6"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 a significantly delayed or changed flight or an alternative flight and the flight departs without the passenger; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HF9D9B55C62F843F8B2B669C06CBFABAA"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 a voucher, credit, or other form of compensation by the date on which the cancelled flight was scheduled to depart or the date that the significantly delayed or changed flight departs.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H1FB6EC6BE5694A968667282CA1DCE310"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (g)
                           Refund notification
                           An air carrier and a foreign air carrier shall update their passenger notification systems to ensure passengers owed a refund under this section are notified of their right to receive a refund.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H806FF1C89E344B7EA15E605FB55541EF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 423 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 42304 the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H9EA7B17EB64D4D04B6735805DC70481F"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        42305. Refunds for cancelled or significantly delayed or changed flights.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H7C72E61D13EC4D268AFED22EE5933400"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               504.
               KNOW YOUR RIGHTS POSTERS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9F6B0A0BE0164D8C8A98EF829AFAA701"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 423 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by inserting after section 42305 the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H1C92FC9024E947D48E42C5B5CB526BB8"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HF6F0DC81BEAA4E978CFB6B2738B26A3A"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        42306.
                        KNOW YOUR RIGHTS POSTERS
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H19839898673F4096A3617466233A3615"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In general
                           Each large hub airport, medium hub airport, and small hub airport with scheduled passenger service shall prominently display posters that clearly and concisely outline the rights of airline passengers under Federal law with respect to, at a minimum—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HFEA6F566D78D427EB28594D2230EDEC7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              flight delays and cancellations;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H919443472CB34BA392CAA09D275467F7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              refunds;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H69E86F5C22754A3386A55DD01CEF91AF"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              bumping of passengers from flights and the oversale of flights; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC281A1C2356E4FF896248EF900E2F155"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              lost, delayed, or damaged baggage.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H899D83BD6C57439B80C42054AECC735E"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Location
                           Posters described in subsection (a) shall be displayed in conspicuous locations throughout the airport, including ticket counters, security checkpoints, and boarding gates.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HDC8961BECF544AEDB08087E9A66AC948"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Accessibility assistance
                           Each large hub airport, medium hub airport, and small hub airport with scheduled passenger service shall ensure that passengers with a disability (as such term is defined in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations) who identify themselves as having such a disability are notified of the availability of accessibility assistance and shall assist such passengers in connecting to the appropriate entities to obtain the same information required in this section that is provided to other passengers.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H37EB34BE79334362889C1D37A22DF106"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Exemption
                  Section 46301(a)(1)(A) of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">chapter 423 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">chapter 423 (except section 42306).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFF5642BF23074D66AF75B4B5753F16A2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 423 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by inserting after the item relating to section 42305 the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HE9B868D7A3824FB2B2A5F39456CE6C86"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        42306. Know Your Rights posters.
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7E8E766937724C3DBADDAF2BC8C8428E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Effective date
                  The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H9850E5EC41414E68B8E5A4803E255D00"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               505.
               ACCESS TO CUSTOMER SERVICE ASSISTANCE FOR ALL TRAVELERS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA2F4A982CC3A45348E1EA4ACF2DD4F42"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Findings
                  Congress finds the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBB39D5B81B9B4D929483D8A0C92B8DFB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In the event of a cancelled or delayed flight, it is important for customers to be able to easily access information about the status of their flight and any alternative flight options.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H478B516D424A4E1DA9E30197F7C60A7B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Customers should be able to access real-time assistance from customer service agents of air carriers without an excessive wait time, particularly during times of mass disruptions.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB116E39BE24A4D6284C4E90A5A3C1095"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Transparency requirements
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF99B255A438C4EAB8DAF23A9814F20C6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Requirement to maintain a live customer chat or monitored text messaging number
                     
                        Chapter 423 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by inserting after section 42306 the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H37F31DB0E3674F778CE99A5853CCE3C8"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H15B2C50F6FB743C6BCE0E6C5B7FBEF51"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes"
                                  section-type="subsequent-section">
                           42307.
                           REQUIREMENT TO MAINTAIN A LIVE CUSTOMER CHAT OR MONITORED TEXT MESSAGING NUMBER
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H0D8F2746090047EF83912BA0F93225D4"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (a)
                              Requirement
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6C8FEFC04E064198A6B692F521E8826C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 In general
                                 A covered air carrier that operates a domestic or international flight to, from, or within the United States shall maintain—
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H937F83DCFC3D411798B7FAEBCD64CC07"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (A)
                                    a customer service telephone line staffed by live agents;
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H460F64373CB94D0CB80DE9EA99236138"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (B)
                                    a customer chat option that allows for customers to speak to a live agent within a reasonable time, to the greatest extent practicable; or
                                 
                                 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                                id="H630CE55CF39249189121D14EF67EC62B"
                                                qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (C)
                                    a monitored text messaging number that enables customers to communicate and speak with a live agent directly.
                                 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H231C1C8B04DD41E4A72FCBDC520E0006"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 Provision of services
                                 The services required under paragraph (1) shall be provided to customers without charge for the use of such services, and shall be available at all times. 
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H04862439EF8A4FF4BF05BC31811D3857"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (b)
                              Rulemaking authority
                              The Secretary shall promulgate such rules as may be necessary to carry out this section.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H90E38D0E23AF48E28048A171BA0E8E13"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (c)
                              Covered air carrier defined
                              In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">covered air carrier means an air carrier that sells tickets for scheduled passenger air transportation on an aircraft that, as originally designed, has a passenger capacity of 30 or more seats.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H6C2A8B8FD893439B8FBF984DCEE162F7"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (d)
                              Effective date
                              Beginning on the date that is 120 days after the date of enactment of this section, a covered air carrier shall comply with the requirement specified in subsection (a) without regard to whether the Secretary has promulgated any rules to carry out this section as of the date that is 120 days after such date of enactment.
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA093F8B0DB7941F088BB74E6EB231762"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Clerical amendment
                     The analysis for chapter 423 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by inserting after the item relating to section 42306 the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HD9D35D8D8F65491496F2D1A60E630D79"
                                    style="OLC">
                        
                           42307. Requirement to maintain a live customer chat or monitored text messaging number.
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H426FFD9B15FF486ABD4459FCA8506FE5"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               506.
               AIRLINE CUSTOMER SERVICE DASHBOARDS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4C34E8A6DED24970AFF81BF85F9F61B6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Dashboards
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1517C5BFC37249BE8D3B91EF1A981A19"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     
                        Chapter 423 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by inserting after section 42307 the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H6AC7A3C2731A430B87DA2BEC8B868BDF"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H74F7068FD7E44910A5FE180E47522E37"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes"
                                  section-type="subsequent-section">
                           42308.
                           DOT AIRLINE CUSTOMER SERVICE DASHBOARDS
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H49091EF2F5CE4F599A1EF62D7F501A1A"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (a)
                              Requirement To establish and maintain publicly available dashboards
                              The Secretary of Transportation shall establish, maintain, and make publicly available the following online dashboards for purposes of keeping aviation consumers informed with respect to certain policies of, and services provided by, large air carriers (as such term is defined by the Secretary) to the extent that such policies or services exceed what is required by Federal law:
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2F45AF06E9A14567A8F0219488A1CF86"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (1)
                                 Delay and cancellation dashboard
                                 A dashboard that displays information regarding the services and compensation provided by each large air carrier to mitigate any passenger inconvenience caused by a delay or cancellation due to circumstances in the control of such carrier.
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBB141487B7854F8AB1C833946F1A4B88"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (2)
                                 Explanation of circumstances
                                 The website on which such dashboard is displayed shall explain the circumstances under which a delay or cancellation is not due to circumstances in the control of the large air carrier (such as a delay or cancellation due to a weather event or an instruction from the Federal Aviation Administration Air Traffic Control System Command Center) consistent with section 234.4 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations. 
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7F8B02764B6044B99845306E52C7451E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (3)
                                 Family seating dashboard
                                 A dashboard that displays information regarding which large air carriers guarantee that each child shall be seated adjacent to an adult accompanying the child without charging any additional fees.
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA89F01AB0E2C43EF9AD66602B8E64F99"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (4)
                                 Seat size dashboard
                                 A dashboard that displays information regarding aircraft seat size for each large air carrier, including the pitch, width, and length of a seat in economy class for the aircraft models and configurations most commonly flown by such carrier.
                              
                              <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC0C63D352C034CA498054FC7ED09606A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (5)
                                 Family seating sunset
                                 The requirement in subsection (a)(3) shall cease to be effective on the date on which the rule in section 516 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024 is effective. 
                              
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H195A08CCDBEE47058E5499E5F9EA0C77"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (b)
                              Accessibility requirement
                              In developing the dashboards required in subsection (a), the Secretary shall, in order to ensure the dashboards are accessible and contain pertinent information for passengers with disabilities, consult with the Air Carrier Access Act Advisory Committee, the Architectural and Transportation Barriers Compliance Board, any other relevant department or agency to determine appropriate accessibility standards, and disability organizations, including advocacy and nonprofit organizations that represent or provide services to individuals with disabilities.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="H464654F2CBF44FD8B51661C78234CED3"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (c)
                              Limitation on dashboards
                              After the rule required in section 516 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024 is effective, the Secretary may not establish or maintain more than 4 different customer service dashboards at any given time.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HE47F3AADAEF544BDA8981998772940C5"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (d)
                              Provision of information
                              Each large air carrier shall provide to the Secretary such information as the Secretary requires to carry out this section.
                           
                           <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                        id="HDE7621791E814FD6B89333EC778572AA"
                                        qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (e)
                              Sunset
                              This section shall cease to be effective on October 1, 2028.
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBAF9F658088B480EB1D229B52A66B680"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Establishment
                     The Secretary shall establish each of the online dashboards required by section 42308(a) of title 49, United States Code, not later than 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDF45F3C9583944A989A371AC8854EED3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 423 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by inserting after the item relating to section 42307 the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H425E27A0124B41C2AFD802B7316270A0"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        42308. DOT airline customer service dashboards.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC7BEF5CB05F04CD7B352A08D3DA75392"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">

               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"

                  (a)
                  In general

                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">$25,000 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">$75,000.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8EF2A1641F774CB5B2CFF68A169AFF37"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Effective date
                  The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to violations occurring on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H70BC4832AE12486CA6EFEE87680AAD9F"

               508.
               ADVISORY COMMITTEE FOR AVIATION CONSUMER PROTECTION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H90A1BC0E9FD540B2865D6111D83DEC10"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Extension
                  Section 411(h) of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 42301 prec. note) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">May 10, 2024 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">September 30, 2028.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC89E14AFFD6B40088A23EBDB95A93917"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Coordination
                  Section 411 of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 42301 prec. note) is amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H7C83EE8F9FCD4719928B3FF7F03FFB4A"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HF6D75A707C194B999F2C7DFB55728D62"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        Consultation
                        The Advisory Committee shall consult, as appropriate, with foreign air carriers, air carriers with an ultra-low-cost business model, nonprofit public interest groups with expertise in disability and accessibility matters, ticket agents, travel management companies, and any other groups as determined by the Secretary.
                     
                     .

               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"

                  Section 429 of FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                     In general
                     Section 429 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 42301 prec. note) is amended—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF37E6FD76C7C40E8B7863123B21730B7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        by transferring such section to appear after section 41726 of title 49, United States Code;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0E8F22B845B24AD98412EE4F3A767844"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by redesignating such section as section 41727 of such title; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6536AE918CC84D9F99D7A709A605BD1C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        by amending the section heading of such section to read as follows:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H9F5B94CAD51842FC893A2DC055D89168"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H5B5B180499DB49E28848839F7804A521"

                              41727.
                              PASSENGER RIGHTS
                           
                           .
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE230D7BE4BA84DBEA5B10B540B6FBD19"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Technical amendment
                     Section 41727 of title 49, United States Code, as transferred and redesignated by paragraph (1), is amended in subsection (a) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"

                            id="HE67DE26DE7E5453E93D53607429242A8"

                  (b)
                  Section 434 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018

                     Section 434 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 41705 note) is amended—

                        by transferring such section to appear after section 41727 of title 49, United States Code, as transferred and redesignated by subsection (a)(1);
