            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB80ACF8353AD411889582EFCC41A5920"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               511.
               BUREAU OF TRANSPORTATION STATISTICS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB88FC87044D948EF9A40F34BE4E34857"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Rulemaking
                  Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Bureau of Transportation Statistics shall initiate a rulemaking to revise section 234.4 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, to create a new <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">cause of delay category (or categories) that identifies and tracks information on delays and cancellations of air carriers (as defined in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code) that are due to instructions from the FAA Air Traffic Control System and to make any other changes necessary to carry out this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA2134C176A8140DAB3B3381B943182E8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Air Carrier code
                  The following causes shall not be included within the Air Carrier code specified in section 234.4 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, for cancelled and delayed flights:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBB7F61B53DD3421E8D4D43E4CC21B8D8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Aircraft cleaning necessitated by the death of a passenger.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB8C16E7373634AE988BDAE1F010B4B3C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Aircraft damage caused by extreme weather, foreign object debris, or sabotage.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE75154B269EC464EA6D76B3A8A06DB57"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     A baggage or cargo loading delay caused by an outage of a bag system not controlled by a carrier or its contractor.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H162599A394E04464B7A16F8C1B39C6EC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Cybersecurity attacks (provided that the air carrier is in compliance with applicable cybersecurity regulations).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H92F1C606236949BDBEE2EB7997838CC8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     A shutdown or system failure of government systems that directly affects the ability of an air carrier to safely conduct flights and is unexpected.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD9DA5441AFAF49E992E49AA60423AED1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Overheated brakes due to a safety incident resulting in the use of emergency procedures.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H513FAD661DEB492CA0A1C6AAC19D1263"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     Unscheduled maintenance, including in response to an airworthiness directive, manifesting outside a scheduled maintenance program that cannot be deferred or must be addressed before flight.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF5116E3F1F76401686A6CAF3E6D89414"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     An emergency that required medical attention through no fault of the carrier.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8457C4217FC64E75B780C9E0273505C2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (9)
                     The removal of an unruly passenger.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4BB7BDAB64314D519D91EF6129103C3C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (10)
                     An airport closure due to the presence of volcanic ash, wind, or wind shear.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8D61B2528C7C489FB8A8316C095DD13C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Family seating complaints
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA0AEE0CCCB1B4423AE798C413324F0E6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Director of the Bureau of Transportation Statistics shall update the reporting framework of the Bureau to create a new category to identify and track information on complaints related to family seating.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H99AD85598C64432E9DBAE20C254999E0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Sunset
                     The requirements in paragraph (1) shall cease to be effective on the date on which the rulemaking required by section 513 is effective. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6FC7ADFE3E9243FE9C831C92F872A84B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Air Travel Consumer Report
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H00CFA22437134F6586AE231F21046E2E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     ATCSCC delays
                     The Secretary shall include information on delays and cancellations that are due to instructions from the FAA Air Traffic Control System Command Center in the Air Travel Consumer Report issued by the Office of Aviation Consumer Protection of the Department of Transportation.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H338DF47232E047BDB4AAFBE6F4E94A2E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Family seating complaints
                     The Secretary shall include information on complaints related to family seating—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8542179836794576832F0BE75FDD11AD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in the Air Travel Consumer Report issued by the Office of Aviation Consumer Protection of the Department of Transportation; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H52227233050E4D59A2204F5EACAE2EB3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        on the family seating dashboard required by subsection (a)(2).
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2A865D1C18E44E108A9FBCEDF7A5A440"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Sunset
                     The requirements in paragraph (2) shall cease to be effective on the date on which the rulemaking required by section 513 is effective.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H8C31CC6A0BA24B6E87AF98A5BC201765"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               512.
               REIMBURSEMENT FOR INCURRED COSTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCB5FF43C585446E4BF98482FC0BFBA49"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall direct all air carriers providing scheduled passenger interstate or intrastate air transportation to establish policies regarding reimbursement for lodging, transportation between such lodging and the airport, and meal costs incurred due to a flight cancellation or significant delay directly attributable to the air carrier.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H71077B112B5A452B9F97E84F67F92577"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Definition of significantly delayed
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">significantly delayed means, with respect to air transportation, the departure or arrival at the originally ticketed destination associated with such transportation has changed—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6E1E867609DA4183A76BF042A02C1168"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in the case of a domestic flight, 3 or more hours after the original scheduled arrival time; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5A790EAE40984BC3B380D90F8147C694"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in the case of an international flight, 6 or more hours after the original scheduled arrival time. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBA10AA2CF2464CB994C9E50F6D003E4E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed as providing the Secretary with any additional authorities beyond the authority to require air carriers establish the policies referred to in subsection (a).
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H94443D042CBC41E882211509795C2CEB"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               513.
               STREAMLINING OF OFFLINE TICKET DISCLOSURES
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB3E3C781AED34883BB8AC3FFEB91A47D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall take such action as may be necessary to update the process by which an air carrier or ticket agent is required to fulfill disclosure obligations in ticketing transactions for air transportation not completed through a website.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5EE7696540D14BD081EFD91C4DFEB50C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Requirements
                  The process updated under subsection (a) shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC5CB1A0937C744999B37EB1FA77C3D90"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     include means of referral to the applicable air carrier website with respect to disclosures related to air carrier optional fees and policies;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6B1DE0312DBD4F608D15EA2489EA4F0D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     include a means of referral to the website of the Department of Transportation with respect to any other required disclosures to air transportation passengers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H77E76C1ECC9B4E4ABE8E74FFFC4D1267"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     make no changes to air carrier or ticket agent obligations with respect to—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF94DD6DE97B94F8EA0B25B7FD9243A36"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        section 41712(c) of title 49, United States Code; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4ED85672982E495F93F953B338A13ECF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        subsections (a) and (b) of section 399.84 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulations); and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H674DAA37FFDE4F1F9AA657761EF418F6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     require disclosures referred to in paragraphs (1) and (2) to be made in the manner existing prior to the date of enactment of this Act upon passenger request.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H810FCBD6D94440D6A5DB515CC44CE468"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Air carrier defined
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">air carrier has the meaning given such term in section 40102(a) of title 49, United States Code.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HEE1DA54973CD4D8891FFB8BF884FB967"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               514.
               GAO STUDY ON COMPETITION AND CONSOLIDATION IN THE AIR CARRIER INDUSTRY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA2E1E6F08560491B857B72413F3C0FB4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Study
                  The Comptroller General shall conduct a study assessing competition and consolidation in the United States air carrier industry. Such study shall include an assessment of data related to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE7023F898E91407AA95E14D6B5B49296"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the history of mergers in the United States air carrier industry, including whether any claimed efficiencies have been realized;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H992A2F79BC7F479288DA527EC7C41CB0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the effect of consolidation in the United States air carrier industry, if any, on consumers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF7359FF81C6F4D87B3A9AE6432EFD869"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the effect of consolidation in the United States air carrier industry, if any, on air transportation service in small and rural markets; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8F339DFB1A504894A7127EBB11A06335"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     the current state of competition in the United States air carrier industry as of the date of enactment of this Act.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1B6B4573E625460B867569997175EBE9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Report
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report containing the results of the study conducted under subsection (a), and recommendations for such legislative and administrative action as the Comptroller General determines appropriate.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H26F6C19FD91B451CB846C54301FF1BFD"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               515.
               GAO STUDY AND REPORT ON THE OPERATIONAL PREPAREDNESS OF AIR CARRIERS FOR CERTAIN EVENTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H90C7312A01684B078DAE6739AF864381"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Study
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H55D7A1F5C01A4ABFB3F31DFFDD0D5767"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Comptroller General shall study and assess the operational preparedness of air carriers for changing weather and other events related to changing conditions and natural hazards, including flooding, extreme heat, changes in precipitation, storms, including winter storms, coastal storms, tropical storms, and hurricanes, and fire conditions. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9A54ABC3E27C4032A90F5988CE219DCB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Requirements
                     As part of the study required under paragraph (1), the Comptroller General shall assess the following:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H254F2E1976294569BD41001A58551243"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        The extent to which air carriers are preparing for weather events and natural disasters, as well as changing conditions and natural hazards, that may impact operational investments of air carriers, staffing levels and safety policies, mitigation strategies, and other resiliency planning.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAA8655135D5B42C2B198C4BCDEEC166B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        How the FAA oversees operational resilience of air carriers relating to storms, natural disasters, and changing conditions.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H664643E22A574FB9B1372212C8D8E31B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Steps the Federal Government and air carriers can take to improve operational resilience relating to storms, natural disasters, and changing conditions. 
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8C39CCA8CD2A4C4A84E7FF15AAD06E68"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Briefing and report
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC1B2A59DFC714F869AA6361A4175D8C6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Briefing
                     Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the results of the study required under subsection (a), and recommendations for such legislative and administrative action as the Comptroller General determines appropriate.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H792129A7EDA249CCAE04A1DD407C67B9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Report
                     Not later than 6 months after the briefing required by paragraph (1) is provided, the Comptroller General shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the results of the study required under subsection (a), and recommendations for such legislative and administrative action as the Comptroller General determines appropriate. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H74975FB318AB47DD99C59D6E1C7627B5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definition of air carrier
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">air carrier has the meaning given such term in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD9D73849726F4B739EE2C22D64AC3D5C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               516.
               FAMILY SEATING
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3F05CFBB15544BDC87C1007468D286A9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking to establish a policy directing air carriers that assign seats, or allow individuals to select seats in advance of the date of departure of a flight, to sit each young child adjacent to an accompanying adult, to the greatest extent practicable, if adjacent seat assignments are available at any time after the ticket is issued for each young child and before the first passenger boards the flight.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCAC09A85C302485FBF4F05E0B03E0934"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Prohibition on fees
                  The notice of proposed rulemaking described in subsection (a) shall include a provision that prohibits an air carrier from charging a fee, or imposing an additional cost beyond the ticket price of the additional seat, to seat each young child adjacent to an accompanying adult within the same class of service.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCED7A12A88FA4F4AAE9B015314173EC9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Rule of construction
                  Notwithstanding the requirement in subsection (a), nothing in this section may be construed to allow the Secretary to impose a change in the overall seating or boarding policy of an air carrier that has an open or flexible seating policy in place that generally allows adjacent family seating as described under this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2F5DD39B6BA348BD816EE6C8B6428289"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Young child
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">young child means an individual who has not attained 14 years of age.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H2A0D766923CF42618560E1393F1F1DA2"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               517.
               PASSENGER EXPERIENCE ADVISORY COMMITTEE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBF6DE5881B66446AA99B22D52E1346AA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Secretary shall establish an advisory committee to advise the Secretary and the Administrator in carrying out activities relating to the improvement of the passenger experience in air transportation customer service. The advisory committee shall not duplicate the work of any other advisory committee.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5A9594CC75644DD08928BBE5BAD9D129"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Membership
                  The Secretary shall appoint the members of the advisory committee, which shall be comprised of at least 1 representative of each of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD4E8BC6544D74DAFA1B5F4B2072CFBB1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     mainline air carriers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3E6F27AEC5A24478AF788D446A6D87F4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     air carriers with a low-cost or ultra-low-cost business model;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8F6055340E14493D8522CBECF426A1AF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     regional air carriers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3B809023A51C46119B6218218375C78A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     large hub airport sponsors and operators;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDFF6145A561A4E33BF8ABE728CF08887"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     medium hub airport sponsors and operators;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H752FE9D5C68D401FB7CFE8434A1B2D08"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     small hub airport sponsors and operators;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDD09FB8C706249ECB1F3C1CCE3216A08"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     nonhub airport sponsors and operators;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H533ABA798668460BA8BA0A6468461F99"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     ticket agents;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H947F9814B7264EF6A302A3F4154D66A7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (9)
                     representatives of intermodal transportation companies that operate at airports;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7500DA22765044C9B9C4FAB0EE20D64F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (10)
                     airport concessionaires;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H315EE69040764D639D4E870A86CC0DC1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (11)
                     nonprofit public interest groups with expertise in consumer protection matters;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6D1E48A3CCFC4E2095E3A942235A541F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (12)
                     senior managers of the FAA Air Traffic Organization;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8E5C00D2D8E94C4798E22B2D46230F6D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (13)
                     aircraft manufacturers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCD5C0D74D2E74742B5EF485C79318EE9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (14)
                     entities representing individuals with disabilities;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H332C7716DAEA4C0CA773EDCD8E21BB81"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (15)
                     certified labor organizations representing aviation workers, including—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5C91B6C086C64CF590CADE05C539FCE5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        FAA employees;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9F3CC29A7710476B8D85BA5AB5412DA5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        airline pilots working for air carriers operating under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDF2C03AA091E4E8BBB65C5438040ABB1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        flight attendants working for air carriers operating under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H984A0D21456E4F12A4E79A5636DE75B8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        other customer-facing airline and airport workers; 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H456FE396CD584E19B75168967EE4768B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (16)
                     other organizations or industry segments as determined by the Secretary; and 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2117DAB5B56C4903A7CDEC6BDA4ED5F8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (17)
                     other Federal agencies that directly interface with passengers at airports. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H934EFF26D08A4C91870B109CCAFA26D1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Vacancies
                  A vacancy in the advisory committee under this section shall be filled in a manner consistent with subsection (b).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD9036217641641ED94006179D6A61F92"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Travel expenses
                  Members of the advisory committee under this section shall serve without pay but shall receive travel expenses, including per diem in lieu of subsistence, in accordance with subchapter I of chapter 57 of title 5, United States Code.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H89B7DFC7C618450B8AFA9D27841E8621"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Chair
                  The Secretary shall designate an individual among the individuals appointed under subsection (b) to serve as Chair of the advisory committee.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H53BCB88F81BE48159C2EEF49034D2ED8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Duties
                  The duties of the advisory committee shall include—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8EA395E9F518408AAC27F2CA3D81503E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     evaluating ways to improve the comprehensive passenger experience, including—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB82526B7361A4D289E9749CD690B216E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        transportation between airport terminals and facilities;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2FC7DB37C5E94DB5B871F4D816A5F3DF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        baggage handling;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H81B34F4BAEBE4197A213908FE369C55B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        wayfinding;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H52CAFDC13141485EAD0F9C474A96471F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        the security screening process; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDCB69D78083D45A08F51E78646842DEC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        the communication of flight delays and cancellations;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA8E82E211E1D403E93DA5BBC19ACFCCA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     evaluating ways to improve efficiency in the national airspace system affecting passengers; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1E47A26588B14F729378B78F518DA4F7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     evaluating ways to improve the cooperation and coordination between the Department of Transportation and other Federal agencies that directly interface with aviation passengers at airports;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H370FCAE7B3314BCBBED573B693B14F7D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     responding to other taskings determined by the Secretary; and 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAAB24C8F699E4E3B9BCAD25BE6BEDA66"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     providing recommendations to the Secretary and the Administrator, if determined necessary during the evaluations considered in paragraphs (1) through (4).
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HEE8F83469DFA4C5BAE53B94A0A37DE51"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Report to Congress
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and every 2 years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report containing—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H371F737E8DBD4F209948C5DF0516F484"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     consensus recommendations made by the advisory committee since such date of enactment or the previous report, as appropriate; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2E76622CAC454821A0A5379BED070ACE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     an explanation of how the Secretary has implemented such recommendations and, for such recommendations not implemented, the Secretary’s reason for not implementing such recommendation.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA49EE061A67F48ECA059139C08A27CD9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (h)
                  Definition
                  The definitions in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code, shall apply to this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBDDDBC95D7434D65B89BD6C6E38B1D58"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (i)
                  Sunset
                  This section shall cease to be effective on October 1, 2028.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD36DDCB77C5040668E830090841FF7BE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (j)
                  Termination of DOT ACCESS Advisory Committee
                  The ACCESS Advisory Committee of the Department of Transportation shall terminate on the date of enactment of this Act.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HDC640BC730C64F618757DC7891C4FDE4"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               518.
               UPDATING PASSENGER INFORMATION REQUIREMENT REGULATIONS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0FE2CBB305964D4298F17B5DA084EF28"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  ARAC tasking
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall task the Aviation Rulemaking Advisory Committee with—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA7FA576BBBB348A7B68CC268D7A673BB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     reviewing passenger information requirement regulations under section 121.317 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulation, and such other related regulations as the Administrator determines appropriate; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA1F14B76D5B643CFA8F7F21CDB0DF50F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     making recommendations to update and improve such regulations.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFF88BB8ABE834572B60D37874FA604D0"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Final regulation
                  Not later than 6 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall issue a final regulation revising section 121.317 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and such other related regulations as the Administrator determines appropriate, to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H41C766D59CA146278131D44965599C3B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     update such section and regulations to incorporate exemptions commonly issued by the Administrator;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3E2C21A988E74A0DA70BA9C4913C63A1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     reflect civil penalty inflation adjustments; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H70CF48CE5C7E4C5DA00AC2E20274735A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     incorporate such updates and improvements recommended by the Aviation Rulemaking Advisory Committee that the Administrator determines appropriate.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD257A920E0654F30B39CC9733B3E140B"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               519.
               SEAT DIMENSIONS
               Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H79562FA146F6498E89B12CE510C00DED"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  initiate a rulemaking activity based on the regulation described in section 577 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 42301 note); or
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD68FD49DCAA34C3C97F0865BC4F1E469"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  if the Administrator decides not to pursue the rulemaking described in paragraph (1), the Administrator shall brief appropriate committees of Congress on the justification of such decision.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB6FB7D64E58746A5A8ED065E23E46B85"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               520.
               MODERNIZATION OF CONSUMER COMPLAINT SUBMISSIONS
               Section 42302 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HC81DE13D1D944392997C2C3F81500788"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0499B6489D4C4B749FA38A41D56DC38D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     42302.
                     CONSUMER COMPLAINTS
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HC936532374744407A3CD097ACAF0526C"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        In general
                        The Secretary of Transportation shall—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4DEBD22EF053409BA4E94DDB59F90BC0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           maintain an accessible website through the Office of Aviation Consumer Protection to accept the submission of complaints from airline passengers regarding air travel service problems; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2E0B2D75797D4258A16A96FCFFCA0B78"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           take appropriate actions to notify the public of such accessible website.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H70E74B6C96014FB3912C30EEE1521F20"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Notice to passengers on the internet
                        An air carrier or foreign air carrier providing scheduled air transportation using any aircraft that as originally designed has a passenger capacity of 30 or more passenger seats shall include on the accessible website of the carrier—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H26010C9906354D76873EC35AA59F8095"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           the accessible website, e-mail address, or telephone number of the air carrier for the submission of complaints by passengers about air travel service problems; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H035C61118A7045DF85D2CDE6FE7E783C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           the accessible website maintained pursuant to subsection (a).
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H5708921AC73A44FF98703D83F0C199EF"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Use of additional or alternative technologies
                        The Secretary shall periodically evaluate the benefits of using mobile phone applications or other widely used technologies to—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H40F11CF76F504D8B9839E19182DD4D8F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           provide additional or alternative means for air passengers to submit complaints; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA38ED1099B564861A2595B545B3AEF07"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           provide such additional or alternative means as the Secretary determines appropriate.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H6D0ED124C58E4D3B8D36142685915C95"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Air ambulance providers
                        Each air ambulance provider shall include the accessible website, or a link to such accessible website, maintained pursuant to subsection (a) and the contact information for the Aviation Consumer Advocate established by section 424 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 42302 note) on—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H660D003C82D945E89E4356FC1D8E4C7C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           any invoice, bill, or other communication provided to a passenger or customer of such provider; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4E85955B3D6A402897A455B245755B99"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           the accessible website and any related mobile device application of such provider.
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <subtitle id="H7D3A5887AE64451283E150CBECEEC1B5"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            B
            Accessibility
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB584032C56CE44C8A2DB1B3DFDBCF5C7"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               541.
               AIR CARRIER ACCESS ACT ADVISORY COMMITTEE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H05B2ED19C1A44942A3CB2A3132630799"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 439 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 41705 note) is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5CF76772CD2B4942A7513D65C1083B20"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in the section heading by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           Advisory committee on the air travel needs of passengers with disabilities
                         and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           Air Carrier Access Act advisory committee
                        ;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC473C2EC87CA4785B66A8B42E164E44A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in subsection (c)(1) by striking subparagraph (G) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H1624536E4F0F4BB9962044CBCA1F671D"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H055B334D504E4BB2AD4D778A99F1ABEA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (G)
                           Manufacturers of wheelchairs, including powered wheelchairs, and other mobility aids.
                        
                        ; and

                              id="H11B87E83587445CBB22BF0E2BFDF8438"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     in subsection (g) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"

                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Conforming amendment
                  Section 1(b) of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254) is amended by striking the item relating to section 439 and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HF479273BA465433B8746E2304C4AACCB"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        Sec. 439. Air Carrier Access Act advisory committee. 
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H54DEBA20232A4A5FA8F3C2B3487D0426"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               542.
               IMPROVED TRAINING STANDARDS FOR ASSISTING PASSENGERS WHO USE WHEELCHAIRS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8D90F608B12D4FCFA5655B51AEB3D34C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Rulemaking
                  Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking to develop requirements for minimum training standards for airline personnel or contractors who assist wheelchair users who board or deplane using an aisle chair or other boarding device.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7272945F461F466998370D6790A4C58C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Requirements
                  The training standards developed under subsection (a) shall require, at a minimum, that airline personnel or contractors who assist passengers who use wheelchairs who board or deplane using an aisle chair or other boarding device—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H028F898431014CE99176A21B468DB0AB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     before being allowed to assist a passenger using an aisle chair or other boarding device to board or deplane, be able to successfully demonstrate skills (during hands-on training sessions) on—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H336649A557874D448C14C8CCA5C7F99C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        how to safely use the aisle chair, or other boarding device, including the use of all straps, brakes, and other safety features;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H66F0B4E21EBD442689EC2CE8BADD4254"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        how to assist in the transfer of passengers to and from their wheelchair, the aisle chair, and the aircraft’s passenger seat, either by physically lifting the passenger or deploying a mechanical device for the lift or transfer; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5EBCFD4A79A94F45B42A056D24352D2F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        how to effectively communicate with, and take instruction from, the passenger;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5599BED500A24163B9439FBC0223C87A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     are trained regarding the availability of accessible lavatories and on-board wheelchairs and the right of a qualified individual with a disability to request an on-board wheelchair; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H159401588C9E422A967314E4A0FEC9B6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     complete refresher training within 18 months of an initial training and be recertified on the job every 18 months thereafter by a relevant superior in order to remain qualified for providing aisle chair assistance. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBC4456B0F7B2427881E5E24CF226C4BB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  In conducting the rulemaking under subsection (a), the Secretary shall consider, at a minimum—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFF5BA5574F634FC881594AB27E7D7AF5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     whether to require air carriers and foreign air carriers to partner with national disability organizations and disabled veterans organizations representing individuals with disabilities who use wheelchairs and scooters in developing, administering, and auditing training; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H540A483604CB44968C840E0602FF6EC8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     whether to require air carriers and foreign air carriers to use a lift device, instead of an aisle chair, to board and deplane passengers with mobility disabilities; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC2C08EB6873349F8AA2EC26C8C794524"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     whether individuals able to provide boarding and deplaning assistance for passengers with limited or no mobility should receive training incorporating procedures from medical professionals on how to properly lift these passengers.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H98E86BF71AAA4EFEAEF7ABEB4F291DE8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Final rule
                  Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue a final rule pursuant to the rulemaking conducted under this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H40CAB6CF58134D33896DF884C7917EAF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Penalties
                  The Secretary may assess a civil penalty in accordance with section 46301 of title 49, United States Code, to any air carrier or foreign air carrier who fails to meet the requirements established under the final rule under subsection (d).
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HBECE138A468C43A891D43EAF7EEF3D30"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               543.
               TRAINING STANDARDS FOR STOWAGE OF WHEELCHAIRS AND SCOOTERS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H682B64B017E547A3A61F03927BB7BCB9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Rulemaking
                  Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking to develop minimum training standards related to stowage of wheelchairs and scooters used by passengers with disabilities on aircraft.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDC270627073A468292308B9C56FECC9B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Requirements
                  The training standards developed under subsection (a) shall require, at a minimum, that personnel and contractors of air carriers and foreign air carriers who stow wheelchairs and scooters on aircraft—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF6ED52DCB20146A2A3768E44F6E60A20"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     before being allowed to handle or stow a wheelchair or scooter, be able to successfully demonstrate skills (during hands-on training sessions) on—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H49C2C7AA71C6446F9454C6C16AC56B25"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        how to properly handle and configure, at a minimum, the most commonly used power and manual wheelchairs and scooters for stowage on each aircraft type operated by the air carrier or foreign air carrier;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H05CDA4347FDE4284B0DADDC9D34ED8E6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        how to properly review any wheelchair or scooter information provided by the passenger or the wheelchair or scooter manufacturer; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H14C74C21CFE04973AB2B02BAC3BB87E9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        how to properly load, secure, and unload wheelchairs and scooters, including how to use any specialized equipment for loading or unloading, on each aircraft type operated by the air carrier or foreign air carrier; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAB9000AA6FE34FF1A2711B00F469F2A3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     complete refresher training within 18 months of an initial training and be recertified on the job every 18 months thereafter by a relevant superior in order to remain qualified for handling and stowing wheelchairs and scooters.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H87141A408F5248278AE983397A0EAE89"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  In conducting the rulemaking under subsection (a), the Secretary shall consider, at a minimum, whether to require air carriers and foreign air carriers to partner with wheelchair or scooter manufacturers, national disability and disabled veterans organizations representing individuals who use wheelchairs and scooters, and aircraft manufacturers, in developing, administering, and auditing training.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H96726FFCD0884EC28FE4367398FAAE3B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Final rule
                  Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue a final rule pursuant to the rulemaking conducted under this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H967024F4DAC44F98871854ED536176C1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Penalties
                  The Secretary may assess a civil penalty in accordance with section 46301 of title 49, United States Code, to any air carrier or foreign air carrier who fails to meet the requirements established under the final rule under subsection (d).
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H8EFE291118BC419087312929360F57E5"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               544.
               MOBILITY AIDS ON BOARD IMPROVE LIVES AND EMPOWER ALL
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H25D02EEE510D475AA436E738B0DE3365"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Publication of cargo hold dimensions
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3B34C0D4618643878707B28366FD6F85"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall require air carriers to publish in a prominent and easily accessible place on the public website of the air carrier, information describing the relevant dimensions and other characteristics of the cargo holds of all aircraft types operated by the air carrier, including the dimensions of the cargo hold entry, that would limit the size, weight, and allowable type of cargo.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H86E0738F69F24A949D66F3D0139D2773"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Proprietary information
                     The Secretary shall allow an air carrier to protect the confidentiality of any trade secret or proprietary information submitted in accordance with paragraph (1), as appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9E81870251324B4085B1613E749F7B48"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Refund required for individual traveling with wheelchair
                  In the case of a qualified individual with a disability traveling with a wheelchair who has purchased a ticket for a flight from an air carrier, but who cannot travel on the aircraft for such flight because the wheelchair of such qualified individual cannot be physically accommodated in the cargo hold of the aircraft, the Secretary shall require such air carrier to offer a refund to such qualified individual of any previously paid fares, fees, and taxes applicable to such flight.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H31E23B679F6846198A8B6E5969F9620A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Evaluation of data regarding damaged wheelchairs
                  Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the Secretary shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8D55F76EAEE341A8B91B5DB47FA97030"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     evaluate data regarding the type and frequency of incidents of the mishandling of wheelchairs on aircraft and delineate such data by—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEFF626193AC44D7EA305328CF8E2BE2A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        types of wheelchairs involved in such incidents; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9C364E3D3F55456B8AB06B1428ABAFCC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the ways in which wheelchairs are mishandled, including the type of damage to wheelchairs (such as broken drive wheels or casters, bent or broken frames, damage to electrical connectors or wires, control input devices, joysticks, upholstery or other components, loss, or delay of return);
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8FEE7A5627E24819A1502ECCD3D41775"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     determine whether there are trends with respect to the data evaluated under paragraph (1); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1C30B75646A44C6CA8FD510A03858E4A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     make available on the public website of the Department of Transportation, in an accessible manner, a report containing the results of the evaluation of data and determination made under paragraphs (1) and (2) and a description of how the Secretary plans to address such results.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE192F3D462804327A0B68D61D123DB75"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Report to Congress on mishandled wheelchairs
                  Upon completion of each annual report required under subsection (c), the Secretary shall transmit to the appropriate committees of Congress such report. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3E84E84A643C4E28986D083597F6A479"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Feasibility of in-Cabin wheelchair restraint systems
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H977275FB299544F0956B2A79837FF5BF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Roadmap
                     Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a publicly available strategic roadmap that describes how the Department of Transportation and the United States Access Board, respectively, shall, in accordance with the recommendations from the National Academies of Science, Engineering, and Mathematics Transportation Research Board Special Report 341—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H80C99B95AF7E40BFAD5862F9A155FEDB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        establish a program of research, in collaboration with the Rehabilitation Engineering and Assistive Technology Society of North America, the assistive technology industry, air carriers, original equipment manufacturers, national disability and disabled veterans organizations, and any other relevant stakeholders, to test and evaluate an appropriate selection of WC19-compliant wheelchairs and accessories in accordance with applicable FAA crashworthiness and safety performance criteria, including the issues and considerations set forth in such Special Report 341; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H15842F0C3DAC465EA67BC0F77805DDD7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        sponsor studies that assess issues and considerations, including those set forth in such Special Report 341, such as—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H247042DBEE5948FBAC6F9E04C3048286"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           the likely demand for air travel by individuals who are nonambulatory if such individuals could remain seated in their personal wheelchairs in flight; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H82F22E32D7424EEDB6840E020C25511E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           the feasibility of implementing seating arrangements that would accommodate passengers in wheelchairs in the main cabin in flight.
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8D2B313EA6CC47689CF4E8B832FB12B5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Study
                     If determined to be technically feasible by the Secretary, not later than 2 years after making such determination, the Secretary shall commence a study to assess the economic and financial feasibility of air carriers and foreign air carriers implementing seating arrangements that accommodate passengers with wheelchairs in the main cabin during flight. Such study shall include an assessment of—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1E3276DD5DA24354992CE1A391325AC8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the cost of such seating arrangements, equipment, and installation;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H260F68CC770040B581B9EE0E1E5768D2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the demand for such seating arrangements;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA5CD55AA010148CD8233B70D064E11F6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the impact of such seating arrangements on passenger seating and safety on aircraft;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA6DF162DB1C4481ABCE423538010AD63"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        the impact of such seating arrangements on the cost of operations and airfare; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3CD79DF630134F749046907A86DEFD09"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        any other information determined appropriate by the Secretary.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC67C71F20F4840D7A7E2E49D298158FB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Report
                     Not later than 1 year after the date on which the study under paragraph (2) is completed, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a publicly available report describing the results of the study conducted under paragraph (2) and any recommendations the Secretary determines appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB75ED9620FF641808CBEB05CCC22EFE7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA150038FB6434F73A3E928BAD142E33E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Air carrier
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
