                                quote-type="text">air carrier has the meaning given such term in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB3E8544DD1AD4D608510AD99B4C5067A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Disability; qualified individual with a disability
                     The terms <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">disability and <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">qualified individual with a disability have the meanings given such terms in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on date of enactment of this Act).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6F5A89DAC8474DEC9D6F4AB52C4C38E6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Wheelchair
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">wheelchair has the meaning given such term in section 37.3 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on date of enactment of this Act), and includes power wheelchairs, manual wheelchairs, and scooters.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H00EDC75A9F444B9BB8198893CB492F42"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               545.
               PRIORITIZING ACCOUNTABILITY AND ACCESSIBILITY FOR AVIATION CONSUMERS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB756D8FC850848FAA7621CF431D9D650"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Annual report
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress, and make publicly available, a report on aviation consumer complaints related to passengers with a disability filed with the Department of Transportation. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFD700D7A6DE943F782970F6BCBEC5BB8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Contents
                  Each annual report submitted under subsection (a) shall, at a minimum, include the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1033BF4030084537B12963BEF55152D4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     The number of aviation consumer complaints reported to the Secretary related to passengers with a disability filed with the Department of Transportation during the calendar year preceding the year in which such report is submitted. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEB50DDC3892B498EBF5C3FD088C92993"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     The nature of such complaints, including reported issues with—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2100BC07FC3647BBBB2FC26BAA90841A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        an air carrier, including an air carrier's staff training or lack thereof; 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAB06C0E8A6084EE190000CFCA1F7D9CF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        mishandling of passengers with a disability or their accessibility equipment, including mobility aids and wheelchairs;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H293E2DD3D52E46B0A2A653FEE1BAA67D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the condition, availability, or lack of accessibility of equipment operated by an air carrier or a contractor of an air carrier;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8DAB151F76E046688F58E62C3AEC1119"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        the accessibility of in-flight services, including accessing and using on-board lavatories, for passengers with a disability; 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD2D1C6A367C240FD83C2ABDF61D7877F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        difficulties experienced by passengers with a disability in communicating with air carrier personnel;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD79292D5CA334009AAC4D863783706E9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        difficulties experienced by passengers with a disability in being moved, handled, or otherwise assisted;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H20B1FBA26EB44EB89A883946A7092724"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (G)
                        an air carrier changing the flight itinerary of a passenger with a disability without the consent of such passenger;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3EDD2C2D30E14758884D049B10E2C10E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (H)
                         issues experienced by passengers with a disability traveling with a service animal; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5F1521A70F7D407DAF18B710861007C8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (I)
                        such other issues as the Secretary determines appropriate. 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAA149D63BD0E4213AC02C37027F9AE8D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     An overview of the review process for such complaints received during such calendar year.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H58A468EF0F47484BB25B859229E937DB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     The median length of time for how quickly review of such complaints was initiated by the Secretary.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H50F3F54A591D4FAB8BEE455C0344A710"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     The median length of time for how quickly such complaints were resolved or otherwise addressed.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4E11D4AB8CA54AC692646C4CF07A8916"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Of the complaints that were found to violate section 41705 of title 49, United States Code—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEB7C54F14A6C435BB4678A4E580DFDED"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the number of such complaints for which a formal enforcement order was issued; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9AAB6A565D654B65A0BB3E14967AE457"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the number of such complaints for which a formal enforcement order was not issued.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H31A37CEE4602430E8E8F8F7FF920EA15"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     How many aviation consumer complaints related to passengers with a disability were referred to the Department of Justice for an enforcement action under—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H14F96C68A8BB4FAAB483814EF5292DA5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. 794);
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H63F8E44AF98F4295801A74C987413B4F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12101 et seq.); or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB53A38716E104B4197A7A260D5AD338F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        any other provision of law. 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC081BA7F3A47418E8F014F2C2A88DD94"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     How many aviation consumer complaints related to passengers with a disability filed with the Department of Transportation that involved airport staff (or other matters under the jurisdiction of the FAA) were referred to the FAA.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H03B748DDDBE4469AA31CBE2D7DBA85B0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (9)
                     The number of disability-related aviation consumer complaints filed with the Department of Transportation involving Transportation Security Administration staff that were referred to the Transportation Security Administration or the Department of Homeland Security.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC8C0A14653904760A9C3EAF2CF221D78"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definitions
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H054A1327093E426C9FE7EAEC919819D3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Except as provided in paragraph (2), the definitions set forth in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code, and section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, apply to this section. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1755BBB31A34470ABE6259E3C63F94CC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Air carrier
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">air carrier means an air carrier conducting passenger operations under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H875380ACB6CA45E8AEE85CA48B303500"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Passengers with a disability
                     In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">passengers with a disability has the meaning given the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">qualified individual with a disability in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB722A61ECDA547399DC13C0AF8C08328"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               546.
               ACCOMMODATIONS FOR QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3592D9743F4941928C3B07E2CA416BC1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H97197A894D7E41BD9ED6155B0550E682"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Advanced notice of proposed rulemaking
                     Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue an advanced notice of proposed rulemaking regarding seating accommodations for any qualified individual with a disability.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H40F9B60A2F47420BB2270C1D1742BD2E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Notice of proposed rulemaking
                     Not later than 18 months after the date on which the advanced notice of proposed rulemaking under paragraph (1) is completed, the Secretary shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking regarding seating accommodations for any qualified individual with a disability.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H506470FBE30F443687DCCA85510BF335"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Final rule
                     Not later than 30 months after the date on which the notice of proposed rulemaking under subparagraph (B) is completed, the Secretary shall issue a final rule pursuant to the rulemaking conducted under this subsection.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H341A60DDF27C476B9F040457112CCE7A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Considerations
                  In carrying out the advanced notice of proposed rulemaking required in subsection (a)(1), the Secretary shall consider the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3060C276C0674CC884D6E8F35C03E2FA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     The scope and anticipated number of qualified individuals with a disability who—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H978CD94F54444851888EE6100F7B5082"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        may need to be seated with a companion to receive assistance during a flight; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H21F1F458181D440FB2B343A7987AD73D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        should be afforded bulkhead seats or other seating considerations.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H831E4BD236AC4060BA81DBC5211624DA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     The types of disabilities that may need seating accommodations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAB524E721B0C4DBD9366627901971B5A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Whether such qualified individuals with a disability are unable to obtain, or have difficulty obtaining, appropriate seating accommodations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9D8043D0DA1F4B2A97806ECCAEE7AAFF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     The scope and anticipated number of individuals assisting a qualified individual with a disability who should be afforded an adjoining seat pursuant to section 382.81 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD004EC59698A40D4AF9A12CA2B67C310"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Any notification given to qualified individuals with a disability regarding available seating accommodations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H57CC68491D9D44DA99E20CFBB40B53E2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Any method that is adequate to identify fraudulent claims for seating accommodations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB614AF94BD6848E29B8996669F6A4CA2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     Any other information determined appropriate by the Secretary.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H72A8381B4A834F2BB78B17A52B3FB986"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Known service animal travel pilot program
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H86B4368A67D54CFB83500CAF61E28120"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Secretary shall establish a pilot program to allow approved program participants as known service animals for purposes of exemption from the documentation requirements under part 382 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, with respect to air travel with a service animal.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF3CEFE700109446C84D1C76A0908E6D4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Requirements
                     The pilot program established under paragraph (1) shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5FF23A77803944A6891A1A31113FE6DD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        be optional for a service animal accompanying a qualified individual with a disability;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEC2E5EC117C947EFBB5350BCE387B2B2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        provide for assistance for applicants, including over-the-phone assistance, throughout the application process for the program; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H651ADF4C1AD746EB850C276ABE7491D9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        with respect to any web-based components of the pilot program, meet or exceed the standards described in section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. 794d) and the regulations implementing that Act as set forth in part 1194 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulations).
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD1CCE93D0E9E443D85AAAF6E3450B65A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Consultation
                     In establishing the pilot program under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall consult with—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6DDDEBB6A51246AB9D7A4C581FC8091C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        disability organizations, including advocacy and nonprofit organizations that represent or provide services to individuals with disabilities;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5E4F5BFE2484424199049B1596435328"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        air carriers and foreign air carriers;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCF21BBC6BDC94CC9893B50DE75495572"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        accredited service animal training programs and authorized registrars, such as the International Guide Dog Federation, Assistance Dogs International, and other similar organizations and foreign and domestic governmental registrars of service animals;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2928C33ABB4749269C7825DC7A87BEEF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        other relevant departments or agencies of the Federal Government; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCAD46EA85E6E49749728F555C4469BEE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        other entities determined to be appropriate by the Secretary.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H30DF4CA2C6F3461482870D8EE6104EEE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Eligibility
                     To be eligible to participate in the pilot program under this subsection, an individual shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1542A8A603444A24A5C3DC552D8913AE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        be a qualified individual with a disability;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H44A6A7FAB24140658CF866A6A5BE061E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        require the assistance of a service animal because of a disability; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H03382C82C84544C89A81A7211A9C2183"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        submit an application to the Secretary at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5854C8BDB21149C59A8485EE10B3073F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Clarification
                     The Secretary may award a grant or enter into a contract or cooperative agreement in order to carry out this subsection.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA84C711B51A341B4B7F7DCA669F70AEB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Nominal fee
                     The Secretary may require an applicant to pay a nominal fee, not to exceed $25, to participate in the pilot program.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H382C157F9FA94477AA1BB465DD754E62"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     Reports to Congress
                     Not later than 1 year after the establishment of the pilot program under this subsection, and annually thereafter until the date described in paragraph (8), the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress and make publicly available report on the progress of the pilot program.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE70140F7F98243FE88B05D2A5722B6EB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     Sunset
                     The pilot program shall terminate on the date that is 5 years after the date of enactment of this Act.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0EEF7986CA2047EA8C5308AA238C7C3D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Accredited service animal training programs and authorized registrars
                  Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall publish and maintain, on the website of the Department of Transportation, a list of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF73EA1C738B84575B9200CA3BB6DA22C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     accredited programs that train service animals; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCA4BB41EEF674273821A19C802184A98"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     authorized registrars that evaluate service animals.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA7BAE54DFA08497CAB0AC447F5E7E0DC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Report to Congress on service animal requests
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on requests for air travel with service animals, including—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD0BD45DABD794F6BAFD84CD03EB2C513"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     during the reporting period, how many requests to board an aircraft with a service animal were made in total, and how many requests were made by qualified individuals with disabilities; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H85D731D23EC944A6950261CD983935C5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the number and percentage of such requests, categorized by type of request, that were reported by air carriers or foreign air carriers as—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC115DF857B204EE8B7A1F18C7E8B25DD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        granted;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA5CA72FE899D44958619D1AE71C6145F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        denied but not fraudulent; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H030679F6B8D14AC394AB0F9F13E8828D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        denied as fraudulent.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H443F7DD3860C4E7BB74123C2B22FE70A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Training
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAA65F54CB84644F99647C580B0887C6F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary shall, in consultation with the Air Carrier Access Act Advisory Committee, issue guidance regarding improvements to training for airline personnel (including contractors) in recognizing when a qualified individual with a disability is traveling with a service animal.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF1EC364D6FAD49E68CFE6A36F8D468BD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Requirements
                     The guidance issued under paragraph (1) shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB39FE6E0B74646B6B31051ADC6E63912"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        take into account respectful engagement with and assistance for individuals with a wide range of visible and nonvisible disabilities;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6A0D296477ED46689745943B42D0EB1D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        provide information on—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H575F90F3929E453CA52DB80C20B952C7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           service animal behavior and whether the service animal is appropriately harnessed, leashed, or otherwise tethered; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFA321C5011C841B3BD4E8754F88EC0DB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           the various types of service animals, such as guide dogs, hearing or signal dogs, psychiatric service dogs, sensory or social signal dogs, and seizure response dogs; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0B589352901649E0A0F6275A77D4EE50"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        outline the rights and responsibilities of the handler of the service animal.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDD9C4082A4B7447A83ED6E04DA35A746"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF81188F83C024739BBC4CBF1B05906A2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Air carrier
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">air carrier has the meaning given that term in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2A51FA156B5E4949848A256EADB48DBF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Foreign air carrier
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">foreign air carrier has the meaning given that term in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2ED508B1B44F4C5B84297F2152C07748"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Qualified individual with a disability
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">qualified individual with a disability has the meaning given that term in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6A7125AC7B28494C98073A7CE862717F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Service animal
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">service animal has the meaning given that term in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H216B0C2DEC9341B4B6187C80114A469F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               547.
               EQUAL ACCESSIBILITY TO PASSENGER PORTALS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0A55B81651DC454E8ADD8022EF42B1FE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Applications and information communication technologies
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall, in consultation with the United States Architectural and Transportation Barriers Compliance Board, issue regulations setting forth minimum standards to ensure that individuals with disabilities are able to access customer-focused kiosks, software applications, and websites of air carriers, foreign air carriers, and airports, in a manner that is equally as effective, and has a substantially equivalent ease of use, as for individuals without disabilities. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA45823171DBD47528A9C658F501500F2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Consistency with guidelines
                  The standards set forth under subsection (a) shall be consistent with the standards contained in the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.1 Level AA of the Web Accessibility Initiative of the World Wide Web Consortium or any subsequent version of such Guidelines.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF5AC3E4B733D4DF5B9D30656787708D9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Review
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA5D630B69F8F43DFB2A0C66E458DFDD2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Air Carrier Access Act Advisory Committee review
                     The Air Carrier Access Act Advisory Committee shall periodically review, and make appropriate recommendations regarding, the accessibility of websites, kiosks, and information communication technology of air carriers, foreign air carriers, and airports, and make such recommendations publicly available.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0798F22282174BDC8AEBD678F62186E4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     DOT review
                     Not later than 5 years after issuing regulations under subsection (a), and every 5 years thereafter, the Secretary shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4F6F1AE117B64787B2739B2FE2A68A49"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        review the recommendations of the Air Carrier Access Act Advisory Committee regarding the regulations issued under this subsection; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBF90FC9842E94BC793ED826B801E3E39"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        update such regulations as necessary.
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HFD0005447CF84C57812CB13F3736E353"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               548.
               AIRCRAFT ACCESS STANDARDS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6E7A1BABFA624A16A79C0D30A6CF0C3F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Aircraft access standards
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4E4ED73E47D44EC0B60B0E470E5A9B5E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Standards
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDC9C2DF7B0534FF3AE2DE52C8A42214B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        Advance notice of proposed rulemaking
                        Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue an advanced notice of proposed rulemaking regarding standards to ensure that the aircraft boarding and deplaning process is accessible, in terms of design for, transportation of, and communication with, individuals with disabilities, including individuals who use wheelchairs.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2AF50B723E904F87A302F03D3BD468E8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Notice of proposed rulemaking
                        Not later than 1 year after the date on which the advanced notice of proposed rulemaking under subparagraph (A) is completed, the Secretary shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking regarding standards addressed in subparagraph (A).
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAE13DF96E6A34092BDAB5D54673A4DF4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        Final rule
                        Not later than 1 year after the date on which the notice of proposed rulemaking under subparagraph (B) is completed, the Secretary shall issue a final rule.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE077278D22B04562AC82446B7C6C108C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Covered airport, equipment, and features
                     The standards prescribed under paragraph (1)(A) shall address, at a minimum—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7B69494F11D840068C602AD635A5021D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        boarding and deplaning equipment;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA64128008B434DD580B85CD606363961"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        improved procedures to ensure the priority cabin stowage for manual assistive devices pursuant to section 382.67 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3C2122FAD3BF4CD6BAAB4953A1A11690"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        improved cargo hold storage to prevent damage to assistive devices.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBE087D603AC441C584CDBED6902DD24F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Consultation
                     For purposes of the rulemaking under this subsection, the Secretary shall consult with the Access Board and any other relevant department or agency to determine appropriate accessibility standards.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB0083354F3E04B78AEC954358FBFE84B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  In-Flight entertainment rulemaking
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking in accordance with the November 22, 2016, resolution of the Department of Transportation ACCESS Committee and the consensus recommendation set forth in the Term Sheet Reflecting Agreement of the Access Committee Regarding In-Flight Entertainment.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD9967A0047A54CDCA0EE34B207F84B3D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Negotiated rulemaking on in-Cabin wheelchair restraint systems and enplaning and deplaning standards
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAF1B8B958ED244B982FA97B2005EB800"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Timing
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H29FF14170F624E03822783FEA56BEF5F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        In general
                        Not later than 1 year after completion of the report required by section 544(e)(2), and if such report finds economic and financial feasibility of air carriers and foreign air carriers implementing seating arrangements that accommodate individuals with disabilities using wheelchairs (including power wheelchairs, manual wheelchairs, and scooters) in the main cabin during flight, the Secretary shall conduct a negotiated rulemaking on new type certificated aircraft standards for seating arrangements that accommodate such individuals in the main cabin during flight or an accessible route to a minimum of 2 aircraft passenger seats for passengers to access from personal assistive devices of such individuals.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H27EE124D1DA141BBBFAD0C29FEFA7C54"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Requirement
                        The negotiated rulemaking under subparagraph (A) shall include participation of representatives of—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCE14EC6EAC434EA1841F874F0D0C712D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           air carriers;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE5713ADCFAB14C1FA12DBB85F5BF7471"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           aircraft manufacturers;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA0501173D819460B96FB3630BC7E14BA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           national disability organizations;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB4865694D33B425EAEAE858EC5C48F0C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           aviation safety experts; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H038FB0FD0EF24EF99FC1E1F614C73144"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (v)
                           mobility aid manufacturers.
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1062CC7C5BEB4C1290FDE78B2C9FA82D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Notice of proposed rulemaking
                     Not later than 1 year after the completion of the negotiated rulemaking required under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking regarding the standards described in paragraph (1).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE64679F8516A450F814B3D8A59A2F5BE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Final rule
                     Not later than 1 year after the date on which the notice of proposed rulemaking under paragraph (2) is completed, the Secretary shall issue a final rule regarding the standards described in paragraph (1).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDE4289795B1B49E88AD6CF4B74166166"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Considerations
                     In the negotiated rulemaking and rulemaking required under this subsection, the Secretary shall consider—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1CF59CD209614605B7FB045B3D444567"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        a reasonable period for the design, certification, and construction of aircraft that meet the requirements;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H98CBA40FBE944869BB7082A0193E52BA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the safety of all persons on-board the aircraft, including necessary wheelchair standards and wheelchair compliance with FAA crashworthiness and safety performance criteria; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9FB11BE0796C4D0DB2E7B7C1B8A1592C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the costs of design, installation, equipage, and aircraft capacity impacts, including partial fleet equipage and fare impacts.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBEAEE0E61DF1417081200394A96284FC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Visual and tactilely accessible announcements
                  The Advisory Committee established under section 439 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 41705 note) shall examine technical solutions and the feasibility of visually and tactilely accessible announcements on-board aircraft.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H98FD5040F2D343709A3CB1BDF4479CE6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Airport facilities
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall, in direct consultation with the Access Board, prescribe regulations setting forth minimum standards under section 41705 of title 49, United States Code, that ensure all gates (including counters), ticketing areas, and customer service desks covered under such section at airports are accessible to and usable by all individuals with disabilities, including through the provision of visually and tactilely accessible announcements and full and equal access to aural communications.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3B8F516F15CA4C7EB38001BF86EFE5BD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H353966B4A618435F8852ABDEEAD0985E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Access Board
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Access Board means the Architectural and Transportation Barriers Compliance Board.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD00271898C5C47BD86BAABB35CD33983"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Air carrier
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">air carrier has the meaning given such term in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H728FA2B3D78843C8847B8487F7D0A6E0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Individual with a disability
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">individual with a disability has the meaning given such term in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE639BD2529CF4A7587E47172B7239B85"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Foreign air carrier
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">foreign air carrier has the meaning given such term in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC28BB6D57AC64EF68F5B91424DA67D81"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               549.
               INVESTIGATION OF COMPLAINTS
               Section 41705(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking paragraph (1), and inserting the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H234E50FCF02E44D5BFB307B6AB707200"
                              style="OLC">
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCCF487316E7A4F0F92B360880A71592D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Secretary shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0EA922B26A904468A0DFE0C4EF37EBDB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        not later than 120 days after the receipt of any complaint of a violation of this section or a regulation prescribed under this section, investigate such complaint; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2229C448ABE842448143FD2B5677DEBE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        provide, in writing, to the individual that filed the complaint and the air carrier or foreign air carrier alleged to have violated this section or a regulation prescribed under this section, the determination of the Secretary with respect to—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEB5B686877024792ADF4608F405AA28C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           whether the air carrier or foreign air carrier violated this section or a regulation prescribed under this section;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H291457BA93F24DFB887AFD1967288AE9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           the facts underlying the complaint; and 
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDB6CD77136AA4F56AFFEF5467BE1EFD9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           any action the Secretary is taking in response to the complaint.
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HE2AED33AC0684AE8A2A8DA3CD1E4A131"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               550.
               REMOVAL OF OUTDATED REFERENCES TO PASSENGERS WITH DISABILITIES
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H68DE750C8CD8471DBBD0A9DF1E15C088"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Sovereignty and use of airspace
                  Section 40103(a)(2) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">handicapped individuals and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">individuals with disabilities.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H79242760FED545F28831AACA084C4A23"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Special prices for foreign air transportation
                  Section 41511(b)(4) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">handicap and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">disability.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD269B4C59F3C41DB89B669867A98DD5B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Discrimination against individuals with disabilities
                  Section 41705 of title 49, United States Code, is amended in the heading by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">
                        handicapped individuals
                      and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">
                        individuals with disabilities
                     .
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAACC0188AA174426B007E4BCE97870D0"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 417 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 41705 and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HA8308DF3E724449B8AA21CFEA6D0853E"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        41705. Discrimination against individuals with disabilities.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA12E69B85EA246DC923A40F3E775DDAF"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               551.
               ON-BOARD WHEELCHAIRS IN AIRCRAFT CABIN
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H98363349EEA34D329C5FC108ABBD67D9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  If an individual informs an air carrier or foreign air carrier at the time of booking a ticket for air transportation on a covered aircraft that the individual requires the use of any wheelchair, the air carrier or foreign air carrier shall provide information regarding the provision and use of on-board wheelchairs, including the rights and responsibilities of the air carrier and passenger as such rights and responsibilities relate to the provision and use of on-board wheelchairs.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3B84CDFA71C04F3492465A9FCE11BDD4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Availability of information
                  An air carrier or foreign air carrier that operates a covered aircraft shall provide on a publicly available website of the carrier information regarding the rights and responsibilities of both passengers on such aircraft and the air carrier or foreign air carrier relating to on-board wheelchairs, including—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H27CBCF88FD5B4109BB40DBBF7AFDDB7D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     that an air carrier or foreign air carrier is required to equip aircraft that have more than 60 passenger seats and that have an accessible lavatory (whether or not having such a lavatory is required by section 382.63 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations) with an on-board wheelchair, unless an exception described in such section 382.65 applies;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDA036CC435964634BA5E69D47ED83439"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     that a qualified individual with a disability (as defined in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on date of enactment of this Act)) may request an on-board wheelchair on aircraft with more than 60 passenger seats even if the lavatory is not accessible and that the basis of such request must be that the individual can use an inaccessible lavatory but cannot reach it from a seat without using an on-board wheelchair;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0116A3487B32488EB1383CEA89FB098B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     that the air carrier or foreign air carrier may require the qualified individual with a disability to provide the advance notice specified in section 382.27 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, in order for the individual to be provided with the on-board wheelchair; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H272A749DE4994B1BBA82B9DFFD9FCA92"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     if the air carrier or foreign air carrier requires the advance notice described in paragraph (3), information on how such a qualified individual with a disability can make such a request.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4DDF52335A1C43C0A81EC96C311A2234"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB118964387ED4529AA8C63A59884F7A5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Applicability of terms
                     The definitions contained in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code, apply to this section.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H48F6CD6B667E4CE6937C40E723B07C0B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Covered aircraft
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">covered aircraft means an aircraft that is required to be equipped with on-board wheelchairs in accordance with section 382.65 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H956289D579AE4663A55FAD482F36E2C5"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               552.
               AIRCRAFT ACCESSIBILITY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H69AC4CD8BC7F4707ADF1683885623677"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall initiate a program to study and evaluate the accessibility of new transport category aircraft designs certified, including, at a minimum—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCC76B14593E146499393816CA7FDC97C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     considering the safe boarding and deplaning processes for such aircraft, including individuals who use wheelchairs or other mobility aids, are blind or have limited vision, or are deaf or hard of hearing; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF699CC191B7842AC905D6699B581CC95"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     determining such aircraft can provide accessible lavatories.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB2988532BA044E4590AD2AE30A9C56C5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Consultation
                  In conducting the study and evaluation under this section, the Secretary shall consult with—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H279C1BDF573A4A578EB20521AF5E00B4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     air carriers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H228C451785A34815A30A2F5EF5A8CE56"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     aircraft manufacturers and aerospace supply companies; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H042681D3D49B4B69ADEC614F16E857C3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     other stakeholders as determined appropriate by the Secretary.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3DDEB5BA6E794F1BBB473F7DAB7C8A21"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report and recommendations
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF24B99A7918640168EB3252682F486C6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     a report on the findings of the study and evaluation under subsection (a); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEED5F4201B4F4B6AABDD128B87CD56D5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     any recommendations based on the findings of such study and evaluation.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9EE9053B30744201A1759149125D2E0B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to require the Secretary to require the retrofit of transport category aircraft based on the findings and evaluation under subsection (a). 
               
            
         
         <subtitle id="HF484E625110B4F70A82577DF71339CD7"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            C
            Air Service Development
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HFD3E45E146164AD0A7C76004F7EEC798"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               561.
               ESSENTIAL AIR SERVICE REFORMS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H89661206F0254DD48B549EA5FDFD5C24"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Reduction in subsidy cap
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE7E0D309CBD14244A99C30CCCB6BC07E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Section 41731(a)(1)(C) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H19A0F53741A445A1BE99F14E26D6EDFA"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC1B2CC119A39491F986E423B4767B26B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           had an average subsidy per passenger, as determined by the Secretary—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H61BC073FED924E3B9A1F7F833DF7867F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              of less than $1,000 during the most recent fiscal year beginning before October 1, 2026, regardless of driving miles to the nearest large or medium hub airport;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEB251EC4D6EB4C51A2E9898B38112862"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              of less than $850 during the most recent fiscal year beginning after September 30, 2026, regardless of driving miles to the nearest medium or large hub airport; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCB029474D6B4450FB4B5F06DDDF74661"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              of less than $650 during the most recent fiscal year for locations that are less than 175 miles from the nearest large or medium hub airport; and
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H071C3AA99A894B0589522E9FC6E0D21C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Notice
                     Section 41731(a)(1)(D)(ii) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">90-day and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">140-day.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H59F13B0142DF4F61BC67B3811F05EBC4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Waivers
                     Section 41731(e) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HF9050F0A30884E56BF275A318DF124A8"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HA5078F401DE54A4F802D7263517DEBCC"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Waivers
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC6F2332A3D704ABEA04A9D1A8727F35F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              The Secretary may waive, on an annual basis, subsections (a)(1)(B) and (a)(1)(C)(iii) with respect to an eligible place if such place demonstrates to the Secretary’s satisfaction that the reason the eligibility requirements of such subsections are not met is due to a temporary decline in demand.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2A2667B095164A509613EF561FA65B35"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Limitation
                              Beginning with fiscal year 2027, the Secretary may not provide a waiver of subsection (a)(1)(B) to any location—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7C259D8D3C8A44B2B73E6315F61B452B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 in more than 2 consecutive fiscal years; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA93E8AB6125B4A29A92F4BE342294527"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 in more than 5 fiscal years within 25 consecutive years.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4239BDE2CFF340F6B686A4CC1ACD1A4A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Limitation
                              Beginning in fiscal year 2027, the Secretary may not provide a waiver of subsection (a)(1)(C)(iii) to any location—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H824DBA2D9DFB4E02B446E771CCB0F0F2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 in more than 2 consecutive fiscal years; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H6DAE1A5105A7467DA91B656819E269E3"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 in more than 5 fiscal years within 25 consecutive years.
                              
                           
                        
                        .

                              id="H833B63FCDE56479DBA93CAC9D59CF425"

                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
