                           id="HD3A799ABED2B436B8842886F505F30E1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Recommendations on changes to increase radio communications coverage below 4,000 feet above ground level within such airspace.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H2965852507BF4A009738F37F5AC46D9C"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            613.
            AERONAUTICAL MOBILE COMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HFD38990DFE094236B1DF4888E3ECF5ED"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Satellite voice communications services
               The Administrator shall evaluate the addition of satellite voice communication services (in this section referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">SatVoice) to the Aeronautical Mobile Communications program (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">AMCS program) that provides for the delivery of air traffic control messages in oceanic and remote continental airspace. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H26A636AA7F2D441293CEF90602D657A8"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Analysis and implementation procedures
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall begin to develop the safety case analysis and implementation procedures for SatVoice instructions over the controlled oceanic and remote continental airspace regions of the FAA.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HEBE9D7D28ABD4E56913D860D19BAA00F"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Requirements
               The analysis and implementation procedures required under subsection (b) shall include, at a minimum, the following:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC26D79F8FEB54B02BD94B5E9F816436A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Network and protocol testing and integration with satellite service providers.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HDF0DECAC1BEB4EE693688896047CD04F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Operational testing with aircraft to identify and resolve performance issues.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE1D5C335F53B40619CF8D4C856A79843"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  A definition of Satcom Standards and Recommended Practices established through a collaboration with the International Civil Aviation Organization, which shall include an RCP–130 performance standard as well as SatVoice standards.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H91A37C1BCB6D4FECAB6B2446896A470F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Training for radio operators on new operation procedures and protocols.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5444AD77C29C42A3A82841D1BF269778"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  A phased implementation plan for incorporating SatVoice services into the AMCS program.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H256186E6D1B149DC91E3603D6E77FA5C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  The estimated cost of the implementation procedures for relevant stakeholders. 
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H3591AC54AE0E4423BC316745A7E32DF1"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               HF/VHF minimum equipage
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5F1273C1AEAB4E689DD8C7925DB6343B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Rule of Construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to affect the HF/VHF equipage requirement for communications in oceanic and remote continental airspace as of the date of enactment of this Act.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7D1790A7DF0E48D482EB9E9C826286F3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Maintenance of HF/VHF services
                  The Administrator shall maintain HF/VHF services existing as of the date of enactment of this Act as minimum equipage under the AMCS program to provide for auxiliary communication and maintain safety in the event of a satellite outage.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HD6C632FD548647FBB1A6F2CAE979EC19"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            614.
            DELIVERY OF CLEARANCE TO PILOTS VIA INTERNET PROTOCOL
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H9D3A571E4FAD4E9E9F9CE2372FAC8F24"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish a pilot program to conduct testing and an evaluation to determine the feasibility of the use, in air traffic control towers, of technology for mobile clearance delivery for general aviation and on-demand air carriers operating under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, at suitable airports that do not have tower data link services.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H90823A94872646E1A0DC972E28B66562"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Airport selection
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H867F781834F44D7F9FE28E3BCE750B92"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  The Administrator shall designate 5 suitable airports for participation in the program established under subsection (a) after consultation with the exclusive representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code, airport sponsors, aircraft and avionics manufacturers, MITRE, and aircraft operators
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H42915DBF111443B084CF13762DDB33C7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Airport size and complexity
                  In designating airports under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall designate airports of different size and complexity.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H95C503415BA64D539CC2E0FE45750CBC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Program objective
               The program established under subsection (a) shall address and include safety, security, and operational requirements for mobile clearance delivery at airports and heliports across the United States. 
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA65A87584C2A4DFEADCD2571313EF354"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Report
               Not later than 1 year after the date on which the program under subsection (a) is established, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the safety, security, and operational performance of mobile clearance delivery at airports pursuant to this section and recommendations on how best to improve the program.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA8F0FCD9C42040D0B56E621ADC9C0000"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Definitions
               In this section:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA18863399D3640AA89877EC6DB62E954"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Mobile clearance delivery
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">mobile clearance delivery means the delivery of access to departure clearance and clearance cancellation via internet protocol via applications to pilots while aircraft are on the ground where traditional data link installations are not feasible or possible.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H18E3690676494DB1BFA20FB10B78B32C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Tower data link services
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">tower data link services means communications between controllers and pilots using controller-pilot data link communications.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2F256261785C4223B04427216ECB677F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Suitable airport
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">suitable airport means towered airports, non-towered airports, and heliports. 
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H21B1704F253D4D559FAC5E02A9A0CA6F"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            615.
            STUDY ON CONGESTED AIRSPACE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HB15B2DF25A3741F0B33E4521D56281FD"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Study
               Not later than 270 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall initiate a study on the efficiency and efficacy of scheduled commercial air service transiting congested airspace.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6B3F72DC173B4E4696787B0737874245"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Contents
               In carrying out the study required under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall examine—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H87C51D86B4F3426B89D61733D7300E8E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  various regions of congested airspace and the differing factors of such regions;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE0DE76FE198F49D5AE60D46EE3F26D2A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  commercial air service;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2BF3182534A243E98490367F83029994"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  military flight activity;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H37EA54CD1B9B466891005A0EE70C17DF"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  emergency response activity;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H539A2D83559543E186D898E2734C9792"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  commercial space launch and reentry activities;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6F6FAFE37806413AA659D622FA89721E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  weather; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H56B1EF52DA8D488F86EBBC531E90F7BC"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  air traffic controller staffing. 
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H1A2DA88522A645F0B1DE6736862F6CFE"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Report
               Not later than 18 months after the initiation of the study under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the results of the study and recommendations to reduce the impacts to scheduled air service transiting congested airspace.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H7C4B5D46AC124AB6A421913F4178ACC4"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            616.
            BRIEFING ON LIT VORTAC PROJECT
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HC4D711A10C1E4287922A39595493E0E4"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the Little Rock Port Authority Very High Frequency Omni-Directional Radio Range Tactical Air Navigation Aid Project (in this section referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">LIT VORTAC).
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA6E22BD42454452CBD96F832152C80C8"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Briefing contents
               The briefing required under subsection (a) shall include the following:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCE6EFA1AE26248C7B96E8AA5E4E9DBB6"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  The status of the efforts by the FAA to relocate the LIT VORTAC.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6FF492736BB7459CBD2333BDB2D24B0C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  The status of new flight planning of the relocated LIT VORTAC.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF8748A94B8FA4A1181887C3B601F8170"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  A description of and timeline for each remaining phase of the relocation of the LIT VORTAC.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H9632AD6C80934C6192C164709023C1D0"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            617.
            SURFACE SURVEILLANCE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HC34AA58C49E2425897FD8C0514C529CF"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall conduct a review of surface surveillance systems that are operational as of such date of enactment.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H3874437614654391AC96621F6B02069B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Contents
               In carrying out the review under subsection (a), the Administrator shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H58AB4C57DE3F42EFA18ED31906B90F12"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  demonstrate that any change to the configuration of surface surveillance systems or decommissioning of a sensor from such systems provides an equivalent level of safety as the current system;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5754B0C05CD64D53AA4E10D473C4E3F5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  determine how a technology refresh of legacy sensor equipment can reduce operational and maintenance costs of surface surveillance systems compared to current costs and extend the useful life and affordability of such systems; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H10B1B5A7CE7B4854A7DBDC9E5285713C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  consider how to enhance such systems through new capabilities and software tools that improve the safety of terminal airspace and the airport surface.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6199014294E44740905FE990FE682AF0"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Consultation
               In carrying out the review under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consult with—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8AFE5146D6EB4BF7AF04EC56D6EEAED4"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  aviation safety experts with specific knowledge of surface surveillance technology, including multilateration and automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast; 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H616359BD4B994C1F8CECA6E961AC8045"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  representatives of the exclusive bargaining representative of the air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code, with expertise in surface safety; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H139C99AE11E944468D688F6F62CFDF75"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  representatives of the exclusive bargaining representative of airway transportation systems specialists of the FAA certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H18286AAB731E4A96B1DC593F928CEF05"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Briefing
               Upon completion of the review under subsection (a), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the findings of such review.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE4F9847884ED472199B53FDA6436FB98"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Implementation
               The Administrator may implement changes to surface surveillance systems consistent with the findings of the review described in subsection (d).
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H1F36F7E972B041BAA0E84EB0DC5F17D1"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            618.

                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                     (D)
                     in paragraph (3)—

            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE2803E852F4D4129BA24EA4947FD18E4"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Systems, procedures, facilities, services, and devices
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6017A876298C490AB9936DE65AC7AE29"

                  (1)
                  In general

                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"

         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HAEF46CE79BAB4D8FB8C786BB07082C54"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            619.
            NEXTGEN PROGRAMS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H81E3FBA8A9134961A7C2874BF4C60F57"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and periodically thereafter as the Administrator determines appropriate, the Administrator shall convene FAA officials to evaluate and expedite the implementation of NextGen programs and capabilities.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HAC9C255ECE2543C690D1C592CCB0E812"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Nextgen program prioritization
               In allocating amounts appropriated pursuant to section 48101(a) of title 49, United States Code, the Secretary shall give priority to the following activities:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBEAA59FCC9924A56AA5DB93C60F101FB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Performance-based navigation. 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCEF9621EED12499AA2EFC6AA8E0FD8F0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Data communications. 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD2D21DBF8E094D9C878A487083C56CE0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Terminal flight data manager. 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H112F14FDE7824D1A9F294D0D11AB2C22"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Aeronautical information management.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC9C73D6857B34F4FB8FD767D323708A6"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Other activities as recommended by the NextGen Advisory Committee and determined by the Administrator to be appropriate.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2EEE28ABB7014F73957E11848B327CF7"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Performance-based navigation
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC1C3D5DC84184889A3E5B2E6C627348D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall fully implement performance-based navigation procedures for all terminal and enroute routes, including approach and departure procedures for covered airports.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4154FF74B10E4B859E2AD8F04538EEB5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Specific procedures
                  Pursuant to paragraph (1), the Administrator shall prioritize the following performance-based navigation procedures:
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H757AC480883A4B0B8D49860B5569AE40"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Trajectory-based operations. 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H51BAA84B2DC74007950E998B1399F53B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Optimized profile descents. 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD2800FDACBA740A990CE7DDAC65D6AF8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     Multiple airport route separation.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8A503D23116741519DE05FF814DD8876"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     Established on required navigation performance.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4F4A4F3B568D4A2FBC6D17AFC1CF254B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     Converging runway display aids.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD833E2C61F7448A09FE8871AA179839E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Performance-based navigation baseline equipage requirements
                  In carrying out paragraph (1), the Administrator shall issue such regulations as may be required, and publish applicable advisory circulars, to establish the equipage baseline appropriate for aircraft to safely use performance-based navigation procedures.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H382F14AF9D62425B9A8AA7CD8354920B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Utilization action plan
                  Not later than 180 days after enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall, in consultation with certified labor representatives of air traffic controllers and the NextGen Advisory Committee, develop an action plan to utilize performance-based navigation procedures as a primary means of navigation to further reduce the dependency on legacy systems within the national airspace system.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD657E063B27944F289889309DD176667"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Data communications
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF16CEB8DCA99434CA8CA5A5437F92851"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall fully implement the use of data communications.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6CFAB78A6FA741BFABA24B63D9C7B46F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Specific capabilities
                  In carrying out subsection (a) and this subsection, the Administrator shall prioritize the following data communications capabilities:
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H145893DFE0624E5AACC3FB9AB743DDD1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Ground-to-ground message exchange for surface aircraft operations and runway safety at airports. 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEB265C1305524D5C9DCF7644EFACE139"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Automated message generation and receipt.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCE9ECC659BAF4EBE96EDFB73EB2EFDDC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     Message routing and transmission.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H43D8E3B82316441A92D44949D1E88361"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     Direct communications with aircraft avionics.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H02E89BAADF39466CB4642821C8496C09"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     Implementation of data communications at all Air Route Traffic Control Centers. 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF181CE224EA54FF49CCCB3A5EF418006"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     The Future Air Navigation System.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HAFC14FEC885F44998BBB8AB6DF5D7A01"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Terminal flight data manager and other systems
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8F099F7FB7754964969FE68422E5A447"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Terminal flight data manager
                  Not later than 4 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall install the Terminal Flight Data Manager system at not less than 89 airports in the United States based on the highest number of annual aircraft operations or a determination of operational need and the impact of installation and deployment on the national airspace system.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC11C36FB86DE47D396D573BC6F8FEA0C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Electronic flight strips
                  At a minimum, the Administrator shall implement electronic flight strips at the air traffic control towers of airports described in paragraph (1).
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA4217136322D41E7BCFF3C9C581EB303"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Flow management data and services
                  Not later than 4 years after the date of enactment of this Act, if the Administrator finds that Terminal Flight Data Manager systems would be beneficial to safety or efficiency, the Administrator shall install Flow Management Data and Services at airports described under paragraph (1).
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H14116B576D6548638108B3B6F216206B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Appropriations
                  The activities under paragraphs (1), (2), and (3) of this subsection shall be contingent on the appropriation of funds to carry out this subsection. 
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H466D4BFD8D394B0895D42600D02F3CCC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (f)
               Aeronautical information management systems
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7E4F3E34CBCE465187B8D44036C4286F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall fully modernize the aeronautical information management systems of the FAA to improve the functionality, useability, durability, and reliability of such systems used in the national airspace system.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA2D9E01B108140D1917E28FD64BF5322"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Requirements
                  In carrying out paragraph (1), the Administrator shall—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H74B80621BA8644A2BA0B3803FCC98963"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     improve the distribution of critical safety information to pilots, air traffic control, and other relevant aviation stakeholders;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3F94914848524566B6E6F18BDB9A9C44"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     fully develop and implement the Enterprise Information Display System; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5B72BEF89FD0483595C254DC96A678E4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     notwithstanding a centralized aeronautical information management system, restructure the back-up systems of aeronautical information management systems to be independent and self-sufficient from one another.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H43FDF68C1C7C4DDEA441CEE2CB88A960"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (g)
               Nextgen equipage plan
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HAFF00783400D4497ADDEB0DE02448BBF"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Not later than 14 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall develop a 2-year implementation plan to further incentivize the acceleration of the equipage rates of certain NextGen avionics within the fleets of air carriers (as such term is defined in section 40102(a) of title 49, United States Code.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9BF1A01B82F144C7BABD71C0345872C1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Contents
                  In developing the plan required under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall, at a minimum—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0C98A0F8C75C43399E11B001509401B7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     provide for further implementation and deployment of NextGen operational improvements to incentivize universal equipage of commercial and regional aircraft with certain NextGen avionics;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2CC01CABB5864BE58EA4B97862B2D631"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     identify any remaining barriers for operators of commercial and regional aircraft to properly equip such aircraft with certain NextGen avionics, including any methods to address such barriers;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7BDA7FF0AE5F48A09E31EE653723B10B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     provide for the use of the best methods to highlight and enhance to operators of commercial and regional aircraft the benefits of equipping such aircraft with certain NextGen avionics; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBFB76AC03A1D47E6B50FECE8F9564BA7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     include in such plan any equipage guidelines and regulations the Administrator determines necessary and appropriate.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3CEC28DA644644B3812643784F5CF852"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Consultation
                  In developing the plan under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall consult with representatives from—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9F86A88A58144B3181C8508DCEC68E1A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     trade associations representing air carriers;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEFF0BD25949C40B0B381CAF229FC0056"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     trade associations representing avionics manufacturers;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H246D3F820CE543E78AF8846590660A16"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     certified labor organizations representing air traffic controllers; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H004E73286A044654B2CC1BA898857F58"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     any other representatives the Administrator determines appropriate.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HEB0968DA78C44ABD986A415574E248D8"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Submission of plan
                  Not later than 15 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress the plan required under this subsection.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC158C598F5A544B098A3FD6B1C1E269E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Implementation
                  Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall initiate such actions necessary to implement the plan developed under paragraph (1), including initiating any required rulemaking.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H884771BCAC6543699BC0E077FEDC7270"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  Definition
                  In this subsection, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">certain NextGen avionics means those avionics and baseline capabilities as recommended in the report of the NextGen Advisory Committee titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Minimum Capabilities List (MCL) Ad Hoc Team NAC Task 19–1 Report, issued on November 17, 2020.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H7B6E7119521440F4B377FE05B4E47A13"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (h)
               Effect of failure to meet deadline
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H55C40EE5F2034937A85EEC732CE0D49A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Notification of Congress
                  For each deadline established under subsections (a) through (g), if the Administrator determines that the Administrator has not met or will not meet each such deadline, the Administrator shall, not later than 30 days after such determination, notify the appropriate committees of Congress about the failure to meet each deadline. 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H77CAF8F763814E3295852647D3A1F2DD"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Contents of notification
                  Each notification under paragraph (1) shall be accompanied by the following:
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC0FDD37E682A4F98B31C9A4A42B8BBA0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     An explanation as to why the Administrator will not or did not meet the deadline described in such paragraph.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6260B7738131472F9CE201964D5B9693"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     A description of the actions the Administrator plans to take to meet the deadline described in such paragraph.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1F4E69B64A5A438094FF97C11DF5AFD6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     Actions Congress can take to assist the Administrator in meeting the deadline described in such paragraph.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H12CFA3AA93064F879F80D23E41148BCA"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Briefing
                  If the Administrator is required to provide notice under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall provide the appropriate committees of Congress quarterly briefings as to the progress made by the Administrator regarding implementation under the respective subsection for which the deadline will not be or was not met until such time as the Administrator has completed the required work under such subsection.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H5DF48466E83E4337A43F2277EEB82AFC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (i)
               NextGen Advisory Committee consultation
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H55FB9493A33D48AD83F6F862163D3064"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  The Administrator shall consult and task the NextGen Advisory Committee with providing recommendations on ways to expedite, prioritize, and fully implement the NextGen program to realize the operational benefits of such programs.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H34B5F1E3331C4033A0E5FBA382550F00"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Considerations
                  In providing recommendations under paragraph (1), the NextGen Advisory Committee shall consider—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1556712BDC8D41C4B66550397EEBFF1B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     air traffic throughput of the national airspace system;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0865CD9B481244788F816FD81E475436"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     daily operational performance, including delays and cancellations; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7974F730F6B74511AA2CFB510D4FEBBF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     the potential need for performance-based operational metrics related to the NextGen program and subsequent air traffic modernization programs and efforts.
                  
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H0C70761A081A4ED6882C6222F114B5E9"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            620.
            CONTRACT TOWER PROGRAM
            Section 47124 of title 49, United States Code, is amended— 
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HA5C2228E05534E0E92CF3785597925F2"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               in subsection (b)(3) by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HE82FEAD366E84E84A40521343739FB59"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H72D6B8EC13984E3BB09A41CFF405B257"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (H)
                     Period for completion of an operational readiness inspection
                     The Secretary shall provide airport sponsors acting in good faith 7 years to complete an operational readiness inspection after receiving a benefit-to-cost ratio of air traffic control services for an airport.
                  
                  ; and
               
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H7D7E8D897E1A4E448DD78C11C4DA76E8"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H528E643C379F4FC58B84DCFF53ED5F4E"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HAD3D9C3925964DA8897492E44FBF9A56"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (f)
                     Improving controller situational awareness
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1D27F1A598FB412D9EF2E4D206EA24DE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall allow air traffic controllers at towers operated under the Contract Tower Program to use approved advanced equipment and technologies to improve operational situational awareness, including Standard Terminal Automation Replacement System radar displays, Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast, Flight Data Input/Output, and Automatic Terminal Information System.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6DD85989FD804330B8CE47DBB38329EC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Installation and maintenance
                        Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall allow airports to—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H273801B318AF48F18126FCC8BD5AB3A3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           procure a Standard Terminal Automation Replacement System or any equivalent system through the Federal Aviation Administration, and install and maintain such system using Administration services; or
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H672D5B7A2A9A40AAB6BED8CB89F24548"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           purchase a Standard Terminal Automation Replacement System, or any equivalent system, and install and maintain such system using services directly from an original equipment manufacturer.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H004FA3211C394E7993B1416596B29122"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Requirements
                        To help facilitate the integration of the equipment and technology described in paragraph (1), the Secretary—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3B2059E64A79465DB5AB73EA2AAF4D92"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           shall establish minimum performance and technical standards that ensure the safe use of equipment and technology, including commercial radar displays capable of displaying primary and secondary radar targets, for use by controllers in contract towers to improve situational awareness;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HEA0F372D29654823BBDF760BEF72BE90"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           shall identify approved vendors for such equipment and technology, to the maximum extent practicable;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H88E4D993BDD44640A50A68375E4DB9F7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           shall establish, in consultation with contract tower operators, an appropriate training program to periodically train air traffic controllers employed by such operators to ensure proper and efficient integration and use of the situational awareness equipment and technology described in paragraph (1) into contract tower operations;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6A89E0070BDE4428A278430DB0C2E10A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           may add Standard Terminal Automation Replacement System equipment or any equivalent system to the minimum level of equipage necessary for Federal contract towers to perform the function of such towers, as applicable; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE44F8F9FF1BF4E35B3BE25500E5BD3DB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (E)
                           shall require that any technology, system, or equipment procured pursuant to this subsection be procured using non-Federal funds, except as made available under a grant issued pursuant to 47124(b)(4).
                        
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H837D157B880B4F08B9E2523B99DE6626"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (g)
                     Liability insurance
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE1EDE8CACC904C77A9F52F032B46924F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall consult with aviation industry experts, including air traffic control contractors and aviation insurance professionals, to determine adequate limits of liability for the Contract Tower Program.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8B829C61E72D46E4BC81DDA1767EB36F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Interim steps
                        Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this subsection and until the Secretary makes a determination on liability limits under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall require air traffic control contractors to have excess liability insurance (as determined by the Secretary) to ensure continuity of such coverage should a major accident occur.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H601413CFB1904BCC8325BE0107486F0F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Briefing
                        Not later than 24 months after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall brief the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate on the findings, conclusions, and actions taken and planned to be taken to carry out this subsection.
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H57C27743022D40A08775B1C548AE0F7E"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            621.
            REMOTE TOWERS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H9E6DF8C02BB7440FAE829E687E0C55CB"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Section 47124 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE7D2A0AC5DD94B5CA59E8C9E5D5FE52F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HF6E93925D172478AB43231FCDA3B7D52"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H5B85A02118DA4A4FA7F0EFEAE3F9080E"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (h)
                        Milestones for design approval of remote towers
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD0988392A7A142E8AF919A08914A095C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall create a program and publish milestones to achieve system design and operational approval for a remote tower system.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H24FDFCB421AC4C229EF62E55265A0E7D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Requirements
                           In carrying out paragraph (1), the Administrator shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3C42D7D398AA4637B38E07F4791706E8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              rely on support from the Office of Airports of the Federal Aviation Administration and the Air Traffic Organization of the Federal Aviation Administration, including the Air Traffic Services Service Unit and the Technical Operations Service Unit;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBBE92877805E4AE69D06009500678962"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              consult with relevant stakeholders, as the Administrator determines appropriate;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2AF314E5E1514741B0DE78769E65F54E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              establish requirements for the system design and operational approval of remote towers, including—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4E9F9ADC424E499C8271901F791172B3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 visual siting processes and requirements for electro-optical sensors;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H49840650875541E499F5D36AB456458B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 datalink latency requirements;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE9AE138FE2724C979B4592B5366F7CED"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 visual presentation design requirements for monitors used to display sensor and camera feeds; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HAB6AE65CEF6D4BDAA0AD553B08C32301"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iv)
                                 any other wireless telecommunications infrastructure requirements to enable the operation of such towers;
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCDCA9926E07F4A8DB596756190E619F7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              use a safety risk management panel process to address any safety issues with respect to a remote tower;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9B87511DCBAF470184D6E075D4DEB926"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              if a remote tower is intended to be installed at a non-towered airport, assess the safety benefits of the remote tower against the lack of an existing tower;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H994D634B137F4965976653272EFDCB39"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              allow the use of surface surveillance technology, either standalone or integrated into the visual automation platform, as a situational awareness tool;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H684382ADEAF3421B8B9D707F32DC1E14"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (G)
                              establish protocols for contingency operations and procedures in the event of remote tower technology failures and malfunctions; and 
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H238FAE1C262746758AAB62FA78AD7A1E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (H)
                              support active testing of a remote tower system that has achieved system design approval by the William J. Hughes Technical Center at an airport that has installed remote tower infrastructure to support such system. 
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE21E61DCF12642F8B9F705B744686CBD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           System design approval and evaluation process
                           Not later than December 31, 2024, the Administrator shall expand the system design approval and evaluation process for a digital or remote tower system to not less than 3 airports at which a digital or remote tower will be installed or operated at airports not located at the William J. Hughes Technical Center and using the criteria under section 161 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 47104 note), to the extent the Administrator has willing technology providers and airports interested in the installation and operation of such towers.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H82519EB2220B4401AC225A48B9AB5F7C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Preservation of existing design approvals
                           Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to invalidate any system design approval activity carried out by the William J. Hughes Technical Center prior to the date of enactment of this subsection.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB7C236C3F2C24E67849A3F2B1403F5B1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Prioritization for remote tower certification
                           In carrying out the program established under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall prioritize system design and operational approval for a remote tower system at—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8F6DC293F969450FA8B7F555C3308FFD"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              airports that do not have a permanent air traffic control tower at the time of application;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE2D56500D75740BE9CB5FB9A9176EA30"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              airports that would provide small and rural community air service; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H38FB758B48884F13B3C0B35038E87D07"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              airports that have been newly accepted as of the date of enactment of this subsection into the Contract Tower Program.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HC0125279EC5D459BB4B048AA4A172C82"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Briefing to Congress
               Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and every 6 months thereafter through October 1, 2028, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7A4942AC75844FCC9ADA09DFFD27232E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  the status of remote and digital tower projects in the system design approval and commissioning process;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4754FCB89C5E498D8BF8592DADC5E7FD"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  the effectiveness and adequacy of the pilot program established under section 161 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 47104 note); and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HFC739259F44841689830963D740F7143"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  any other issues related to the demand for and potential use of remote tower technology that the Administrator determines are appropriate.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2BFDF8E5F8AF4BAF8CED459B690DB2F1"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Conforming amendments
               Section 47124(b) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H22D48FD1FFF84AEE8FD4A2B4046F5D5F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in paragraph (3)(B)(ii) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">or a remote air traffic control tower equipment that has received System Design Approval from the Federal Aviation Administration after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">an operating air traffic control tower; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBB54E200728A4E248CFB641C53E7FF95"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  in paragraph (4)(A)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF344F8B8A6BD42D4B99235C4B8748689"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     in clause (i)(III) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">or remote air traffic control tower equipment that has received System Design Approval from the Federal Aviation Administration after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">certified by the Federal Aviation Administration; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6640266CCF1245769537E2F933F4138F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     in clause (ii)(III) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">or remote air traffic control tower equipment that has received System Design Approval from the Federal Aviation Administration after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">certified by the Federal Aviation Administration.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HC02B2C335040487FA3CEB3A37F3B3075"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Extension
               Section 161(a)(10) of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 47104 note) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">May 10, 2024 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">September 30, 2028.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H54122FDBDB83412792D11A748B25DD99"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            622.
            AUDIT OF LEGACY SYSTEMS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA55D0A07EE814D43A1884A1EF6914948"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall initiate an audit of all legacy systems of the national airspace system to determine the level of operational risk, functionality, and security of such systems and the compatibility of such systems with current and future technology.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H7DE5221979A847CFB7E57296FC156440"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Scope of audit
               The audit required under subsection (a)—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H25FC2173D79D42F0B5B797D84851B885"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  shall be conducted by an independent third-party contractor or a federally funded research and development center selected by the Administrator;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1A863D99225844BA8891E2C347C0F0E0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  shall include an assessment of whether a legacy system is an outdated, insufficient, unsafe, or unstable legacy system;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H241FDB19D8B8430EA57A3C884B90D9CF"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  with respect to any legacy systems identified in the audit as an outdated, insufficient, unsafe, or unstable legacy system, shall include—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB423EBDAB89D42E19226C10E2C2EA3F6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     an analysis of the operational risks associated with using such legacy systems;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA6104F41209A425981CC6826D81118AD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     recommendations for replacement or enhancement of such legacy systems; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC985AAAB81A14A9F8CC9BCE9FBE6F370"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     an analysis of any potential impact on aviation safety and efficiency; and
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H24A8E455CEAD433F89D60C51D045989D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  shall include recommended performance metrics by which the Administrator can assess the circumstances in which safety-critical communication, navigation, and surveillance aviation infrastructure within the national airspace system can remain in operational service, which take into account—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H998B48E5396342458AC2DCF182C48DD1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the expected lifespan of such aviation infrastructure;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE9260E98828141DB8E76A3FD8DA70E3D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     the number and type of mechanical failures of such aviation infrastructure;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC3B33C85EEE74356A870FF701BB61210"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     the average annual costs of maintaining such aviation infrastructure over a 5-year period and whether such costs exceed the cost to replace such aviation infrastructure; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H43820BED9FC24D69978B6B2AD942CBAB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     the availability of replacement parts or labor capable of maintaining such aviation infrastructure.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA475892155CB48A2BCAADD39F3420B30"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Deadline
               Not later than 15 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the audit required under subsection (a) shall be completed.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H450A04EAC62E428CA537BF9F184B335F"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Report
               Not later than 180 days after the audit required under subsection (a) is completed, the Administrator shall provide to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the findings and recommendations of such audit, including—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA70C934DE88048BF95AA032F31ABDB44"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  an inventory of the legacy systems in use;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD2010437A0D949B8A0827222B70C8E5A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
