            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H939B17338C6D412A89E0E8B16D7C20AA"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               706.
               COMMUNITY USE OF AIRPORT LAND
               Section 47107(v) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H7728A5552E204ACBBB7D966DCD76FCDE"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H62F84549DC1844FC83AF5B2DD6BC9AAF"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (v)
                     Community use of airport land
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H56419B855C324C6E8C50859FE543FB93"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        Notwithstanding subsections (a)(13), (b), and (c) and section 47133, and subject to paragraph (2), the sponsor of a public-use airport shall not be considered to be in violation of this subtitle, or to be found in violation of a grant assurance made under this section, or under any other provision of law, as a condition for the receipt of Federal financial assistance for airport development, solely because the sponsor has—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H57E90334CBD94D498F7541834FBDF21A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           entered into an agreement, including a revised agreement, with a local government providing for the use of airport property for an interim compatible recreational purpose at below fair market value; or
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB0569D8EC85B440BB4F8F7B2040A4E5E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           permanently restricted the use of airport property to compatible recreational and public park use without paying or otherwise obtaining payment of fair market value for the property.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCE4552316A03432D864DDC38D9AB6C21"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Restrictions
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC97429DCFD5D4E93B42CFCD645776972"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           Interim compatible recreational purpose
                           Paragraph (1) shall apply, with respect to a sponsor that has taken the action described in subparagraph (A) of such paragraph, only—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC04C3FB2D4BB49E1B5005B16F05EBC5E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              to an agreement regarding airport property that was initially entered into before the publication of the Federal Aviation Administration’s Policy and Procedures Concerning the Use of Airport Revenue, dated February 16, 1999;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD3B3C4DB064D46A092E7C6B1CC8454BD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              if the agreement between the sponsor and the local government is subordinate to any existing or future agreements between the sponsor and the Secretary, including agreements related to a grant assurance under this section;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5E25C970A13B4B57A42763553DE73963"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              to airport property that was purchased using funds from a Federal grant for acquiring land issued prior to January 1, 1989;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H003D90F6EB4043FE83DAF9095E8559AC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iv)
                              if the airport sponsor has provided a written statement to the Administrator that the property made available for a recreational purpose will not be needed for any aeronautical purpose during the next 10 years;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4998047A1F4F4B50885349C8403B70EE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (v)
                              if the agreement includes a term of not more than 2 years to prepare the airport property for the interim compatible recreational purpose and not more than 10 years of use for that purpose;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0B2C2FE714184253B56DE0E0091B0A1A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (vi)
                              if the recreational purpose will not impact the aeronautical use of the airport;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8BE035ADB70F4C2F8A036BDEA0633E33"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (vii)
                              if the airport sponsor provides a certification that the sponsor is not responsible for preparation, startup, operations, maintenance, or any other costs associated with the recreational purpose; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H33D4EC3F9F78469DBAA22992E093988A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (viii)
                              if the recreational purpose is consistent with Federal land use compatibility criteria under section 47502.
                           
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2A243B4CE37D4133811B7C1CFEDB0EAA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Recreational use
                           Paragraph (1) shall apply, with respect to a sponsor that has taken the action described in subparagraph (B) of such paragraph, only—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCC7DA8509D634A08B5E2054EB40A42B8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              to airport property that was purchased using funds from a Federal grant for acquiring land issued prior to January 1, 1989;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDCF6F9BF534843218F798350D987449F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              to airport property that has been continuously leased or licensed through a written agreement with a governmental entity or non-profit entity for recreational or public park uses since July 1, 2003;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC29C634763E741E4A4AD00FD02245F38"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              if the airport sponsor has provided a written statement to the Administrator that the recreational or public park use does not impact the aeronautical use of the airport and that the property to be permanently restricted for recreational or public park use is not needed for any aeronautical use at the time the written statement is provided and is not expected to be needed for any aeronautical use at any time after such statement is provided;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8954F4A80A7F463A8EBEE2D0FF00493A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iv)
                              if the airport sponsor provides a certification to the Administrator that the sponsor is not responsible for operations, maintenance, or any other costs associated with the recreational or public park use;
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDC7E70CA27FA4CDCB8B1EDFE5F5D4F93"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (v)
                              if the recreational purpose is consistent with Federal land use compatibility criteria under section 47502; and
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD065AAF27F2C4A4C997148B9A6EF4CEA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (vi)
                              if the airport sponsor will—
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H367F2780E51448A5AEDEDD51DAC24FCD"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (I)
                                 lease the property to a local government entity or non-profit entity to operate and maintain the property at no cost to the airport sponsor; or
                              
                              <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB8E42AD5FA62426EB9DA872BDAB68138"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (II)
                                 transfer title to the property to a local government entity subject to a permanent deed restriction ensuring compatible airport use under regulations issued pursuant to section 47502.
                              
                           
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF59D4775D1044B83AB0457A105C97E54"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        Revenue from certain sales of airport property
                        Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an airport sponsor leasing or selling a portion of airport property as described in paragraph (2)(B)(vi) may—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD63D289630F04FADB686C968BEA3B1FE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           lease or sell such portion of airport property for less than fair market value; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H017251D23CB4450CBD77A6AC472CB91A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           subject to the requirements of subsection (b), retain the revenue from the lease or sale of such portion of airport property for use in accordance with section 47133.
                        
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE8F31444FE25414FA460272F026E4694"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        Secretary review and approval
                        Notwithstanding any other provision of law, and subject to the sponsor providing a written statement certifying such sponsor meets the requirements under this subsection, no actions permitted under this subsection shall require the review or approval of the Secretary of Transportation.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H70D4DF5565AE42EF8FB15CCC445E9A9B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        Statutory construction
                        Nothing in this subsection may be construed as permitting a diversion of airport revenue for the capital or operating costs associated with the community use of airport land.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7D3089E4987F4A9D9F1C9B3D236074CF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (6)
                        Aeronautical use; aeronautical purpose defined
                        In this subsection, the terms <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">aeronautical use and <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">aeronautical purpose—
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDFF0D5AB73E34FF3B4EDA81F4AA0D18E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           mean all activities that involve or are directly related to the operation of aircraft, including activities that make the operation of aircraft possible and safe;
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDE0BDC2980EC4EFDBC1097C454BEF88A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           include services located at an airport that are directly and substantially related to the movement of passengers, baggage, mail, and cargo; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB95E5059D5844563A35018EB1D517FF2"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           do not include any uses of an airport that are not described in subparagraph (A) or (B), including any aviation-related uses that do not need to be located at an airport, such as flight kitchens and airline reservation centers.
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H03A7170F2A05427E80ADDAA565A245D0"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               707.
               PRICE ADJUSTMENT PROVISIONS
               Section 47108 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H59542E7475724EE99D30D41C414A14F2"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in subsection (a) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">47114(d)(3)(A) of this title and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">47114(d)(2)(A);
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4612FA4926C64FAFBDDCE39800126C21"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HA87FAF88857849A3932829E1C71B8473"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HD7BC8806831A44B196645D5591DA6F1C"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Increasing government share
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2B4E0DFE73A543A4980E3ADA9BDBA0BE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           Except as provided in paragraph (2) or (3), the amount stated in an offer as the maximum amount the Government will pay may not be increased when the offer has been accepted in writing.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8A127E7D3C5446B4A6CC408FF9881759"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Exception
                           For a project receiving assistance under a grant approved under this chapter or chapter 475, the amount may be increased—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H22571DD48D374EBEB584D84F98727866"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              for an airport development project, by not more than 15 percent; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H96070C55838E48E1B5CE29AFF652EF75"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              to acquire an interest in land for an airport (except a primary airport), based on creditable appraisals at the time of the acquisition or a court award in a condemnation proceeding, by not more than the greater of—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0A87D97129AE4A2987CEA9BCBB1C9A69"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 15 percent; or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA8615A349D0641EDA1D5604878A02C6E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 25 percent of the total increase in allowable project costs attributable to acquiring an interest in land.
                              
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3936CF3112AE42D88C9E83966CF00296"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Price adjustment provisions
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H006E6F8E93FB449F9AD2D0351CD92577"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              The Secretary may incorporate a provision in a project grant agreement under which the Secretary agrees to pay more than the maximum amount otherwise specified in the agreement if the Secretary finds that commodity or labor prices have increased since the agreement was made.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8CD183BC8A364D24A7A16463F99F19E2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Decrease in costs
                              A provision incorporated in a project grant agreement under this paragraph shall ensure that the Secretary realizes any financial benefit associated with a decrease in material or labor costs for the project.
                           
                        
                     
                     ; 
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4A5B8FF8BC4A4834B57E629EE0C3CBEA"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  by striking subsection (c); and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H48856F75CD924B979F770A57E94C8B1E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H140D40D510534529A1941FD736D88035"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               708.
               UPDATING UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT’S SHARE OF PROJECT COSTS
               Section 47109 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H1A610097E45D45DF9F792AFC9153B9E9"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HCAA4E9C09D6A44B097F6F8E91EE05AED"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (h)
                     Special rule for fiscal years 2025 and 2026
                     Notwithstanding subsection (a), the Government’s share of allowable project costs for a grant made to a nonhub or nonprimary airport in each of fiscal years 2025 and 2026 shall be 95 percent.
                  
                  .

                     in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HABACB7999C4042B592609A9C33199ED3"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               710.
               SMALL AIRPORT LETTERS OF INTENT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD2CB08F4D87F4FECB92DF6282C62761C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 47110 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H9AA730D82B444EF28B084D69CC3DF058"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HC27853DB10A54B8092AA7626D71505AE"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        Small airport letters of intent
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H691D94735857470F8EB01D2625E3C61F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           The Secretary may issue a letter of intent to a sponsor stating an intention to obligate an amount from future budget authority for an airport development project (including costs of formulating the project) at a nonhub airport or an airport that is not a primary airport.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H32CB45AD3FB843A1909F0A7ECC7B1150"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Contents
                           In the letter issued under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall establish a schedule under which the Secretary will reimburse the sponsor for the Government’s share of allowable project costs, as amounts become available, if the sponsor, after the Secretary issues the letter, carries out the project without receiving amounts under this subchapter.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC9FB65C71C6A47718289289967BABAA4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Limitations
                           The amount the Secretary intends to obligate in a letter of intent issued under this subsection shall not exceed the larger of—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H825E6E51DBE8486180059613245F6EFE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              the Government’s share of allowable project costs; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFCBA4543B01B45FEB4E3BF6997BD8AEB"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              $10,000,000.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H148BA4F596394961BD40C1493D8C1966"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Financing
                           Allowable project costs under paragraphs (1) and (2) may include costs associated with making payments for debt service on indebtedness incurred to carry out the project.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9140A0F5C9784FE0A9F5A1CFEFF50C45"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Requirements
                           The Secretary shall issue a letter of intent under paragraph (1) only if—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H257A8AD8184C40D6A49834DA5358D51E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              the sponsor notifies the Secretary, before the project begins, of the intent of the sponsor to carry out the project and requests a letter of intent; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H06E3A013D4964A2C9CEBC29F2FC17AB9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              the sponsor agrees to comply with all statutory and administrative requirements that would apply to the project if it were carried out with amounts made available under this subchapter.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB4EF6E99D4704E1ABE09452284FB7AF6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (6)
                           Assessment
                           In reviewing a request for a letter of intent under this subsection, the Secretary shall consider the grant history of an airport, the enplanements or operations of an airport, and such other factors as the Secretary determines appropriate.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC22801129E204548877EC9F486046199"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (7)
                           Prioritization
                           In issuing letters of intent under this subsection, the Secretary shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H017A26BB0FF94FF192B346107A2C4A30"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              prioritize projects that—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H07AAF5FFA6714F3B8AABB04BE1D31347"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 cannot reasonably be funded by an airport sponsor using funds apportioned under section 47114(c), 47114(d)(2)(A), or 47114(d)(6), including funds apportioned under such sections in multiple fiscal years pursuant to section 47117(b)(1); and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC82AD4DDFF5947E9A4449B61166F0F44"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 are necessary to the continued safe operation or development of an airport; and
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H13B73AFA0B344B2685BFEC616B31A20C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              structure the reimbursement schedules under such letters in a manner that minimizes unnecessary or undesirable project segmentation.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H17FB9562C5AC4B839BE86C01535DD21D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (8)
                           No obligation or commitment
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6B5911BE4B2645B9B8141E1C1FFEB9B3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              A letter of intent issued under this subsection is not an obligation of the Government under section 1501 of title 31, and the letter is not deemed to be an administrative commitment for financing.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9FBF08C599604FC0A265F34F84DD4175"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Obligation or commitment
                              An obligation or administrative commitment may be made only as amounts are provided in authorization and appropriation Acts.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0AE1F6720AE84090AED16264564F2401"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (9)
                           Limitation on statutory construction
                           Nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit the obligation of amounts pursuant to a letter of intent under this subsection in the same fiscal year as the letter of intent is issued.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H82061515ADF14C8C98B62648F601127D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Conforming amendments
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE752669E8C874190952E789915A1B633"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Letters of intent
                     Section 47110(e)(7) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">under this section and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">under this subsection.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE05E503FC9BB4873B791CF3A571444B3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Priority for letters of intent
                     Section 47115(h) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">prior to fulfilling intentions to obligate under section 47110(i) after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">section 47110(e). 
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H52A8F47E9A8F4B4D9BD6343BB8826EB9"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               711.
               PROHIBITION ON PROVISION OF AIRPORT IMPROVEMENT GRANT FUNDS TO CERTAIN ENTITIES THAT HAVE VIOLATED INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS OF UNITED STATES ENTITIES
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1C8F9127D30E4F2BB371AE54BD229B2E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Beginning on the date that is 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act, amounts provided as project grants under subchapter I of chapter 471 of title 49, United States Code, may not be used to enter into a covered contract with any entity on the list required under subsection (b).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HACF1E438D7EF4DBA87829C4E72CB0A37"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  List required
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4C0ABEC9CF884EF093213D3BA3CE933F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and thereafter as required under paragraph (2), the United States Trade Representative, the Attorney General, and the Administrator shall make available to the Administrator a publicly-available list of entities manufacturing airport passenger boarding infrastructure or equipment that—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H33AF03C4B7E04E8AB52F0EB91A05C822"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        are owned, directed by, or subsidized in whole or in part by the People’s Republic of China;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB0F848EEB38043619B20877D46CBFFEE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        have been determined by a Federal court to have misappropriated intellectual property or trade secrets from an entity organized under the laws of the United States or any jurisdiction within the United States;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H36386595ADCA4FE3B884147D59704877"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        own or control, are owned or controlled by, are under common ownership or control with, or are successors to an entity described in subparagraph (A); or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H30F0EBB08D0E4A0F97B8E9D6A5D75923"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        have entered into an agreement with or accepted funding from, whether in the form of minority investment interest or debt, have entered into a partnership with, or have entered into another contractual or other written arrangement with an entity described in subparagraph (A).
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H58A718C6E0CB452293ABA079B54A80C6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Updates to list
                     The United States Trade Representative shall update the list required under paragraph (1), based on information provided by the Attorney General and the Administrator—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0B83A121173548A78753148610637185"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        not less frequently than every 90 days during the 180-day period following the initial publication of the list under paragraph (1); and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7F780015E6704B6FA5CF989DFA37D36D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        not less frequently than annually thereafter.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD231D3ED67AC48C99F9F2827FA336EBF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD9337CC85744428D93F0A29EB5442C60"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The definitions in section 47102 of title 49, United States Code, shall apply.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBF28F3C455904727A60BE39496AE9A0B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Covered contract
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">covered contract means a contract or other agreement for the procurement of infrastructure or equipment for a passenger boarding bridge at an airport.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HF8A4CFE228D14A7E90C3DC7246CED5DB"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               712.
               APPORTIONMENTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE0D617E332264209B0F5025DF980BC31"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Primary, commercial service, and cargo airports
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB59F48F04C1447AD94897E44F9A9AD58"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Primary and commercial service airports
                     Section 47114(c)(1) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H7A677E29DE2E41A78C4145F6A8A8C3EB"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC00992A92CBE487F94B3D8292B97EA2A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Primary and commercial service airports
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE6A9DA32A56A43C0BC35F85B4A2635D5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Primary airport apportionment
                              The Secretary shall apportion to the sponsor of each primary airport for each fiscal year an amount equal to—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H26F785892F864B2FB3CB334B01F7DFBE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 $15.60 for each of the first 50,000 passenger boardings at the airport during the prior calendar year;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBB3403EBED23437CBEBA475418D571D7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 $10.40 for each of the next 50,000 passenger boardings at the airport during the prior calendar year;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5564D03C987E438F804695773D05AF95"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 $5.20 for each of the next 400,000 passenger boardings at the airport during the prior calendar year;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HFAAF3F9A81334B2182ED4ECC079361FB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iv)
                                 $1.30 for each of the next 500,000 passenger boardings at the airport during the prior calendar year; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCB8A778555534E8D835CD3C8E03C864D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (v)
                                 $1.00 for each additional passenger boarding at the airport during the prior calendar year.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H09FD2C6C8DBC4188A8228BA7CC7541A5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Minimum and maximum apportionments
                              Not less than $1,300,000 nor more than $22,000,000 may be apportioned under subparagraph (A) to an airport sponsor for a primary airport for each fiscal year.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4FB6259267DE4CDCAE7025B70BF42020"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              New airport
                              Notwithstanding subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall apportion in the first fiscal year following the official opening of a new airport with scheduled passenger air transportation an amount equal to $1,300,000 to the sponsor of such airport.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0DD147B5417845DBB81B8B2A94DC74D6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Nonprimary commercial service airport apportionment
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBF9D9DF9F5144E7BA6A64309F3C69FFD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 In general
                                 The Secretary shall apportion to each commercial service airport that is not a primary airport an amount equal to—
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HDB6B89BDCF9040CD82C4F49952661CC9"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (I)
                                    $60 for each of the first 2,500 passenger boardings at the airport during the prior calendar year; and
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA6E99F6FE09E4C93B516C47036900F5D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (II)
                                    $153.33 for each of the next 7,499 passenger boardings at the airport during the prior calendar year.
                                 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H456A3B6C90EA444AB5FA5F62FD451C1F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 Applicability
                                 Paragraphs (4) and (5) of subsection (d) shall apply to funds apportioned under this subparagraph.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF3E99E2A1CFE4309A7DDDB22915937BD"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              Public airports with military use
                              Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a public airport shall be considered a primary airport in each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028 for purposes of this chapter if such airport was—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5601DA1C48264EB9B0636DBB6351B348"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 designated as a primary airport in fiscal year 2017; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF37A20292C954A6B802A67C22039066C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 in use by an air reserve station in the calendar year used to calculate apportionments to airport sponsors in a fiscal year.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7E83BBCB3E284F39A08D56FEAADEB268"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              Special rule for fiscal year 2024
                              Notwithstanding any other provision of this paragraph or the absence of scheduled passenger service at an airport, the Secretary shall apportion in fiscal year 2024 to the sponsor of an airport an amount based on the number of passenger boardings at the airport during whichever of the following years that would result in the highest apportioned amount under this paragraph:
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H107AAD44078D42B7BC25BDC8C1A2ABD6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 Calendar year 2018.
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB6C055158C904BA18BBB9379C3ED60D4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 Calendar year 2019.
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA3FA915AFDB548A2BFB890EE435015A8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 The prior full calendar year prior to fiscal year 2024.
                              
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               713.
               PFC TURNBACK REDUCTION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7EFBADE98BC34F71B3F65205747E7BA4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 47114(f) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBFAF3C58FD5C47859959D035B73730BA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in paragraph (1)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB9811E6AF33C4A31B787CB185CE60F67"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">sponsor of an airport having at least .25 percent of the total number of boardings each year in the United States and and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">sponsor of a medium or large hub airport; 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9D6CF87D1C0A4DD5B3331AD375629831"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        in subparagraph (A) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">50 percent and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">40 percent each place it appears; and 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8FE9BDD7DD7649EFA01404FBDE9565BA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        in subparagraph (B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">75 percent and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">60 percent each place it appears; and 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB59176D0AF20485BAD7AA5D9F6C5E273"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     by striking paragraphs (2) and (3) and inserting the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H144FBAE66091430BA9E1B2EBF118DECD"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7C27AF9BD5CE4E20B1A9DAA14C239043"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Effective date of reduction
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0DCC3AD2ED4B493FA6F3B3B5CD6343F7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              New charge collection
                              A reduction in an apportionment under paragraph (1) shall not take effect until the first fiscal year following the year in which the collection of the charge imposed under section 40117 has begun.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6196759C5EB74D41B2A6A5755EDCD2CE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              New categorization
                              A reduction in an apportionment under paragraph (1) shall only be applied to an airport if such airport has been designated as a medium or large hub airport for 3 consecutive years.
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB17093DA8581488DB30BF773205DD454"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Applicability
                  For an airport that increased in categorization from a small hub to a medium hub in any fiscal year beginning after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254) and prior to the date of enactment of this Act, the amendment to section 47114(f)(2) of title 49, United States Code, under subsection (a) shall be applied as though the airport increased in categorization from a small hub to a medium hub in the calendar year prior to the first fiscal year in which such amendment is applicable.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H6BCF69F383164A7D8E8EE77F8770DCF4"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               714.
               AIRPORT SAFETY AND RESILIENT INFRASTRUCTURE DISCRETIONARY PROGRAM
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H709B82B4ABEC46CAB036425FF9BFB6AD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 47115(j) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9EC2429F4817427EA4AB21D2A4424E29"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in the heading by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           Supplemental Discretionary Funds
                         and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           Airport Safety and Resilient Infrastructure Discretionary Program
                        ;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H17EE08EE058042F89D07DF4B3423B8E0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in paragraph (3) by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HECEB27F1091346B6AFB94E706AA0739D"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCC305EDBA2C14FB98271B73E8B25ECF5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (B)
                           Minimum allocation
                           Not less than 50 percent of the amounts available under this subsection shall be used to provide grants at nonprimary, nonhub, and small hub airports.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H83E64156CF9C44E38E0F9EFF84EB97E3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (C)
                           Prioritization
                           In making grants for projects eligible under subparagraph (D)(iii), the Secretary shall prioritize grants to large and medium hub airports.
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H922BE3CDD64440B49AE75C475EF37EB5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           Eligibilities
                           In making grants under this subsection, the Secretary shall provide grants to airports for projects that—
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCBD01B4CAD6C4F54B302075C46FD845F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (i)
                              meet the definition of <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">airport development under section 47102(3)(T);
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8E44C2D083D5453BB446595AB6086FED"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (ii)
                              would otherwise increase the resilience of airport infrastructure against changing flooding or inundation patterns; or
                           
                           <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H99EF565B333D4341A34920A48A2BB709"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (iii)
                              reduce runway incursions or increase runway or taxiway safety.
                           
                        
                        ;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAEA5C1A1F10C4C1C8C1FF5E959633414"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     in paragraph (4)(A) by striking clauses (i) through (vi) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HF2AF71DA9E2040E1A0ACEBC231A81DE4"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H022970FF1EB04C1EBC68A96D9EC71C06"

                              id="H149DA87AF5BE497E8C45A205365F686A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     in paragraph (4)(B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">2 fiscal years and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">3 fiscal years.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HEBDB8FE3E3234D89A0F22F7EEE3618F8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Briefing
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9558047CEF9442FD8AC6E20B7D966A2B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 6 months after the Secretary first awards a grant for fiscal year 2025 under section 47115(j) of title 49, United States Code, and annually thereafter through 2028, the Secretary shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the grant program established under such section.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC9327F00663B4DB2A34AF3B62C4D4CBB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Contents
                     In briefing the appropriate committees of Congress under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall include—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF1C8B19BAFD845C884610B744B02F94F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        a description of each project funded under the grant program established under section 47115(j), including the vulnerabilities such program addresses;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5AC4663168B34EC0913474475EFB0B27"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        a description of projects completed that received funding under such program, including the total time between award and project completion;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7A7EEE8A90AE4DD5A05A23A5BB2E3410"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        a description of the consultation with other agencies that the Secretary has undertaken in carrying out such program;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF0E94CA00CF1496792476590F19DEBA9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        recommendations to improve the administration of such program, including additional consultation with other agencies and whether additional appropriation levels are appropriate; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD1832CD5A25149B6B4E70B0FA3951A59"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        other items determined appropriate by the Secretary.

                      id="H09F621E06C4D4FCA8E5C9F0F9F834C87"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               715.
               SPECIAL CARRYOVER ASSUMPTION RULE
               Section 47115 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H924DF4C5E13E4C11A0ED61117DAEE87F"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HF104CB686492459C9C41733ECD916BB4"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (l)
                     Special carryover assumption rule
                     Notwithstanding any other provision of law, in addition to amounts made available under paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (a), the Secretary may add to the discretionary fund an amount equal to one-third of the apportionment funds made available under section 47114 that were not required during the previous fiscal year pursuant to section 47117(b)(1) out of the anticipated amount of apportionment funds made available under section 47114 that will not be required during the current fiscal year pursuant to section 47117(b)(1).
                  
                  .
