            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H04B1AE372FC9489687855FBB46720547"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               719.
               PROTECTING GENERAL AVIATION AIRPORTS FROM CLOSURE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3AF0C8B137F641EFA56165E47E1241ED"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Non-surplus property
                  Section 47125 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HFCF26C6724364B2ABA9F9DC56C190E25"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H1ADAA191063248D9A3A985070493AA3D"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        Waiving restrictions
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6F02F6E8F7484569A2ABB472E504BAEE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           Subject to paragraph (2), the Secretary may grant to an airport, city, or county a waiver of any of the terms, conditions, reservations, or restrictions contained in a deed under which the United States conveyed to the airport, city, or county an interest in real property for airport purposes pursuant to section 16 of the Federal Airport Act (60 Stat. 179), section 23 of the Airport and Airway Development Act of 1970 (84 Stat. 232), or this section.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5043185E6C7947D58C14CD41D55E824F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Conditions
                           Any waiver granted by the Secretary pursuant to paragraph (1) shall be subject to the following conditions:
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HDE3A1C2057584278B99FD7FF822F216A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              The applicable airport, city, county, or other political subdivision shall agree that in conveying any interest in the real property which the United States conveyed to the airport, city, or county, the airport, city, or county will receive consideration for such interest that is equal to its current fair market value. 
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAF158F3711BE449096D3AD761D8C6B69"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Any consideration received by the airport, city, or county under subparagraph (A) shall be used exclusively for the development, improvement, operation, or maintenance of a public airport by the airport, city, or county.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H63873B5E81524D63A755FC88F3250553"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              Such waiver—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA11D5E4E449B4FC5828095A1A74B2C6E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 will not significantly impair the aeronautical purpose of an airport;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2DE098E88F2149FABC4F70C9CD66E1B5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 will not result in the permanent closure of an airport (unless the Secretary determines that the waiver will directly facilitate the construction of a replacement airport); or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H41E1524BBAAD42D2B76979C082902832"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 is necessary to protect or advance the civil aviation interests of the United States.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H520D1F400CB843B9AE4988CEC3A29FF2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Any other conditions required by the Secretary.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4A09BBD666F44EB3AFF71038DA46C331"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Annual reporting
                           The Secretary shall include a list and description of each waiver granted pursuant to paragraph (1) in the plan required under section 47103. 
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD5FCBB24997E467E807EEB7CD5515335"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Surplus property
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE6169D22867E4C09982DAA5B0322F960"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Section 47151 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (d) and inserting the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HA808BA3F17B2424890AB148C792E2C5C"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HC7487D099B7C4A8EAE5E54EC49CFCE6A"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Waiver of condition
                           The Secretary may not waive any condition imposed on an interest in surplus property conveyed under subsection (a) that such interest be used for an aeronautical purpose unless the Secretary provides public notice not less than 30 days before the issuance of such waiver and determines that such waiver—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H92A93653039D4034ABC2BE1490FF8D02"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              will not significantly impair the aeronautical purpose of an airport; 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBF4EFC4735304E9A8B9F6BD9979E4861"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              will not result in the permanent closure of an airport (unless the Secretary determines that the waiver will directly facilitate the construction of a replacement airport); or 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H51289ABC6990482982AC92EA87207C30"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              is necessary to protect or advance the civil aviation interests of the United States.
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H637E1556838543838B75789F0247130B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Waiving and adding terms
                     Section 47153 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HB5D1C3A71A214648820DDD88BC2A2307"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H85F0FF38AB98481C810CB2BEC0537728"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Restrictions on waiver
                           Notwithstanding subsections (a) and (b), the Secretary may not waive any term under this section that an interest in land be used for an aeronautical purpose unless—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4E3A2E7B53D9487B8FE834E21D2A931C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              the Secretary provides public notice not less than 30 days before the issuance of a waiver; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H58B4EE38EDFC4045B3B93486C62ED473"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              the Secretary determines that such waiver—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H1ACAF87948354C588F4FC588D24148E2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 will not significantly impair the aeronautical purpose of an airport;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB2FBB4B121794698A290A4A4792ADBA0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 will not result in the permanent closure of an airport (unless the Secretary determines that the waiver will directly facilitate the construction of a replacement airport); or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H620E2B56309548F3B0223C7F85C691DC"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 is necessary to protect or advance the civil aviation interests of the United States.
                              
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDB60A9C4A08A45E98E905CA58AAAF91C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Repeals
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBF1601BF5B5841B996C52BDF103243AD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Airports near closed or realigned bases
                     Section 1203 of the Federal Aviation Reauthorization Act of 1996 (49 U.S.C. 47101 note), and the item relating to such section in the table of contents under section 1(b) of such Act, are repealed.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H58B747D1187C42B1B81FFF8EDEC39D54"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Release from restrictions
                     Section 817 of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 47125 note), and the item relating to such section in the table of contents under section 1(b) of such Act, are repealed.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HDCD7EB9FB5614D0687418ACDF4421E35"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               720.
               STATE BLOCK GRANT PROGRAM
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H35AD23B2F8884DFA9757ACB35488F6FD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Training
                  Section 47128 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HE5378583A523448DB1FAE1F2A18DF7D2"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H5F6DEB3283074FB1A14D7DBB38D75D73"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (e)
                        Training for participating States
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H34AC9F74E32A498FB81CA880DF165195"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           The Secretary shall provide to each State participating in the block grant program under this section training or updated training materials for the administrative responsibilities assumed by the State under such program at no cost to the State. 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H32319DD1EFE146EB89CAB3B96F5CFFA4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Timing
                           The training or updated training materials provided under paragraph (1) shall be provided at least once during each 2-year period and at any time there is a material change in the program.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4D61DEEABEE447598BC0F53120D7D706"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Administration
                  Section 47128 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HEF9BFE7D55A04BDFB23E9123F020BBC6"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H1253BB8D408945D1BF0D110913998AB0"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (f)
                        Roles and responsibilities of participating States
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF96C1314C3CA46B5829021699DF2CF35"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Airports
                           Unless a State participating in the block grant program under this section expressly agrees in a memorandum of agreement, the Secretary shall not require the State to manage functions and responsibilities for airport actions or projects that do not relate to such program. 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H07E08696F7F64665B9EF3119CD37E0FA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Program documentation
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFDFE6A3F73CC4088925A28FFAB6AB065"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              Any grant agreement providing funds to be administered under such program shall be consistent with the most recently executed memorandum of agreement between the State and the Federal Aviation Administration.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H43DD00E8A8274585B7CACF845F42490F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Parity
                              The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall provide parity to participating States and shall only require the same type of information and level of detail for any program agreements and documentation that the Administrator would perform with respect to such action if the State did not participate in the program.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE1B643A5C9E944EB9E093C043FE27590"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Responsibilities
                           Unless the State expressly agrees to retain responsibility, the Administrator shall retain responsibility for the following:
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9A388379E7664780927A0CAFF4313942"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Grant compliance investigations, determinations, and enforcement.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA1158D0CAE28424CB09E011D243DB039"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Obstruction evaluation and airport airspace analysis, determinations, and enforcement off airport property.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB30C8A1FA3AD413F95AD42FCD0ED4092"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              Non-rulemaking analysis, determinations, and enforcement for proposed improvements on airport properties not associated with this subchapter, or off airport property.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEFA171E4272E4F53BFBE3C9944EC0F50"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Land use determinations, compatibility planning, and airport layout plan review and approval (consistent with section 47107(x)) for projects not funded by amounts available under this subchapter.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H441893A4DC604517B958A530B312B1F2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              Nonaeronautical and special event recommendations and approvals.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H97EEB2977A604BF1B97F2B1C9F03A57A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              Instrument approach procedure evaluations and determinations.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB4114512CEF748ED92E173606D08A8D8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (G)
                              Environmental review for projects not funded by amounts available under this subchapter.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB0E74F544FF74166AD6C2EE126F0C5CE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (H)
                              Review and approval of land leases, land releases, changes in on-airport land-use designation, and through-the-fence agreements.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7C3A7FEFFC0B43DC95D55E5F96A2C357"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  IIJA State block grant program administrative funding
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA5007E535BAE4EFF8507B22106437332"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall distribute administrative funding to assist States participating in the State block grant program under section 47128 of title 49, United States Code, with program implementation of airport infrastructure projects under the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9B8D8CCF78434CDDB300363F8F3C7628"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Funding source
                     In distributing administrative funds to States under this subsection, the Secretary shall distribute such funds from the funds made available in the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58) for personnel, contracting, and other costs to administer and oversee grants of the Airport Infrastructure Grants, Contract Tower Competitive Grant Program, and Airport Terminal Program.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB667B04EBA2A45C181C5850731FAC4C7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Administrative funds
                     With respect to administrative funds made available for fiscal years 2022 through 2026—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1B0326A8A4DD482784D1A4D39BB943CE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the amount of administrative funds available for distribution under paragraph (2) shall be an amount equal to a percentage determined by the Secretary, but not less than 2 percent, of the annual allocations provided under the heading <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">AIRPORT INFRASTRUCTURE GRANTS under the heading <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">FEDERAL AVIATION ADMINISTRATION in title VIII of division J of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58) to non-primary airports participating in the State’s block grant program each fiscal year of the Airport Infrastructure Grant program;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2F762F7C8DE043C6A7223D51DF355D2E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        administrative funds distributed under paragraph (2) shall be used by such States to—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE3B846C5C87B42A4BDDA119FAFBD2743"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           administer and oversee, as outlined in a memorandum of agreement or other agreement between the FAA and the State, all airport grant program funds provided under the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58) to non-primary airports participating in the State’s block grant program, whether through direct allocation or through competitive selection; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H36FB989C41ED4F18BDC27C9427881573"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           carry out the public purposes of supporting eligible and justified airport development and infrastructure projects as provided in the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58); and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA4BD3FBFA7B24D53A502F031E6331F43"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        except as provided in paragraph (4), such administrative funds shall be distributed to such States through a cooperative agreement executed between the State and the FAA not later than December 1 of each fiscal year in which the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58) provides airport grant program funds.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H41CF830EF17448EBB333BB34DE36BEA0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Initial distribution
                     With respect to administrative funds made available for fiscal years 2022 through 2024, funds available as of the date of enactment of this Act shall be distributed to States through a cooperative agreement executed between the State and the FAA not later than 30 days after such date of enactment.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9D87E4A35BAC44B8ADDD22C5CE4EB199"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Report
                  The Comptroller General shall issue to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the Office of Airports of the FAA and the airport improvement program under subchapter I of chapter 471 and chapter 475 of title 49, United States Code, and include in such report a description of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE33AB8850E5C4BDEAC511E20235AA723"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the responsibilities of States participating in the block grant program under section 47128 of title 49, United States Code; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA98E18A470EA4670B61B7FCD2091B54A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the impact of title VIII of division J of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (Public Law 117–58) and other Federal administrative funding sources on the ability of such States to disburse and administer airport improvement program funds.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HEDC0F839F1734043B8130C88EF78ED82"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               721.
               INNOVATIVE FINANCING TECHNIQUES
               Section 47135 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H51F6EBA806FC476DA63E00D0A45D6B51"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  by striking subsections (a) and (b) and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HB7AEBDD31A564C9381CB0FDEF299403D"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H96ED74BF95B245258636F188490F0C59"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        Authority
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2E252B0183E840DAB9D51EE904867272"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           The Secretary of Transportation may approve an application by an airport sponsor to use grants received under this subchapter for innovative financing techniques related to an airport development project that is located at an airport that is not a large hub airport.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD6BB2860A07F4C59B7FB89CB1E7A2D84"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Approval
                           The Secretary may approve not more than 30 applications described under paragraph (1) in a fiscal year.
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H628314A8CAE84FFAAEB2D09FCCBB1049"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Purposes
                        The purpose of grants made under this section shall be to—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H333C107FA7624430BB9ECCEDF4EABFFB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           provide information on the benefits and difficulties of using innovative financing techniques for airport development projects;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFF1DF4024F7D4B048AE82093E3EC5137"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           lower the total cost of an airport development project; or
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1B11915D08E54BA5986D4F3DEE51B2F9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           expedite the delivery or completion of an airport development project without reducing safety or causing environmental harm.
                        
                     
                     ; and
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H50AAB661D68E4B9E9AA1026319E0E792"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  in subsection (c)(2)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4040B6761A5C445FBD8540CAAE215CA5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     in subparagraph (C) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and at the end;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0779CCB2B53A4925AF151F505B4B547F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     in subparagraph (D) by striking the period at the end and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">; and; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H024CBD2F8ABB453387FF314103C2D2FC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H66806D28880B4E77AED640470CABC3C1"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCF10B77A21F546CBBD3F66153B59BDA6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (E)
                           any other techniques that the Secretary determines are consistent with the purposes of this section.
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H52A10FA4E7D6405CA840F7D6724AF94B"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">

               Section 47136(c) of title 49, United States Code is amended—

                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">applicants that will and inserting the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HBB876190E31B4615B65C14E271A2AB53"
                                 style="OLC">
                     applicants that—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD470DD2172AE4577BA516857BF2E5EDC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        will
                     
                     ; 
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD7B20D9A9BCB488DA61975AE4D7793F3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">

                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">; and; and
