            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H5ED54078080E44A09DDE3093472398E1"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               723.
               ALTERNATIVE PROJECT DELIVERY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD02EF2FC91214247BCE99EB8EC3B4F22"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 47142 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H58B8B5EB85074E2588D5F9D71E82FC03"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in the section heading by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           Design-build contracting
                         and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           Alternative project delivery
                        ; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0422DEAAF167429C9A47A0CDE94647D5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in subsection (a)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA9798EF7F6474E439BF2D18A558EED50"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in the matter preceding paragraph (1)—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H592A6E805F4B4A36B5426FC4EFA456FC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Secretary of Transportation; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6BB34B20F1EB4A32966A0824E9573A3E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">award a design-build and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">award a covered project delivery;
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H533DF18C47CA472094E2E216A2A29FF5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        in paragraph (2) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">design-build and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">covered project delivery; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H12B51A3E7B6946DA92AC05C1361A5512"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        in paragraph (4) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">design-build contract will and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">covered project delivery contract is projected to; and 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0FC6A7A36B904E2899FA3FFD3AEFFB3A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H2FD4831C10594A4BB78631A87795A1DA"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H6C008A7F092F4ECF824916F2EA5E4005"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Pilot program
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB1C1EE12A5554AED9978330120875473"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Pilot program
                              Not later than 270 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary shall establish a pilot program under which the Administrator may award grants for integrated project delivery contracts, as described in subsection (d)(2), to carry out up to 5 building construction projects at airports in the United States with a grant awarded under section 47104.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4AC9438DDD7B411CAFC017A6DA46F858"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Application
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H62E1A06C935840B092BE656CA7B911CE"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 Eligibility
                                 A sponsor of an airport may submit to the Secretary an application, in such time and manner and containing such information as the Secretary may require, to carry out a building construction project under the pilot program that would otherwise be eligible for assistance under this chapter.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HFFFCBFC40B2A4746BF34723439FEBC11"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Approval
                                 The Secretary may approve the application of a sponsor of an airport submitted under paragraph (1) to authorize such sponsor to award an integrated project delivery contract using a selection process permitted under applicable State or local law if—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H78F698967C734B4192182DDB5DD3EF2E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    the Secretary approves the application using criteria established by the Secretary;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC9E4DB8601BB44D6A41BD72964E7F539"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    the integrated project delivery contract is in a form that is approved by the Secretary;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6B393E3A06F3470CB8950437E1F5FF9D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    the Secretary is satisfied that the contract will be executed pursuant to competitive procedures and contains a schematic design and any other material that the Secretary determines sufficient to approve the grant;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H463837958C4A4F2FB6AD96E1BBC98C86"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iv)
                                    the Secretary is satisfied that the use of an integrated project delivery contract will be cost effective and expedite the project;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H95A76320CE1348D88A19902D94403AE4"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (v)
                                    the Secretary is satisfied that there will be no conflict of interest; and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF9BAA0CD3F214709A591E8A5BAA59062"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (vi)
                                    the Secretary is satisfied that the contract selection process will be open, fair, and objective and that not less than 2 sets of proposals will be submitted for each team entity under the selection process.
                                 
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC5FA2765621A4936ACEE68A894A47A49"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Reimbursement of costs
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H0422B8F221F74C8E97155C5E3AC77115"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 In general
                                 The Secretary may reimburse a sponsor of an airport for any design or construction costs incurred before a grant is made pursuant to this section if—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8A852A76C91648A0979BAA0B3A41FF40"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    the project funding is approved by the Secretary in advance;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFC5D9B4C67A749C685938C3F9E4DF433"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    the project is carried out in accordance with all administrative and statutory requirements under this chapter; and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H880D05106CAA4474A46E8F6F0ED3F2B1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    the project is carried out under this chapter after a grant agreement has been executed.
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H754FFC1AFA8448FEA35B6B7EC16CB0DE"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Accounting
                                 Reimbursement of costs shall be based on transparent cost accounting or open book cost accounting.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HA4B90E67B70D453C8308D7ABEE50A14F"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Covered project delivery contract defined
                           In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">covered project delivery contract means—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD7FDFC310E374DB4BDB5B5D32974A6A6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              an agreement that provides for both design and construction of a project by a contractor through alternative project delivery methods, including construction manager-at-risk and progressive design build; or
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD3AC60B2CBFB4C0EA68602ABD247F7C0"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              a single contract for the delivery of a whole project that—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB699C35BE42F47558008DBF2488F922A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 includes, at a minimum, the sponsor, builder, and architect-engineer as parties that are subject to the terms of the contract;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5C2783A0323247E18CA8C8BEBF4342E1"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 aligns the interests of all the parties to the contract with respect to the project costs and project outcomes; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H0431ECB687484F4182995CD45F187656"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 includes processes to ensure transparency and collaboration among all parties to the contract relating to project costs and project outcomes.
                              
                           
                        
                        . 
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H209106B87D2E4A0E8AF3CF45975FAB19"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Briefing
                  Not later than 2 years after the Secretary establishes the pilot program under section 47142(c) of title 49, United States Code (as amended by subsection (a)), the Secretary shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on whether integrated project delivery or other covered project delivery contracts authorized under such section resulted in any project efficiencies.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H716CBF67C828450EACF50C0C9E92C297"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 471 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 47142 and inserting the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H4800896FE0F04111AD73D38790BF20ED"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        47142. Alternative project delivery. 
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H33D9DB3749BD4C39B56233BFDAB66A6E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               724.
               NONMOVEMENT AREA SURVEILLANCE SURFACE DISPLAY SYSTEMS PILOT PROGRAM
               Section 47143(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">May 11, 2024 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">October 1, 2028.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H47F29681E720481AA30888EEA13BAC0F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               725.
               AIRPORT ACCESSIBILITY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF900C27424C54C1DA6523061097E3E4F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Subchapter I of chapter 471 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HE0DEA0DCC4D24C849409D8BE8EE22111"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H100728497EA540698309792AEFA8DF17"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        47145.
                        PILOT PROGRAM FOR AIRPORT ACCESSIBILITY
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H413406CD4D3E4918896A0544E43B13CF"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In general
                           The Secretary of Transportation shall establish and carry out a pilot program to award grants to sponsors to carry out capital projects to upgrade the accessibility of commercial service airports for individuals with disabilities by increasing the number of commercial service airports, airport terminals, or airport facilities that meet or exceed the standards and regulations under the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12131 et seq.) and the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. 701 note).
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H50593FFDAB724A088F255C6EF1A25DE4"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Use of funds
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H08FE0C102CC34D0CBBC6C6F5C0FBBD10"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              Subject to paragraph (2), a sponsor shall use a grant awarded under this section—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA9F3ACCF061A4A68A3A594C4BD639A22"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 for a project to repair, improve, or relocate the infrastructure of an airport, airport terminal, or airport facility to increase accessibility for individuals with disabilities, or as part of a plan to increase accessibility for individuals with disabilities;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE4D2D917CF1745B993DB7E84E22CE978"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 to develop or modify a plan (as described in subsection (e)) for a project that increases accessibility for individuals with disabilities, including—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBB1207EBE00742818D2F7D0A2315A2B4"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    assessments of accessibility or assessments of planned modifications to an airport, airport terminal, or airport facility for passenger use, performed by the disability advisory committee of the recipient airport (if applicable), the protection and advocacy system for individuals with disabilities in the applicable State, a center for independent living, or a disability organization, including an advocacy or nonprofit organization that represents or provides services to individuals with disabilities; or
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HDD87C066DC0B47939244CD9A9EFAFE8A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    coordination by the disability advisory committee of the recipient airport with a protection and advocacy system, center for independent living, or such disability organization; or
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HDF57C5A284E0499FBD31DA9B32BF0A22"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 to carry out any other project that meets or exceeds the standards and regulations described in subsection (a).
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H92E75BDBCD4542EDB1C128E86345A570"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Limitation
                              Eligible costs for a project funded with a grant awarded under this section shall be limited to the costs associated with carrying out the purpose authorized under subsection (a).
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H570CEF4AADDE4EFDAAABFA81B8B6C10E"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Eligibility
                           A sponsor may use a grant under this section to upgrade a commercial service airport that is accessible to and usable by individuals with disabilities—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3AFD5BDDBC214239ACCFC25B2BED377B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              consistent with the current (as of the date of the upgrade) standards and regulations described in subsection (a); and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H98EE3F78A17F44D391A22F21E90FB42E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              even if the related service, program, or activity, when viewed in the entirely of the service, program, or activity, is readily accessible and usable as so described.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H6D187B382BE8487EBDC75D5F2C991BCB"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Selection criteria
                           In making grants to sponsors under this section, the Secretary shall give priority to sponsors that are proposing—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2C43104044BF41139B1185F741EB7E64"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              a capital project to upgrade the accessibility of a commercial service airport that is not accessible to and usable by individuals with disabilities consistent with standards and regulations described in subsection (a); or
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HACC9568EB4F24EDDA075F4134207BF06"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              to meet or exceed the Airports Council International accreditation under the Accessibility Enhancement Accreditation, through the incorporation of universal design principles.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HD36CB6BEC29840DAB8C9EA457565BC5D"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Accessibility commitment
                           A sponsor that receives a grant under this section shall adopt a plan under which the sponsor commits to pursuing airport accessibility projects that—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA1C44F605FDA414CA412EFE5D07DE2AB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              enhance the passenger experience and maximize accessibility of commercial service airports, airport terminals, or airport facilities for individuals with disabilities, including by—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H18409102749743728BD8532CEFCDB2F2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 upgrading bathrooms, counters, or pumping rooms;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HFAB06CA55F404D96908410AC37ACE872"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 increasing audio and visual accessibility on information boards, security gates, or paging systems;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H50C391D08ADC475EB5AA6D2358200438"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 updating airport terminals to increase the availability of accessible seating and power outlets for durable medical equipment (such as powered wheelchairs); 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H645E6D4404234B9BB6F4066F7D1FCC07"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 updating airport websites and other information communication technology to be accessible for individuals with disabilities; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7BAFD4227476450EA8D2E7E3540B930F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 increasing the number of elevators, including elevators that move power wheelchairs to an aircraft;
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3DDBF124F585454EAE02649C2CB9F37B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              improve the operations of, provide efficiencies of service to, and enhance the use of commercial service airports for individuals with disabilities;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H79AA0614AB454EE5AD01794F67A72C13"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              establish a disability advisory committee if the airport is a small, medium, or large hub airport; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE24E92F7AA9E4E479B06B41A62DEF7FA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              make improvements in personnel, infrastructure, and technology that can assist passenger self-identification regarding disability and needing assistance.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H7DCDC57DC00640D1902D9159DC8F5B93"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (f)
                           Coordination with disability advocacy entities
                           In administering grants under this section, the Secretary shall encourage—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H22AABAE31A8340CA87BF439D2208F16E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              engagement with disability advocacy entities (such as the disability advisory committee of the sponsor) and a protection and advocacy system for individuals with disabilities in the applicable State, a center for independent living, or a disability organization, including an advocacy or nonprofit organization that represents or provides services to individuals with disabilities; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HADCA7A9DFD4E46EB8296556CAC5F4F91"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              assessments of accessibility or assessments of planned modifications to commercial service airports to the extent merited by the scope of the capital project of the sponsor proposed to be assisted under this section, taking into account any such assessment already conducted by the Federal Aviation Administration.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H243B82942D244D59BF1C64661BDCC454"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (g)
                           Federal share of costs
                           The Government’s share of allowable project costs for a project carried out with a grant under this section shall be the Government’s share of allowable project costs specified under section 47109. 
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H1984CE7AF1AD43D58DB5BF5D50699D8C"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (h)
                           Definitions
                           In this section:
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF86AD77ED734477190D047CD3701639E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Center for independent living
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">center for independent living has the meaning given such term in section 702 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. 796a).
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7052194C1F1C4129A8E5790E04677DFC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Disability advisory committee
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">disability advisory committee means a body of stakeholders (including airport staff, airline representatives, and individuals with disabilities) that provide to airports and appropriate transportation authorities input from individuals with disabilities, including identifying opportunities for removing barriers, expanding accessibility features, and improving accessibility for individuals with disabilities at airports.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6CADB8EAFE2D49E18738EF5153CDC72A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Protection and advocacy system
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">protection and advocacy system means a system established in accordance with section 143 of the Developmental Disabilities Assistance and Bill of Rights Act of 2000 (42 U.S.C. 15043).
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HF9639382702E457DA850055358C7DEC8"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           Funding
                           Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028, the Secretary may use up to $20,000,000 of the amounts that would otherwise be used to make grants from the discretionary fund under section 47115 for each such fiscal year to carry out this section.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBF53554861D7413FB657351069BB969C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Conforming amendment
                  The analysis for subchapter I of chapter 471 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 47144 the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HE7008BDD8D7A44CEBF349D11D7348C4B"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        47145. Pilot program for airport accessibility.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA6E6F52424DA44E5A89ABB4C8ACE0903"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               726.
               GENERAL AVIATION AIRPORT RUNWAY EXTENSION PILOT PROGRAM
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD7C3A29BEBA3458E93AEEFE7B5C41ECE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Subchapter I of chapter 471 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HF1591599454A40388CF8AB31E1BB7A8E"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H831B5FBC9C744CEFA06C0B4395ECB4AD"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        47146.
                        GENERAL AVIATION PROGRAM RUNWAY EXTENSION PILOT PROGRAM
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HD6F8343FEC1A409BBFAF162D12A6C198"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           Establishment
                           The Secretary of Transportation shall establish and carry out a pilot program to provide grants to general aviation airports to increase the usable runway length capability at such airports in order to—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF11403F92A5849DF991DBE0D1721327F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              expand access to such airports for larger aircraft; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H160FCEDA922246F98D52AF4AC860783E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              support the development and economic viability of such airports.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H716F0F2D39254B799DA9C3EB65F2009D"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Grants
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5FB2FF5A792F4AB2B548397ECA80144F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              For the purpose of carrying out the pilot program established in subsection (a), the Secretary shall make grants to not more than 2 sponsors of general aviation airports per fiscal year.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HEFD2B8E5F1A746068CE1FA9A1B5DDAB4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Use of funds
                              A sponsor of a general aviation airport shall use a grant awarded under this section to plan, design, or construct a project to extend an existing primary runway by not greater than 1,000 feet in order to accommodate large turboprop or turbojet aircraft that cannot be accommodated with the existing runway length.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6B233291397342209A9F9E3722B7C97C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Eligibility
                              To be eligible to receive a grant under this section, a sponsor of a general aviation airport shall submit an application to the Secretary at such time, in such form, and containing such information as the Secretary may require.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA8BFB8D8A48D47BD80373EFFA1ECDD34"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Selection
                              In selecting an applicant for a grant under this section, the Secretary shall prioritize projects that demonstrate that the existing runway length at the airport is—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HABA2EAFA239242CA91BD8628A43EF027"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 inadequate to support the near-term operations of 1 or more business entities operating at the airport as of the date of submission of such application;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA0778FEA3F074CF09F96205F0E8D5341"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 a direct aircraft operational impediment to airport economic viability, job creation or retention, or local economic development; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H771155D518D24797812B9DAEF9FE239B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 not located within 20 miles of another National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems airport with comparable runway length.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HE0CD1AEDF939464AA6C6406EFAE40316"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Project justification
                           A project that demonstrates the criteria described in subsection (b) shall be considered a justified cost with respect to the pilot program, notwithstanding—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3EF4E84A6A3F451E8688C2E30D4EE935"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              any benefit-cost analysis required under section 47115(d); or
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H780A49D163764ABE84626A02684ABB2E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              a project justification determination described in section 3 of chapter 3 of FAA Order 5100.38D, Airport Improvement Program Handbook (dated September 30, 2014) (or any successor document).
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H853982DF20CC45DC834030FEA02FDFDE"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Federal share
                           The Government's share of allowable project costs for a project carried out with a grant under this section shall be the Government's share of allowable project costs specified under section 47109.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HA1B1D0DAC137481984351489B76751C6"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Report to Congress
                           Not later than 5 years after the establishment of the pilot program under subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report that evaluates the pilot program, including—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H382FF003F7D242249C93F2F4EFF9414C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              information regarding the level of applicant interest in grants for increasing runway length;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3D5C514A231E47EA8AB277F763FB6B87"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              the number of large aircraft that accessed each general aviation airport that received a grant under the pilot program in comparison to the number of such aircraft that accessed the airport prior to the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, based on data provided to the Secretary by the airport sponsor not later than 6 months before the submission date described in this subsection; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8732914C469D4381B7E8F014EED32141"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              a description, provided to the Secretary by the airport sponsor not later than 6 months before the submission date described in this subsection, of the economic development opportunities supported by increasing the runway length at general aviation airports.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H5A20931D80894C5EAB6D1316CC2CBE55"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (f)
                           Funding
                           For each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028, the Secretary may use funds under section 47116(b)(2) to carry out this section.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD4EB850C9A2346B08B9E3149D5AB6B39"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for subchapter I of chapter 471 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by inserting after the item relating to section 47145 the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H2A130358D9AB432EAC8D54F798CD2B2D"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        47146. General aviation airport runway extension pilot program.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC213DBA25F3F4236A8B1DB6E39F95D1A"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               727.
               REPEAL OF OBSOLETE CRIMINAL PROVISIONS
               Section 47306 of title 49, United States Code, and the item relating to such section in the analysis for chapter 473 of such title, are repealed.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HAAC91C26191E44F4B681DE69DC710A4F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"

               728.

                              id="H75C462BB65F244539F75026AD9BC0D3A"

                     in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"

                              id="H74E212A8FA3543F7BCA149A30A300DB2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in paragraph (3)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H03E61549C00840E4AAE04B398A6E1698"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in subparagraph (B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">or at the end;

                                       style="OLC">

                                          qb-display-quote="yes">

                              id="H40611A1499314344A7ECC7325A542429"

                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
