                        Determination of need
                        With respect to the amount of firefighting foam concentrate required for foam production commensurate with applicable aircraft rescue and firefighting equipment required in accordance with the most recent FAA-approved Airport Certification Manual, the Secretary shall determine—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB48763EBFABD41E38CB545C41C6BD213"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           for each eligible airport, the total amount of such concentrate required for all of the federally required aircraft rescue and firefighting vehicles that meet index requirements under part 139, in gallons; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H346D7BC24F5042C290B04D1E533886AC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           for all eligible airports, the total amount of firefighting foam concentrate, in gallons.
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC6085993B58D46C49E847F5892A244E5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Determination of grant amounts
                        The Secretary shall make a grant to the sponsor of each eligible airport in an amount equal to the product of—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDBA477BAB11646ABAF4F78044C231C09"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           the amount of funds made available to carry out this section that remain available after the Secretary reserves the amount described in paragraph (1); and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBCB3D91FEEBC4C3EBB7D8128325E5F58"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           the ratio of the amount determined under subparagraph (A)(i) for such eligible airport to the amount determined under subparagraph (A)(ii).
                        
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1958E06C50F345AB9BA0B28046246E20"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Program requirements
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4FFB6A566309446CB2C88F8619AB980B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Secretary shall determine the eligibility of costs payable under the PFAS replacement program by taking into account all engineering, technical, and environmental protocols and generally accepted industry standards that are developed or established for approved fluorine-free firefighting foams.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF5910B6574D54F489BE8DC29E18B5FF2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Compliance with applicable law
                     To be eligible for reimbursement under the program established under subsection (a), the sponsor of an eligible airport shall carry out all actions related to the acquisition, disposal, and transition to approved fluorine-free firefighting foams, including the cleaning and disposal of equipment, in full compliance with all applicable Federal laws in effect at the time of obligation of a grant under this section.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6D5E91F4AC3D41F5B3BEE6DBA2ECB8DD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Federal share
                     The Federal share of allowable costs under the PFAS replacement program shall be 100 percent. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC60A1EFB743C47D68FF3C37FCCA32152"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Authorization of appropriations
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H026C74D412364E238C804E6D8E5189B1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     There is authorized to be appropriated not more than $350,000,000 to carry out the PFAS replacement program.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0425B977C5D24AF1875A894381FEFD13"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Requirements
                     Amounts made available to carry out the PFAS replacement program shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H429B39EAD24641DAB53C6E8EF675D50F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        remain available for expenditure for a period of 5 fiscal years; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8B6C374960774FD8884F06D957FC0E38"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        be available in addition to any other funding available for similar purposes under any other Federal, State, local, or Tribal program.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6DEFF99B644844A899ED5E0AED1DC1A5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7E349887D9CB4F659D23402EC2899BFC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Eligible airport
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">eligible airport means an airport holding an Airport Operating Certificate issued under part 139.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9C8EB8D236944B409621EEBEA1F631EA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Part 139
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">part 139 means part 139 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H49BB88E203EC42D7A56D4F5534B5B286"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     PFAS replacement program
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">PFAS replacement program means the program established under subsection (a).
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4D0A3CDD98304FA385214764D8E36660"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               768.
               LIMITATION ON CERTAIN ROLLING STOCK PROCUREMENTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1DA57DDDCE384814B3372155FCB8A935"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 50101 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF267762EC13E40FFBB07D7BBA2107366"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">(except section 47127) each place it appears; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE2C487D87ACB4454B7786AFB7E61CBC9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HC337898E6C1A4555A59FC5BCB657B0C4"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H6AB1848BCB5B4079BCE5255BAD38A49B"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Limitation on certain rolling stock procurements
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8DA88B224F19401A8AC54409C0791B6D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              Financial assistance made available under the provisions described in subsection (a) shall not be used in awarding a contract or subcontract to an entity on or after the date of enactment of this subsection for the procurement of rolling stock for use in an airport-related project if the manufacturer of the rolling stock—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H4325965805B846F4822A5304C1D54B3C"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 is incorporated in or has manufacturing facilities in the United States; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HC9BB5575AC684F52BD12C80F345684F4"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 is owned or controlled by, is a subsidiary of, or is otherwise related legally or financially to a corporation based in a country that—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7AC63EA15F9E4FE5B08A6F3B26FE0199"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    is identified as a nonmarket economy country (as defined in section 771(18) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1677(18))) as of the date of enactment of this subsection;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF322FDC8A08D4A2AA1A9E71E09EADB06"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    was identified by the United States Trade Representative in the most recent report required by section 182 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2242) as a foreign country included on the priority watch list defined in subsection (g)(3) of that section; and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0A160A9C4FED46E2A198361B74ADFAAE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    is subject to monitoring by the Trade Representative under section 306 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2416).
                                 
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9AD8DCDB481841CF871ABC1DC56E9A29"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Exception
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H377A6324AD4D4232B9F52D52BD754281"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 In general
                                 For purposes of paragraph (1), the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">otherwise related legally or financially does not include—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6A423A2AE8F04C9D981FB87A6E94C106"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    a minority relationship or investment; or
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5DFEBB4189204645B9711A024822FF07"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    relationship with or investment in a subsidiary, joint venture, or other entity based in a country described in paragraph (1)(B) that does not export rolling stock or components of rolling stock for use in the United States.
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3A436D2FA9A5421F912A30FC23F4B3F7"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Corporation based in people’s republic of china
                                 Notwithstanding subparagraph (A)(i), for purposes of paragraph (1), the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                            quote-display-start="auto"
                                            quote-type="text">otherwise related legally or financially includes a minority relationship or investment if the relationship or investment involves a corporation based in the People’s Republic of China.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD94B0E35E19240AAA4B61C44231FB949"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              International agreements
                              This subsection shall be applied in a manner consistent with the obligations of the United States under international agreements.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H68CF725E43834EB2A2DA396AF6EC3B6E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Waiver
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H77E265B75BCD4428A68900C995A019B4"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 In general
                                 The Secretary may waive the limitation described in paragraph (1) using the criteria described in subsection (b).
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HD79A2DCCFB9B4664A49AB68857AF586F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Notification
                                 Not later than 10 days after issuing a waiver under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall notify the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate.
                              
                           
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8722921E5D2D43ADBC1FCC54B93E237E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Conforming amendments
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFC41368533DC40EBBCA616D03F28C5B8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Restricting contract awards because of discrimination against United States goods or services
                     Section 50102 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">(except section 47127).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4EEDF5857D424C1CA5CCCF2285215DB2"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               769.
               MAINTAINING SAFE FIRE AND RESCUE STAFFING LEVELS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H47141DBF5D79468EA7C5189D509D1CC9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Update to regulation
                  The Administrator shall update the regulations contained in section 139.319 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, to ensure that paragraph (4) of such section provides that at least 1 individual maintains certification at the emergency medical technician basic level, or higher, at a small, medium, or large hub airport.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCD5D1832AE3D4D218DDB5521E13A47CF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Staffing review
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall conduct a review of airport environments and related regulations to evaluate sufficient staffing levels necessary for firefighting, rescue, and emergency medical services and response at airports certified under part 139 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4D387EF0DE2146CF8C85574FAC2316E9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report
                  Not later than 1 year after completing the review under subsection (b), the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report containing the results of the review.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HDF2F7446560149408327EDE9BFC500F4"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               770.
               GRANT ASSURANCES
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD1792F9FEA4E441595A132BC6F49EA3A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  General written assurances
                  Section 47107(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9969A9EE8C3646408209F94BA20FA81B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in paragraph (20) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and at the end;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5F2D3E321CCB46B6A5CA9199A87F91B2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in paragraph (21) by striking the period at the end and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">; and; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H701BD58A1A3142B489ED89AA046EAED4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H48108481DA1F4B57B7B6E49446033481"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8D83FF71F1154B218AA86DA17B3A717E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (22)
                           the airport owner or operator may not restrict or prohibit the sale or self-fueling of any 100-octane low lead aviation gasoline for purchase or use by operators of general aviation aircraft if such aviation gasoline was available at such airport at any time during calendar year 2022, until the earlier of—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H60F5C95D80FF4054ABB6917EF1EDC14B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              December 31, 2030; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H65D79DD1590D4E49AEB6B78ECD94C3FD"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">

                              the date on which the airport or any retail fuel seller at such airport makes available an unleaded aviation gasoline that—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H921F149AEDD3425CB28979A595E0A7A6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 has been authorized for use by the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration as a replacement for 100-octane low lead aviation gasoline for use in nearly all piston-engine aircraft and engine models; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8BAF9B4D6AEB4CAF86A702EFA861074F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 meets either an industry consensus standard or other standard that facilitates the safe use, production, and distribution of such unleaded aviation gasoline, as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                              
                           
                        
                        .

                            id="H5EFCF5E8ED144F438271485EDC7CF6C3"

                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"

                           Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the maximum civil penalty for a violation of section 47107(a)(22) (including any assurance made under such section) committed by a person, including if the person is an individual or a small business concern, shall be $5,000 for each day that the person is in violation of that section.

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H429D20F2769D46E29A0EFBFF40ACF08E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               771.
               AVIATION FUEL IN ALASKA
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1A4B422D88AB4D45B16F030BEF9564BB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBAE36B812D904A3BAEE54A3349BB16D3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Prohibition on restriction of fuel usage or availability
                     The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration and the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency shall not restrict the continued use or availability of 100-octane low lead aviation gasoline in the State of Alaska until the earlier of—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4982D75DFA7E42A0B2321BABA304C9D0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        December 31, 2032; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3F4999AE41984F6498302DCCA1C26B16"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        6 months after the date on which the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration finds that an unleaded aviation fuel is widely commercially available at airports throughout the State of Alaska that—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0410D29EE7044E9088E31C9055FB0F86"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           has been authorized for use by the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration as a replacement for 100-octane low lead aviation gasoline; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H81115345FB4141E3BBD4D0621799E3AF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           meets either an industry consensus standard or other standard that facilitates and ensures the safe use, production, and distribution of such unleaded aviation fuel.
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB79CF5C354E74E3D85B817E6D897F5E5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Savings clause
                     Nothing in this section shall limit the authority of the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration or the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to address the endangerment to public health and welfare posed by lead emissions—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H906F213E77274AA0A971CE534E4E1B86"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in the United States outside of the State of Alaska; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H86665D19FB904ABDA587FBA8547BE870"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        within the State of Alaska after the date specified in paragraph (1).
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H797F5F46C0E7462E8B2E6EF8A9D36665"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  GAO report on transitioning to unleaded aviation fuel in the State of Alaska
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H268A98ED8EEF4F6D85629820F332E921"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Evaluation
                     The Comptroller General of the United States shall conduct an evaluation of the following:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFB2AFEB10C5C432B93FC3FD012888DF7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        The aircraft, routes, and supply chains in the State of Alaska utilizing leaded aviation gasoline, including identification of remote and rural communities that rely upon leaded aviation gasoline.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF3995425B7A0429A8A475D47324B1A20"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        The estimated costs and benefits of transitioning aircraft and the supply chain in the State of Alaska to aviation fuel that meets the requirements described in clauses (i) and (ii) of section 47107(a)(22)(B) of title 49, United States Code, as added by section 770, including direct costs of new aircraft and equipment and indirect costs, including transportation from refineries to markets, foreign imports, and changes in leaded aviation gasoline prices as a result of reduced supply.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H770CC4EDA13C46BCA74B942536BB2A8C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        The programs of the Environmental Protection Agency, the Federal Aviation Administration, and other government agencies that can be utilized to assist individuals, communities, industries, and the State of Alaska with the costs described in subparagraph (B).
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H58F79A2E7A16416CB514C3F10F88B298"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        A reasonable time frame to permit any limitation on 100-octane low-lead aviation gasoline in the State of Alaska.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3757A507359A4162B33EAA6A10658ACC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        Other logistical considerations associated with the transition described in subparagraph (B).
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE67CFBEFC2F643B092B52D8EB8D7BC57"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Report
                     Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this section, the Comptroller General shall submit a report containing the results of the evaluation conducted under paragraph (1) to—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H46912F97237744CFB5A5026DC7B1321B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8934975FABE34D5C94D47390D47EDB32"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H09FFB65AF3BF4E6DB6EEE83315BABBDE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H54D6CAE341C9491C859F24186EC6D37E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives. 
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H3B041B495A5E46468863BE2FEE3E48C3"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               772.
               APPLICATION OF AMENDMENTS
               The amendments to the Airport Improvement Program apportionment and discretionary formulas under chapter 471 of title 49, United States Code, made by this Act (except as they relate to the extension of provisions or authorities expiring on May 10, 2024, or May 11, 2024) shall not apply in a fiscal year beginning before the date of enactment of this Act. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HF2F6604B22B2416BA4D871A0E1A2794A"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               773.
               PROHIBITION ON USE OF AMOUNTS TO PROCESS OR ADMINISTER ANY APPLICATION FOR THE JOINT USE OF HOMESTEAD AIR RESERVE BASE WITH CIVIL AVIATION
               No amounts appropriated or otherwise made available to the Federal Aviation Administration for fiscal years 2024 through 2028 may be used to process or administer any application for the joint use of Homestead Air Reserve Base, Homestead, Florida, by the Air Force and civil aircraft. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA39E6B58313041ECB7F38C9BA2474F68"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               774.
               UNIVERSAL CHANGING STATION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H127E141567B440099E37765DF8123F6E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Grant assurances
                  Section 47107 of title 49, United States Code, as amended by section 743(b)(2), is further amended by adding at the end the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H759EEE2397C54CFC82880023CF8C9236"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H72BAD63FC3ED4B23AF70CBBD81FD6DB6"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (y)
                        Universal changing station
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB9458392792A4FB981944C60A5C70C4C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           In fiscal year 2030 and each fiscal year thereafter, the Secretary of Transportation may approve an application under this subchapter for an airport development project grant only if the Secretary receives written assurances that the airport owner or operator will install or maintain (in compliance with the requirements of section 35.133 of title 28, Code of Federal Regulations), as applicable—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H13F0AA41B52F41869DF9035E555228DF"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              at least 1 private, single-use room with a universal changing station that—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBF242F7C99594DD2954135A7F1D1505B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 meets the standards established under paragraph (2)(A); and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE625AAFD9F3143EF9495C2F2C7075E54"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 is accessible to all individuals for purposes of use by an individual with a disability in each passenger terminal building of the airport; and
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC58BB127DDC049DBA1D9150D1F26CAA0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              signage at or near the entrance to the changing station indicating the location of the changing station.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9993E51DBC4E422B8AECFE708D8C7C0E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Standards required
                           Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this subsection, the United States Access Board shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H56337B454C1A47A89ECC231613DC780D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              establish—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H06E89EC0F20D4893BECDAAAEC779F4B8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 comprehensive accessible design standards for universal changing tables; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF4CDAF86073144839E2B6E56B74A62B4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 standards on the privacy, accessibility, and sanitation equipment of the room in which such table is located, required to be installed, or maintained under this subsection; and
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8F7B5F380AE048C4A2C427FBC094374C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              in establishing the standards under subparagraph (A), consult with entities with appropriate expertise relating to the use of universal changing stations used by individuals with disabilities.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEF66AECD2790426C8498F624A8F46DE6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Applicability
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H890E43F0C926433EAF6C9F0EA446887B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Airport size
                              The requirement in paragraph (1) shall only apply to applications submitted by the airport sponsor of a medium or large hub airport.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEF86E58E4BC849F7AF89B111A8ECD768"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Special rule
                              The requirement in paragraph (1) shall not apply with respect to a project grant application for a period of time, determined by the Secretary, if the Secretary determines that construction or maintenance activities make it impracticable or unsafe for the universal changing station to be located in the sterile area of the building.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6C277BFA6BA84A5EB8F34A7D4E9F43B4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Exception
                           Upon application by an airport sponsor, the Secretary may determine that a universal changing station in existence before the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, complies with the requirements of paragraph (1) (including the standards established under paragraph (2)(A)), notwithstanding the absence of 1 or more of the standards or characteristics required under such paragraph. 
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H742742732AF248E5A01312DD38F0C688"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Definition
                           In this section:
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2255C7F8D98749EEA64BD3D20174360A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Disability
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">disability has the meaning given that term in section 3 of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12102). 
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H176B157546224FA8B56BD5E82A0272C6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Sterile area
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">sterile area has the same meaning given that term in section 1540.5 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC6E0061EE29A47DC97FF496F890CD174"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              Universal changing station
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">universal changing station means a universal or adult changing station that meets the standards established by the United States Access Board under paragraph (2)(A). 
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H9D213AFB3B7C4A68A02EEDDE5B4FBD4E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              United States Access Board
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">United States Access Board means the Architectural and Transportation Barriers Compliance Board established under section 502(a)(1) of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. 792(a)(1)).
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H290570A6C11C43B0AE671520BE5EDD24"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Terminal development costs
                  Section 47119(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H8F60BB1C38114FFE9AC2C3A689C3834B"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H81618D393A8745C98C1988D8367035AF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        Universal changing stations
                        In addition to the projects described in paragraph (1), the Secretary may approve a project for terminal development for the construction or installation of a universal changing station (as defined in section 47107(y)) at a commercial service airport.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA617A49A13D2432FA93ACB5E55A23685"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               774A.
               AIRPORT HUMAN TRAFFICKING PREVENTION GRANTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H57435AF6F0074678A8627F273BFED578"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Secretary shall establish a grant program to provide grants to airports described in subsection (b)(1) to address human trafficking awareness, education, and prevention efforts, including by—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H18A87C0615F34328A3523CA4EE12779E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     coordinating human trafficking prevention efforts across multimodal transportation operations within a community; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9FAA3276425F4AB2AC17F04C4AEE4886"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     accomplishing the best practices and recommendations provided by the Department of Transportation Advisory Committee on Human Trafficking. 
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H37BA4E64635B4152A5430333B23855A6"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Distribution
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA984DF5A530B45C0B3B1FFD7B4C54736"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Secretary shall distribute amounts made available for grants under this section to—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE51862B06E3E4B8DB2FBF2368D844514"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the 75 airports in the United States with the highest number of passenger enplanements annually, based on the most recent data available; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H68FE09CA074942D7881D88E3684CC4A9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        as the Secretary determines to be appropriate, an airport not described in subparagraph (A) that serves an area with a high prevalence of human trafficking, on application of the airport.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H146F1FEC6E724DCAA79C5A4D8230DB89"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Priority; considerations
                     In distributing amounts made available for grants under this section, the Secretary shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7EA682F7C0314CD69BBDC5D5E0A5CB1E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        give priority in grant amounts to airports referred to in paragraph (1) that serve regions with a higher prevalence of human trafficking; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H771C090561F04497872B20300C3A9B7C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        take into consideration the effect the amounts would have on surrounding areas. 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCB6EC1D81EE54770AA6C883680336C2D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Consultation
                     In distributing amounts made available for grants under this section, the Secretary shall consult with the Department of Transportation Advisory Committee on Human Trafficking in determining the amounts to be distributed to each grant recipient to ensure the best use of the funds.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H78F7DDFEE6614F56BEF5F32C0160A4FA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Authorization of appropriations
                  There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this section $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB2AD393FA081402F868D083C0E696EE7"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               774B.
               STUDY ON IMPROVEMENTS FOR CERTAIN NONHUB AIRPORTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF5D6E49EE1B04A0883DB5F2CB872E0C4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Comptroller General shall conduct a study on the challenges faced by nonhub airports not designated as essential air service communities and recommend ways to help secure and retain flight schedules using existing Federal programs, such as the Small Community Air Service Development program.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7A1A7FAE5D3A496C8147BF16E7074E8E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Report
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this section, the Comptroller General shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the results of the study conducted under subsection (a), including recommendations for such legislation and administrative action as the Comptroller General determines appropriate. 
               
            
         
         <subtitle id="H8E5D2530640D41C2B710A838F2B5092C"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            B
            Passenger Facility Charges
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HFF6EF80FA0724373810798D519FB48B1"

                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               775.
               ADDITIONAL PERMITTED USES OF PASSENGER FACILITY CHARGE REVENUE
               Section 40117(a)(3) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HDB970C98281F4E72A1C35C97B53367F6"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HABC87969ACD748CC86A0FF04CAF4F608"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (H)
                     A project at a small hub airport for a noise barrier where the day–night average sound level from commercial, general aviation, or cargo operations is expected to exceed 55 decibels as a result of new airport development.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9A455E4B5EAF4C98ABC76896AEC71DB0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (I)
                     A project for the replacement of existing workspace elements (including any associated in-kind facility or equipment within or immediately adjacent to a terminal development or renovation project at such airport) related to the relocation of a Federal agency on airport grounds due to such terminal development or renovation project for which development costs are eligible costs under this section.
                  
                  .

                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by striking paragraph (1) and inserting the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="HB8070C692D4943C7BDE067EB6CD9BF05"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE8A504F4D0A04D28BDAED1B91A4BE154"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H0AFD669D1E07420387D134FF03CD2158"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 Regulations
                                 The Secretary shall prescribe regulations to streamline the process for authorizing eligible agencies for airports to impose passenger facility charges.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H97B1EB97820A4945BDEF3D887A762F11"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Passenger facility charge
                                 An eligible agency may impose a passenger facility charge of $1, $2, $3, $4, or $4.50 in accordance with the provisions of this subsection instead of using the procedures otherwise provided in this section.
                              
                           
                           ;
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0C5DBD01295A41769914A44DC4677F71"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        by striking paragraph (4) and inserting the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H47BFC4B34561453EBF0B0924793B1778"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC3A4F0E5B5F64134992AF589DF29E28B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Acknowledgment of receipt and indication of objection
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HEFDD042DA93A45B5BC47760E492FDEC8"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 In general
                                 The Secretary shall acknowledge receipt of the notice and indicate any objection to the imposition of a passenger facility charge under this subsection for any project identified in the notice within 60 days after receipt of the eligible agency's notice.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H257C6FA517E9458390F84CD174C30626"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Prohibited objection
                                 The Secretary may not object to an eligible airport-related project that received Federal financial assistance for airport development, terminal development, airport planning, or for the purposes of noise compatibility, if the Federal financial assistance and passenger facility charge collection (including interest and other returns on the revenue) do not exceed the total cost of the project.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H31C7FC44B7B64C0B912603AE10AD55D5"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 Allowed objection
                                 The Secretary may only object to the imposition of a passenger facility charge under this subsection for a project that—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0D767A10FEC94D669BD540CF168D003F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    establishes significant policy precedent;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2B15DD8A072641948D715ED4BD628DC1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    raises significant legal issues;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE85AC817ACFC44D2AF8612F46DEA6D32"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    garners significant controversy, as evidenced by significant opposition to the proposed action by the applicant or other airport authorities, airport users, governmental agencies, elected officials, or communities;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7AA1409213C94C25A61CF87192B1CAF0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iv)
                                    raises significant revenue diversion, airport noise, or access issues, including compliance with section 47111(e) or subchapter II of chapter 475;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3E44A2C67F84425AA1A4D1D8C94FCFF8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (v)
                                    includes multimodal components; or
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H6BFFBAFB2BF14DE395870DB9DF272FE3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (vi)
                                    serves no aeronautical purpose.
                                 
                              
                           
                           ;
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H84210DD9D52A41689F377AC2031293E5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        by striking paragraph (6); and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6ECC4AA6E0834A05979FDAFC1DA980F5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        by redesignating paragraph (7) as paragraph (6).
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H86B1DD4097DA4EBF885CDDF1491201CC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Rulemaking
                  Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall initiate a rulemaking to implement the amendments made by subsection (a).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD28FD45BB2704E6084EA41A53A92BB8E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Interim guidance
                  The interim guidance established in the memorandum of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">PFC 73–20. Streamlined Procedures for Passenger Facility Charge (PFC) Authorizations at Small-, Medium-, and Large-Hub Airports, issued on January 22, 2020, including any modification to such guidance necessary to conform with the amendments made by subsection (a), shall remain in effect until the effective date of the final rule issued under subsection (b).

                  by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"

                        Aviation projects subject to a streamlined environmental review process
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H61691FDBD75B419CB04494ABE7743BB6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general

                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8A6416D7322C4698930A6F89A235BD21"

                                          qb-display-quote="yes">

                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                          qb-display-quote="yes">

                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H13C0A39D54D9499FA916C072F570AD29"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">

                                 In general
                                 The Secretary shall establish guidelines for the designation of an aviation safety project or aviation security project for priority environmental review.
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                             id="HB98612078EA24EF183A2EF1D6FB0429A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">

                                    the potential for undertaking the environmental review under existing emergency procedures under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.);
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HAB8E0E39D16F4E8ABF1DDE0B3F4AAB9B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">

                                    the need for cooperation and concurrent reviews by other Federal or State agencies; and

                                             id="H170C3F89F1224D27ADCFC18A941BC669"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (IV)
                                    the prospect for undue delay if the project is not designated for priority review.
                                 
                              
                           
                        
                     
                     ;
