                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H32BB1BCF783842128936DEF5391CEC6A"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (m)
                        Coordination and schedule
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2F208603F1BF4C1B96C1021A773AFE36"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Coordination plan
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5B4351616754435786D93A91814E278C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              Not later than 90 days after the date of publication of a notice of intent to prepare an environmental impact statement or the initiation of an environmental assessment, the Secretary of Transportation shall establish a plan for coordinating public and agency participation in and comment on the environmental review process for a project described or designated under subsection (b). The coordination plan may be incorporated into a memorandum of understanding.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEAFF418FF0BE49DB9AA191AA80439355"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Cloud-based, interactive digital platforms
                              The Secretary is encouraged to utilize cloud-based, interactive digital platforms to meet community engagement and agency coordination requirements under subparagraph (A).
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE44B05DFB2054644BCC2AD5557577A5B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              Schedule
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE3D3340A338D4156AC19C47642E31A70"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 In general
                                 The Secretary shall establish as part of such coordination plan, after consultation with and the concurrence of each participating agency for the project and with the State in which the project is located (and, if the State is not the project sponsor, with the project sponsor), a schedule for—
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H4409395391D54F7780EBAD52EFF0F3DD"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (I)
                                    interim milestones and deadlines for agency activities necessary to complete the environmental review; and
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HAC23F91808284A9B835DED7C12540660"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (II)
                                    completion of the environmental review process for the project.
                                 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF3C1892FC0D64D019A4C2324558D9E03"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 Factors for consideration
                                 In establishing the schedule under clause (i), the Secretary shall consider factors such as—
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H061114BAAF4C40E1A43D2ABD3E059518"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (I)
                                    the responsibilities of participating agencies under applicable laws;
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HD9E6D2A2062040C79F17546F4A8297FB"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (II)
                                    resources available to the cooperating agencies;
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H508103C4C8D3411C8085730E11332027"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (III)
                                    overall size and complexity of the project;
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H6BE9EC9C6E98499E8461E44BF04C7D15"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (IV)
                                    the overall time required by an agency to conduct an environmental review and make decisions under applicable Federal law relating to a project (including the issuance or denial of a permit or license) and the cost of the project; and
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HEEBC15FFB359414B97774282737EBC72"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (V)
                                    the sensitivity of the natural and historic resources that could be affected by the project.
                                 
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7EED893EFE9A4AACACE2D4774BD0FB18"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 Maximum project schedule
                                 To the maximum extent practicable and consistent with applicable Federal law, the Secretary shall develop, in concurrence with the project sponsor, a maximum schedule for the project described or designated under subsection (b) that is not more than 2 years for the completion of the environmental review process for such projects, as measured from, as applicable, the date of publication of a notice of intent to prepare an environmental impact statement to the record of decision.
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3EFCEA4AC1114692AD92EE46EB6712CE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iv)
                                 Dispute resolution
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H6F8C957380184EFB958F1FDB9DA3EED6"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (I)
                                    In general
                                    Any issue or dispute that arises between the Secretary and participating agencies (or amongst participating agencies) during the environmental review process shall be addressed expeditiously to avoid delay.
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H028A56F2D2374F11B908752F622D0813"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (II)
                                    Responsibilities
                                    The Secretary and participating agencies shall—
                                    <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="HEBC9AFE77DF943A9BE3A26AD35C7919E"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (aa)
                                       implement the requirements of this section consistent with any dispute resolution process established in an applicable law, regulation, or legally binding agreement to the maximum extent permitted by law; and
                                    
                                    <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="H6EF68BF7374B4B1596A5F8BCB6AA2994"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (bb)
                                       seek to resolve issues or disputes at the earliest possible time at the project level through agency employees who have day-to-day involvement in the project.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HEFA5A3F7D57D4D459F91AF1D2952C09B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (III)
                                    Secretary responsibilities
                                    <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="H2973A1D1543F4B1EBEC7C80A6B55E170"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (aa)
                                       In general
                                       The Secretary shall make information available to each cooperating and participating agency and project sponsor as early as practicable in the environmental review regarding the environmental, historic, and socioeconomic resources located within the project area and the general locations of the alternatives under consideration.
                                    
                                    <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="H135BEA2E2BFD4B129A06204EB9F274C0"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (bb)
                                       Sources of information
                                       The information described in item (aa) may be based on existing data sources, including geographic information systems mapping.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE81CE82434044908988579C76A462B7D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (IV)
                                    Cooperating and participating agency responsibilities
                                    Each cooperating and participating agency shall—
                                    <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="H75C986E4F3804EF7945278151BFB325A"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (aa)
                                       identify, as early as practicable, any issues of concern regarding any potential environmental impacts of the project, including any issues that could substantially delay or prevent an agency from completing any environmental review or authorization required for the project; and
                                    
                                    <item display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                           id="H775B1A5E952F43FFA931C17BB129D2A0"
                                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                                       (bb)
                                       communicate any issues described in item (aa) to the project sponsor.
                                    
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H8201A68726904824B938E29144CE48D4"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (V)
                                    Elevation for missed milestone
                                    If a dispute between the Secretary and participating agencies (or amongst participating agencies) causes a milestone to be missed or extended, or the Secretary anticipates that a permitting timetable milestone will be missed or will need to be extended, the dispute shall be elevated to an official designated by the relevant agency for resolution. The elevation of a dispute shall take place as soon as practicable after the Secretary becomes aware of the dispute or potential missed milestone.
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE95C79D58466447EA794750A788540C8"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (VI)
                                    Exception
                                    Disputes that do not impact the ability of an agency to meet a milestone may be elevated as appropriate.
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H4DFAB8258A0A4201880C44A63BD38D03"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (VII)
                                    Further evaluation
                                    If a resolution has not been reached at the end of the 30-day period after a relevant milestone date or extension date after a dispute has been elevated to the designated official, the relevant agencies shall elevate the dispute to senior agency leadership for resolution.
                                 
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB41FB31F92844D47A7845F57AD9CC4E7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Consistency with other time periods
                              A schedule under subparagraph (C) shall be consistent with any other relevant time periods established under Federal law.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB5A6A7A539BB4314B78316E6B776D2C3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              Modification
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HAD0E128F0F764A4CBBEE383F5E69786A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 In general
                                 Except as provided in clause (ii), the Secretary may lengthen or shorten a schedule established under subparagraph (C) for good cause. The Secretary may consider a decision by the project sponsor to change, modify, expand, or reduce the scope of a project as good cause for purposes of this clause.
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD02BA850BDD1428296B4777BC4BD4E70"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 Limitations
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H259222EC56C1431DAB1127D593A29B32"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (I)
                                    Lengthened schedule
                                    The Secretary may lengthen a schedule under clause (i) for a cooperating Federal agency by not more than 1 year after the latest deadline established for the project described or designated under subsection (b) by the Secretary.
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HCC54803768384B2CA9A79FC8F57585C7"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (II)
                                    Shortened schedule
                                    The Secretary may not shorten a schedule under clause (i) if doing so would impair the ability of a cooperating Federal agency to conduct necessary analyses or otherwise carry out relevant obligations of the Federal agency for the project.
                                 
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8C326B322B1C4575A3E46097CD78390B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              Failure to meet deadline
                              If a cooperating Federal agency fails to meet a deadline established under subparagraph (D)(ii)(I)—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H723135F781694B608323B5D0643A739C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 the cooperating Federal agency shall, not later than 10 days after failing to meet the deadline, submit to the Secretary a report that describes the reasons why the deadline was not met; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC41A84EB96DB45C8BED331A88F0BC414"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 the Secretary shall—
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE084FCF843994633812F3057C6FFF9B1"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (I)
                                    submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a copy of the report under clause (i); and
                                 
                                 <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H1F32ECB4D1254A4385884D072BD4B170"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (II)
                                    make the report under clause (i) publicly available on a website of the Department of Transportation.
                                 
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8D54D82D5C804E398A6B7255E3D1C9A3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (G)
                              Dissemination
                              A copy of a schedule under subparagraph (C), and of any modifications to the schedule under subparagraph (E), shall be—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB188674F16AF40C8A43B6D906A306471"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 provided to all participating agencies and to the State department of transportation of the State in which the project is located (and, if the State is not the project sponsor, to the project sponsor); and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H772EDA7618F343FEA9B6B8FDA0489124"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 made available to the public.
                              
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H90C5BCCC88D54F2E97074DBFCAAA4BF3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Comment deadlines
                           The Secretary shall establish the following deadlines for comment during the environmental review process for a project:
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCAA8D9A9CAA2474DA6DDFAD6FC2E5DD4"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              For comments by agencies and the public on a draft environmental impact statement, a period of not more than 60 days after publication in the Federal Register of notice of the date of public availability of such statement, unless—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA8104241A8F343E29873A040CDAB137D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 a different deadline is established by agreement of the lead agency, the project sponsor, and all participating agencies; or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD946A308B27242A5BDED20C1E02DECB3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 the deadline is extended by the lead agency for good cause.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE00FDC7C0A2140169B1DF53E70BCD81D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              For all other comment periods established by the lead agency for agency or public comments in the environmental review process, a period of not more than 45 days from availability of the materials on which comment is requested, unless—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8F1EB73FC69D4082B1085B6B05A2063B"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 a different deadline is established by agreement of the Secretary, the project sponsor, and all participating agencies; or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDA980E6955234EC1AE5D4B47705DDD2D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 the deadline is extended by the lead agency for good cause.
                              
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8A8273D8D7B84E91B5EAE0C13B4EFD39"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Deadlines for decisions under other laws
                           In any case in which a decision under any Federal law relating to a project described or designated under subsection (b) (including the issuance or denial of a permit or license) is required to be made by the later of the date that is 180 days after the date on which the Secretary made all final decisions of the lead agency with respect to the project or 180 days after the date on which an application was submitted for the permit or license, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and publish on a website of the Department of Transportation—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA8DF9176ABC845B0AE7742EA997E33F3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              as soon as practicable after the 180-day period, an initial notice of the failure of the Federal agency to make the decision; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE05901D5B13046C6815BFA0ABD475982"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              every 60 days thereafter until such date as all decisions of the Federal agency relating to the project have been made by the Federal agency, an additional notice that describes the number of decisions of the Federal agency that remain outstanding as of the date of the additional notice.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H480267EE507D4C81AB5EC8E6573B40BC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Involvement of the public
                           Nothing in this subsection shall reduce any time period provided for public comment in the environmental review process under existing Federal law, including a regulation. 
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HEC473B53445C4E6D9EA681B1A49DB858"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (n)
                        Concurrent reviews and single NEPA document
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1B6BAEBB3B094B0597006CC69B13B7CF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Concurrent reviews
                           Each participating agency and cooperating agency under the expedited and coordinated environmental review process established under this section shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H53F1DC0EA2E84290833782ED455E135B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              carry out the obligations of such agency under other applicable law concurrently, and in conjunction, with the review required under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.), unless doing so would impair the ability of such agency to conduct needed analysis or otherwise carry out such obligations; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H7648132A52054B29B1D5E0E80D6D82D6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              formulate and implement administrative, policy, and procedural mechanisms to enable the agency to ensure completion of the environmental review process in a timely, coordinated, and environmentally responsible manner.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEE23B7183A2A4CAD9A10FCDA4182B3D2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Single NEPA document
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBFED2A9C8805423FB533930096D6FA91"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              To the maximum extent practicable and consistent with Federal law, all Federal permits and reviews for a project shall rely on a single environmental document prepared under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) under the leadership of the Secretary.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC380794847094821B42EE56DEFE477B7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Use of document
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF9ED9E135ACA4915B3D267B599110B8D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 In general
                                 To the maximum extent practicable, the Secretary shall develop an environmental document sufficient to satisfy the requirements for any Federal approval or other Federal action required for the project, including permits issued by other Federal agencies.
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H60B27BF0A47A4FC0BE97EB0E3F7F9655"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 Cooperation of participating agencies
                                 In carrying out this subparagraph, other participating agencies shall cooperate with the lead agency and provide timely information.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFF13BEB9BF8947A2A0E84713F8E46A6A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              Treatment as participating and cooperating agencies
                              A Federal agency required to make an approval or take an action for a project, as described in this paragraph, shall work with the Secretary to ensure that the agency making the approval or taking the action is treated as being both a participating and cooperating agency for the project.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCBC428CADF6B41DF8E76FF32F8D526E9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Exceptions
                              The Secretary may waive the application of subparagraph (A) with respect to a project if—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2A424A7AB9964578B047BE190FAC7CE7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 the project sponsor requests that agencies issue separate environmental documents;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H922A4E40FCB94B0881E5FE719AA50506"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 the obligations of a cooperating agency or participating agency under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) have already been satisfied with respect to the project; or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8BF3CCD1CA814E0483F99C88D0C13077"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 the Secretary determines that reliance on a single environmental document (as described in subparagraph (A)) would not facilitate timely completion of the environmental review process for the project.
                              
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBB970B1C83C34A0B87BE1039FF18B0B4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Participating agency responsibilities
                           An agency participating in the expedited and coordinated environmental review process under this section shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H566534F27EA54F629555047E0FEE33EA"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              provide comments, responses, studies, or methodologies on areas within the special expertise or jurisdiction of the agency; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB8074FE3F71E443F8A59A2F8F63E7FDE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              use the process to address any environmental issues of concern to the agency.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H67D59ADF54684BEF97264D81D036E559"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (o)
                        Environmental impact statement
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H79742F6DBB19427BA65630EE21133769"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           In preparing a final environmental impact statement under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) for a project described or designated under subsection (b), if the Secretary modifies the statement in response to comments that are minor and are confined to factual corrections or explanations of why the comments do not warrant additional agency response, the Secretary may write on errata sheets attached to the statement instead of rewriting the draft statement, subject to the condition that the errata sheets—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H32516807841B4CD5BA18B0A12B35B67C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              cite the sources, authorities, and reasons that support the position of the agency; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD914496E2EAC4F90841A9CABFEE31674"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              if appropriate, indicate the circumstances that would trigger agency reappraisal or further response.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H33430F04D74F40B7B43139936B173220"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Single document
                           To the maximum extent practicable, for a project subject to a coordinated review process under this section, the Secretary shall expeditiously develop a single document that consists of a final environmental impact statement and a record of decision, unless—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HDBD1EFD0E6DD4F6EB5E10B4373B4BFB6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              the final environmental impact statement or record of decision makes substantial changes to the project that are relevant to environmental or safety concerns; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H37A497E976194A06A6D770223FFFCB73"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              there is a significant new circumstance or information relevant to environmental concerns that bears on the proposed action or the environmental impacts of the proposed action.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4505407864514CA1802FE2ADC0D0CD23"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Length of environmental document
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0FBF1774F9C5407F8236D51ADA021809"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              In general
                              Except as provided in subparagraph (B), an environmental impact statement shall not exceed 150 pages, not including any citations or appendices.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H23485CC1312F4332841DDA4D0C964DFF"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Extraordinary complexity
                              An environmental impact statement for a proposed agency action of extraordinary complexity shall not exceed 300 pages, not including any citations or appendices.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H9488EE76D9FC4950B3A324DF5B385A1C"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (p)
                        Integration of planning and environmental review
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H77CF429AE59F415280E9BE780B5760F0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           Subject to paragraph (5) and to the maximum extent practicable and appropriate, the following agencies may adopt or incorporate by reference, and use a planning product in proceedings relating to, any class of action in the environmental review process of a project described or designated under subsection (b):
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H710551D6371D4080AB181618008B73B0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              The lead agency for a project, with respect to an environmental impact statement, environmental assessment, categorical exclusion, or other document prepared under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.).
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA9CABD879F8B4CADB6A7C73EF490C1CB"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              A cooperating agency with responsibility under Federal law with respect to the process for and completion of any environmental permit, approval, review, or study required for a project under any Federal law other than the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.), if consistent with such Act.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD86AB9B4E85E47D18D0C1512E1BCB1E9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Identification
                           If a lead or cooperating agency makes a determination to adopt or incorporate by reference and use a planning product under paragraph (1), such agency shall identify the agencies that participated in the development of the planning products.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDC22C76F7C224D1AA9B5D6DBF0856621"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Adoption or incorporation by reference of planning products
                           Such agency may—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H83D46AA5F6B049EABEE56FF8C7EC95B0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              adopt or incorporate by reference an entire planning product under paragraph (1); or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H347FF3AB05AC4DB1BD4F7E1EBE0E1D94"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              select portions of a planning project under paragraph (1) for adoption or incorporation by reference.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9953E878038D4CF78207597475E0C4D0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Timing
                           The adoption or incorporation by reference of a planning product under paragraph (1) may—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC1AE2F1E7E23410BA6DEBBCB961BD2D7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              be made at the time the lead and cooperating agencies decide the appropriate scope of environmental review for the project; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H136F4DECB53147E4993C51E1CD5826DA"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              occur later in the environmental review process, as appropriate.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBA69F9830BA44E7EB41B744AE02D357C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Conditions
                           Such agency in the environmental review process may adopt or incorporate by reference a planning product under this section if such agency determines, with the concurrence of the lead agency, if appropriate, and, if the planning product is necessary for a cooperating agency to issue a permit, review, or approval for the project, with the concurrence of the cooperating agency, if appropriate, that the following conditions have been met:
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HA9629D10FB934E01BCE746985EEB79C7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              The planning product was developed through a planning process conducted pursuant to applicable Federal law.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H90C7879C99A14559BBE980CD69CB6EFC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              The planning product was developed in consultation with appropriate Federal and State resource agencies and Indian Tribes.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H433F531B61494A90947878EE92D35232"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              The planning process included broad multidisciplinary consideration of systems-level or corridor-wide transportation needs and potential effects, including effects on the human and natural environment.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HBC2D2C7130D64652A5E4733FBE1B5BBD"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              The planning process included public notice that the planning products produced in the planning process may be adopted during any subsequent environmental review process in accordance with this section.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1D5FA98C6D8D404687ECF6B12B30CE7C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              During the environmental review process, the such agency has—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2261C75191784E63A264683B2D2A2371"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 made the planning documents available for public review and comment by members of the general public and Federal, State, local, and Tribal governments that may have an interest in the proposed project;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD7FDA609A1B841FE8F7935348066A006"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 provided notice of the intention of the such agency to adopt or incorporate by reference the planning product; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0E7825915B1F499F89D324B74CB189ED"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 considered any resulting comments.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE9D842B587D94ECFBA607C88EFBD04C9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              There is no significant new information or new circumstance that has a reasonable likelihood of affecting the continued validity or appropriateness of the planning product or portions thereof.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8154A8BF678D4F5F8C715C353141575D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (G)
                              The planning product has a rational basis and is based on reliable and reasonably current data and reasonable and scientifically acceptable methodologies.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H444CB5487ACC485CBA0B0F62B66CA236"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (H)
                              The planning product is documented in sufficient detail to support the decision or the results of the analysis and to meet requirements for use of the information in the environmental review process.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFAFE46E510D0478F9379487B183554D3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              The planning product is appropriate for adoption or incorporation by reference and use in the environmental review process for the project and is incorporated in accordance with, and is sufficient to meet the requirements of, the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) and section 1502.21 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3AA6F29DAD1A45D7804BDB80727CAAC3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (6)
                           Effect of adoption or incorporation by reference
                           Any planning product or portions thereof adopted or incorporated by reference by such agency in accordance with this subsection may be—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HABF29E4B262248F99FEE1AE79841B48F"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              incorporated directly into an environmental review process document or other environmental document; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H61AA34140EE2476EA3C409FF31CFE57A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              relied on and used by other Federal agencies in carrying out reviews of the project.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HE73A147CF1B442C3A5428E279D2E4721"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (q)
                        Report on NEPA data
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3B7F60BADE0142C09A42FC7963DC983D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           The Secretary shall carry out a process to track, and annually submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives, the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate a report on projects described in subsection (b)(1) that contains the information described in paragraph (3).
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0518B2E034DE4190B7EFCDC9CFA366AB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Time to complete
                           For purposes of paragraph (3), the NEPA process—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB369BA4AA2E9423D8B6555CE781D8C0B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              for an environmental impact statement—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H04669EA984BE4DA8A12948C2AF0EAA3A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 begins on the date on which a notice of intent is published in the Federal Register; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF34FE2600369457ABDDFBE2651B2FA4E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 ends on the date on which the Secretary issues a record of decision, including, if necessary, a revised record of decision; and
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H08396A9191DE4443B1E2E2EC8F3400E5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              for an environmental assessment—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3A2D27EF8E174C17B81D10228FBB21D9"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 begins on the date on which the Secretary makes a determination to prepare an environmental assessment; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7D14041B7FF74C6EA9049AF3191A9A70"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 ends on the date on which the Secretary issues a finding of no significant impact or determines that preparation of an environmental impact statement is necessary.
                              
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF3F85758DC8B46358910A4F64F35F307"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Information described
                           The information referred to in paragraph (1) is, with respect to the Federal Aviation Administration—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8F3145C86E934237973EF32F3D474B8E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              the number of proposed actions for which a categorical exclusion was applied by the Secretary during the reporting period;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF4D887FA53414F3AB1D1D0F55765720C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              the number of proposed actions for which a documented categorical exclusion was applied by the Secretary during the reporting period;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4A054AACE6FB460189FAF0C257DC7AF7"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              the number of proposed actions pending on the date on which the report is submitted for which the issuance of a documented categorical exclusion by the Secretary is pending;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H42786948D1D24C8DB7BF16B5AF9087BC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              the number of proposed actions for which an environmental assessment was issued by the Secretary during the reporting period;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HB0C1BE7B6BA4431DAE69EE3F6E2F8D1B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              the length of time the Administration took to complete each environmental assessment described in subparagraph (D);
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H729FAC7540AA484B9E3CEFAAEF904287"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (F)
                              the number of proposed actions pending on the date on which the report is submitted for which an environmental assessment is being drafted by the Secretary;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1897757F56704D608998190B0F7A4D36"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (G)
                              the number of proposed actions for which a final environmental impact statement was completed by the Secretary during the reporting period;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H951DB3B1A4744EF4B899D09DAFA37420"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (H)
                              the length of time that the Secretary took to complete each environmental impact statement described in subparagraph (G);
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H27718358A5C24EBC834F9FA0F8C71F3D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              the number of proposed actions pending on the date on which the report is submitted for which an environmental impact statement is being drafted; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H114E383B900542AF9A390F05315DC03A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (J)
                              for the proposed actions reported under subparagraphs (F) and (I), the percentage of such proposed actions for which—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5C1A327643054B10BB8318B9AF3AD973"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 project funding has been identified; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA009C00106D74E9E86BF8CF2F974D1FD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 all other Federal, State, and local activities that are required to allow the proposed action to proceed are completed.
                              
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB4C8D7376E89466D982B21E9F141E6EF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Definitions
                           In this section:
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H4BF1969EA3F34E4B8F180E3CA8E41953"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Environmental assessment
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">environmental assessment has the meaning given such term in section 1508.1 of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation).
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H24622BCCD668471EA0CB6290AB8AE414"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Environmental impact statement
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">environmental impact statement means a detailed statement required under section 102(2)(C) of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4332(2)(C)).
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H294A348753FF4DF681B62FC3F9F94D64"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              NEPA process
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">NEPA process means the entirety of the development and documentation of the analysis required under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.), including the assessment and analysis of any impacts, alternatives, and mitigation of a proposed action, and any interagency participation and public involvement required to be carried out before the Secretary undertakes a proposed action.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8A4B81FDFE3C469A977086BEEE915E8C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Proposed action
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">proposed action means an action (within the meaning of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.)) under this title that the Secretary proposes to carry out.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF880D766AF224EC795559F9E497D21C5"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (E)
                              Reporting period
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">reporting period means the fiscal year prior to the fiscal year in which a report is issued under subsection (a).
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H1501397C06954E82AF001FB77A382309"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               784.
               SUBCHAPTER III DEFINITIONS
               Section 47175 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4A696D59940746E1AF32A970F45C99C6"

                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">and at the end and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">or;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBB726763AEE84EE183FD447FC6E3758C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">

                  by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H5072A70A24BC47E993AF51ABACDE3617"

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H9C7F0E9E3B1B4C56A1B162B54CE804C8"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               785.
               PILOT PROGRAM EXTENSION
               Section 190 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 47104 note) is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HEAEF1992C31F445AB2E236F7F3417348"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in subsection (a) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">in each fiscal year after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">6 projects; and 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H590A83AE60754AAFA5647B4966A83786"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  in subsection (i) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">5 years and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">on October 1, 2028..
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H7425D74561EF4E42B12BED25BA2B0688"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               786.
               PART 150 NOISE STANDARDS UPDATE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0EACD75C15DC438B8B7D1FD7F376686A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall review and revise, as appropriate, part 150 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, to reflect all relevant laws and regulations, including part 161 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H288595DC7C1340DD925E225FA17D79C1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Outreach
                  As part of the review conducted under subsection (a), the Administrator shall clarify existing and future noise policies and standards and seek feedback from airports, airport users, and individuals living in the vicinity of airports and in airport adjacent communities before implementing any changes to any noise policies or standards.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H50CC10AB72A44EF4A940D44BB20562A5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Briefing
                  Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and every 6 months thereafter, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress regarding the review conducted under subsection (a).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8BB76730AB2A47CFA74D393206470FB2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Sunset
                  The requirement under subsection (c) shall terminate on the earlier of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD7EA24CE60414931B6ACA9ADC62668C3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     October 1, 2028; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H40C39FC47ACA4E218A01120726FC2B28"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the date on which 1 briefing is provided under subsection (c) after the changes in subsection (a) are implemented.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HDA20807E3F2B455EA7EA0993B205921C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               787.
               REDUCING COMMUNITY AIRCRAFT NOISE EXPOSURE
               In implementing or substantially revising a flight procedure, the Administrator shall consider the following actions (to the extent that such actions do not negatively affect aviation safety or efficiency) to reduce undesirable aircraft noise:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE84EC57430F34037A7FC3D7CE27AFB2A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Implement flight procedures that can mitigate the impact of aircraft noise, based on a consensus community recommendation.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6D50B565C1204D2A8F5F7EB393E9D88F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Work with airport sponsors and potentially impacted neighboring communities in establishing or modifying aircraft arrival and departure routes.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE84C4C8272A8455CA9B9D9CE638369E9"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  In collaboration with local governments, discourage local encroachment of residential or other buildings near airports that could create future aircraft noise complaints or impact airport operations or aviation safety.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H62B1E26452234A4B85C372D88C2421F1"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               788.
               CATEGORICAL EXCLUSIONS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3FB5F0A56EE44053930C8DD28C044D82"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Categorical exclusion for projects of limited Federal assistance
                  An action by the Administrator to approve, permit, finance, or otherwise authorize any airport project that is undertaken by the sponsor, owner, or operator of a public-use airport shall be presumed to be covered by a categorical exclusion under FAA Order 1050.1F (or any successor document), if such project—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H17537652C8DB4166A311A7FFC8E17ABD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     receives less than $6,000,000 (as adjusted annually by the Administrator to reflect any increases in the Consumer Price Index prepared by the Department of Labor) of Federal funds or funds from charges collected under section 40117 of title 49, United States Code; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6386BC702446420893CFB069014CC67D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     has a total estimated cost of not more than $35,000,000 (as adjusted annually by the Administrator to reflect any increases in the Consumer Price Index prepared by the Department of Labor) and Federal funds comprising less than 15 percent of the total estimated project cost.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAEE8930AC6A64D4EA64440621747F8E1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Categorical exclusion in emergencies
                  An action by the Administrator to approve, permit, finance, or otherwise authorize an airport project that is undertaken by the sponsor, owner, or operator of a public-use airport shall be presumed to be covered by a categorical exclusion under FAA Order 1050.1F (or any successor document), if such project is—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBA1E7E18B46C41D298B43A0C112336DE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     for the repair or reconstruction of any airport facility, runway, taxiway, or similar structure that is in operation or under construction when damaged by an emergency declared by the Governor of the State with concurrence of the Administrator or for a disaster or emergency declared by the President pursuant to the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5121 et seq.);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE28937924AE6418EAC5676C0C77F2058"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in the same location with the same capacity, dimensions, and design as the original airport facility, runway, taxiway, or similar structure as before the declaration described in this section; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H932D28C7FBA9424990E89D149EB7B488"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     commenced within a 2-year period beginning on the date of a declaration described in this section.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9F52CB0471464BB19096DADE2630FECD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Extraordinary circumstances
                  The presumption that an action is covered by a categorical exclusion under subsections (a) and (b) shall not apply if the Administrator determines that extraordinary circumstances exist with respect to such action.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCA71196D453F417D877C1B6DE628449A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to impact any aviation safety authority of the Administrator.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
