                            id="H30F3AE9CF3BE41F5904B5895F301A8C2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H36DEA399B4C845339ACA1CCD81F7D593"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Categorical exclusion
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">categorical exclusion has the meaning given such term in section 1508.1(d) of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H13F779B539C149AE85E7DD22F76E52F3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Public-use airport; sponsor
                     The terms <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">public-use airport and <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">sponsor have the meanings given such terms in section 47102 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HBDCF01E083264FFC80C155E07ADA373E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               789.
               UPDATING PRESUMED TO CONFORM LIMITS
               Not later than 24 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall take such actions as are necessary to update the FAA’s list of actions that are presumed to conform to a State implementation plan pursuant to section 93.153(f) of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations, to include projects relating to the construction of aircraft hangars.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H8E39234DB34845ADB5A0009CAE37D826"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               790.
               RECOMMENDATIONS ON REDUCING ROTORCRAFT NOISE IN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3D2B0B39A9D74AD09A62653A89C2F5D1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Study
                  The Comptroller General shall conduct a study on reducing rotorcraft noise in the District of Columbia.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H338F8E3F29E84A1BB829F8B8D1BFB45F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Contents
                  In carrying out the study under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall consider—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H47C56521E1F440D08ACDD69D0435B8A2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the extent to which military operators consider operating over unpopulated areas outside of the District of Columbia for training missions;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H300753ED9AD543BE8DB192C8B0603122"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the extent to which vehicles or aircraft other than conventional rotorcraft (such as unmanned aircraft) could be used for emergency and law enforcement response; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD065BC5F3EDC42B0889FBBE696EAEF7A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the extent to which relevant operators and entities have assessed and addressed, as appropriate, the noise impacts of various factors of operating rotorcraft, including, at a minimum—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE32BE99ABB204926BFE00A8B2AA321B8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        altitude;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8D448CF4E5874DE79301F2B99D95C58B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the number of flights;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H48090D18E6A14A2EA00A62AC08246E15"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        flight paths;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H85076368962B4B09988247244D261169"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        time of day of flights;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H298D470A84E1443F88A725888EE3F63C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        types of aircraft;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H693A0945221A4556A351C494C1DB8B4F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        operating procedures; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6DD772DC28BF478897EE8B3EBAEF3985"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (G)
                        pilot training.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HEBD1352581254934B4F4D1E3D20A626A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on preliminary observations, with a report to follow at a date agreed upon at the time of the briefing, containing—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDDC6F37349CD4D069F05ABB7B474F422"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the contents of the study conducted under subsection (a); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3E32C83E4DF2407B9EE9D8426CC4A98C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     any recommendations for the reduction of rotorcraft noise in the District of Columbia.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H762721F04F104305968D1A481CB6F9D4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Relevant operators and entities defined
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">relevant operators and entities means—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC03F40A1A86146949A28DC81718145A0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the Chief of Police of the Metropolitan Police Department of the District of Columbia;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H64648715D2BD4C899CC0FA93A11EFEF3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     any medical rotorcraft operator that routinely flies a rotorcraft over the District of Columbia; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H26727F0F218641318FAFB0C41824C790"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     any other operator that routinely flies a rotorcraft over the District of Columbia.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H57278917BA41443EBE323E41234AF8F0"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               791.
               UFP STUDY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCA1DCA135DD34F56A3CD45C7EFCB74BF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall seek to enter into an agreement with the National Academies under which the National Research Council shall carry out a study examining airborne ultrafine particles and the effect of such particles on airport-adjacent communities.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7E04F4E8124B4894B838F6F63C7067E8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Scope of study
                  In carrying out the study under subsection (a), the National Research Council shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H45E1E7914D234EC7B119835F371F28F6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     summarize the relevant literature and studies done on airborne UFPs worldwide;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA4E1101337304B12AB14523A75F75AF3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     focus on large hub airports;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF183C0E1032F4E888E6CA50008CCDC41"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     examine airborne UFPs and the potential effect of such UFPs on airport-adjacent communities, including—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7B1DBC2B92FA465196C0E43861B3564B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        characteristics of UFPs present in the air;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8101837FFA7E42A3AAE9E3E6605F6E30"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        spatial and temporal distributions of UFP concentrations;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H559EE306C3364B91820FB5FF21AE09D9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        primary sources of UFPs;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEB5EC0CEAB5B4EA5B2720CA713A226A4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        the contribution of aircraft and airport operations to the distribution of UFP concentrations compared to other sources;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H74C2307A0BDC4448B85DEEC245BA6BC3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        potential health effects associated with elevated UFP exposures, including outcomes related to cardiovascular disease, respiratory infection and disease, degradation of neurocognitive functions, and other health effects; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9737539F74EE472BB2C24A3BB6D80ECF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        potential UFP exposures, especially to susceptible groups;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8CCABCBA5A484D30841898B19F854A1C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     consider the concentration of UFPs resulting from various aviation fuel sources including aviation gasoline, sustainable aviation fuel, and hydrogen, to the extent practicable;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEF1BF8DE49CA4250A95F421688687C23"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     identify measures intended to reduce the release of UFPs; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC47A5A9622864C6DB4B266AADDBE8FF9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     identify information gaps related to understanding potential relationships between UFP exposures and health effects, contributions of aviation-related emissions to UFP exposures, and the effectiveness of mitigation measures.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H77C4FCD99AB24212846576A86459F2E7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Coordination
                  The Administrator may coordinate with the heads of such other agencies that the Administrator considers appropriate to provide data and other assistance necessary for the study.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3AD444BD44FC4E0EBE4B585686944FBF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Report
                  Not later than 180 days after the National Research Council submits of the results of the study to the Administrator, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report containing the results of the study carried out under subsection (a), including any recommendations based on such study.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9993F2C19A364076B57FC34E9BF8ED9B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Definition of ultrafine particle
                  In this section, the terms <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">ultrafine particle and <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">UFP mean particles with diameters less than or equal to 100 nanometers.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H7147A75801694D11838EF0B05CFBB280"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               792.
               AIRCRAFT NOISE ADVISORY COMMITTEE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC60DF2C4106A4BA68B470613503DBEB1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Establishment
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an Aircraft Noise Advisory Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Advisory Committee) to advise the Administrator on issues facing the aviation community that are related to aircraft noise exposure and existing FAA noise policies and regulations.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H061D244FEC1F4C1DB6521D2A099C2121"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Membership
                  The Administrator shall appoint the members of the Advisory Committee, which shall be comprised of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H58D6B41310354178A0606A136F71330B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     at least 1 representative of each of—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4EA489EEAB3C414E9FDC89B365535A86"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        engine manufacturers;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0206C8D6D1564D58B22EC76FC50D0425"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        air carriers;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2E56E59C1B014FD394FBC32DC31A494C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        airport owners or operators;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HDFD6EB25B35844CDB57202D4F96B3D1A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        aircraft manufacturers;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4454806141FF47FEA192EF9AB363BD96"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        advanced air mobility manufacturers or operators; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3D9B3C8C98174F3D8F2180DA7B7C4ADC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        institutions of higher education; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7C4549FC3ED949FBA97E95E52661C761"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     representatives of airport-adjacent communities from geographically diverse regions.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4AA210992A3640679807F2A9AD5067A3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Duties
                  The duties of the Advisory Committee shall include—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H318754B507C84C76B4D2B736C5CE8826"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the evaluation of existing research on aircraft noise impacts and annoyance;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8DC9E628C7E640A7B69400790C21566D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the assessment of alternative noise metrics that could be used to supplement or replace the existing Day Night Level standard, in consultation with the National Academies;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H179A87E182004D56ADD0FBC96B41C0A1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the evaluation of the current 65-decibel exposure threshold, including the impact to land use compatibility around airports if such threshold was lowered;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC2C63D145DA84E0FBEC73B6CF0FE746C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     the evaluation of current noise mitigation strategies and the community engagement efforts by the FAA with respect to changes in airspace utilization, such as the integration of new entrants and usage of performance-based navigation; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H46900E65A3044F75A88A19E9709AACC7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     other duties determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3AE38DFC00BB473A91C058E17D4B39DC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Reports
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC4B20FE6C1C74BAD850C5498C09785BC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 1 year after the date of establishment of the Advisory Committee, the Advisory Committee shall submit to the Administrator a report on any recommended changes to current aviation noise policies.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H36250A2147D5403C8476437BEAF8F8BC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Report to congress
                     Not later than 180 days after the date the Administrator receives the report under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report containing the recommendations made by the Advisory Committee.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1FB13628EA464BD08D81FD4C960C9F35"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Congressional briefing
                  Not later than 30 days after submission of the report under paragraph (2), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on how the Administrator plans to implement recommendations contained in the report and, for each recommendation that the Administrator does not plan to implement, the reason of the Administrator for not implementing the recommendation.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H842B710102E84122972E218DD29BFF90"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Consultation
                  The Advisory Committee shall consult with other relevant Federal agencies, including the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, in carrying out the duties described in section (c).
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4BEF72C656224DF79B3906C8FEAFDA35"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               793.
               COMMUNITY COLLABORATION PROGRAM
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H68C76260BE7B4D41AD3541E0CA4688DE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Establishment
                  The Administrator shall continue existing community engagement activities under the designation of a Community Collaboration Program (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Program).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF515EDEEB5FE4BFCA30303B58D0B0D75"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Responsibilities
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H885903E142244BD2B2469303B9754848"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     In carrying out the Program, the Administrator shall facilitate and harmonize, as appropriate, policies and procedures carried out by various offices of the FAA pertaining to community engagement relating to—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H16EDC76E8A9F4EE38F9AF093DB503BF7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        airport planning and development;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCF64C033F70B464BBB8C204F8A405D77"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        noise and environmental policy;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0F9911062A8945A09227CAEC643C9284"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        NextGen implementation;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD97B28DED9484773AB7155DDE2506101"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        air traffic route changes;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H56B82807AA414A13A7D37005F9E30A46"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        integration of new and emerging entrants; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H16E7717DC80245ABB57C55516B7500B1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        other topics with respect to which community engagement is critical to program success.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2FDA4A7ED8584A0CA136DE3BBA5F5216"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Specified responsibilities
                     In carrying out the Program, the Administrator shall be responsible for—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H83D06EDBD8424F78B1BE041003E8E5E0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        updating the internal guidance of the FAA for community engagement based on—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H24BF0B3EFDFF4E28B433D31DEF8A2500"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           best practices of other Federal agencies and external organizations with expertise in community engagement;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H415079CDDDD543E2B992B62EF5BAE5BD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           interviews with impacted residents; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC755FB54EF8642F19D40D1F58A552F5F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           recommendations solicited from individuals and local government officials in communities adversely impacted by aircraft noise;
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBC673BF954C94B5EBD21F4C3ECD5128B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        coordinating with the Air Traffic Organization on community engagement efforts related to air traffic procedure changes to ensure that impacted communities are consulted in a meaningful way;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7E1B031FACE8442DB7621DEDB84F3E6D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        coordination with Regional Ombudsmen of the FAA;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2DEA3D1EF1EF48358D410E5B69F217D4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        oversight, streamlining, and increasing the responsiveness of the noise complaint process of the FAA by—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H084D9EC8CC8C4E1AB913FF7213F9B39B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           centralizing noise complaint data and improving data collection methodologies;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2D149AE337084416AC8A4EC58E9F5528"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           ensuring such Regional Ombudsmen are consulted in local air traffic procedure development decisions; and 
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0DEC2C4590544D8BBA5FB4A7864384AA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           collecting feedback from such Regional Ombudsmen to inform national policymaking efforts; 
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9AAA01223E064CE2A5309BE6296B311C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        timely implementation of the recommendations, as appropriate, made by the Comptroller General to the Secretary contained in the report titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Aircraft Noise: FAA Could Improve Outreach Through Enhanced Noise Metrics, Communication, and Support to Communities, issued in September 2021 (GAO–21–103933) to improve the outreach of the FAA to local communities impacted by aircraft noise, including—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA0DAE7CA24CF49D19F8FB36376CACE80"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           any recommendations to—
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5E0703C89EE14F7B8DC4F4D7B7714701"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              identify appropriate supplemental metrics for assessing noise impacts and circumstances for their use to aid in the internal assessment of the FAA of noise impacts related to proposed flight path changes;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H223E6923C5044B64AE03B815F00B0C6C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              update guidance to incorporate additional tools to more clearly convey expected impacts, such as other noise metrics and visualization tools; and
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HAFCC4EB2FF9A4FB38EEAC65A6846D593"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (III)
                              improve guidance to airports and communities on effectively engaging with the FAA; and
                           
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H292F029AE7F541F2BA58955238AD05CB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           any other recommendations included in the report that would assist the FAA in improving outreach to communities affected by aircraft noise;
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6426D72DBC6448A2B6F295C5D4F06166"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        ensuring engagement with local community groups as appropriate in conducting the other responsibilities described in this section; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5585911C9C7E4111A7EE8E4086DF9855"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (G)
                        other responsibilities as considered appropriate by the Administrator.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H542B500BFEA14A04A319253F7D094810"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Briefing
                  Not later than 2 years after the Administrator implements the recommendations described in subsection (b)(2)(E), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress describing—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H137376D527144DC7868AAA0EF18F9305"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the implementation of each such recommendation;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDC6035B8039D4AB898A4CC7CFD90DA07"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     how any recommended actions are assisting the Administrator in improving outreach to communities affected by aircraft noise and other community engagement concerns; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HADECA262FC3C498F8FF97AFFE9AF2F49"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     any challenges or barriers that limit or prevent the ability of the Administrator to take such actions.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD8F69D4F16C443A1AAF307808E571EA0"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to require the Administrator to alter the organizational structure of the FAA nor change the reporting structure of any employee.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC9FEEE6876B74EEE999B249A5AD6679F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               794.
               INFORMATION SHARING REQUIREMENT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7466233D66C64BFDAF70DE2240479FA4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary, acting through the Administrator, shall establish a mechanism to make helicopter noise complaint data accessible to the FAA, to helicopter operators operating in the Washington, DC area, and to the public on a website of the FAA, based on the recommendation of the Government Accountability Office in the report titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Aircraft Noise: Better Information Sharing Could Improve Responses to Washington, D.C. Area Helicopter Noise Concerns, published on January 7, 2021 (GAO–21–200).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H01A809382D9A490E95275E728B40B733"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Cooperation
                  Any helicopter operator operating in the Washington, DC area shall, to the extent practicable, provide helicopter noise complaint data to the FAA through the mechanism established under subsection (a).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF5C5A1D09428477B994F7D5D71C4D2B8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE2318BBD52B7404C8F601E331D2A8115"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Helicopter noise complaint data
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">helicopter noise complaint data—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H68E9CE8F96094A07A9982F1F15DB8932"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        means general data relating to a complaint made by an individual about helicopter noise in the Washington, DC area and may include—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDDE22C9FF9344E04A18DEF38A4FF219D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           the location and description of the event that is the subject of the complaint;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1B9BB0398FEC4B0284D47FEF18C953D0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           the start and end time of such event;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H122B77E6AC1040AAB8691F6C39F07F3C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           a description of the aircraft that is the subject of the complaint; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDFFA3CEED90B4DBCBAC35E2BBAF40D33"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           the airport name associated with such event; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6210A487274643498149CD6E3E6F96BD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        does not include the personally identifiable information of the individual who submitted the complaint.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6875990690EC4DE28476EDA55BABBBB3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Washington, DC area
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Washington, DC area means the area inside of a 30-mile radius surrounding Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H870EC86804CD400B968C3BDC8636560E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               795.
               MECHANISMS TO REDUCE HELICOPTER NOISE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA316FC6646ED45FBACC8B7F7FFD27867"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall initiate a study to examine ways in which a State, territorial, or local government may mitigate the negative impacts of commercial helicopter noise.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H408122BAFC5544E699A40B9C925CAB53"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Considerations
                  In conducting the study under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall consider—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9D71EB3B7EC54EE69E3AD14AC106DD4F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the varying degree of commercial helicopter operations in different communities; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3452CB58DE4D42B7A8F7BE6C001DD31D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     actions that State and local governments have taken, and authorities such governments have used, to reduce the impact of commercial helicopter noise and the success of such actions.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCD638FDB7AC34D41BC22AD37500D910D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall provide to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the findings of the study conducted under subsection (a).
               
            
         
      
      <title id="HF010F024432947EC9E1A35995154987B"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         VIII
         GENERAL AVIATION
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H20CA131E4CC34EDFB0AB5A7EAFAACBC4"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            801.
            REEXAMINATION OF PILOTS OR CERTIFICATE HOLDERS
            The Pilot’s Bill of Rights (Public Law 112–153) is amended by adding at the end the following:
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="HBA42BE2559364B95A3EC962075EBB0F6"
                           style="OLC">
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HA70F6F08142049969927CD897E190920"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  5.
                  REEXAMINATION OF AN AIRMAN CERTIFICATE
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HB50E01F284BA4416834FD540BD638EFB"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     In general
                     The Administrator shall provide timely, written notification to an individual subject to a reexamination of an airman certificate issued under chapter 447 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HC02E9A1E28084B6EB2397A9BFC0667EC"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Information required
                     In providing notification under subsection (a), the Administrator shall inform the individual—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H250C5291AAA0441088E29AFCBE591A38"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        of the nature of the reexamination and the specific activity on which the reexamination is necessitated;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H90B5C75961374D60AC5126077B65A988"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        that the reexamination shall occur within 1 year from the date of the notice provided by the Administrator, however, if the reexamination is not conducted within 30 days, the Administrator may restrict passenger carrying operations;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC15678C18AC0403B9775C6D94083D7EA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        that if such reexamination is not conducted after 1 year from date of notice, the airman certificate of the individual may be suspended or revoked; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0524642792734F05B7221BB1A11532D9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        when, as determined by the Administrator, an oral or written response to the notification from the Administrator is not required.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H00AC855B73A6459EA9541B3B735C670A"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (c)
                     Exception
                     Nothing in this section prohibits the Administrator from reexamining a certificate holder if the Administrator has reasonable grounds—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEBF564900E004F6AAC658C7F0A7E2682"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        to establish that an airman may not be qualified to exercise the privileges of a certificate or rating based upon an act or omission committed by the airman while exercising such privileges or performing ancillary duties associated with the exercise of such privileges; or
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9140C53E2B874D3691E69742BDAEA3C9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        to demonstrate that the airman obtained such a certificate or rating through fraudulent means or through an examination that was inadequate to establish the qualifications of an airman.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HEE5FD6F9141B41C58911985E28C0B75F"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Standard of review
                     An order issued by the Administrator to amend, modify, suspend, or revoke an airman certificate after reexamination of the airman is subject to the standard of review provided for under section 2 of this Act.
                  
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H7FB520FC42FC443A9E534199C6F15E09"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            802.
            GAO REVIEW OF PILOT’S BILL OF RIGHTS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H4BFF7036F13249F795D6F3363803A178"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a study of the implementation of the Pilot’s Bill of Rights.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HBA1045049B7B44FFA11D03D6ED4FE7D4"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Contents
               In conducting the study under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall review—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1273D0876D9A492FAD5C81F8EA9DA979"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  the implementation and application of the Pilot’s Bill of Rights;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4A620681B31344F88B0F3E1464AD0875"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  the application of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure and the Federal Rules of Evidence to covered proceedings by the National Transportation Safety Board, as required by section 2 of the Pilot’s Bill of Rights; 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC9C7011A035B48CBA8C40F43F31FBD65"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  the appeal process and the typical length of time associated with a final determination in a covered proceeding; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD0EF95D65BFB4AA2A33863B98F3FA795"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  any impacts of the implementation of the Pilot’s Bill of Rights. 
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H426DDBBDDDEA4F849F41A4FA16E2FC9D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Definitions
               In this section:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H250D35CFCF53411F9DACEAA6BA6AA4B0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Covered proceeding
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">covered proceeding means a proceeding conducted under subpart C, D, or F of part 821 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, relating to denial, amendment, modification, suspension, or revocation of an airman certificate.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF3FB6F387625409683BC858272BAED33"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Pilot’s Bill of Rights
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Pilot’s Bill of Rights means the Pilot’s Bill of Rights (Public Law 112–153). 
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H22C67AA65ABE40129AA351F63BFB7DFC"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            803.
            DATA PRIVACY
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD07D206DCC4F41619F275F12DC294C16"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               
                  Chapter 441 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H9C3846B4818C4D8790E853976062D5B0"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF63EEDA417594BD3A6A0C9DE24FAADFC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     44114.
                     PRIVACY
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H88FBACCE2603482A89FC51857143166D"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        In general
                        Notwithstanding any other provision of law, including section 552(b)(3) of title 5, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall establish and update as necessary a process by which, upon request of a private aircraft owner or operator, the Administrator withholds the registration number and other similar identifiable data or information, except for physical markings required by law, of the aircraft of the owner or operator from any broad dissemination or display (except in furnished data or information made available to or from a Government agency pursuant to a government contract, subcontract, or agreement, including for traffic management purposes) for the noncommercial flights of the owner or operator.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HE6D3C3289E4946A9A17B96D0595416AE"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Withholding personally identifiable information on the aircraft registry
                        Not later than 2 years after the enactment of this Act and notwithstanding any other provision of law, including section 552(b)(3) of title 5, the Administrator shall establish a procedure by which, upon request of a private aircraft owner or operator, the Administrator shall withhold from broad dissemination or display by the FAA (except in furnished data or information made available to or from a Government agency pursuant to a government contract, subcontract, or agreement, including for traffic management purposes) the personally identifiable information of such individual, including on a publicly available website of the FAA.
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H7DED0521A3724C72A29B1940F61EDAD1"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (c)
                        ICAO aircraft identification code
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H02A4DEC9E956410DB5908AE2FE3C6F83"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           The Administrator shall establish a program for aircraft owners and operators to apply for a new ICAO aircraft identification code.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H62B468B0F55A4D80A6D59C6B5AD7E350"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Limitations
                           In carrying out the program described in paragraph (1), the Administrator shall require—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFC4AA3566E6E4A948756470C61CC03F3"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              each applicant to attest to a safety or security need in applying for a new ICAO aircraft identification code; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H91AF0E033EDC4EF4A233CA9A9D1B2CF6"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              each approved applicant who obtains a new ICAO aircraft identification code to comply with all applicable aspects of, or related to, part 45 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, including updating an aircraft’s registration number and N–Number to reflect such aircraft’s new ICAO aircraft identification code.
                           
                        
                     
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HF52131C9E10E4464AD56C76F1E241B40"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Definitions
                        In this section:
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3E65ED8C2F3F4FA9B34E98A95AD8DE87"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           ADS–B
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">ADS–B means automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA47E74409C5A4FC398F78111D6FAF2A8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           ICAO
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">ICAO means the International Civil Aviation Organization.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H369C037E18BE479B8BD1AC6E35CBC307"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           Personally identifiable information
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">personally identifiable information means—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H3BECC17879DD4A4BB3F0281E72258E56"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              the mailing address or registration address of an individual;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1ADAACCE8660484084C87CF7D1F11A72"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              an electronic address (including an email address) of an individual; or
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H0537DB97363E4904A4D432633C95F2BF"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              the telephone number of an individual.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5BA19B01AFBC47D1AE7930599A09753D"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              the names of the aircraft owner or operator, if the owner or operator is an individual.
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H1F8711D7CBE04782860783AAC7E83893"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Clerical amendment
               The analysis for chapter 441 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H8064F6B9BA28425F83DD208C831BEBD4"
                              style="OLC">
                  
                     44114. Privacy. 
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HCD64ED361E06457EA0240A1992D25AAC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Conforming amendment
               Section 566 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 44103 note) and the item relating to such section in the table of contents under section 1(b) of such Act are repealed.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H2AFC5F437087423FBB8F539B746B9879"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            804.
            ACCOUNTABILITY FOR AIRCRAFT REGISTRATION NUMBERS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H18D71B08554D4A38BEB0BC377F61E03F"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall initiate a review of the process for reserving aircraft registration numbers to ensure that such process offers an equal opportunity for members of the general public to obtain specific aircraft registration numbers.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HBD46DA30205F40F68314A9139A0EEB5D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Assessment
               In conducting the review under subsection (a), the Administrator shall assess the following:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA599D546158F4E4E88C6A436C52F33CC"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Whether the use of readily available software to prevent computer or web-based auto-fill systems from reserving aircraft registration numbers in bulk would improve participation in the reservation process by the general public.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5CB2F7B272074B3098166CD276FEF574"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Whether a limit should be imposed on the number of consecutive years a person may reserve an aircraft registration number.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2D51E251A4FB41BB844A7C80B7BED41A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Briefing
               Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the review conducted under subsection (a), including any recommendations of the Administrator to improve equal participation in the process for reserving aircraft registration numbers by the general public.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HB4E1B113E753468793847EA1F21D30A5"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            805.
            TIMELY RESOLUTION OF INVESTIGATIONS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE1BCD1E2BD0A4BE2AA604FF719199FEC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 2 years after the date of issuance of a letter of investigation to any person, as required by section 2(b) of the Pilot's Bill of Rights (49 U.S.C. 44703 note), the Administrator shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE3D97B8F23B9462FA42FE18C2969DAAB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  make a determination regarding such investigation and pursue subsequent action; or
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HAEE333D3C49240BB9F82A43870AF4D1E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  close such investigation.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H55249703E0A24CCBAC8DAF5A1EFE7B6C"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Extension
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HDF6DAA43FD3A431D80EB17404399B81D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  If, upon review of the facts and status of an investigation described in subsection (a), the Administrator determines that the time provided to make a final determination or close such investigation is insufficient, the Administrator shall approve an extension of such investigation for 2 years.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HBB0DDB8B647F426E948CF66B66EFB331"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Additional extensions
                  The Administrator may approve consecutive extensions under paragraph (1).
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H484B46842A1A4CACA8539190975B4497"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Delegation
               The Administrator may not delegate the authority to approve an extension described in subsection (b) to anyone other than the leadership of the Administration as described in section 106(b) of title 49, United States Code.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HD00571B051F147BA97F5B08258C2C726"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            806.
            ALL MAKES AND MODELS AUTHORIZATION
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H9A4EA65D29124FEAB8837DA42B970B25"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC0ACBEDE94BE48E1AEAA1A7B56E35793"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Unlimited letter of authorization
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall take such action as may be necessary to allow for the issuance of letters of authorizations to airmen with the authorization for—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0E684126D7114AF393F8AD527A3BE169"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     all types and makes of experimental high–performance single engine piston powered aircraft; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H81BE691228644B73883FA6401408E918"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     all types and makes of experimental high–performance multiengine piston powered aircraft.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HDE187B4FFAAB4819B20C688420861C91"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Requirements
                  An individual who holds a letter of authorization and applies for an authorization described in paragraph (1)(A) or (1)(B)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDD8137AF8BCC4BE6AA3340E969CC21E4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     shall be given an all-makes and models authorization of—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC3934C7487184491A34ED866E1932C52"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        experimental single–engine piston powered authorized aircraft; or
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF9E29348EA5F4DC7B00B5470DDBC778F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        experimental multiengine piston powered authorized aircraft;
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3556F3AA2C9548DCA16659DAB80AF3CF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     shall hold the appropriate category and class rating for the authorized aircraft;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB281CC41C10E4224B78C317C6B24BF40"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     shall hold 3 experimental aircraft authorizations in aircraft of the same category and class rating for the authorization sought; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD2C7314A35824AF38D4F40555832A21D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     may become qualified in additional experimental aircraft by completing aircraft-specific ground and flight training.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H04090E4F304B419B83CC36EBE75C0EAC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Rule of construction
               Nothing in this section may be construed to disallow an individual from being given both an authorization described in paragraph (1)(A) and an authorization described in paragraph (1)(B).
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HCDC14C8F833A46999EE88ADDE769B694"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Failure to comply
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4D027D5222B0433C9CC0AE7FAC0BF64C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  If the Administrator fails to implement subsection (a) within the time period prescribed in such subsection, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the status of the implementation of such subsection on a monthly basis until the implementation is complete.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H78D67D230A2F45E286C1F0D2F89FD798"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  No delegation
                  The Administrator may not delegate the briefing described in paragraph (1).
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HAE93A7F444A64893AF3F1F705887882D"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            807.
            RESPONSE TO LETTER OF INVESTIGATION
             Section 2(b) of the Pilot’s Bill of Rights (49 U.S.C. 44703 note) is amended by adding at the end the following:
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="HD45EDB22DE7E4D8596E6B1D26AEAE93A"
                           style="OLC">
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9CE997336A724EA399258F1D86923FF2"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  Response to letter of investigation
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H83EA2E6EAD3444A5901ED388EB5B94F9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     In general
                     If an individual decides to respond to a Letter of Investigation described in paragraph (2)(B), such individual may respond not later than 30 days after receipt of such Letter, including providing written comments on the incident to the investigating office.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H38BCA4EDA52C41358C2FDB0A356E71B2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Construction
                     Nothing in this paragraph shall be construed to diminish the authority of the Administrator (as of the day before the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024) to take emergency action relating to an airman certificate.
                  
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HFACE5C2155BA4E52B954F56326BD0416"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            808.
            ADS–B OUT EQUIPAGE STUDY; VEHICLE-TO-VEHICLE LINK PROGRAM
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HCFB2C3BEB9E141E0BEE4E7869DCB0348"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Study and briefing on ADS–B out equipage
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD3E90903AEBC4783870A84913A636F5E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Study
