         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE92F131AA92A4CCABCE707060EF3E882"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            824.
            MODERNIZATION OF SPECIAL AIRWORTHINESS CERTIFICATION RULEMAKING DEADLINE
            Not later than 24 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall issue a final rule for the rulemaking activity titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">Modernization of Special Airworthiness Certification, published in Fall 2022 in the long-term actions of the Unified Agenda of Federal Regulatory and Deregulatory Actions (RIN 2120–AL50).
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HFB0A1801F6B8456B982074388908BEDA"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            825.
            EXCLUSION OF GYROPLANES FROM FUEL SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
            Section 44737 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H38D2ACC3DC984A7BBF2CA052E5648735"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">rotorcraft and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">helicopter each place it appears;
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HD78853BDE48B4F5EB1F8982E1ADCC801"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               in the heading for paragraph (2) of subsection (a) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">
                     rotorcraft
                   and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">
                     helicopter
                  ; and
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="H56CA29E19B1546F993FDB859DA5140BE"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (3)
               by adding at the end the following: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H0B89C4CDD8D44A8495E194290823AC63"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H6FCB6DD522E64FD583A360A7C8BB74DC"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Exception
                     A helicopter issued an experimental certificate under section 21.191 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulations), or operating under a Special Flight Permit issued under section 21.197 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulations), is excepted from the requirements of this section. 
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H85FA2A8E482A410A95E5CF168AC5BBB9"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            826.
            PUBLIC AIRCRAFT FLIGHT TIME LOGGING ELIGIBILITY
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HB1190D54F41C41FC92755C47952AB4F3"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Forestry and fire protection flight time logging
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF40EC2F69A74413CB734F2E790A51B11"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Notwithstanding any other provision of law, aircraft under the direct operational control of forestry and fire protection agencies are eligible to log pilot flight times, if the flight time was acquired by the pilot while engaged on an official forestry or fire protection flight, in the same manner as aircraft under the direct operational control of a Federal, State, county, or municipal law enforcement agency.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H93EB3B94D53F45BF996D8DB0E2AE4090"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Retroactive application
                  Paragraph (1) shall be applied as if enacted on October 5, 2018.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H5CFED5A33C4B4A9BA44F7BE1FA712B32"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Regulations
               Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall make such regulatory changes as are necessary to conform to the requirements of this section.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H2DF083918CBE4E3F9E76F533E5DEB4D3"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            827.
            EAGLE INITIATIVE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2AAA3A73B2954DB1A54E0CED2D7973E9"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               EAGLE initiative
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA638548240DD4F59A875EE790CE55A4C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  The Administrator shall continue to partner with industry and other Federal Government stakeholders in carrying out the Eliminate Aviation Gasoline Lead Emissions Initiative (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">EAGLE Initiative) through the end of 2030.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HC5DDE9C6957E4170B93CFA9315081DB7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  FAA responsibilities
                  In collaborating with industry and other Government stakeholders to carry out the EAGLE Initiative, the Administrator shall take such actions as may be necessary under the authority of the Administrator to facilitate—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1136D6B1B33A4F76B3ABB84C39E659D5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the safe elimination of the use of leaded aviation gasoline by piston-engine aircraft by the end of 2030 without adversely affecting the safe and efficient operation of the piston-engine aircraft fleet;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H352152D61C3F451FB0190C8F9ECC87D1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     the approval of the use of unleaded alternatives to leaded aviation gasoline for use in all piston-engine aircraft types and piston-engine models;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBDBAF7646B0B42629200754762B3A83B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     the implementation of the requirements of section 47107(a)(22) of title 49, United States Code, as added by this Act, as such requirements relate to the continued availability of aviation gasoline; 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2DF801A2A7FC41E6A21E7277477EE0CC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     efforts to make unleaded aviation gasoline that is approved for use in piston-engine aircraft and engines widely available for purchase and use at airports in the National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA96FA3EC83454FEDA2C22B0A28FD4D93"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     the development of a transition plan to safely enable the transition of the piston-engine general aviation aircraft fleet to unleaded aviation gasoline by 2030, to the extent practicable.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCD4284DCD71A4D639E6C7596A8CBBC8E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Activities
                  In carrying out the responsibilities of the Administrator pursuant to paragraph (2), the Administrator shall, at a minimum—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEBA0CCFCCE9945618EF85D66224CD81B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     maintain a fleet authorization process for the efficient approval or authorization of eligible piston-engine aircraft and engine models to operate safely using qualified unleaded aviation gasolines;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9B2C771D95BB4EC39F9D31B32D591025"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     review, update, and prioritize, as soon as practicable, certification processes and projects, as necessary, for aircraft engines and modifications to such engines to operate with unleaded aviation gasoline;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA3F4314BE5FD4813B0F7D3881192F1F4"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     seek to facilitate programs that accelerate the creation, evaluation, qualification, deployment, and use of unleaded aviation gasolines;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA20593D439024E6EB0514B35BA961580"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     carry out, in partnership with the general aviation community, an ongoing campaign for training and educating aircraft owners and operators on how to safely transition to unleaded aviation gasoline;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H79C684D3FFB84221BB1D8F1741125FAC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     evaluate aircraft and aircraft engines to ensure that such aircraft and aircraft engines can safely operate with unleaded aviation gasoline candidates during cold weather conditions; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE80072E98C6E4A739912C14765DD27D6"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     facilitate the development of agency policies and processes, as appropriate, to support the deployment of necessary infrastructure at airports to enable the distribution and storage of unleaded aviation gasolines.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2691ED6A3D6D464F9B576CFB79E0B52C"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Consultation and collaboration with relevant stakeholders
                  In carrying out the EAGLE Initiative, the Administrator shall continue to consult and collaborate, as appropriate, with relevant stakeholders, including—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H69428A36DF864764BDFCB129F6B3CC34"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     general aviation aircraft engine, aircraft propulsion, and aircraft airframe manufacturers;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7DA1B18403E64AC6B336598C49D85C97"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     general aviation aircraft users, aircraft owners, aircraft pilots, and aircraft operators;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H04BA06F0E2C04606A2084151B1F67572"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     airports and fixed-base operators;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAAD42F16A4BC4B60BAB7CEF1314159B3"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     State, local, and Tribal aviation officials;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8196DD1EA9D641C69DF42E667EF78E45"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     representatives of the petroleum industry, including developers, refiners, producers, and distributors of unleaded aviation gasolines; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2C964DEE79624470A87D3C29DEE4B8C0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     air carriers and commercial operators operating under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H154B7B89ADB047D4A2A1BB3103B9FC3F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Report to Congress
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA030CA5EBC45426F827C50CB52555740"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Initial report
                     Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report that—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD6E7EAFFF2A84A31982FD7085F6F471C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        contains an updated strategic plan for maintaining a fleet authorization process for the efficient approval and authorization of eligible piston-engine aircraft and engine models to operate using unleaded aviation gasolines in a manner that ensures safety;
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD45DCC722B7642D48A3864DE7E4C87EC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        describes the structure and involvement of all FAA offices that have responsibilities described in paragraph (2); and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HADC33F6395A444369F56E784B2C90746"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iii)
                        identifies policy initiatives, regulatory initiatives, or legislative initiatives needed to improve and enhance the timely and safe transition to unleaded aviation gasoline for the piston-engine aircraft fleet.
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H47827DD7831F45138A167C1A86BF7675"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     Annual briefing
                     Not later than 1 year after the date on which the Administrator submits the initial report under subparagraph (A), and annually thereafter through 2030, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on activities and progress of the EAGLE Initiative.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6513904922C24236854CC756F7EF62A5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     Sunset
                     Subparagraph (B) shall cease to be effective after December 31, 2030.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HE1CA76C614844FFA809EC253FF17144C"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Transition plan to unleaded aviation gasoline
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3DB4650EA952425CBD84F4799423E9FB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  In developing the transition plan under subsection (a)(2)(E), the Administrator may, at a minimum, assess the following:
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4B8A69A7EB19435B9F2DDA158ACA5C84"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     Efforts undertaken by the EAGLE Initiative, including progress towards—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA91D4079C42F4F1B9147921C4D7E89D1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        safely eliminating the use of leaded aviation gasoline by piston-engine aircraft by the end of 2030 without adversely affecting the safe and efficient operation of the piston-engine aircraft fleet; 
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H43400F7664A849E3B02C449B2298EDC6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        approving the use of unleaded alternatives to leaded aviation gasoline for use in all piston-engine aircraft types and piston-engine models; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE9897BDEE26C46628C4789CAFAE7DA7D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iii)
                        facilitating efforts to make approved unleaded aviation gasoline that is approved for use in piston-engine aircraft and engines widely available at airports for purchase and use in the National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems.
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEB59598202A84E5A81B535AA94DB7791"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     The evaluation and development of necessary airport infrastructure, including fuel storage and dispensing facilities, to support the distribution and storage of unleaded aviation gasoline.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H937053970D1846B3A8F51530063B77C1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     The establishment of best practices for piston-engine aircraft owners and operators, airport operators and personnel, aircraft maintenance technicians, and other appropriate personnel for protecting against exposure to lead containment when—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5E3F503E446E4C1A864D282239460C44"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        conducting fueling operations;
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H05263B14D2D74E68B4D0FA376025ECFA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        disposing of inspected gasoline samples;
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H35DCC96D8421408C9B1C79152DB820AC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iii)
                        performing aircraft maintenance; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD33D43DBBA984FE39E19037BD587AC38"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iv)
                        conducting engine run-ups.
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC45F39E6D41441DEA7E86F66CB85D467"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     Efforts to address supply chain and other logistical barriers inhibiting the timely distribution of unleaded aviation gasoline to airports.
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBF1BF992F37E433287E36E039F453469"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     Outreach efforts to educate and update piston-engine aircraft owners and operators, airport operators, and other members of the general aviation community on the potential benefits, availability, and safety of unleaded aviation gasoline.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2AA0438955FD4FD2AAEE79E1B92D3E6D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Publication; guidance
                  Upon completion of developing such transition plan, the Administrator shall—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC479FB75EFC2479F8069E53DAF75A659"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     make the plan available to the public on an appropriate website of the FAA; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5E02A4A1E7234666B75C97B43F26DF2C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     provide guidance supporting the implementation of the transition plan.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HDEC64A43639F46C8ADCD2F087B5E242E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Collaboration with EAGLE Initiative
                  In supporting the development of such transition plan and issuing associated guidance pertaining to the implementation of such transition plan, the Administrator shall consult and collaborate with individuals carrying out the EAGLE Initiative.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H583F79496CF4478AA0A8B4B73CB09C35"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Unleaded aviation gasoline communication materials
                  The Administrator may collaborate with individuals carrying out the EAGLE Initiative to jointly develop and continuously update websites, brochures, and other communication materials associated with such transition plan to clearly convey the availability of unleaded aviation gasoline at airports.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H33146A1D35D04934AD46E4E29FCFAC66"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Briefing to Congress
                  Not later than 60 days after the publication of such transition plan, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on such transition plan and any agency efforts or actions pertaining to the implementation of such transition plan.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA0F51C2F79B5480EBF4114C9F423CE5E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  Savings clause
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to delay or alter the ongoing work of the EAGLE Initiative established by the Administrator in 2022.
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H0FD99FFBBF694045AD13B3E6FCD8660C"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            828.
            EXPANSION OF BASICMED
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HD3F6EBCF447645C4AD0D919F27AD7678"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Section 2307 of the FAA Extension, Safety, and Security Act of 2016 (49 U.S.C. 44703 note) is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HDD4BF99C3F7D4F54B6558773DC321DD1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in subsection (a)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD240072F1B9448B1A41C31051F4AB97B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H45CE1FF01ED94C1FBC94F457766F78F2"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF01921DF6D924A9A871918B68D294908"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           the individual holds a medical certificate issued by the Federal Aviation Administration or has held such a certificate at any time after July 14, 2006;
                        
                        ;
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA7E31FA02CF6475182DA6E7D31CADC3E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     in paragraph (7) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">calendar before <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">months; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HB13FC60D6ED342A380103593AB1B3081"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     in paragraph (8)(A) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">5 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">6;
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H33831FA9E5CB4055A827762DB4CCA553"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  in subsection (b)(2)(A)(i) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">(or any successor form) after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">(3–99);
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD4C6988171F5493DB79BCDE91A63E353"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  by striking subsection (h) and inserting the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H96777825A78B4D01A9F6644DD82582DD"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H861677CC991C41F696EF7A4E3EC189FC"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (h)
                        Report required
                        Not later than 4 years after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, the Administrator, in coordination with the National Transportation Safety Board, shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a report that describes the effect of the regulations issued or revised under subsection (a) and includes statistics with respect to changes in small aircraft activity and safety incidents.
                     
                     ; and
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4FB9A47E2A414DFBB0AC940B419A521F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  by striking subsection (j) and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HCF409B2F79A046D0A09738AF93C0C35E"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HF640639F2B6042A69AADF1965DE74E8F"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (j)
                        Covered aircraft defined
                        In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">covered aircraft means an aircraft that—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H57E534A1CC704DF48270F98D2C06EDAD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           is authorized under Federal law to carry not more than 7 occupants;
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1C2C06A464064F0D93FA9C114E009FD1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           has a maximum certificated takeoff weight of not more than 12,500 pounds; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7242829114574CEF934B77962A0249A2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           is not a transport category rotorcraft certified to airworthiness standards under part 29 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H43B180A2E49D4860B88F444098B96513"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Rulemaking
               The Administrator shall update regulations in parts 61 and 68 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, as necessary, to implement the amendments made by this section.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H4BC7458CE5A24FA3BB9B5759F549E065"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Applicability
               Beginning on the date that is 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall apply parts 61 and 68, Code of Federal Regulations, in a manner reflecting the amendments made by this section.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE8F6A45B4D864CD3A31D0B7D8775056B"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            829.
            PROHIBITION ON USING ADS–B OUT DATA TO INITIATE AN INVESTIGATION
            Section 46101 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="H3C622AB94B5E4113B24EEF201C35D8F6"
                           style="OLC">
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4CB6CA18A05642ACBBCC271C8481DE84"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Prohibition on using ADS–B out data to initiate an investigation
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3ACE5CEF91834298A1C3E7AFD4ACB2BB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration may not initiate an investigation (excluding a criminal investigation) of a person based exclusively on automatic dependent surveillance–broadcast data.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAFC89E6ACEFE49A6BD5EEEC98DB10CE7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Rule of construction
                     Nothing in this subsection shall prohibit the use of automatic dependent surveillance–broadcast data in an investigation that was initiated for any reason other than the review of automatic dependent surveillance–broadcast data, including if such investigation was initiated as a result of a report or complaint submitted to the Administrator.
                  
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H4540955E2E1D4016A09AD79E633B4A92"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            830.
            CHARITABLE FLIGHT FUEL REIMBURSEMENT EXEMPTIONS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H58142D02840A426C919814CC42F1B0C0"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3D39627A906D4305B0C708FCE742DE20"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Validity of exemption
                  Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, an exemption from section 61.113(c) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, that is granted by the Administrator for the purpose of allowing a volunteer pilot to accept reimbursement from a volunteer pilot organization for the fuel costs and airport fees attributed to a flight operation to provide charitable transportation pursuant to section 821 of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) shall be valid for 5 years.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HAE27FD14739643A9A5721DCC555F0268"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Failing to adhere
                  If the Administrator finds an exemption holder under paragraph (1) or a volunteer pilot fails to adhere to the conditions and limitations of the exemption described under such paragraph, the Administrator may rescind or suspend the exemption. 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD7DDFAACE55744BCA9B10219C6CFA3FE"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  No longer qualifying
                  If the Administrator finds that such exemption holder no longer qualifies as a volunteer pilot organization, the Administrator shall rescind such exemption. 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1D3BEF1270954024816C980C723DB2DB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Forgoing exemption
                  If such exemption holder informs the Administrator that such holder no longer plans to exercise the authority granted by such exemption, the Administrator may rescind such exemption.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H443C651B42E242D18EB66154271F07DA"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Additional requirements
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA3654DA7DD304F088AA4BF3B7593D790"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  A volunteer pilot organization may impose additional safety requirements on a volunteer pilot without—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5C3DECF30FEB4DC69DF19DC51857C979"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     being considered—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAC119550840E4E5598ED916000517A72"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        an air carrier (as such term is defined in section 40102 of title 49, United States Code); or
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD161EFB98F294790AB07BA9AC20DB49E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        a commercial operator (as such term is defined in section 1.1 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations); or
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA767BFBB14994273A26424787FC92AD1"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     constituting common carriage.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCDF0906B8E614FDBA319E60BEF331153"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Savings clause
                  Nothing in this subsection may be construed to limit or otherwise affect the authority of the Administrator to regulate, as appropriate, a flight operation associated with a volunteer pilot organization that constitutes a commercial operation or common carriage.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H57B687D0CFC945B8B9D918D900E23D4A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Reissuance of existing exemptions
               In reissuing an expiring exemption described in subsection (a) that was originally issued prior to the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall ensure that the reissued exemption—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7B86A88F1F104A6DAA610B345380E5CD"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  accounts for the provisions of this section and section 821 of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note); and 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6E3E6A2043DF45AA87620C8A320CF050"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  is otherwise substantially similar to the previously issued exemption.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HEBA0DA359D1E4B7D9E5800D4A4917FB5"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Statutory construction
               Nothing in this section shall be construed to—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCD14576F61334B3B8F47D8E2AC0F7796"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  affect the authority of the Administrator to exempt a pilot (exercising the private pilot privileges) from any restriction on receiving reimbursement for the fuel costs and airport fees attributed to a flight operation to provide charitable transportation; or
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCDF2D5154FA14897897D0ED91AEE36D1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  impose or authorize the imposition of any additional requirements by the Administrator on a flight that is arranged by a volunteer pilot organization in which the volunteer pilot—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8D3B15335395455CB014FD679749B6DC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     is not reimbursed the fuel costs and airport fees attributed to a flight operation to provide charitable flights; or
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8AF0E7B85EC9409B9EB0936821E46BCD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     pays a pro rata share of expenses as described in section 61.113(c) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6FB64B70F9FD42FF8DA6CF867E4D091C"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (e)
               Definitions
               In this section:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9723FA26F6E24F1AA50C77F4A7F7C825"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Volunteer pilot
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">volunteer pilot means a person who—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0770AD39F1FB4198AEABEFCA385B6C89"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     acts as a pilot in command of a flight operation to provide charitable transportation pursuant to section 821 of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note); and 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4D168C1AA681464F81A5DC61A2106E92"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     holds a private pilot certificate, commercial pilot certificate, or an airline transportation pilot certificate issued under part 61 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H08EFC1F3E11A4C9BBF8FE32BDEA5B5F5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Volunteer pilot organization
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">volunteer pilot organization has the meaning given such term in section 821(c) of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note). 
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H2441102FFACE46BFBA3A35807878BDCE"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            831.
            GAO REPORT ON CHARITABLE FLIGHTS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2660076B33304B6AB485752756E82E12"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Report
               Not later than 4 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall initiate a review of the following:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H419C605C26BE419182855F80407BA8B3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Applicable laws, regulations, policies, legal opinions, and guidance pertaining to charitable flights and the operations of such flights, including reimbursement of fuel costs.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H984AE9E5F93740E88338DFD64486EA24"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Petitions for exemption from the requirements of section 61.113(c) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, for the purpose of allowing a pilot to accept reimbursement for the fuel costs associated with a flight operation to provide charitable transportation pursuant to section 821 of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note), including assessment of—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HBEC8D260C5A542D0BF281A802585DB76"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the conditions and limitations a petitioner shall comply with if the exemption is granted and whether such conditions and limitations are—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA771F05C69584826ACD4AF6A9C3622D7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        applied to petitioners in a consistent manner; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H26E7752C272940CEB5AC1495CAE78CBF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        commensurate with the types of flight operations exemption holders propose to conduct under any such exemptions;
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEA9CFF4EB69D42DFA0386CA643DBD3EF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     denied petitions for such an exemption and the reasons for the denial of such petitions; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H31419CC561E441CFADC0B9139109DFA7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     the processing time of a petition for such an exemption.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HB596000B66B24DABA04995624C434E9F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Charitable flights conducted without an exemption from section 61.113(c) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, including an analysis of the certificates, qualifications, and aeronautical experience of the operators of such flights.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H566EACB682F8403A8D6A34A04C19005E"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Consultation
               In carrying out the review initiated under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall consult with charitable organizations, including volunteer pilot organizations, aircraft owners, and pilots who volunteer to provide transportation for or on behalf of a charitable organization, flight safety experts, and employees of the FAA.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H3123DBC30F634D139B906A5881AE4C17"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Recommendations
               As part of the review initiated under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall make recommendations, as determined appropriate, to the Administrator to improve the rules, policies, and guidance pertaining to charitable flight operations.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H48B7BE2BC2A64833A41F95127EF84B96"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Report
               Upon completion of the review initiated under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report describing the findings of such review and recommendations developed under subsection (c).
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H7A9DCAD96AFD4C5CAA9350E4445B9A41"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            832.
            FLIGHT INSTRUCTION OR TESTING
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H85DC55D8246C4239A361660A54BBDA31"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Authorized additional pilots
               An individual acting as an authorized additional pilot during Phase I flight testing of aircraft holding an experimental airworthiness certificate, in accordance with section 21.191 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and meeting the requirements set forth in FAA regulations and policy in effect as of the date of enactment of this Act, shall not be deemed to be operating an aircraft carrying persons or property for compensation or hire.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6C509D846A324D5E8F9E7B9FF0B7D503"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Use of aircraft
               An individual who uses, causes to use, or authorizes to use aircraft for flights conducted under subsection (a) shall not be deemed to be operating an aircraft carrying persons or property for compensation or hire.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H1FD98088E5624596BBA09277EB6D2EFB"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Revision of rules
               The Administrator shall, as necessary, issue, revise, or repeal the rules, regulations, guidance, or procedures of the FAA to conform to the requirements of this section.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE3933BEEC4B04DFEAE92660E8EFFE6C6"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            833.
            NATIONAL COORDINATION AND OVERSIGHT OF DESIGNATED PILOT EXAMINERS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H93E33B5CC27A4019A1DEAFE2043F76AA"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               The Administrator shall establish an office to provide oversight and facilitate national coordination of designated pilot examiners appointed under section 183.23 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2C0F08944FB64DCB881C7B5FB653CEE2"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Responsibilities
               The office described in subsection (a) shall be responsible for the following:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H22F513A3FE3E4BF2BB8F8056A5495B0E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Oversight of designated pilot examiners appointed under section 183.23 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H673F317795914B4B8194465539C9DBB7"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Coordinating with other offices, as appropriate, to support the standardization of policy, guidance, and regulations across the FAA pertaining to the selection, training, duties, and deployment of designated pilot examiners appointed under section 183.23 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, including evaluating the consistency by which such examiners apply Administration policies, orders, and guidance.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H57FE130566924063B337F955739F3B7F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Evaluating the consistency by which such examiners apply FAA policies, orders, and guidance.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9CCD98E9400342A59ECC8311DD6ECD48"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Coordinating placement and deployment of such examiners across regions based on demand for examinations from the pilot community.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H1C58C9B2587D48FC84636F35B6ECFE78"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Developing a code of conduct for such examiners.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE1F88EE9FDCB4BDD8001B3B41CFCAE6E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  Deploying a survey system to track the performance and merit of such examiners.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HCD1E98E59D7B4386BD3F3BA8871F1CB5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  Facilitating an industry partnership to create a formal mentorship program for such examiners.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HBB7669B4C4734DA6A87656C2EF31E1FC"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Coordination
               In carrying out the responsibilities listed in subsection (b), the Administrator shall ensure the office—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H134553BFEF7F4FDD8770FF14805FF107"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  coordinates on an ongoing basis with flight standards district offices, designated pilot examiner managing specialists, and aviation industry stakeholders, including representatives of the general aviation community; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H4F8C1F188182406499A34E0484BA0175"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  considers whether to implement the final recommendations report issued by the Designated Pilot Examiner Reforms Working Group and accepted by the Aviation Rulemaking Advisory Committee on June 17, 2021.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H9217AD75BD264EDF8ECD94A50AC478DE"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Report
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H263846D47A384730BD053F8E6FB39E9D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and biennially thereafter through fiscal year 2028, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report that evaluates the use of designated pilot examiners appointed under section 183.23 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation), for testing, including both written and practical tests.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H60E008FFCC054A5BA416BD486F03F4B3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Contents
                  The report under paragraph (1) shall include an analysis of—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H89DA2BF789D94F588D4DA3960C011657"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the methodology and rationale by which designated pilot examiners are deployed;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H08D36425CB4E4779B5CAE28211D6E7D5"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     with respect to the previous fiscal year, the average time an individual in each region must wait to schedule an appointment with a designated pilot examiner;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF9A7AEAD55D2427FBB5E94725410727A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     with respect to the previous fiscal year, the estimated total time individuals in each region were forced to wait to schedule an appointment with a designated pilot examiner;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA0A3526CA6424C1CA208CBAB82696D19"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     the primary reasons and best ways to reduce wait times described in subparagraph (C);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H18DD2554B06C4D2D8350E5F98B75B79A"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     the number of tests conducted by designated pilot examiners;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7453F31286884304B9CDC89C16A2544C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     the number and percentage of available designated pilot examiners that perform such tests; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H297CBA02C16140E89546AAA9740E87E7"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (G)
                     the average rate of retests, including of both written and practical tests.
                  
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H211088BFC5304A8B8CB985A55D5242A8"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            834.
            PART 135 PILOT SUPPLEMENTAL OXYGEN REQUIREMENT
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H8E0689E963A84FBF9C42C0332AB02697"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking concerning whether to revise the requirements under paragraphs (3) and (4) of section 135.89(b) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, to apply only to aircraft operating at altitudes above flight level 410.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H052070386E944292A232290E0355177E"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Considerations
               In issuing the notice of proposed rulemaking, the Administrator shall consider applicable safety data and risks, including in relation to applicable incidents and accidents, as well as the investigations and recommendations of the National Transportation Safety Board.
            
         
      
      <title id="H409EA2FED9014183ACAA10DEDB0A4E65"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         IX
         NEW ENTRANTS AND AEROSPACE INNOVATION
         <subtitle id="H1D1BE26279434F138CDE725FCECD20C2"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"

            Unmanned Aircraft Systems
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"

               DEFINITIONS
               Except as otherwise provided, the definitions contained in section 44801 of title 49, United States Code, apply to this subtitle.

                      id="H048BFF254DB34C32A692579E704BFEEB"

                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               902.
               UNMANNED AIRCRAFT IN THE ARCTIC

                            id="HADDBFD5E522E476895C006658B30A437"

                  In general

                              id="HB2677C63FDCA474E869F2B22C490AA48"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">

                     in the section heading by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           Small unmanned
                         and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           Unmanned
                        ; and

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"

                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               904.
               AIRPORT SAFETY AND AIRSPACE HAZARD MITIGATION AND ENFORCEMENT
               Section 44810 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5A6363472FC84CDA89C41C36D66A3757"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in subsection (c) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">, and any other location the Administrator determines appropriate after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Data; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE8F3CACE87604B9FB842FA4FD1BA5E02"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  in subsection (h) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">May 10, 2024 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">September 30, 2028.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H166F093D1A5B47B09917CA9D253E87A5"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               905.
               RADAR DATA PILOT PROGRAM
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H76CDE4C51E614A3AAE4F4331DCD70775"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Sensitive radar data feed pilot program
                  Not later than 270 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator, in coordination with the Secretary of Defense, and other heads of relevant Federal agencies, shall establish a pilot program to make airspace data feeds containing controlled unclassified information available to qualified users (as determined by the Administrator), consistent with subsection (b). 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD79D768A9C7F4E8F9D26A81A2F2BA083"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Authorization
                  In carrying out subsection (a), the Administrator, in coordination with the Secretary of Defense and other heads of relevant Federal agencies, shall establish a process to authorize qualified users to receive airspace data feeds containing controlled unclassified information related to air traffic within the national airspace system and use such information in an agreed upon manner to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H581E32F8A8E64CA9AC270F89AAE6CF53"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     provide and enable—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE57B1C477862460BB2E12CCE02EA5A22"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        air traffic management services; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8AEDA6DB1D8640078DDDAB841147D6FF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        unmanned aircraft system traffic management services; or
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0D308411FD8F4BF68BB9FBBB40A62BD3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     to test technologies that may enable or enhance the provision of the services described in paragraph (1).
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H072EF084B87E443DA4424BAED6E5DDF3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Consultation
                  In establishing the process described in subsection (b), the Administrator shall consult with representatives of the unmanned aircraft systems industry and related technical groups to identify an efficient, secure, and effective format and method for providing data described in this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4D19F1CD76464B75BDC917F3D92EDAC7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Briefing
                  Not later than 90 days after establishing the pilot program under subsection (a), and annually thereafter through 2028, the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress on the findings of the pilot program established under this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFBB00D6EFDA743139706C1E3E956976A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Sunset
                  This section shall cease to be effective on October 1, 2028.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H8F5D1CAB7A46446F989C18F14B83FD9C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               906.
               ELECTRONIC CONSPICUITY STUDY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H29B88EE0ED984350BB7CE1FD3E5A3DAA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Comptroller General shall conduct a study of technologies and methods that may be used by operators of unmanned aircraft systems to detect and avoid manned aircraft that may lawfully operate below 500 feet above ground level and that are—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H87CE5BCB3CDE4D5F8552C6634652F365"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     not equipped with a transponder or automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast out equipment; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF1EC781D0EB746E19DC90A0FB0B3C096"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     otherwise not electronically conspicuous.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8A87512EC2404A2E8854A0AEE4B64231"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Consultation
                  In conducting the study required under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall consult with—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2E2C4A83F6DB45F2966D76A2DAEA0563"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     representatives of—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF00441C35F534770A26F85292F0F9501"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        unmanned aircraft systems manufacturers and operators;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9052110D17434581970C872CA2BBD3D6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        general aviation operators;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB7B876C110F841E8A1031DCE0545902D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        agricultural aircraft operators; 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAABBE8F5D81647788951F35F854265F4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        helicopter operators; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8DACF4CF5A5D475AAE0CB111FEE5FD32"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        State and local governments; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H56952CB3C7BD4D1684C8E446EA0C7321"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     any other stakeholder the Comptroller General determines appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4F5837BDD75D48CEACEDA485420E5A84"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report describing the results of such study.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H42AF67F7EE974077B402C87F8B7E32DD"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               907.
               REMOTE IDENTIFICATION ALTERNATIVE MEANS OF COMPLIANCE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6F475E23CF944B8785CF4BDF1B85CFC1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Evaluation
                  The Administrator shall review and evaluate the final rule of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Remote Identification of Unmanned Aircraft, issued on January 15, 2021 (86 Fed. Reg. 4390), to determine whether unmanned aircraft manufacturers and operators can meet the intent of such final rule through alternative means of compliance, including through network–based remote identification.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H653F8709F56D47D9A4AC0C63FE1E7570"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Report
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on the results of the evaluation under subsection (a).
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H25A9371BBE8648B09E7C94EBC7B3A544"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               908.
               PART 107 WAIVER IMPROVEMENTS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3B487EE13A5A4E85987D14CC7DD45DA1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Administrator shall adopt a performance- and risk-based approach in reviewing requests for certificates of waiver under section 107.200 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2EAAD3E9083942C28D11D5AE600E13CE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Standardization of waiver application
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAC4351639CCA493A84E11711D2AE5FE1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     In carrying out subsection (a), the Administrator shall improve the process to submit requests for certificates of waiver described in subsection (a).
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H32BB9A4415C9475C8D1DAA58986269DE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
