            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HE5F375F375D748FABBB6C962F110CFC3"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               920.
               EXTENSION OF BEYOND PROGRAM
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3785A0AF245A4346A948FB527AFEBDB8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  FAA BEYOND program extension
                  The Administrator shall extend the BEYOND program of the FAA as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of this Act (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Program) and the existing agreements with State, local, and Tribal governments entered into under the Program until the date on which the Administrator determines the Program is no longer necessary or useful.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0CAB12B9F5404566B7FAF49BAF1ABE30"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  FAA BEYOND Program Expansion
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF290A5C7434443CEA35809262900EA0D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Administrator shall consider expanding the Program to include additional State, local, and Tribal governments to test and evaluate the use of new and emerging aviation concepts and technologies to evaluate and inform FAA policies, rulemaking, and guidance related to the safe integration of such concepts and technologies into the national airspace system.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7E26CE383C34460A8AC75E435D6F3A05"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Scope
                     If the Administrator determines the Program should be expanded, the Administrator shall address additional factors in the Program, including—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF189E7058F594D2D927969F94103519D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        increasing automation in civil aircraft, including unmanned aircraft systems and new or emerging aviation technologies;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA445F49549DE402885EFD268A45FDC94"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        operations of such systems and technologies, including beyond visual line of sight; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H13CD1906F91F49B990BBB41471D22843"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the societal and economic impacts of such operations.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDAC054D7A7F64866B1D9BE076F108C3D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Additional waiver authority
                     In carrying out an expansion of the Program, the Administrator may waive the requirements of section 44711 of title 49, United States Code, including related regulations, under any BEYOND program agreement to the extent consistent with aviation safety. 
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H47EBEC62DB774E5B89770082760CDDFB"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               921.
               UAS INTEGRATION STRATEGY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDB52393799854D14BEA7105DBDF65EC9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Administrator shall implement the recommendations made by—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBF13F562230E4E38B4795FA0DF7594BA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the Comptroller General to the Secretary contained in the report of the Government Accountability Office titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Drones: FAA Should Improve Its Approach to Integrating Drones into the National Airspace System, issued in January 2023 (GAO–23–105189); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H19D2DE1053E343729E4A173BECD38D34"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the inspector general of the Department of Transportation to the Administrator contained in the audit report of the inspector general titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">FAA Made Progress Through Its UAS Integration Pilot Program, but FAA and Industry Challenges Remain To Achieve Full UAS Integration, issued in April 2022 (Project ID: AV2022027).
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE2541FEDE06E44D4BE02A1D1A44131F2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Briefing
                  Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter through 2028, the Administrator shall provide a briefing to the appropriate committees of Congress that—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H09182269D51F42D9BEDABD7E68F03BCC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     provides a status update on the—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBFC1FE81FCD04E5EAD607704C5D8DC5F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        implementation of the recommendations described in subsection (a);
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H316A616923504E4D9C81FC3C2D6C2C07"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        implementation of statutory provisions related to unmanned aircraft system integration under subtitle B of title III of division B of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254); and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5EEC9B5AABD2432FB9D44DBDE5E41435"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        actions taken by the Administrator to implement recommendations related to safe integration of unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system included in aviation rulemaking committee reports published after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254);
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H27EE33706E33456998D8E70C77BD4F83"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     provides a description of steps taken to achieve the safe integration of such systems into the national airspace system, including milestones and performance metrics to track results;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB23FFCB643C941E5952596B1B92C731B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     provides the costs of executing the integration described in paragraph (2), including any estimates of future Federal resources or investments required to complete such integration; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF44897F7E7474D2F9C4EC6395B25E37C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     identifies any regulatory or policy changes required to execute the integration described in paragraph (2).
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD95B5606632240DCB8A650A59660D6A5"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               922.
               EXTENSION OF KNOW BEFORE YOU FLY CAMPAIGN
               Section 356 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254) is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">2019 through 2023 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">2024 through 2028. 
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HECE436717E604236BBEF500F8CAA8C4E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               923.
               PUBLIC AIRCRAFT DEFINITION
               Section 40125(a)(2) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF173EC0036554345A59BB0A103626B29"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">research, or and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">research,; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H2FB665B3A4854745A4F7E93655F02007"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">(including data collection on civil aviation systems undergoing research, development, test, or evaluation at a test range (as such term is defined in section 44801)), infrastructure inspections, or any other activity undertaken by a governmental entity that the Administrator determines is inherently governmental after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">biological or geological resource management.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HEB65407843304FDAAE99A014920C5E0A"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               924.
               FAA COMPREHENSIVE PLAN ON UAS AUTOMATION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA74104C2C0B64770A695BE034700304B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Comprehensive plan
                  The Administrator shall establish a comprehensive plan for the integration of autonomous unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA5A9EBB1E304473AB1D2C7FAB1F2A82B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Comprehensive plan contents
                  In establishing the comprehensive plan under subsection (a), the Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H60D5179A42B141369A2826374476CFF6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     identify FAA processes and regulations that need to change to accommodate the increasingly automated role of a remote operator of an unmanned aircraft system; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H95DC5095FB7E4674931D94401F2247EB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     identify how the Administrator intends to authorize operations ranging from low risk automated operations to increasingly complex automated operations of such systems.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HCD40C69A8E0247B5AB01FB1A62CBABE9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Coordination
                  In establishing the comprehensive plan under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consult with—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2C5D40A5213241CFA2814EF8C0ADF6C0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the National Aeronautics and Space Administration;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1ECDA6DB6D944774A30CAC09D42AC38A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the Department of Defense;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H60E9B8A790C847EB85EC5D8256D1932F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     manufacturers of autonomous unmanned aircraft systems; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCF7F132C4EF94587A89926D54BC3C9D4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     operators of autonomous unmanned aircraft systems; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2840F17CCD7E4634B10D7374D2B7AF04"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     other stakeholders with knowledge of automation in aviation, the human-computer interface, and aviation safety, as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H0412A7A2A8F64CA995CF2664BCC0917A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Submission
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress, the subcommittee on Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies of the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate and the subcommittee on Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies of the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives the plan established under subsection (a).
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HFA0F9E6AF88A4B178DDB8D2B1DECD050"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               925.
               UAS TEST RANGES
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2F15A3E826C64347A13A1BF92580782A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking section 44803 and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H87F5247BBFE0474CA12522278C302F94"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HEEFEB8BB0DDB4599A696C9BBF8A3F8FE"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        44803.
                        UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEM TEST RANGES
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HBE267674017C454BB222803E23534DF6"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           Test ranges
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE55417F445454559B281108E3D0A8DBA"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall carry out and update, as appropriate, a program for the use of unmanned aircraft system (in this section referred to as UAS) test ranges to—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H03E4CAB6DE694661A4B00A8AFBD19DB7"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 enable a broad variety of development, testing, and evaluation activities related to UAS and associated technologies; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H0244856D4FC64F83BC1DBA2B1D8DF4FC"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 the extent consistent with aviation safety and efficiency, support the safe integration of unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H732A94DCA1804CBA9932E5F671DEA5BD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Designations
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H588EAF5A96674F78A1A6255125A00370"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 Existing test ranges
                                 Test ranges designated under this section shall include the 7 test ranges established under the following:
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD21444E97C1E4E06B690F25F4769C9F2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    Section 332(c) of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note), as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254).
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCB6FDEFA64B8422A96F1C25F51761ED2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    Any other test ranges designated pursuant to the amendment made by section 2201(b) of the FAA Extension, Safety, and Security Act of 2016 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) after the date of enactment of such Act.
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB4D7ED3532F9449082C8353152505D68"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 New test ranges
                                 If the Administrator finds that it is in the best interest of enabling safe UAS integration into the national airspace system, the Administrator may select and designate as a test range under this section up to 2 additional test ranges in accordance with the requirements of this section through a competitive selection process.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3B0F7371891242C991EF7908F63D2D51"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 Limitation
                                 Not more than 9 test ranges designated under this section shall be part of the program established under this section at any given time.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA555C9B51B654DB1AD9D6697B4EEF1B5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3) 
                              Eligibility
                              Test ranges selected by the Administrator pursuant to (2)(B) shall—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7B5DB957E89E4D42BCA0578CB6DD9426"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 be an instrumentality of a State, local, Tribal, or territorial government or other public entity;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H336E93785B7243ACAED870D4A2DBFAF1"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 be approved by the chief executive officer of the State, local, territorial, or Tribal government for the principal place of business of the applicant, prior to seeking designation by the Administrator;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H4BAD27C64F08492DB6FB34B9CAF88C0D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 undertake and ensure testing and evaluation of innovative concepts, technologies, and operations that will offer new safety benefits, including developing and retaining an advanced aviation industrial base within the United States; and 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HEB51290DCE9B47FAAF91E27FC2A8E7ED"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 meet any other requirements established by the Administrator.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H4846B7B51E4A478C85599EBAA2F0F2DE"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Airspace requirements
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H50E24A6EE5D94F0D87E4D056E94FACBC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              In carrying out the program under subsection (a), the Administrator may establish, upon the request of a test range sponsor designated by the Administrator under subsection (a), a restricted area, special use airspace, or other similar type of airspace pursuant to part 73 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, for purposes of—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H903BC1F063C94D7F8B6813CCDCA82C84"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 accommodating hazardous development, testing, and evaluation activities to inform the safe integration of unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H1FF9A5DB6AFF4F39B0E553080797ED00"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 other activities authorized by the Administrator pursuant to subsection (f).
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF42EA00C790646A8814C72CC470EC42E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              NEPA review
                              The Administrator may require that each test range sponsor designated by the Administrator under subsection (a) provide a draft environmental review consistent with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.), subject to the supervision of and adoption by the Administrator, with respect to any request for the establishment of a restricted area, special use airspace, or other similar type of airspace under this subsection.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H976128B122544D8388C38786B4CBEA00"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Inactive restricted area or special use airspace
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HF1B9575487BE4F15AAD5E69135A208B4"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 In general
                                 In the event a restricted area, special use airspace, or other similar type of airspace established under paragraph (1) is not needed to meet the needs of the using agency (as described in subparagraph (B)), any related airspace restrictions, limitations, or designations shall be inactive.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H82722CDA24DC4C0E8ECF258CFADDECEE"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Using agency
                                 For purposes of this subsection, a test range sponsor designated by the Administrator under subsection (a) shall be considered the using agency with respect to a restricted area established by the Administrator under this subsection.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3B1465CC11FE40568850B8AFEA4D9127"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Approval authority
                              The Administrator shall have the authority to approve access by a participating or nonparticipating operator to a test range or restricted area, special use airspace, or other similar type of airspace established by the Administrator under this subsection.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H42F4E770648D40FA82E45FF2B5677AF2"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Program requirements
                           In carrying out the program under subsection (a), the Administrator—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H66B6D39507C249149644FE6776C0D952"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              may develop operational standards and air traffic requirements for flight operations at test ranges;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD0F745AB9C5444DF9F88458D157536B8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              shall coordinate with, and leverage the resources of, the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and other relevant Federal agencies, as determined appropriate by the Administrator;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H829B733DFAAF46A7846C9C5BE3E979C0"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              shall address both civil and public aircraft operations;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H40059731614C48038889F47F6D86F0B3"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              shall provide for verification of the safety of flight systems and related navigation procedures as such systems and procedures relate to the continued development of regulations and standards for integration of unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4AD342E54F534E6481948075754C6AC8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (5)
                              shall engage test range sponsors, as necessary and with available resources, in projects for development, testing, and evaluation of flight systems, including activities conducted pursuant to section 1042 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, to facilitate the development of regulations and the validation of standards by the Administrator for the safe integration of unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system, which may include activities related to—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H97A0C52D6673490593598E1CDEDFFF9C"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 developing and enforcing geographic and altitude limitations;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HC1414830A12748B3891F3284098719B9"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 providing for alerts regarding any hazards or limitations on flight, including prohibition on flight, as necessary;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H9A4C4E3445384FAD9D597D87A79F28A9"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 developing or validating sense and avoid capabilities;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H4C6C285B484C427090B3568A942CB67D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 developing or validating technology to support communications, navigation, and surveillance;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H47354043A1B84DB0B5467008250C600D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 testing or validating operational concepts and technologies related to beyond visual line of sight operations, autonomous operations, nighttime operations, operations over people, operations involving multiple unmanned aircraft systems by a single pilot or operator, and unmanned aircraft systems traffic management capabilities or services; 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H379C8884715248B8AB26EA5E2C227754"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (F)
                                 improving privacy protections through the use of advances in unmanned aircraft systems; 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HF0B1F7C62EF24FD0864EBF057078C8D5"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (G)
                                 conducting counter-UAS testing capabilities, with the approval of the Administrator; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE820492112284B08B13758EF607F0FF9"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (H)
                                 other relevant topics for which development, testing or evaluation are needed;
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5E00617C28234CB3A5141E385126ECCE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (6)
                              shall develop data sharing and collection requirements for test ranges to support the unmanned aircraft systems integration efforts of the Administration and coordinate periodically with all test range sponsors to ensure the test range sponsors know—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H8C601646F1644D919AA509284A352F9E"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 what data should be collected;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H47D6B60830AE4CABBEC2D151A921074D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 how data can be de-identified to flow more readily to the Administration;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H18BD1C4E64C943D6844FCDFF9FC5996E"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 what procedures should be followed; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HEEE61CE0AB4843019D7C0F4D2FCE4103"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 what development, testing, and evaluation would advance efforts to safely integrate unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system;
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H58686B5C691D44A7A6A354BCE93CF4D2"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (7)
                              shall allow test range sponsors to receive Federal funding, including in-kind contributions, other than from the Federal Aviation Administration, in furtherance of research, development, testing, and evaluation objectives; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0518A6333D344FE9846E2EC24001164F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (8)
                              shall use modeling and simulation tools to assist in the testing, evaluation, verification, and validation of unmanned aircraft systems.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HF125E1FB82EC4001A1AC352F48F63076"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Exemption
                           Except as provided in subsection (f), the requirements of section 44711, including any related implementing regulations, shall not apply to persons approved by the test range sponsor for operation at a test range designated by the Administrator under this section.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H8C2A510F4BED4B8CA4AF417EB6A8CF4E"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Responsibilities of test range sponsors
                           The sponsor of each test range designated by the Administrator under subsection (a) shall—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE512CC34DDB54841AE10BD94B05B5342"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              provide access to all interested private and public entities seeking to carry out research, development, testing and evaluation activities at the test range designated pursuant to this section, to the greatest extent practicable, consistent with safety and any operating procedures established by the test range sponsor, including access by small business concerns (as such term is defined in section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632));
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H90550351D0254D7981E05E8DC7CB80C0"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              ensure all activities remain within the geographical boundaries and altitude limitations established for any restricted area, special use airspace, or other similar type of airspace covering the test range;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA091C227601C45D299A0A5F833572FAC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              ensure no activity is conducted at the designated test range in a careless or reckless manner;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF680B1DC6CC1471AAB6FCEE2BB923868"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              establish safe operating procedures for all operators approved for activities at the test range, including provisions for maintaining operational control and ensuring protection of persons and property on the ground, subject to approval by the Administrator;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC79656BEE33A41278C50E283D4051C71"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (5)
                              exercise direct oversight of all operations conducted at the test range;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H40ABFC1BE8684C1CBE70B6CBEA73D840"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (6)
                              consult with the Administrator on the nature of planned activities at the test range and whether temporary segregation of the airspace is required to contain such activities consistent with aviation safety;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H75A9C70BA0534E5C871608F8082C3798"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (7)
                              protect proprietary technology, sensitive data, or sensitive research of any civil or private entity when using the test range;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H44BAB83A38514B21A12A30FD659AAD22"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (8)
                              maintain detailed records of all ongoing and completed activities conducted at the test range and all operators conducting such activities, for inspection by, and reporting to, the Administrator, as required by agreement between the Administrator and the test range sponsor;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB3BE6252FF3646588D7B42E3C548D025"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (9)
                              make all original records available for inspection upon request by the Administrator; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE57260E7546F4001AF1DBE52EC467948"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (10)
                              provide recommendations, on a quarterly basis until the program terminates, to the Administrator to further enable public and private development, testing, and evaluation activities at the test ranges to contribute to the safe integration of unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H41056A738C504598B27A80B78B1CAEC7"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (f)
                           Testing
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0E4A126F47244759A821A5AEA1CE9803"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              The Administrator may authorize a sponsor of a test range designated under subsection (a) to host research, development, testing, and evaluation activities, including activities conducted pursuant to section 1042 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, as appropriate, other than activities directly related to the integration of unmanned aircraft systems into the national airspace system, so long as the activity is necessary to inform the development of regulations, standards, or policy for integrating new types of flight systems into the national airspace system.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6C6D0B9843634CDF8B1D7AF59C51E63F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Waiver
                               In carrying out this section, the Administrator may waive the requirements of section 44711 (including any related implementing regulations) to the extent the Administrator determines such waiver is consistent with aviation safety.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H05F115A545824679A819C10898F85354"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (g)
                           Collaborative research and development agreements
                           The Administrator may use the transaction authority under section 106(l)(6), including in coordination with the Center of Excellence for Unmanned Aircraft Systems, to enter into collaborative research and development agreements or to direct research, development, testing, and evaluation related to unmanned aircraft systems, including activities conducted pursuant to section 1042 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, as appropriate, at any test range designated under subsection (a).
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HFE023EC96F0940BE8FE04669A6A948EC"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (h)
                           Authorization of appropriations
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8754797095CC4E73A86622BE01D7A21E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Establishment
                              Out of amounts authorized to be appropriated under section 106(k), $6,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028, shall be available to the Administrator for the purposes of—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H9F7D1289484D48D18D7A910587F9BBD2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 providing matching funds to commercial entities that contract with a UAS test range to demonstrate or validate technologies that the FAA considers essential to the safe integration of UAS into the national airspace system; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE9D2762616FA47B7B25A261CD849BDD5"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 supporting or performing such demonstration and validation activities described in subparagraph (A) at a test range designated under the section.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB836B61F10F844CA904B9D0B3D4182DB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Disbursement
                              Funding provided under this subsection shall be divided evenly among all UAS test ranges designated under this section, for the purpose of providing matching funds to commercial entities described in paragraph (1) and available until expended. 
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H9A892DEA8D1F45129FC486F6F1DF07AD"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           Termination
                           The program under this section shall terminate on September 30, 2028.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3E4DB1CC102E4CEFB5AD1F5CD3035581"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Conforming amendments
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H027DE6FA11DD4A7F861F564B99F2010B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Conforming amendment
                     Section 44801(10) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">any of the 6 test ranges established by the Administrator under section 332(c) of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note), as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018, and any public entity authorized by the Federal Aviation Administration as an unmanned aircraft system flight test center before January 1, 2009 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">the test ranges designated by the Administrator under section 44803.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC404189099C446DAB11F7D4311BB7A8A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Clerical amendment
                     The analysis for chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 44803 and inserting the following: 
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HA94E50D127644164BE53EBC268C9ADC8"
                                    style="OLC">
                        
                           44803. Unmanned aircraft system test ranges.
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB782FC2BFF694DE5ABDBE1E5F6BCCE85"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Sense of Congress
                  It is the sense of Congress that the test ranges designated under section 44803 of title 49, United States Code, shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7216CEC3499A404792A4B1F91E7DE555"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     provide fair and accessible services to a broad variety of unmanned aircraft technology developers, to the extent practicable;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H69DB3AFCCA5D4AE98DA41BF15BF250E7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     operate in the best interest of domestic technology developers in terms of intellectual property and proprietary data protections; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H53D40F19454A46B88D767FD6335F1E54"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     comply with data sharing and collection requirements prescribed by the FAA.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H39C41B3825CD46649DD79732881769BE"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               926.
               PUBLIC SAFETY USE OF TETHERED UAS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H088F95CF76B7467086926A1F6C674952"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 44806 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFCC08054B746462A8A1EF7D7DA5ED2E8"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in the section heading by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           and public safety use of tethered unmanned aircraft systems
                         after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           systems
                        ;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4025C49E9614417DAFBEAD59E4207F50"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in subsection (c)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEAAC3219CB394ED9A6A5DE7CC2A6D7D0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in the subsection heading by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">
                              safety use of
                            after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">
                              public
                           ; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1AA09E19D3044722B6D0D58C6845B292"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        in paragraph (1)—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0DBA230C09064ECDBA4CD8C88CBB2B9C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           in the matter preceding subparagraph (A)—
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3D2934C4600B44FA94F4DA70C68DB845"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">The;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HABFBACE6B1C34DD08E4DAA8AB2B89E72"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">permit the use of and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">permit;
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H681D1DE3EABB4AC48BA6CB499F079C80"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (III)
                              by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">public; and
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5DACA1B1159D4484AD6F93D26BB4A665"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (IV)
                              by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">by a public safety organization for such systems after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">systems;
                           
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H59358C89CF85415391F434559A5F728E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the following:
                           <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                          display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          display-quotes="yes"
                                          id="H29F2D75553B74EA7B5958614CFE24356"
                                          style="OLC">
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H1A4EE6209CAB48A6A7C81D467490038E"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 operated—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H57B5772AA41C4D2394E6002B8E13C9CE"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    at or below an altitude of 150 feet above ground level within class B, C, D, E, or G airspace, but not at a greater altitude than the ceiling depicted on the UAS Facility Maps published by the Federal Aviation Administration, where applicable;
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8BA368F8CA7B4DF8A4745923A8CC5E68"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    within zero-grid airspaces as depicted on such UAS Facility Maps, only if operated in life-saving or emergency situations and with prior notification to the Administration in a manner determined by the Administrator; or
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE75753B7394B4F579DC30978A7B50F9B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (iii)
                                    above 150 feet above ground level within class B, C, D, E, or G airspace only with prior authorization from the Administrator;
                                 
                              
                              ;
                           
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4C6CA431AC4E4217B1268BED1184E2FB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           by striking subparagraph (B); and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H65E49306652F405FAF5726703A06E4FE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           by redesignating subparagraphs (C), (D), and (E) as subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D), respectively; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2EDABFCBE46F476CAD6A34A2F2433EDA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        in paragraph (3) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Public actively and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Actively; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA2EAFD4698914BE4BEB4DA832807DF0C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H445AB061AD314FCD987AC2462FC39513"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HAD964DA693A2423DA39D676C6AFE4A53"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Definition
                           In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">public safety organization means an entity that primarily engages in activities related to the safety and well-being of the general public, including law enforcement, fire departments, emergency medical services, and other organizations that protect and serve the public in matters of safety and security.
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE24B5D3A87F9496684BA00D52E2433D2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 44806 and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HFBCB5C89CDF94CBBBB11F3C117C3222C"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        44806. Public unmanned aircraft systems and public safety use of tethered unmanned aircraft systems.
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H568EB1DB28014B5DB6C2D26C18413A3F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definition
                  Section 44801(1) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB1E34B3B1CCF4EB681D709C824E3EB4A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HF748DF8152CA47D28078F10F26136797"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCF04CB5E14DE4114B36F660174BEFA07"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (A)
                           weighs 55 pounds or less, including payload but not including the tether;
                        
                        ; 
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0AE0E86D8075445D9AAF85DA03BC213B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in subparagraph (B) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">and at the end;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7D1AD3B2C2A14A8D8446F8271224F130"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     in subparagraph (C) by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAAD2855D19924AF59A78698D720FE774"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H402ECB73208C4AF39D53BAA773BF6CA6"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H955C153D088F4914AF9F2CE04C56C6BF"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (D)
                           is able to maintain safe flight control in the event of a power or flight control failure during flight; and
                        
                        <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE62B3DA0ACBC444A8B86091BF0610546"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (E)
                           is programmed to initiate a controlled landing in the event of a tether separation.
                        
                        .

                      id="HFF2CC401EA3A40BFA17366CD13810FB5"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               927.
               EXTENDING SPECIAL AUTHORITY FOR CERTAIN UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3E2BC8A91366429ABD74B3331240A4D5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Extension
                  Section 44807(d) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">May 10, 2024 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">September 30, 2033.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC61F3D85EA96417DA9E5D7D96E0E314F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clarification
                  Section 44807 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H79481A4A69E443FBB61AB149093E80FE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in subsection (a)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8940F6DA291C40A89188C96983F4E6DD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">or chapter 447 after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Notwithstanding any other requirement of this chapter;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H10594C1BBB19482DA3F3E2DABC136F1E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">the Secretary of Transportation and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
