                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">if certain and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">how;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2AE3A0EBDB164C3585B977C0D93B8F79"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in subsection (b)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H12C1D8012DC24F0988691A69B46A48F7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Secretary and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Administrator; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC8784B2DC9ED409EAC26383A652D578C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">which types of and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">how such.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5627D0B798D446C595287C38A01288E0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H5464E30BD3A94E88AF18828F687287B7"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HCB73340C2E4E4F669777C93DF19A7ACC"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Requirements for safe operation
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDC30656CE7204C0C8DA7BB458463F76A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              In carrying out this section, the Administrator shall establish requirements, or a process to accept proposed requirements, for the safe and efficient operation of unmanned aircraft systems in the national airspace system, including operations related to testing and evaluation of proprietary systems.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7BB6B10330A94B1089325BD4555FEB5C"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Expedited exemptions and approvals
                              The Administrator shall, taking into account the statutory mandate to ensure safe and efficient use of the national airspace system, issue approvals—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5E22269D8E1E472C86829A17256BE729"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 to enable low-risk beyond visual line of sight operations, including, at a minimum, package delivery operations, extended visual line of sight operations, or shielded operations within 100 feet of the ground or a structure; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H029559B07D804BFA9D585334EAD094E6"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 that are aligned with Administration exemptions or approvals that enable beyond visual line of sight operations with the use of acoustics, ground based radar, automatic dependent surveillance–broadcast, and other technological solutions.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H36258EF0753144E8AAC89E06C5E9820A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Treatment of mitigation measures
                              To the extent that an operation under this section will be conducted exclusively within the airspace of a Mode C Veil, such operation shall be treated as satisfying the requirements of section 91.113(b) of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, if the operation employs—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA6A5AC94C6A2477C90E7197CBEEF7E0F"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 automatic dependent surveillance–broadcast in-based detect and avoid capabilities;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HA9C934ED58874B6682DB77F3FB733BCA"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 air traffic control communication and coordination; 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H76967C644C2A435194FA21BC7A45040D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 aeronautical information management systems acceptable to the Administrator, such as notices to air missions, to notify other airspace users of such operations; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HFD8A6CD7B54C4E1FA0A336E3A13B83A0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 any other risk mitigations as set by the Administrator.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4242CCFB0B714315BB95DFE3063D4CC6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Rule of construction
                              Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H19A66C1557CD49CDBD8DB261A971E4B0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 provide an unmanned aircraft operating pursuant to this section the right of way over a manned aircraft; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H2EAB979F56AE4E1589EBCF1C0310F136"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 limit the authority of the Administrator to impose requirements, conditions, or limitations on operations conducted under this section in order to address safety concerns.
                              
                           
                        
                        ; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H41B71A67FA5D4DCA94C5BE6EB9B34C06"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HC9EEEAFF66E44BB9B5822AF834B1D71D"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HD41632DFB5EB4DB58C7C96C3CDC68911"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Authority
                           The Administrator may exercise the authorities described in this section, including waiving applicable parts of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, without initiating a rulemaking or imposing the requirements of part 11 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, to the extent consistent with aviation safety.
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFE1B36B9003E44348C2DD71292AB27C0"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Clarification of status of previously issued rulemakings and exemptions
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0260F41F5D55479C8F6B22D9C1D7D764"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Rulemakings
                     Any rule issued pursuant to section 44807 of title 49, United States Code, shall continue to be in effect following the expiration of such authority.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H94CADB4981934BB7B61E32CFAAA9974F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Exemptions
                     Any exemption granted under the authority described in section 44807 of title 49, United States Code, and in effect as of the expiration of such authority, shall continue to be in effect until the date that is 3 years after the date of termination described in such exemption, provided the Administrator does not determine there is a safety risk.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9636198701764F7A890C51380A7A45EA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Rules of construction
                     Nothing in this section shall be construed to interfere with the Administrator’s—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7B697BF6EB5B41A89DE4E0FCAEEC8893"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        authority to rescind or amend an exemption for reasons such as unsafe conditions or operator oversight; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H37DAA3F55CC94E37A1770A27C9F4120C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        ability to grant an exemption based on a determination made pursuant to section 44807 of title 49, United States Code, prior to the date described in subsection (d) of such section.
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H49549A07A6EA4A2186A86F03241B1B40"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               928.
               RECREATIONAL OPERATIONS OF DRONE SYSTEMS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H75F5A1551A1F4DEAABC95E199A4DC6CC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Specified exception for limited recreational operations of unmanned aircraft
                  Section 44809 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC3BF6E92A0404DDD8EB7ABC11D53F308"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in subsection (a) by striking paragraph (6) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H68F1975B56B14A11830C87DB1C9A2A27"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H024C19C9B4454CC2A43F845B0F644408"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (6)
                           Except for circumstances when the Administrator establishes alternative altitude ceilings or as otherwise authorized in section (c), in Class G airspace, the aircraft is flown from the surface to not more than 400 feet above ground level and complies with all airspace and flight restrictions and prohibitions established under this subtitle, such as special use airspace designations and temporary flight restrictions.
                        
                        ;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H449AE8F52B5D4F8897A8E2DCE0705EA6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H8E0FEAF41C9947878662327C75F0DAEB"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HDC4A3BD670834BAFB849ECD58C225E49"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Operations at fixed sites
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDFDCFC5AE06847FB84A4FE62729F120F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              The Administrator shall establish a process to approve, and publicly disseminate the location of, fixed sites at which a person may carry out recreational unmanned aircraft system operations.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD9C5F21C123A46BD8E114D1074ADD240"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Operating procedures
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H08CD9222A85144AEA83F102A51B22BDA"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 Controlled airspace
                                 Persons operating unmanned aircraft under paragraph (1) from a fixed site within Class B, Class C, or Class D airspace or within the lateral boundaries of the surface area of Class E airspace designated for an airport, or a community-based organization sponsoring operations within such airspace, shall make the location of the fixed site known to the Administrator and shall establish a mutually agreed upon operating procedure with the air traffic control facility.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H92B2019DAC7248D4BBB755F372EE2714"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 Altitude
                                 The Administrator, in coordination with community-based organizations sponsoring operations at fixed sites, shall develop a process to approve requests for recreational unmanned aircraft systems operations at fixed sites that exceed the maximum altitude contained in a UAS Facility Map published by the Federal Aviation Administration.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5A8971ACCB114C4D967A80EFEDEF959B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 Uncontrolled airspace
                                 Subject to compliance with all airspace and flight restrictions and prohibitions established under this subtitle, including special use airspace designations and temporary flight restrictions, persons operating unmanned aircraft systems from a fixed site designated under the process described in paragraph (1) may operate within Class G airspace—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H69D1853FEA54463BABEEBD3CA0BFDBF8"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    up to 400 feet above ground level, without prior authorization from the Administrator; and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H35673D0EAEA344B39D1C0D5FB96F1875"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    above 400 feet above ground level, with prior authorization from the Administrator.
                                 
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H33FBF2B2328F4F5387944CD6BCCE39E5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Unmanned aircraft weighing 55 pounds or greater
                              A person may operate an unmanned aircraft weighing 55 pounds or greater, including the weight of anything attached to or carried by the aircraft, if—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H443FDFE6A1134C879C894D3511FDAAF1"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 the unmanned aircraft complies with standards and limitations developed by a community-based organization and approved by the Administrator; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3B14EF40B959460FA4DD93DE9D704DEE"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 the aircraft is operated from a fixed site as described in paragraph (1).
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HD77FBDBEC5CD4AA598793724A70E0CB0"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              FAA-recognized identification areas
                              In implementing subpart C of part 89 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, the Administrator shall prioritize the review and adjudication of requests to establish FAA Recognized Identification Areas at fixed sites established under this section.
                           
                        
                        ;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0AA736A15788409597FC7FCEFEB99C07"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     in subsection (d)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H64CE2A5BA9C1496283C8EE259C0A5505"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in paragraph (3) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">subsection (a) of; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4C446B2469804A3CAE589B402221867A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by striking the subsection designation and heading and all that follows through <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">(3) Savings clause.— and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">(d) Savings clause.—;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H724447C18E8B4684BBAD76553B33FB09"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     in subsection (f)(1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">updates to;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5501801094464929ADCC2D993B629270"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     by striking subsection (g)(1) and inserting the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HFAD3E8311C3D4902A9AF84F7AD18F47B"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD4B5460995D54F54922B5D89557DCB39"

                           The Administrator, in consultation with manufacturers of unmanned aircraft systems, community-based organizations, and other industry stakeholders, shall develop, maintain, and update, as necessary, an aeronautical knowledge and safety test. Such test shall be administered electronically by the Administrator or a person designated by the Administrator.
                        
                        ; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                              qb-display-quote="yes">

                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)

                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"

                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9D0C8FC0A325438A822E1508BBCC1E66"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              is recognized by the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration;
                           
                           .
                        
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H00E7F81586F84DE69D949EC35A9460C7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Use of unmanned aircraft systems for educational purposes
                  Section 350 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 44809 note) is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H88539545A0434D698649993E00CE67F7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in subsection (a)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        by redesignating paragraphs (2) and (3) as paragraphs (3) and (4), respectively; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H795092CA31B64CD0B01A442F7299A0A3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by inserting before paragraph (3) (as so redesignated) the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       display-quotes="yes"
                                       id="H050AC72D362B4F4685B588AABFEE6D02"
                                       style="OLC">
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8187FF8C1A25423B94CBFAA1A9E108C2"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              operated by an elementary school, a secondary school, or an institution of higher education for educational or research purposes;
                           
                           ; and
                        
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0CC1466DCBB44E588958C68696D81167"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in subsection (d)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4D3D5838E6344D37817E2597A4A32349"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        in paragraph (2) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">an elementary school, or a secondary school after <quote quote-display-end="auto"

                                    id="HFDDAFBE5619E4A7DBCE71E0B2FEC24F9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by adding at the end the following:
                        <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                       display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Elementary school
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">elementary school has the meaning given to that term by section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801(19)).
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB895D2763B0440ABACE3F3A17E5ABBC5"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Secondary school
                              The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">secondary school has the meaning given to that term by section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801(45)).
                           
                           .
                        
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA86163AEE8BD45CA9D2452E4DEAA9511"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               929.
               APPLICATIONS FOR DESIGNATION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5F3A7886176E419EAABA1966C0DD4EE8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Section 2209 of the FAA Extension, Safety, and Security Act of 2016 (49 U.S.C. 44802 note) is amended—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5022C63F74A5416B9F5624B04AD865AA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     in subsection (a) by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">, including temporarily, after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">restrict;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0DA278797C014005893E6F10FC652AA9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     in subsection (b)(1)(C)(iv) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Other locations that warrant such restrictions and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">State prisons; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFF725BCD3AF6469DB5BA98EF8C5EBC6F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H0342D24E33CC437F8B3D2411D8BE4955"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HED4DD91725154AE0B9E96C329B7C9EF5"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (f)
                           Deadlines
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC4ECD2EF22F84A7E95A19D66797FC4EE"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, the Administrator shall publish a notice of proposed rulemaking to carry out the requirements of this section.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE1A0B9AD10CC4341815788169E2E75BC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Not later than 16 months after publishing the notice of proposed rulemaking under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall issue a final rule based on the notice of proposed rulemaking published under paragraph (1).
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HB9FDFE10E9CA4495AEFC9F942BEAF7F5"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (g)
                           Definition of State prison
                           In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">State prison means an institution under State jurisdiction, including a State Department of Corrections, the primary use of which is for the confinement of individuals convicted of a felony.
                        
                        .
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H863A3D08F8714D3F914B19B71FBDEF8F"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               930.
               BEYOND VISUAL LINE OF SIGHT OPERATIONS FOR UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC0A6CB27CC6148C7AEC7E90A403B8E42"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H76A582C7A098492A9D80DFAF66C76882"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HDCE57593BA8B4BFA8117FE64988C7266"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        44811.
                        BEYOND VISUAL LINE OF SIGHT OPERATIONS FOR UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H6E4E031320F841318FF04C5E36C318A4"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           Proposed rule
                           Not later than 4 months after the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024, the Administrator shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking establishing a performance-based regulatory pathway for unmanned aircraft systems (in this section referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">UAS) to operate beyond visual line of sight (in this section referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">BVLOS).
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H860B2FBD4D9F4FD8A18A7EA71FD1D9AF"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Requirements
                           The proposed rule required under subsection (a) shall, at a minimum, establish the following:
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H240E57F5165247DEB2CF1C90B15C2294"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Acceptable levels of risk for BVLOS UAS operations, including the levels developed pursuant to section 931 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H6E4EAEBBC0FE4E3484E9880E799FE7C2"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Standards for remote pilots or UAS operators for BVLOS operations, taking into account varying levels of automated control and management of UAS flights.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE25B48365707490482F0523FFF630213"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              An approval or acceptance process for UAS and associated elements (as defined by the Administrator), which may leverage the creation of a special airworthiness certificate or a manufacturer’s declaration of compliance to a Federal Aviation Administration accepted means of compliance. Such process—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H7DACC4B30AAA4A45810BDE197A1F955B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 shall not require, but may allow for, the use of type or production certification;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HF24FA9976F0F400BA1D7284B057C5717"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 shall consider the airworthiness of any UAS that—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H61B25062D5E244F69E36C0D5919ECE45"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    is within a maximum gross weight or kinetic energy, as determined by the Administrator; and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD35960783D984F11AFDA7C1A333F2B31"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    operates within a maximum speed limit as determined by the Administrator; 
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H66D888394CC74D239E9E6AB24C4F80D0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 may require such systems to operate in the national airspace system at altitude limits determined by the Administrator; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HBF6C38AF92FC4A3392BCFEF9DE9EC62A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 may require such systems to operate at standoff distances from the radius of a structure or the structure’s immediate uppermost limit, as determined by the Administrator.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HACD17B632D4D4DD189AD85BA97CF246A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              Operating rules for UAS that have been approved or accepted as described in paragraph (3). 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HCA7902B805694FDBB1B1ED7EF9BE18E8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (5)
                              Protocols, if appropriate, for networked information exchange, such as network-based remote identification, in support of BVLOS operations. 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC038F46E812A403FB58BED3C1BB7F9C6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (6)
                              The safety of manned aircraft operating in the national airspace system and consider the maneuverability and technology limitations of certain aircraft, including hot air balloons.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HE0E2864BF8EA4A93BF74A8C186A79DF1"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Final rule
                           Not later than 16 months after publishing the proposed rule under subsection (a), the Administrator shall issue a final rule based on such proposed rule.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H050219586BF44F85A1983D73BEFBB1B1"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Savings clause
                           Nothing in this section shall be construed to require the agency to rescope any rulemaking efforts related to UAS BVLOS operations that are ongoing as of the date of enactment of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2024.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF75F4C43B5D04A639DE477705EAD696C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HDB876A406C6C4FD19620374DD862CC83"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        44811. Beyond visual line of sight operations for unmanned aircraft systems.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H2333A7668BE74E908E5FBDD3A732732E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               931.
               ACCEPTABLE LEVELS OF RISK AND RISK ASSESSMENT METHODOLOGY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC825B6D4AD1D435FACABE9AB4724A8B5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall develop a risk assessment methodology that allows for the determination of acceptable levels of risk for unmanned aircraft system operations, including operations beyond visual line of sight, conducted—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD4F35013BF9E46D689A92DC5026CF3F3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     under waivers issued to part 107 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA116B8ACC9324141881289CACFD54A6D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     pursuant to section 44807 of title 49, United States Code; or
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC2B5449F57A44D99AE3B31DD79A915D2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     pursuant to other applicable regulations, as appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H25B14E3B997840B0809A9A69741FB3DD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Risk assessment methodology considerations
                  In establishing the risk assessment methodology under this section, the Administrator shall ensure alignment with the considerations included in the order issued by the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">UAS Safety Risk Management Policy (FAA Order 8040.6A), and any subsequent amendments to such order, as the Administrator considers appropriate.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H74C1DEF262204CCCBECFF57D1354C9C5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Publication
                  The Administrator shall make the risk assessment methodology established under this section available to the public on an appropriate website of the Administration and update such methodology as necessary.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H6194541804A249E18FD150489B6ACB28"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               932.
               THIRD-PARTY SERVICE APPROVALS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE9CB8D9696AC4617B49A0E07D67102FA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Approval process
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish procedures, which may include a rulemaking, to approve third-party service suppliers, including third-party service suppliers of unmanned aircraft system traffic management, to support the safe integration and commercial operation of unmanned aircraft systems.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2E5D66E0322A482CAB81B3B474F68FE4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Acceptance of standards
                  In establishing the approval process required under subsection (a), the Administrator shall ensure that, to the maximum extent practicable, industry consensus standards, such as ASTM International Standard F3548–21, titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">UAS Traffic Management (UTM) UAS Service Supplier (USS) Interoperability, are included as an acceptable means of compliance for third-party services.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H4EB21B5995B84E26A32DA2140C8EF134"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Approvals
                  In establishing the approval process required under subsection (a), the Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5A60EBE52F6E4A12A8185B881A5A8BD1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     define and implement criteria and conditions for the approval and oversight of third-party service suppliers that—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB0E60E1F954A4267B14793B806EE23D7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        could have a direct or indirect impact on air traffic services in the national airspace system; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE9D59C250B3847158282D385D8F1D460"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        require FAA oversight; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H844EA231AC4E437B9C6FD954AC2369DE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     establish procedures by which unmanned aircraft systems can use the capabilities and services of third-party service suppliers to support operations.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H401EC38019D64EDCB51249F61F5D7E1F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Harmonization
                  In carrying out this section, the Administrator shall seek to harmonize, to the extent practicable and advisable, any requirements and guidance for the development, use, and operation of third-party capabilities and services, including UTM, with similar requirements and guidance of other civil aviation authorities.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE03AAD82457E41E7B1A25BC12DE2D83F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Coordination
                  In carrying out this section, the Administrator shall consider any relevant information provided by the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration regarding research and development efforts the National Aeronautics and Space Administration may have conducted related to the use of UTM providers.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9C357AFAA5FF4F758477C5475C016DA1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Third-party service supplier defined
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">third-party service supplier means an entity other than the FAA that provides a distributed service that affects the safety or efficiency of the national airspace system, including UAS service suppliers, supplemental data service providers, and infrastructure providers, such as providers of ground-based surveillance, command-and-control, and information exchange to another party.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H557223E4A7B74527B6A952E8DF52BA7D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Rules of construction
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H22E91F314CB24C6FBF5C4A12D63863DC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Beyond visual line of sight operations
                     Nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent or prohibit beyond visual line of sight operations of unmanned aircraft systems, or other types of operations, through the use of technologies other than third-party capabilities and services.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H13E12BB765704CCFA1291AB84204F8C9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Airspace
                     Nothing in this section shall be construed to alter the authorities provided under section 40103 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H98F481AD427E4B00B1A7014926095B7E"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               933.
               SPECIAL AUTHORITY FOR TRANSPORT OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS BY COMMERCIAL PACKAGE DELIVERY UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H073B229464DA42EF8A6DD59488506111"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Notwithstanding any other Federal requirement or restriction related to the transportation of hazardous materials on aircraft, the Secretary shall, beginning not later than 180 days after enactment of this section, use a risk-based approach to establish the operational requirements, standards, or special permits necessary to approve or authorize an air carrier to transport hazardous materials by unmanned aircraft systems providing common carriage under part 135 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, or under successor authorities, as applicable, based on the weight, amount, and type of hazardous material being transported and the characteristics of the operations subject to such requirements, standards, or special purposes.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H60C92AF4481A4F4BBB7354EB183B3E10"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Requirements
                  In carrying out subsection (a), the Secretary shall consider, at a minimum—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7633F420331E4C7798628EE0A848B031"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the safety of the public and users of the national airspace system;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD4DF143546444CA29ED4BF21E6964B52"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     efficiencies of allowing the safe transportation of hazardous materials by unmanned aircraft systems and whether such transportation complies with the hazardous materials regulations under subchapter C of chapter I of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, including any changes to such regulations issued pursuant to this section;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9A5067193CCF4A4F894235AA00260768"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the risk profile of the transportation of hazardous materials by unmanned aircraft systems, taking into consideration the risk associated with differing weights, quantities, and packing group classifications of hazardous materials;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H010234A18B264E75B7790E65C3EB0BEA"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     mitigations to the risk of the hazardous materials being transported, based on the weight, amount, and type of materials being transported and the characteristics of the operation, including operational and aircraft-based mitigations; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H789A2A2C24F84885ACF901C08AD66521"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     the altitude at which unmanned aircraft operations are conducted.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA1409AEFA7AC4658A174786D90357195"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Safety risk assessments
                  The Secretary may require unmanned aircraft systems operators to submit a safety risk assessment acceptable to the Administrator, as part of the operator certification process, in order for such operators to perform the carriage of hazardous materials as authorized under this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H892F30CBB50B45BBA930ED467B5417F9"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Conformity of hazardous materials regulations
                  The Secretary shall make such changes as are necessary to conform the hazardous materials regulations under parts 173 and 175 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, to this section. Such changes shall be made concurrently with the activities described in subsection (a).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3765F3168CC645AEB31451F5157B421E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Stakeholder input on changes to the hazardous materials regulations
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD1A2D9E36F9C4DB281B992A96FA55879"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Implementation
                     Not later than 180 days of the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall hold a public meeting to obtain input on changes necessary to implement this section. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEF3AA796C21242BCB092746ABC442021"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Periodic Updates
                     The Secretary shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9B103513C9C2429EBB2482681DED6B86"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        periodically review, as necessary, amounts of hazardous materials allowed to be carried by unmanned aircraft systems pursuant to this section; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H46837064295143C7991525E95FE831E1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        determine whether such amounts should be revised, based on operational and safety data, without negatively impacting overall aviation safety.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2A54AFBCB683402C9398B78BAEEBB19A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Savings clause
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1D26C5E21CB7422CABD9D3DDB6425053"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     limit the authority of the Secretary, the Administrator, or the Administrator of the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration from implementing requirements to ensure the safe carriage of hazardous materials by aircraft; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1FF9E2E7700345DAB0944D00CC369CC9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     confer upon the Administrator the authorities of the Administrator of the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration under part 175 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, and chapter 51 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7C242ED95BFB491AB0962F0B771A1120"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Definition of hazardous materials
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">hazardous materials has the meaning given such term in section 5102 of title 49, United States Code.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HFE5221C2C82A484282DF1A85EEB8ED6A"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               934.
               OPERATIONS OVER HIGH SEAS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD9E17C0E2ACE466DBB12E36B0C5ECF47"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  To the extent permitted by treaty obligations of the United States, including the Convention on International Civil Aviation (in this section referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">ICAO), the Administrator shall work with other civil aviation authorities to establish and implement operational approval processes to permit unmanned aircraft systems to operate over the high seas within flight information regions for which the United States is responsible for operational control. 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD539E9248F4D483E986F3C15AE99BBE5"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Consultation
                  In establishing and implementing the operational approval process under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consult with appropriate stakeholders, including industry stakeholders.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H29D0645E293A4220BEC9E8E3306C8FA7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  ICAO activities
                  Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall engage ICAO through the submission of a working paper, panel proposal, or other appropriate mechanism to clarify the permissibility of unmanned aircraft systems to operate over the high seas.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H79303B152C8A4FDEB65B428BF02E2B80"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Review
                  Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall review whether, and to what extent, ICAO member states are approving the operation of unmanned aircraft systems over the high seas and brief the appropriate committees of Congress regarding the findings of such review.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HCDE220E8BE064636851DC75138DE5C88"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               935.
               PROTECTION OF PUBLIC GATHERINGS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H79C3D5D9B1AA46D288C9DEE167C148A8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H7119C39B07B444109D19982DBF9A209C"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HEB52A224AC864EB3A294C4E116EE54BF"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        44812.
                        TEMPORARY FLIGHT RESTRICTIONS FOR UNMANNED AIRCRAFT
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H3CC7C8C755F446E58344FB604E65D9F6"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In general
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H7AC07EF915084AE7AFB9C5B9FFEAA618"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Temporary flight restrictions
                              The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall, upon the request by an eligible entity, temporarily restrict unmanned aircraft operations over eligible large public gatherings.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC594FFB777EC44E69B90203A96CFD6CC"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Denial
                              Notwithstanding paragraph (1), the Administrator may deny a request for a temporary flight restriction sought under paragraph (1) if—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H14D20FC3A342400284FF407AF69CBE2A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 the temporary flight restriction would be inconsistent with aviation safety or security, would create a hazard to people or property on the ground, or would unnecessarily interfere with the efficient use of the airspace;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H70600811AAAB45599DE90F8C3E50C95C"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 the entity seeking the temporary flight restriction does not comply with the requirements in subsection (b);
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HC25E517863244E3CA78039D5BC055C7E"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 the eligibility requirements in subsections (c) and (d) have not been met;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HE79116DBA3914260B19B91DBB6426BDB"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 a flight restriction exists to the airspace overlying the same location as the temporary flight restriction sought under this section; or
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HAE9C254D84714B698382E29AD14D75F2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 the Administrator determines appropriate for any other reason. 
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HA79ED2B31B4A4215813B560C46E9B14E"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Requirements
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HBD865AFB314A47D88043541365A90F91"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Advance notice
                              Eligible entities may only request a temporary flight restriction under subsection (a) not less than 30 calendar days prior to the eligible large public gathering.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H4DB4D750727347819158CCA33951E5DB"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Required information
                              Eligible entities seeking a temporary flight restriction under this section shall provide the Administrator with all relevant information, including the following: 
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HB8E70A286E804EEF8D8AA126BC809947"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 Geographic boundaries of the stadium or other venue hosting the eligible large public gathering, as applicable.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H4A8CEA268E0E410F9BFA84A080A9F589"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 The dates and anticipated starting and ending times for the large public gathering.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3EBEAE4E3CB54E0B8C16EB908DE4D430"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 Points of contact for the requesting eligible entity and the on-scene incident command responsible for securing the large public gathering.
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H2987C16E3AE6482DBAC96E795B391448"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 Any other information the Administrator considers necessary to establish the restriction.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H64B479A378FF43929223A4F57D43FD36"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Eligible large public gatherings
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8FB6B5E59E7347EC843273DBF6C95121"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              In general
                              To be eligible for a temporary flight restriction under this section, large public gatherings hosted in a stadium or other venue shall—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H22659E8EDE344F8381A8B87FA622C7B3"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 be hosted in a stadium or other venue that—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H90432DE101D1450E9BD903E47BD3162A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    has previously hosted events qualifying for the application of special security instructions in accordance with section 521 of the Transportation, Treasury, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 2004 (Public Law 108–199); and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H024FD87DF11C41F6B108ABB2D35109D0"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    is not enclosed;
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3AA10A237F954EB985860CDDC139CE91"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 have an estimated attendance of at least 30,000 people; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H4FF539087E634284A4E3F13289791D2D"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 be advertised in the public domain.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HAF862CD76E474F68A9FC0E4211125FCD"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Additional gatherings
                              To be eligible for a temporary flight restriction under this section, large public gatherings hosted in a venue other than a stadium or other venue described in paragraph (1)(A) shall—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H335206E1B72E47F583CF5B15B5C5DCD7"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 have an estimated attendance of at least 100,000 people;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H708B36B1B5C24AE392134C109B0A0C8A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 be primarily outdoors;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H901E7CB1F9F4407DAD88E38DCEE5BB0A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 have a defined and static geographical boundary; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HD9215AD984DF4BDA96FB013536BBF824"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 be advertised in the public domain.
                              
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H262CE7C149A84B67909276140BF426B4"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
