                           Eligible entities
                           An entity eligible to request a temporary flight restriction under subsection (a) shall be a credentialed law enforcement organization of the Federal Government or a State, local, Tribal, or territorial government.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H0C73F7C13EA640DA9C936DA76819EC3B"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (e)
                           Timeliness
                           The Administrator shall make every practicable effort to assess eligibility and establish temporary flight restrictions under subsection (a) in a timely fashion.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H6493FAED525148D99DB33F7A18E24846"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (f)
                           Public information
                           Any temporary flight restriction designated under this section shall be published by the Administrator in a publicly accessible manner at least 2 days prior to the start of the eligible large public gathering.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H2BAFF4EBB04746328DC070196BC36142"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (g)
                           Prohibition on operations
                           No person may operate an unmanned aircraft within a temporary flight restriction established under this section unless—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5DEC1F4735E94B64B0CC8C1CA85615E9"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              the Administrator authorizes the operation for operational or safety purposes; 
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H00DE757A2E38459AA83F24D37D8BCE61"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              the operation is being conducted for safety, security, or compliance oversight purposes and is authorized by the Administrator; or
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HEE02BDC76AEB4A71AABFE2F53207DB44"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              the aircraft operation is conducted with the approval of the eligible entity.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H44E104821F1F440BBED6284446C2F9D7"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (h)
                           Savings clause
                           Nothing in this section may be construed as prohibiting the Administrator from authorizing the operation of an aircraft, including an unmanned aircraft system, over, under, or within a specified distance from an eligible large public gathering for which a temporary flight restriction has been established under this section or cancelling a temporary flight restriction established under this section.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H92CBC6BA0E1E43DFBE718A8839BFFEBD"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           Rule of construction
                           Nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent the Administrator from using existing processes or procedures to meet the intent of this section.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H54FD42DBA5F948CA8914BDC8EE8F6B49"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HBFFA6755B9CC4280BEF02E2C0022CC74"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        44812. Temporary flight restrictions for unmanned aircraft.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HB41B1280C87A458B88D76D86E092D888"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               936.
               COVERED DRONE PROHIBITION
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDC0372D4D1FB464E9D6BA41288777669"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Prohibitions
                  The Secretary is prohibited from—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBDC7EB8CB65D49288B655F4DD12792E5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     entering into, extending, or renewing a contract or awarding a grant—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H56008CDBF5E441D78227890C553A1104"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        for the operation, procurement, or contracting action with respect to a covered unmanned aircraft system; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD47C8BC32FE84677B0D6D7CF9C87B0AB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        to an entity that operates (as determined by the Administrator) a covered unmanned aircraft system in the performance of such contract;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA096B4257B47458C9C7997A2E58D977B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     issuing a grant to a covered foreign entity for any project related to covered unmanned aircraft systems; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCF3B4C96964741218255511A5203B59F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     operating a covered unmanned aircraft system.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H247FC0C5A84649AEB2F5873E359F433D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Exemptions
                  The Secretary is exempt from any prohibitions under subsection (a) if the grant, operation, procurement, or contracting action is for the purposes of testing, researching, evaluating, analyzing, or training related to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC01986631C4D42ABAAE22A53855FAF9F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     unmanned aircraft detection systems and counter-UAS systems, including activities conducted—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H95F8D060D44943068B60648C31F7CFA4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        under the Alliance for System Safety of UAS through Research Excellence Center of Excellence of the FAA; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAA29E7CFAE1C467B9D6E5ADF75A4D087"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        by the unmanned aircraft system test ranges designated under section 44803 of title 49, United States Code;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2821BE5698644DE686E52FA2F3B3BBED"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the safe, secure, or efficient operation of the national airspace system or maintenance of public safety;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1B5DDC6D81894B7FB5DBB0C71AEA9DC3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the safe integration of advanced aviation technologies into the national airspace system, including activities carried out under the Alliance for System Safety of UAS through Research Excellence Center of Excellence of the FAA;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE10339F16D8E4AB48939054A880D532B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     in coordination with other relevant Federal agencies, determining security threats of covered unmanned aircraft systems; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H888A21EA1CAB4009A423CD82F83BAFF3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     intelligence, electronic warfare, and information warfare operations.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA70166F6C50844A89A0D7C575BDE09EF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Waivers
                  The Secretary may waive any restrictions under subsection (a) on a case-by-case basis by notifying the appropriate committees of Congress in writing, not later than 15 days after waiving such restrictions, that the procurement or other activity is in the public interest.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAC10B9B9B30E4D99963EFB1A07E1E20E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Replacement of certain unmanned aircraft systems
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H09F11A289C694723A57224C7E71DBF47"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Secretary shall take such actions as are necessary to replace any covered unmanned aircraft system that is owned or operated by the Department of Transportation as of the date of enactment of this Act with an unmanned aircraft system manufactured in the United States or an allied country (as such term is defined in section 2350f(d)(1) of title 10, United States Code) if the capabilities of such covered unmanned aircraft system are consequential to the work of the Department or the mission of the Department.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBD7A8CEE69664DDABD9F10B5B72F8BB1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Funding
                     There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary $5,000,000 to carry out this subsection.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H99DE9A899AAF4E8185E41028AB7BEA05"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Effective dates
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA17CD54CC3DE41979A2075FA37FED6E2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Operations
                     The prohibitions under paragraphs (1) and (3) of subsection (a) shall be in effect on the date of enactment of this Act.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCA37662B8F5C41CEBBCA15E9BE715359"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Grants
                     The prohibitions under paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (a) shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6B188199BB1044B08AFAC0C6FE396C52"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        not apply to grants awarded before the date of enactment of this Act; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE3A96975CC134E1E940E50466F1B9A72"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        apply to grants awarded after the date of enactment of this Act.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7FF820690A874B4281E584A9DF8BE6A3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Application of prohibitions
                  The prohibitions under subsection (a) are applicable to all offices and programs of the Department of Transportation, including—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF938238357BC448C963C25CE2822F7BE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     aviation research grant programs;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD14A399C02064475924C5D261CA85D7E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     aviation workforce development programs established under section 625 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0E015C8AABC842B794BD9498A37A60BE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     FAA Air Transportation Centers of Excellence;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAE81517C7B3A4670B780D01D21696BD1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     programs established under sections 631 and 632 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note); and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBA076405121E48C1B809A967291A27F1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     the airport improvement program under subchapter I of chapter 471 of title 49, United States Code.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H02E5DC34C83D46A1ADA737C6B3206BFB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall prevent a State, local, Tribal, or territorial governmental agency from procuring or operating a covered unmanned aircraft system purchased with non-Federal funding.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA5D60209FBDA4DDE87E6E8C79BB9D779"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (h)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA478A573D6994C199670499DE454FAD0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Covered foreign country
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">covered foreign country means any of the following:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H18245BBBEB1548DDAB42669CB9283FD3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        The People’s Republic of China.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7F3717D621CC4EA490E7F6C215B866A1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        The Russian Federation.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC3A0822C31C6415DB367AE695DD71F04"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        The Islamic Republic of Iran.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6FD8750558E64B26B96E1F979211B04C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        The Democratic People’s Republic of Korea.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H375D1C3DFD4F4B38B0F2BE9FCC865042"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        The Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H69799A9C71DE40DAA7DF35AAFDC6A73E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        The Republic of Cuba. 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8C35A3B1C7984F809FB4EF630BE0E670"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (G)
                        Any other country the Secretary determines necessary.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6555CC879C9344D1A3AF58758ED6F030"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Covered foreign entity
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">covered foreign entity means—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H80CCA4A05D2B4CEAA5F88E62A6C31AC9"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        an entity included on the list developed and maintained by the Federal Acquisition Security Council and published in the System for Award Management;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2D22CD03EC55480B8AE71BDF1A8D4373"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        an entity included on the Consolidated Screening List or Entity List as designated by the Secretary of Commerce;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAAE44D2B7F984DAFBE7A572674C69054"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        an entity that is domiciled in, or under the influence or control of, a covered foreign country; or
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6F5F1C300AFF43E39E7016F428DAEC43"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        an entity that is a subsidiary or affiliate of an entity described under subparagraphs (A) through (C).
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H24A2B84BE53E4B0CB176BA66A0B2686A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Covered unmanned aircraft system
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">covered unmanned aircraft system means—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H14C09B3E309E4977834699BC56F78B69"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        a small unmanned aircraft, an unmanned aircraft, and unmanned aircraft system, or the associated elements of such aircraft and aircraft systems related to the collection and transmission of sensitive information (consisting of communication links and the components that control the unmanned aircraft) that enable the operator to operate the aircraft in the National Airspace System which is manufactured or assembled by a covered foreign entity; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5895C8AE2CDF4522A10CC3C2D89AA24A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        an unmanned aircraft detection system or counter-UAS system that is manufactured or assembled by a covered foreign entity. 
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H26E31C4830684F4B85008A4B82916B8C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               937.
               EXPANDING USE OF INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGIES IN THE GULF OF MEXICO
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD87FE488330E40529B5A49E05629C62A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Administrator shall prioritize the authorization of an eligible UAS test range sponsor partnering with an eligible airport authority to achieve the goals specified in subsection (b).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF81D4EDFCF8F41999A4B28B25D20903D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Goals
                  The goals of a partnership authorized pursuant to subsection (a) shall be to test the operations of innovative technologies in both commercial and non-commercial applications, consistent with existing law, to—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC0AED045590049EB86B5C17AAB252159"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     identify challenges associated with aviation operations over large bodies of water;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2DFD1A5742B7445793BABD194DBDE034"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     provide transportation of cargo and passengers to offshore energy infrastructure;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H62764D7738C34D38956436421EF4F4EF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     assess the impacts of operations in saltwater environments; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDF943D72C55F48C6AE2DFCE36D27A158"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     identify the challenges of integrating such technologies in complex airspace, including with commercial rotorcraft; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H35201003F1DF4B4A8E5EDC7915EFBD33"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     identify the differences between coordinating with Federal air traffic control towers and towers operated under the FAA Contract Tower Program.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6B5F9B71D46C41A7A717180C644CCFC7"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Briefing to Congress
                  The Administrator shall provide an annual briefing to the appropriate committees of Congress on the status of the partnership authorized under this section, including detailing any barriers to the commercialization of innovative technologies in the Gulf of Mexico.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1CF6410B590948B69A1A39FBE36FBA53"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC64D764394224C75A9A6C6CB9A2D76E6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Eligible airport authority
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">eligible airport authority means an AIP-eligible airport authority that is—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H70771F6D53E548E5B825ED9AE812B4C3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        located in a state bordering the Gulf of Mexico which does not already contain a UAS Test Range;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H18406980FFEF42D09DD2278C77C693A6"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        has an air traffic control tower operated under the FAA Contract Tower Program;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA6A70A60F1A2436DBBDFE7A333FAC177"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        is located within 60 miles of a port; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFF970B58CC9040209BC1990C8E818446"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        does not have any scheduled passenger airline service as of the date of the enactment of this Act.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2E5D523F5A7A4515BF00D523A2D7AD7F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Innovative technologies
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">innovative technologies means unmanned aircraft systems and powered-lift aircraft.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDFE8E1C988264B0D8A50AF88FC86CABE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     UAS
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">UAS means an unmanned aircraft system. 
                  
               
            
         
         <subtitle id="HF2871AA3759047F482A6AB94B1209819"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            B
            Advanced Air Mobility
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H01F5CB2FC8E74DA491ABF3973914CD8D"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               951.
               DEFINITIONS
               In this subtitle:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H09C5A6446435458C91DC2EF47EE896D0"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Advanced air mobility
                  The terms <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">advanced air mobility and <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">AAM mean a transportation system that is comprised of urban air mobility and regional air mobility using manned or unmanned aircraft.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5E80E032F4F341079A769E922FF439A6"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Powered-lift aircraft
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">powered-lift aircraft has the meaning given the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">powered-lift in section 1.1 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H278E665C11BE44AD9D7AF5E45F001937"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  Regional air mobility
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">regional air mobility means the movement of passengers or property by air between 2 points using an airworthy aircraft that—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H4820BD80FC964C0C8613E8A1EC424DCD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     has advanced technologies, such as distributed propulsion, vertical takeoff and landing, powered lift, nontraditional power systems, or autonomous technologies;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H8BCA73CC1E90419F9A74C4E3ED183FA8"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     has a maximum takeoff weight of greater than 1,320 pounds; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H44E8D9601D574E3A8D39E5F709E8BFC9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     is not urban air mobility.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF64A2569FF9D4DDB9BEE5F35861F83DB"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  Urban air mobility
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">urban air mobility means the movement of passengers or property by air between 2 points in different cities or 2 points within the same city using an airworthy aircraft that—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDB39F35BDDA640C0B6F71B91DB411F0F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     has advanced technologies, such as distributed propulsion, vertical takeoff and landing, powered lift, nontraditional power systems, or autonomous technologies; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAA05C3D8BF124BC89E9CE447256007EB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     has a maximum takeoff weight of greater than 1,320 pounds.
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HAA47DD943F5D4E07AAAD85F40ED21E44"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  Vertiport
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">vertiport means an area of land, water, or a structure used or intended to be used to support the landing, takeoff, taxiing, parking, and storage of powered-lift aircraft or other aircraft that vertiport design and performance standards established by the Administrator can accommodate.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HDEB8EE3FAA7C48F08B1C9BEFD00DA7D2"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               952.
               SENSE OF CONGRESS ON FAA LEADERSHIP IN ADVANCED AIR MOBILITY
               It is the sense of Congress that—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE2B2B00D82014CA38404F4AE1A85FC37"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  the United States should take actions to become a global leader in advanced air mobility; 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6C46D32FF05042F992A39B2D605A2382"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  as such a global leader, the FAA should—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H34CDEE985A88430FACB142E8135B9342"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     prioritize work on the type certification of powered-lift aircraft;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H87D5671ABA1B43BBAAA3768F4D227072"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     publish, in line with stated deadlines, rulemakings and policy necessary to enable commercial operations, such as the Special Federal Aviation Regulation of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Integration of Powered-Lift: Pilot Certification and Operations; Miscellaneous Amendments Related to Rotorcraft and Airplanes, issued on June 14, 2023 (2120-AL72); 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFCB19940350D4190B3C2D335A0B5F86E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     work with global partners to promote acceptance of advanced air mobility products; and 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7CB36BDDEC66433D917DA11E4CC47546"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     leverage the existing aviation system to the greatest extent possible to support advanced air mobility operations; and
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA14CBEF6FB8D4495A3F1C9871106A47A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  the FAA should work with manufacturers, prospective operators of powered-lift aircraft, and other relevant stakeholders to enable the safe entry of such aircraft into the national airspace system.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H2D0F949F53D248198DD9D0DF1B3F4F21"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               953.
               APPLICATION OF NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT CATEGORICAL EXCLUSIONS FOR VERTIPORT PROJECTS
               In considering the environmental impacts of a proposed vertiport project on an airport for purposes of compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.), the Administrator shall—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H6B21196491F5430E868B210D0AFB3BB8"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  apply any applicable categorical exclusions in accordance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) and subchapter A of chapter V of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE187CD24345344C088C63D2B7507723D"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  after consultation with the Council on Environmental Quality, take steps to establish additional categorical exclusions, as appropriate, for vertiports on an airport, in accordance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.) and subchapter A of chapter V of title 40, Code of Federal Regulations.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HD897DD17E49848E3A2C25D007C76F553"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
