                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H36926FBC1EE046AD9B5791B381608AB6"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H02E604A4DE1F479494A1EF68F29695B4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           In general
                           Not later than 30 days
                        
                        ; and
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7E6CE140CC934FD6A975E28739C449ED"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HA8CE36E800B24A90AC9D2A886D84B787"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H538AC13EBA11431BAADA5BD3FF057010"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Considerations for termination of working group
                           In deciding whether to terminate the working group under this subsection, the Secretary, in consultation with the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration, shall consider other interagency coordination activities associated with AAM, or other new or novel users of the national airspace system, that could benefit from continued wider interagency coordination.
                        
                        ; and
                     
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3D9075D5E0CE43518C0710475EFF2A17"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  in subsection (i)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H65C91778414A4B898AA1E444F060384E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">transports people and property by air between two points in the United States using aircraft with advanced technologies, including electric aircraft or electric vertical take-off and landing aircraft, and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">is comprised of urban air mobility and regional air mobility using manned or unmanned aircraft;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H2118A0E8F933464A8C5C3FCE881ECDCA"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (7);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCF400DB5D10046C7BD71EA74E310544D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     by redesignating paragraph (6) as paragraph (9);
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H627EB7CB33CE4E32934556CB1008FD51"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (D)
                     by inserting after paragraph (4) the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HCB97DCF31FC0457BA3AD0D8988CE1E89"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9E61E48513C64131B8F1DB3BBA7E921E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (5)
                           Powered-lift aircraft
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">powered-lift aircraft has the meaning given the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">powered-lift in section 1.1 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEE47527176414DDB9203C0F79AB05BA3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (6)
                           Regional air mobility
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">regional air mobility means the movement of passengers or property by air between 2 points using an airworthy aircraft that—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HECDCAC42F21048B387F0CEE15F56941B"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              has advanced technologies, such as distributed propulsion, vertical take-off and landing, powered-lift, non-traditional power systems, or autonomous technologies;
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H819BBE9B525F4DC0989AD7B8FF29FC89"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              has a maximum takeoff weight of greater than 1,320 pounds; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAED1FB5BD94441489B7CD69C1D13D4B1"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              is not urban air mobility.
                           
                        
                        ;
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HEAFFCA4EEF2C416C8BFC343CA06BEC1D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (E)
                     by inserting after paragraph (7), as so redesignated, the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HC8FB2F1BA1F545379B299995E180BB0E"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5401FEE55E8244D49C4DEB611F1C309C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (8)
                           Urban air mobility
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">urban air mobility means the movement of passengers or property by air between 2 points in different cities or 2 points within the same city using an airworthy aircraft that—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2AFA66D19ADE4F4B95C3BC0D521E6057"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              has advanced technologies, such as distributed propulsion, vertical takeoff and landing, powered lift, nontraditional power systems, or autonomous technologies; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HD56630EBE55545D8AAD507697E88CDCB"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              has a maximum takeoff weight of greater than 1,320 pounds.
                           
                        
                        ; and
                     
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFA52E85F3F834771BE1A113439572AF9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (F)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H9DD0509ED3F347A3B328237ADB387CEB"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAF438339D47A48378E97602539B34B53"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (10)
                           Vertiport
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">vertiport means an area of land, water, or a structure, used or intended to be used to support the landing, take-off, taxiing, parking, and storage of powered lift or other aircraft that vertiport design and performance standards established by the Administrator can accommodate.
                        
                        . 
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC6791EDDFCC340C195CF43E0932B66E4"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               955.
               RULES FOR OPERATION OF POWERED-LIFT AIRCRAFT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H655E3538514C488696D47E4D27BDBAC1"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  SFAR rulemaking
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7342D5B9F11F434A9FD7C2EFFD448009"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 7 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall publish a final rule for the Special Federal Aviation Regulation of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Integration of Powered-Lift: Pilot Certification and Operations; Miscellaneous Amendments Related to Rotorcraft and Airplanes, issued on June 14, 2023 (2120–AL72), establishing procedures for certifying pilots of powered-lift aircraft and providing operational rules for powered-lift aircraft capable of transporting passengers and cargo.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8FCAA0FD53EE4837A602B6492C999315"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Requirements
                     With respect to any powered-lift aircraft type certificated by the Administrator, the regulations established under paragraph (1) shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0AC7BE26754E4F849D280BDCA861C696"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        provide a practical pathway for pilot qualification and operations;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBA800218AA80431890F132EBEFC2983C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        establish performance-based requirements for energy reserves and other range- and endurance-related requirements that reflect the capabilities and intended operations of the aircraft;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H07DD68E59CF94948A20EDD94F726BC42"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        provide for a combination of pilot training requirements, including simulators, to ensure the safe operation of powered-lift aircraft; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H39D9ED08A9F94535BE76831895108B1C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        to the maximum extent practicable, align powered-lift pilot qualifications with section 2.1.1.4 of Annex 1 to the Convention on International Civil Aviation published by the International Civil Aviation Organization.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1F0B358D57F34195837F43800DB9C63F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Considerations
                     In developing the regulations required under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H154639E85EB645279E66687C11FA3E14"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        consider whether to grant an individual with an existing commercial airplane (single- or multi-engine) or helicopter pilot certificate the authority to serve as pilot-in-command of a powered-lift aircraft in commercial operation following the completion of an FAA-approved pilot type rating for such type of aircraft;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2CACEB9504B64CF7993CA005F729DF7A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        consult with the Secretary of Defense with regard to—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H47557A388EC94053A8B40ED3DB2536B0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           the Agility Prime program of the United States Air Force; 
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD885FD47CEA14671982B6C4AE11A627E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           powered-lift aircraft evaluated and deployed for military purposes, including the F–35B program; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC0952330581A433AA5ABC185B0CC3309"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           the commonalities and differences between powered-lift aircraft types and the handling qualities of such aircraft; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7CEE1118BC554DFD98879DA7C2A3400D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        consider the adoption of the recommendations for powered-lift operations, as appropriate, contained in document 10103 of the International Civil Aviation Organization titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Guidance on the Implementation of ICAO Standards and Recommended Practices for Tilt-rotors, published in 2019.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H349133B951CF4249972E56A68FD5BEC3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Interim application of rules and privileges in lieu of rulemaking
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2677DF849B0545BA854D3693D6A0E56E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Beginning 16 months after the date of enactment of this Act, if a final rule has not been published pursuant to subsection (a)—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H58C9FBDBDEEB432EA5FCDD7DB8050712"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the rules in effect on the date that is 16 months after the date of enactment of this Act that apply to the operation and the operator of rotorcraft or fixed-wing aircraft under subchapters F, G, H, and I of chapter 1 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, shall be—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HAFE22B09FD4D4DEDB32723CB514B9CF0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           deemed to apply to—
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H799645C1805E4F44A490102A397E5243"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              the operation of a powered-lift aircraft in the national airspace system; and
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5019DC8FC4EF4D1C9107B3B86E23288E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              the operator of such a powered-lift aircraft; and
                           
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7365AD2469464B539162CFFBCEBD36CC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           applicable, as determined by the operator of an airworthy powered-lift aircraft in consultation with the Administrator, and consistent with sections 91.3 and 91.13 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations; and 
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF92A7ABEE8F54DFD9020EB82AB768961"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        upon the completion of a type rating for a specific powered-lift aircraft, airmen that hold a pilot or instructor certification with airplane category ratings in any class or rotorcraft category ratings in the helicopter class shall be deemed to have privileges of a powered-lift rating for such specific powered-lift aircraft.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H523A3227F8DF4BC7A4871C79F725DD15"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Termination of interim rules and privileges
                     This subsection shall cease to have effect 1 month after the effective date of a final rule issued pursuant to subsection (a).
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7FC54410717A4A0C9206CA3BA6C3734A"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Powered-lift aircraft aviation rulemaking committee
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HEE744894D0984E00BF182768D1DB9462"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 3 years after the date on which the Administrator issues the first certificate to commercially operate a powered-lift aircraft, the Administrator shall establish an aviation rulemaking committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Committee) to provide the Administrator with specific findings and recommendations for, at a minimum, the creation of a standard pathway for the—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1E0049EEB81C4451ABB6F91FD11F0713"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        performance-based certification of powered-lift aircraft;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H80CA1C57A8DF4C00A51E6F9E62AA8FCD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        certification of airmen capable of serving as pilot-in-command of a powered-lift aircraft; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEEE186C2B9AB4000976E237E6DBD33DD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        operation of powered-lift aircraft in commercial service and air transportation.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H96242D3F0A3E46CD94282A0AEA29A1F5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Considerations
                     In providing findings and recommendations under paragraph (1), the Committee shall consider the following:
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H946E3B78CCA9472380FCD581E6A2199F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        Outcome-driven safety objectives to spur innovation and technology adoption and promote the development of performance-based regulations.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBA9B4519483B45A5B042382F57219329"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        Lessons and insights learned from previously published special conditions and other Federal Register notices of airworthiness criteria for powered-lift aircraft.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H103405CA56544D34BDF2A63A3A451586"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        To the maximum extent practicable, aligning powered-lift pilot qualifications with section 2.1.1.4 of Annex 1 to the Convention on International Civil Aviation published by the International Civil Aviation Organization.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H42D8DCC24460412F818CBCFEF11B844D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        The adoption of the recommendations contained in document 10103 of the International Civil Aviation Organization titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Guidance on the Implementation of ICAO Standards and Recommended Practices for Tilt-rotors, published in 2019, as appropriate.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9BAE7E8F0B5A4BEA9505797BF898D54F"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        Practical pathways for pilot qualification and operations.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE2DA3EF628434DD5B24792908EDC2226"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        Performance-based requirements for energy reserves and other range- and endurance-related designs and technologies that reflect the capabilities and intended operations of the aircraft.
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1EAFB3BE858D489F99C195B180C94A61"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (G)
                        A combination of pilot training requirements, including simulators, to ensure the safe operation of powered-lift aircraft.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCEB8E6ECC702416D9306C1F89FCA7E01"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Report
                     The Committee shall submit to the Administrator a report detailing the findings and recommendations of the Committee.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HC8F4D0DC33C74CB4843ACE40BC732F52"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Powered-lift aircraft rulemaking
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA176B893DB14448886254E8D616311C0"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     Not later than 270 days after the date on which the Committee submits the report under subsection (c)(3), the Administrator shall initiate a rulemaking to implement the findings and recommendations of the Committee, as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1296BF9437A945DDB9D18DD395FB1D47"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Requirements
                     In developing the rulemaking under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC5B6FA8E679E4DDA83314FDB380A7CE8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        consult with the Secretary of Defense with regard to methods for pilots to gain proficiency and earn the necessary ratings required to act as a pilot-in-command of powered-lift aircraft;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF795EA100AF942039D46DDFF15D5F2FA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        consider and plan for unmanned and remotely piloted powered-lift aircraft, and the associated elements of such aircraft, through the promulgation of performance-based regulations;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAF73ECCFEC024AF6A0AAE4E31889BBAA"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        consider any information and experience gained from operations and efforts that occur as a result of the Special Federal Aviation Regulation of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">Integration of Powered-Lift: Pilot Certification and Operations; Miscellaneous Amendments Related to Rotorcraft and Airplanes, issued on June 14, 2023 (2120–AL72);
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAD8D0CB987074119A47D6DE20C507EA4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        consider whether to grant an individual with an existing commercial airplane (single- or multi-engine) or helicopter pilot certificate the authority to serve as pilot-in-command of a powered-lift aircraft in commercial operation following the completion of an FAA-approved pilot type rating for such type of aircraft;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAE7A2D7193154385B38FC6870801C75E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        work to harmonize the certification and operational requirements of the FAA with those of civil aviation authorities with bilateral safety agreements in place with the United States, to the extent such harmonization does not negatively impact domestic manufacturers and operators; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HB9152AD0C37B4F7691E8F82F1E426EFB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        consider and plan for the use of alternative fuel types and propulsion methods, including reviewing the performance-based nature of parts 33 and 35 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and any related recommendations provided to the Administrator by the aviation rulemaking advisory committee described in section 956.
                     
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HE031356DDF4042F18957B81B61613FFD"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               956.
               ADVANCED PROPULSION SYSTEMS REGULATIONS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB8766B9BD3684D22BC30B1AA4F0C4146"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall task the Aviation Rulemaking Advisory Committee (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">Committee) to provide the Administrator with specific findings and recommendations for regulations related to the certification and installation of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H763FF675984F4B40847FFBFEE13064F6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     electric engines and propellers;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H07704048517E43058121E70009FD8869"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     hybrid electric engines and propulsion systems;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD78F28F3B8C84FB99C30D6760D73976A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     hydrogen fuel cells;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8062EBAA68B2499EAACFBD90C85819ED"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     hydrogen combustion engines or propulsion systems; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9821ABBD80924BF1A68D793DF0209794"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     other new or novel propulsion mechanisms and methods as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HF7047FE61EBC47BFBEE8D0D5990E6BE8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Considerations
                  In carrying out subsection (a), the Committee shall consider, at a minimum, the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8EE6F1A9B4A84F16A6B0A7994FAFA08B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Outcome-driven safety objectives to spur innovation and technology adoption, and promote the development of performance-based regulations.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6134D902B3E940E897B87C4E0452B44E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Lessons and insights learned from previously published special conditions and other published airworthiness criteria for novel engines, propellers, and aircraft.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3562F11A91C84E018AEC96606D9D2695"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     The requirements of part 33 and part 35 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, any boundaries of applicability for standalone engine type certificates (including highly integrated systems), and the use of technical standards order authorizations.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD4B2F0574E8742BAA17E9155F224C080"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report
                  Not later than 1 year after providing findings and recommendations under subsection (a), the Committee shall submit to the Administrator and the appropriate committees of Congress a report containing such findings and recommendations.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9F6F03A128184BE096BC17F66667C0DA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Briefing
                  Not later than 180 days after the date on which the Committee submits the report under subsection (c), the Administrator shall brief the appropriate committees of Congress regarding plans of the FAA in response to the findings and recommendations contained in the report.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H4A73BDDD183A47A3998231C827310AD4"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               957.
               POWERED-LIFT AIRCRAFT ENTRY INTO SERVICE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8077391B22FC43BE9CD67BEB0EE577ED"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Administrator shall, in consultation with exclusive bargaining representatives of air traffic controllers certified under section 7111 of title 5, United States Code, and any relevant stakeholder as determined appropriate by the Administrator, take such actions as may be necessary to safely integrate powered-lift aircraft into the national airspace system, including in controlled airspace, and learn from any efforts to adopt and update related policy and guidance.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H7E51946D06424AB380753509B5BA278C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Air traffic policies for entry into service
                  Not later than 40 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall update air traffic orders and policies, to the extent necessary, and address air traffic control system challenges in order to allow for—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA1B677EF31D54894968A3CBD862D9561"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the use of existing air traffic procedures, where determined to be safe by the Administrator, by powered-lift aircraft; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2627D6D23CE14D41842F8866A30D9E30"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the approval of letters of agreement between air traffic control system facilities and powered-lift operators and infrastructure operators to minimize the amount of active coordination required for safe recurring powered-lift aircraft operations, as appropriate.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB301203C7DE84AFA8DBB4C14912D1A69"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Long-term air traffic policies
                  Beginning 40 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD877358FC6B646C19741D4F4E9FBB01F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     continue to update air traffic orders and policies to support the operation of powered-lift aircraft;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9AB72317972040AA8D061B11700C7705"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     to the extent necessary, develop powered-lift specific procedures for airports, heliports, and vertiports;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2E42EBBF72BE4187B9D7396BA059781F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     evaluate the human factors impacts on controllers associated with managing powered-lift aircraft operations, consider the impact of additional operations on air traffic controller staffing, and make necessary changes to staffing, procedures, regulations, and orders; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA60DEE42D07E4F41AFA53BF4C4281D3A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     consider the use of third-party service providers to manage increased operations in controlled airspace to support, supplement, and enhance the work of air traffic controllers.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA359181358C1443CA16863F4C22324A1"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               958.
               INFRASTRUCTURE SUPPORTING VERTICAL FLIGHT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H3EA45A1700DB4F8CAEB7D60584D34C49"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Update to design standards
                  The Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H328E9EA3BE8A414E8EE605D3C7817783"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     not later than December 31, 2024, publish an update to the memorandum of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Engineering Brief No. 105, Vertiport Design, issued on September 21, 2022 (EB No. 105);
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA88676CDD6EA46B79065DC37F3008014"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     not later than December 31, 2025, publish a performance-based vertiport design advisory circular; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC397976FDE3A47928DCBB7D2FE4B5685"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     begin the work necessary to update the advisory circular of the FAA titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Heliport Design (Advisory Circular 150/5390) in order to provide performance-based guidance for heliport design, including consideration of alternative fuel and propulsion mechanisms.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H1FC89CCC2B0846A59B0717F421677709"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Engineering brief sunset
                  Upon the publication of an advisory circular pursuant to subsection (a)(2), the Administrator shall cancel the memorandum described in subsection (a)(1).
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H683F68F3EBAF487C80347E56B08E9B94"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Dual use facilities
                  The Administrator shall establish a mechanism by which owners and operators of aviation infrastructure can safely accommodate, or file a notice to accommodate, powered-lift aircraft if such infrastructure meets the safety requirements or guidance of the FAA for such aircraft.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD5D8AB13D75A499FAB9E8C9BB1B49473"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Guidance, forms, and planning
                  The Administrator shall—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE51ADE12FE074735865EA5B09C131133"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, ensure airport district offices of the FAA have sufficient guidance and policy direction regarding the use and applicability of heliport and vertiport design standards of the FAA, and update such guidance routinely;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H33B0AA59EB6D4A62B7BB83C138EC4354"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     determine if updates to FAA Form 7460 and Form 7480 are necessary and update such forms, as appropriate; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2BF926FEC0084995AFE816EDF379648F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     ensure that the methodology and underlying data sources of the Terminal Area Forecast of the FAA include commercial operations conducted by aircraft regardless of propulsion type or fuel type.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA973A21B3BFC4EDA99CFD2D0D609AD5C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               959.
               CHARTING OF AVIATION INFRASTRUCTURE
               The Administrator shall increase efforts to update and keep current the Airport Master Record of the FAA, including by establishing a streamlined process by which the owners and operators of public and private aviation facilities with nontemporary, nonintermittent operations are encouraged to keep the information on such facilities current.
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H744866678A8E4AD8A4A027F96B11D607"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">

                                    display-quotes="yes"

            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H5AE428B184854C0294A26CF28C7265BC"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               961.
               CENTER FOR ADVANCED AVIATION TECHNOLOGIES
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HFBE8E413C34F4ACB83EA30B5433E4ECD"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Plan
                  Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall develop a plan to establish a Center for Advanced Aviation Technologies to support the testing and advancement of new and emerging aviation technologies.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2648EE3D82B549479B9AC133EA3A3E22"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Consultation
                  In developing the plan under subsection (a), the Administrator may consult with the Advanced Air Mobility Working Group established in the Advanced Air Mobility Coordination and Leadership Act (Public Law 117–203), as amended by this Act, and the interagency working group established in section 1042 of this Act.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H38F00BE9E01C418D983C2C444898BD7D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  In developing the plan under subsection (a), the Administrator shall consider as roles and responsibilities for the Center for Advanced Aviation Technologies—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC1B61E0609B0460CA253348361F8E632"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     developing an airspace laboratory and flight demonstration zones to facilitate the safe integration of advanced air mobility aircraft into the national airspace system, with at least 1 such zone to be established within the same geographic region as the Center for Advanced Aviation Technologies and that also has aviation manufacturers with relevant expertise, such as powered-lift;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H92F00AABCED0440DB940393D37BCA827"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     establishing testing corridors for the purposes of validating air traffic requirements for advanced air mobility operations, operational procedures, and performance requirements, with at least 1 such corridor to be established within the same geographic region as the Center for Advanced Aviation Technologies;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF5878443C3584A80BF60F5B37DEB8DB1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     developing and facilitating technology partnerships with, and between, industry, academia, and other government agencies, and supporting such partnerships;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD31F9D0DD7AB466ABF95DC95E89536AF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     identifying new and emerging aviation technologies, innovative aviation concepts, and relevant aviation services, including advanced air mobility, powered-lift aircraft, and other advanced aviation technologies, as determined appropriate by the Administrator; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDFA486C62B1D4C8EBD21CC6FE2683134"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     any other duties, as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8E9DCA9618FD407C8794FFC5800F257F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Submission to congress
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate the plan developed under subsection (a). 
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB1B2F63E068949959B92004BBF56C80E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Center
                  Not later than September 30, 2026, the Administrator shall establish the Center for Advanced Aviation Technologies in accordance with the plan developed under subsection (a). In choosing the location for the Center for Advanced Aviation Technologies, the Administrator shall give preference to a community or region with a strong aeronautical presence, specifically the presence of—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H550110F86C11436AA6DCC769B9063F96"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     a large commercial airport or large air logistics center;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HFD870C6A18C94DAA897200ED7EF1DE78"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     aviation manufacturing with expertise in advanced aviation technologies, such as powered-lift;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE34A6E9699D6460AA1EE9FD9A9F7721B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     existing FAA facilities or offices, such as a Center, Institute, certificate management office, or a regional headquarters; 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2AB1AF5C6A7441AA9DDE054A7F12FDD2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     airspace utilized for advanced aviation technology testing activity, and capable of supporting a wide range of use cases;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3195E7F510234652A1A1F7D2781AFFBF"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     proximity to both rural and urban communities;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA01E27492A7B4169921D1563B807264E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     State, local, or Tribal governments;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H2AA8D3A3D83746BCA516940C9593B495"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     programs to support public-private partnerships for advanced aviation technologies; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H37C70E52FAEC40CFA15C88934938E335"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     academic institutions that offer programs relating to advanced aviation technologies engineering.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD4385B2B8B3F400693D0E5A4E5EC8BFE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Authorization
                  Out of amounts made available under section 106(k) of title 49, United States Code, $35,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028 is authorized to carry out this section.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H294221E304EA4ED5BD4D8190D3AEDB0D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Interaction with other entities
                  The Administrator, in carrying out this section, shall, to the maximum extent practicable, leverage the research and testing capacity and capabilities of the Center of Excellence for Unmanned Aircraft Systems and, as appropriate, the unmanned aircraft test ranges established in section 44803 of title 49, United States Code.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H04E06A4B2761456992672A4480BBEC48"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (h)
                  Savings clauses
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to interfere with any of the following activities:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H42E7A0F893874F22B362A45377BD749A"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     The ongoing activities of the unmanned aircraft test ranges established in section 44803 of title 49, United States Code, to the maximum extent practicable.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H139F9F367F684570A72B9F9BD5B67164"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     The ongoing activities of the William J. Hughes Technical Center for Advanced Aerospace, to the maximum extent practicable.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDD5EC94475D843E9864E0FBA9ADEED6E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     The ongoing activities of the Center of Excellence for Unmanned Aircraft Systems, to the maximum extent practicable.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0B8242C8B2DD4CCEA5BCCB6BF9B43EE5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     The ongoing activities of the Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center, to the maximum extent practicable.
                  
               
            
         
      
      <title id="H317A050DA329475CA401F62039AC6A30"
              qb-display-quote="yes"
              style="OLC">
         X
         RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
         <subtitle id="H07CC5E8A458C4DBE842207AACB98EA54"
                    qb-display-quote="yes"
                    style="OLC">
            A
            General Provisions
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA8458D5488324860BC3C8F1C74873F68"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1001.
               DEFINITIONS
               In this title:
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H916DC34266074CBB9EC845165A5F4053"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  Covered committees of Congress
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">covered committees of Congress means the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate.
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7F1256BE929C4344B88B26872D4D716F"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  NASA
                  The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">NASA means the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H8F3837D31CE84D03929AD5F914D6AD44"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">

                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1003.
               REPORT ON IMPLEMENTATION; FUNDING FOR SAFETY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
               Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit to the covered committees of Congress a report on the allocation of funding pursuant to section 48102 of title 49, United States Code, to the Secretary to conduct civil aviation research and development and to assess the implementation of section 48102(b)(2) of such title.

                      id="HCAEECEE378524D0A9D5457F0769C94AF"

               1005.
               ADVANCED MATERIALS CENTER OF EXCELLENCE ENHANCEMENTS
               Section 44518 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD53C3DCA157D4ECFAB6FE660A259B7A9"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  by striking subsection (a) and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HF2F021230F4B4E80ABBCC54A87B5ABA5"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HEF63F99763B04DF280DF68E4A23F8DB0"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (a)
                        In general
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFFDB4ABC07D64CAD8BD72BC3B7D28B03"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Continued operations
                           The Administrator shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H234C680F85BB475FA1B2DD3AA5EA0B8A"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              continue operation of the Advanced Materials Center of Excellence (referred to in this section as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                         quote-display-start="auto"
                                         quote-type="text">Center); and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H5C61FB4F8356455F857AC54AE344B098"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              make a determination on whether to award a grant to the Center not later than 90 days after the date on which the grants officer of the Federal Aviation Administration recommends a proposal for award of such grant to the Administrator.
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC1F3A22C59194B61B2921B7F392EB714"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Purposes
                           The Center shall—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H8AF77F2A03CD4641986E2C0F7869F3FA"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              focus on applied research and training on the safe use of composites and advanced materials, and related manufacturing practices, in airframe structures; and
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H2D5977FA0BDD4C7F929E5E99E8ACFE69"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              conduct research and development into aircraft structure crash worthiness and passenger safety, as well as address safe and accessible air travel of individuals with a disability (as defined in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation)), including materials required to facilitate safe wheelchair restraint systems on commercial aircraft.
                           
                        
                     
                     ; and
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H30FF99A2D650492D865FCCC6A45F5013"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HE42CE5D67F584E46A5212291E4B95A83"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HC980B15CDAA547F09DB0D60D6D26E4D0"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (b)
                        Responsibilities
                        The Center shall—
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9E356CB3D3EF4B04939D1A25007A1752"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           promote and facilitate collaboration among member universities, academia, the Administration, the commercial aircraft industry, including manufacturers, commercial air carriers, and suppliers, and other appropriate stakeholders for the purposes under subsection (a) and the activities described in paragraphs (2) through (4);
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFBD0CFEA1B41454DBB3E8042F036FF2A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           carry out research and development activities to advance technology, improve engineering practices, and facilitate continuing education in relevant areas of study, which shall include—
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HE0F9680937D54E2BAD0EB2726B67E03E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              all structural materials, including—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HA1B8531EF1914FB38367130F47D487E4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 metallic and non-metallic based additive materials, ceramic materials, carbon fiber polymers, and thermoplastic composites;
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H66A543A8DAF346E09D111FC9347D3189"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 the long-term material and structural behavior of such materials; and
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H99E644AC67F44528A69B6137A2129ED4"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (iii)
                                 evaluating the resiliency and long-term durability of advanced materials in high temperature conditions and in engines for applications in advanced aircraft; and
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HF7517DE167B14B4FAA9D0C798F7F7914"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              structural technologies, such as additive manufacturing, to be used in applications within the commercial aircraft industry, including traditional fixed-wing aircraft, rotorcraft, and emerging aircraft types such as advanced air mobility aircraft; and
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6BA53E0CE1AA450FB7136F8FD1F8C2D8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (3)
                           conduct research activities for the purpose of improving the safety and certification of aviation structures, materials, and additively manufactured aviation products and components; and
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4B39081854DB4BB5A1ADA0417B320F4E"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           conducting research activities to advance the safe movement of all passengers, including individuals with a disability (as defined in section 382.3 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation)), and individuals using personal wheelchairs in flight, that takes into account the modeling, engineering, testing, operating, and training issues significant to all passengers and relevant stakeholders.
                        
                     
                     .

                      id="HB20ED86F9C4447A59B875CBFF4876BE0"

                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1006.
               CENTER OF EXCELLENCE FOR UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6314952F28F047CDBD9DAD8D7A709F8F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H60A31D7DB74D40ED8E61947524F5B7DD"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HCD302F6BB5434A899274231B633A8672"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        44813.
                        CENTER OF EXCELLENCE FOR UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HF373F45D4C334DA0A23D63FD52A53902"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In general
                           The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall continue operation of the Center of Excellence for Unmanned Aircraft Systems (referred to in this section as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Center).
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HB37A1E8A5F58414B875E57BAFD627FA1"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Responsibilities
                           The Center shall carry out the following responsibilities:
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HDEDCD5B76AE7416A9D5A3A45E757BD1E"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Conduct applied research and training on the safe and efficient integration of unmanned aircraft systems and advanced air mobility into the national airspace system.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC292AF3740E04104B5D337493F4C7994"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Promote and facilitate collaboration among academia, the Federal Aviation Administration, Federal agency partners, and industry stakeholders (including manufacturers, operators, service providers, standards development organizations, carriers, and suppliers), with respect to the safe and efficient integration of unmanned aircraft systems and advanced air mobility into the national airspace system.
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HACB2903E548D48A590F9AEFABB288B68"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              Establish goals set to advance technology, improve engineering practices, and facilitate continuing education with respect to the safe and efficient integration of unmanned aircraft systems and advanced air mobility into the national airspace system.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H47BC135B752E4C19974EED594E7CFBD7"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Program participation
                           The Administrator shall ensure the participation in the Center of institutions of higher education (as defined in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001)) and research institutions that provide accredited bachelor’s degree programs in aeronautical sciences that provide pathways to commercial pilot certifications and that include a focus on pilot training for women aviators.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HD210695FE7314C9A9DB088B1964E9B34"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Leveraging of certain capacity and capabilities
                           The Administrator shall, in carrying out research necessary to validate consensus safety standards accepted pursuant to section 44805, to the maximum extent practicable, leverage the research and testing capacity and capabilities of—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HE1F2A06618A94A03BAC4ED8C4BB984E0"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              the Center;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9A8DD0BE633C4FD78CD9BC5FE425DB39"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              the test ranges designated under section 44803;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H692A418D08624A658AE43FF4F5295481"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              existing Federal and non-Federal test ranges and testbeds;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H3D8C49F69FDC4022B8016EA75C01E8F2"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (4)
                              the National Aeronautics and Space Administration; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H701E39079D9649B4A9710CBBBDA13CCF"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (5)
                              the William J. Hughes Technical Center for Advanced Aerospace.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6E56BD81623A4F33916B2DE077179202"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"

                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        44813. Center of Excellence for Unmanned Aircraft Systems.
                     
                     .

               1007.
               ASSURED SAFE CREDENTIALING AUTHORITY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H585B4ED7C1874C6581CA727734D372D4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H7E4E240376CC4F498675BC062111D227"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HF8CE61B245CC407C816667C851A48149"
