                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        44814.
                        ASSURED SAFE CREDENTIALING AUTHORITY
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H5EA6B1A326944F99A1BD548018740D21"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In general
                           Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall establish a credentialing authority for the program of record of the Federal Aviation Administration (referred to in this section as <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">ASSUREd Safe) under the Center of Excellence for Unmanned Aircraft Systems.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HF925D643AD6D4736B05D23B3B539F6B8"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Purposes
                           ASSUREd Safe shall offer services throughout the United States, and to allies and partners of the United States, including—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5B6060FE4B95464BB694CD448DD8CAA6"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              online and in-person standards, education, and testing for the use of unmanned aircraft systems by first responders for emergency and disaster management operations;
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HAB9B0D512CD44C1799C14A48FED864B8"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              uniform communications standards, operational standards, and reporting standards for civilian, military, and international allies and partners; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H11FA32B23F944537A9A1F0B02E50EA7A"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              any other relevant standards development related to operation of unmanned aircraft systems, as determined appropriate by the Administrator.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H65B947ECA4584567B6A7516BE1067B05"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Coordination
                           The Administrator shall ensure that the Center of Excellence for Unmanned Aircraft Systems coordinates with the National Institute of Standards and Technology and the Federal Emergency Management Agency on establishment of ASSUREd Safe, and on any services offered by ASSUREd Safe.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H8DE1E9BCA7804C8FBF71FEF99269E2BA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 448 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HE4C9FB7C40914ABAB8CAAC6C62D034FE"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        44814. ASSUREd Safe credentialing authority.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H3D8DFE489A504F1FA97F3557B574BFFC"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1008.
               CLEEN ENGINE AND AIRFRAME TECHNOLOGY PARTNERSHIP
               Section 47511 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H186C29911D3043AB9EAF99F29A6CE89A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in subsection (a), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">subsonic after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">fuels for civil; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H9B5C3A8DE123487090726619515A974A"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HFB1584F79F7C47A79CF9C5E744D2B4F9"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="H3A58271BDA1145CD9ADC6130DE1101D6"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Selection
                        In carrying out the program, the Administrator may provide that not less than 2 of the cooperative agreements entered into under this section involve the participation of an entity that is a small business concern (as defined in section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632)), provided that the submitted technology proposal of the entity meets, at a minimum, FAA Acquisition Management System requirements and requisite technology readiness levels for entry into the agreement, as determined by the Administrator.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HF35FEB64200A4D05A3467150AE2F38A0"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1009.
               HIGH-SPEED FLIGHT TESTING
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6EE213C04AD94C08993F9E71579F47E2"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  The Administrator, in consultation with the Administrator of NASA, shall establish procedures for the exclusive purposes of developmental and airworthiness testing and demonstration flights, which may include the establishment of high-speed testing corridors in the national airspace system—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6EB79FDA4BFD451F859392BE1479BDBC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     with respect to manufacturers and operators of high-speed aircraft that conduct flights operating with supersonic speed, not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7E48C850DFD0453E8B4C0269E7CCAA20"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     with respect to manufacturers and operators of high-speed aircraft that conduct flights operating with hypersonic speed, not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5ABE82200219410693792F9BD9E027DA"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Areas of testing and demonstration
                  The Administrator shall take action, as appropriate, to ensure flight testing and demonstration flights occur in areas where such flights will not interfere with the safety of other aircraft or the efficient use of airspace in the national airspace system.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBF52C86D258147DC944408C4C35E597F"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  In carrying out subsection (a), the Administrator shall consider—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF0B9CDAB14AD4CDAABD92C6ADF5953D1"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     sections 91.817 and 91.818 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H7477A85BC869455D94D9967D78416C37"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     applications for special flight authorizations for flights operating at supersonic or hypersonic speed, as described in section 91.818 of such title;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HF3429C4CCD9D49099CD38BA579216987"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the environmental impacts of developmental and airworthiness testing operations;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H928969E54B604FE4BCB4124037EC81E2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     requiring applicants to include specification of proposed flight areas;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8C4BD0EE352A4C7FA45FCD3B1CB89575"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     the authorization of flights to and from airports in Class D airspace within 10 nautical miles of oceanic coastline;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBEB5D85CACDD4D24AC52178EE0E1CF0B"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     developing the vertical limits at or above the altitude necessary for safe supersonic and hypersonic operations;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H0F1B2A24E6964A28AECECEF036248ED2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     proponent-provided data regarding the design and operational analysis of the aircraft, as well as data regarding sonic boom overpressures;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA0622779F9FA4EBDAA48368D8F6D3E13"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (8)
                     the safety of the uninvolved public; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9BF2B99487804CAA90216163796D2848"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (9)
                     community outreach, education, and engagement.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDFBFC1367E9741D0AFD51077D836C7FE"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Consultation
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator, in consultation with the Environmental Protection Agency and other stakeholders, shall assess and report to the covered committees of Congress on a means for supporting continued compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4321 et seq.). The Administrator shall seek to enter into an agreement with an appropriate federally funded research and development center, or other independent nonprofit organization that recommends long term solutions for maintaining compliance with such Act for 1 or more over-land or near-land hypersonic and supersonic test areas as established by the Administrator.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6CE56C95B5EA47F8AF1189F0FE49C7A4"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H432805CB6C8E4050B6D15E64FB20731C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     High-speed aircraft
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">high-speed aircraft means an aircraft operating at speeds in excess of Mach 1, including supersonic and hypersonic aircraft. 
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB594FC1E0BEA4A309D8F83F94E95C739"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Hypersonic
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">hypersonic means flights operating at speeds that exceed Mach 5.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE5E8C59A7B6F460482AEBC981912E200"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Supersonic
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">supersonic means flights operating at speeds in excess of Mach 1 but less than Mach 5.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H3E17CAE5EFE844E2BA36705AD87F1BB2"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1010.
               HIGH-SPEED AIRCRAFT PATHWAY TO INTEGRATION STUDY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H72873D2D18504A43A156CB24EC5E9009"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Study
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC0E80A48A2C94A638C5AB8FBF341B465"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Administrator, in consultation with aircraft manufacturers and operators, institutions of higher education (as defined in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001)), the Administrator of NASA, the Secretary of Defense, and any other agencies the Administrator determines appropriate, shall conduct a study assessing actions necessary to facilitate the safe operation and integration of high-speed aircraft into the national airspace system.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HAB89CFF797B04C47A84A1F7DE9923380"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Contents
                     The study conducted under paragraph (1) shall include, at a minimum—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8E82BBF9D52B41C68F79A95841B9CBC5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        an initial assessment of cross-agency equities related to high-speed aircraft technologies and flight;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE15C2719825A4196B4B6001BF7E2CABB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the identification and collection of data required to develop certification, flight standards, and air traffic requirements for the deployment and integration of high-speed aircraft;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HFB0271E68C0C42F2A2493A6FFD6C80E8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        the development of a framework and potential timeline to establish the appropriate regulatory requirements for conducting high-speed aircraft flights;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HBF2567F295304F8BABD35365E3043479"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        strategic plans to improve the FAA’s state of preparedness and response capability in advance of receiving applications to conduct high-speed aircraft flights; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCFC81E803C1748E09504BAF4407C6FC1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        a survey of global high-speed aircraft-related regulatory and testing developments or activities.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H158362350F8048D982F4FD6E7479220D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Considerations
                     In conducting the study under paragraph (1), the Administrator may consider—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF62A4D9E19654BB68956C0D441C8425D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        feedback and input reflecting the technical expertise of the aerospace industry and other stakeholders, as the Administrator determines appropriate, to inform future development of policies, regulations, and standards that enable the safe operation and integration of high-speed aircraft into the national airspace system;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H3B512B8E0F0F45A28876A20A7E08E7C5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        opportunities for—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H775D3092942441A092FA467A1B77A87B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           demonstrating United States global leadership in high-speed aircraft and related technologies; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6AD80A150804433A8A64E2E45B220494"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           strengthening global harmonization in aeronautics including in the development of international policies relating to the safe operation of high-speed aircraft; and
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H86DA54D02D56425BBFA0A58415A8DEEF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        methods and opportunities for community outreach, education, and engagement.
                     
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H90E9A7763C1D41BEBF8653BCF05BD3EB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Report
                  Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the covered committees of Congress and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report on the results of the study conducted under subsection (a) and recommendations, if appropriate, to facilitate the safe operation and integration of high-speed aircraft into the national airspace system.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H00F9EA67474A48C49B85623605E02343"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5A68DAEA283C45218245FA4CD5F03D43"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     High-speed aircraft
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">high-speed aircraft means an aircraft operating at speeds in excess of Mach 1, including supersonic and hypersonic aircraft.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA1D5A6BF7C644E51B7E913A3EAEF9F53"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Hypersonic
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">hypersonic means flights operating at speeds that exceed Mach 5.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA7D3DB34FEB944848D794606ECB0EA70"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Supersonic
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">supersonic means flights operating at speeds in excess of Mach 1 but less than Mach 5.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HDE73318E5F884C19995C96C76B398A94"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1011.
               OPERATING HIGH-SPEED FLIGHTS IN HIGH ALTITUDE CLASS E AIRSPACE
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB11CB7C59D394858AF3DBC5F1CA8EE43"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  Research
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator, in consultation with the Administrator of NASA and any other relevant stakeholders the Administrator determines appropriate, including industry and academia, shall undertake research to identify, to the maximum extent practicable, the minimum altitude above the upper boundary of Class A airspace, at or above which flights operating with speeds above Mach 1 generate sonic booms that do not produce appreciable sonic boom overpressures that reach the surface under prevailing atmospheric conditions.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HAC7AF5D510B14EF9BD9814ECEB10167C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Hypersonic defined
                  In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">hypersonic means a flight operating at speeds that exceed Mach 5.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H8FF8A21BBE6E450CB743AD5316088ECC"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1012.
               ELECTRIC PROPULSION AIRCRAFT OPERATIONS STUDY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H63670273A04043F88692250449B26910"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall initiate a study assessing the safe and scalable operation and integration of electric aircraft into the national airspace system.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H096DE43017C34E308CBE94E16C910B12"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Contents
                  In conducting the study required under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall address—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA2CC2A1779D54B6C8B32D7F40A022490"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     identification of the workforce technical capacity and competencies needed for the Administrator to certify aircraft systems specific to electric aircraft;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5E2857E903AC4795AC3CAF7EB782F2C5"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the data development and collection required to develop standards specific to electric aircraft;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCFE01DDA450E4CD0A0CF5AE43B964564"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the regulatory standards and guidance material needed to facilitate the safe operation and maintenance of electric aircraft, including—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEA0F127C587945EDA7448C77699339FD"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        fire protection;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HC1B55D7ED8E34226BE07E1163447DABE"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        high voltage electromagnetic environments;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H33DFEBC212444D9E92294CF11C3FBD0D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        engine and human machine interfaces;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6084632D03594C51B254954E13F1C1B4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        reliability of high voltage components and insulation;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5BC9245D92E94F5EAE606B0A0512EB52"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        lithium batteries for propulsion use;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H93F015F19E1F427D88F01552507C67ED"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        operating and pilot qualifications; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HA5FC5AA410C747AEB9F45DE821725BA0"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (G)
                        airspace integration;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDD41FD7D69FB4F9B884EFE78862E0259"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     the airport infrastructure requirements to support electric aircraft operations, including an assessment of—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2F312561CE0449599E94E7961802F286"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the capabilities of airport infrastructure, including, to the extent practicable, the capabilities and capacity of the electrical power grid of the United States to support such operations, including cost, challenges, and opportunities for clean generation of electricity relating to such support, existing as of the date of enactment of this Act;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H1B989A05AC4C41B0A2C9A8A5A5ADAFA4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        aircraft operations specifications;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H34209EAD0DE94A3B87D1AADB73FC137A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        projected operations demand by carriers and other operators;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H50027F188D13456BA759825C4ECB87FB"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        potential modifications to existing airport infrastructure;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H332EE3EAA13D454781AF0DF21FD904A3"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        additional investments in new infrastructure and systems required to meet operations demand; 
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H70EDB40F2D284EB7AB624A31E737CB1C"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        management of infrastructure relating to hazardous materials used in hybrid and electric propulsion; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0A33D3FD79DA44E6BA218F6A417D2819"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (G)
                        ability of such current and future airport infrastructure capabilities to adapt to meet the evolving needs of electric aircraft operations; and
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H167DD7EDBBA040DAA2E8F610839C8A9E"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     varying types of electric aircraft, including advanced air mobility aircraft and small or regional passenger or cargo aircraft.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE5790A585F1648E780B5A03C829ABB3E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  In conducting the study under subsection (a), the Comptroller General may consider the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H155F5C9123ED4FF5B709EEBC8AF44C9C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     The potential for improvements to air service connectivity for communities through the deployment of electric aircraft operations, including by—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H2387974148FE4599BDA34DC8D8E1AF72"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        establishing routes to small and rural communities; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H03C8B477DB844FF999C75E856E728D52"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        introducing alternative modes of transportation for multimodal operations within communities.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA1323691A82A46BDA4A5B68AFF56DE79"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Impacts to airport-adjacent communities, including implications due to changes in airspace utilization and land use compatibility.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H846C0B7CDE6C4AB1AA9E2C976F260592"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Report to Congress
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall submit to the covered committees of Congress and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report on the results of the study conducted under subsection (a) and recommendations for such legislation and administrative action as the Comptroller General determines appropriate.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H93C256B90D654FF9BD798E2CD4A15ABB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (e)
                  Definitions
                  In this section:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB256FCA140F743FF8ECF1A6ABD2BA6BB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Electric aircraft
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">electric aircraft means an aircraft with a fully electric or hybrid electric driven propulsion system used for flight.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6A7966090424481890E907220D2C0FBC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Advanced air mobility
                     The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">advanced air mobility means a transportation system that transports passengers and cargo by air between two points in the United States using aircraft with advanced technologies, including aircraft with hybrid or electric vertical take-off and landing capabilities, in both controlled and uncontrolled airspace.
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HC60CDF78EFA146C1952277423815D17C"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1013.
               CONTRACT WEATHER OBSERVERS PROGRAM
               Section 2306 of the FAA Extension, Safety, and Security Act of 2016 (Public Law 114–190; 130 Stat. 641) is amended by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HA37DD21580EC4A6882F8B15F3B6B6821"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H1878A91869F2422091FFE9457A47C203"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Continued use of contract weather observers
                     The Administrator may not discontinue or diminish the contract weather observer program at any airport until September 30, 2028.
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H3C07B88D09A94ED0994F507B29DA6FF9"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1014.
               AIRFIELD PAVEMENT TECHNOLOGY PROGRAM
               Section 744 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–254; 49 U.S.C. 44505 note) is amended to read as follows: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H9B3D78D95A5A468AB2E4868ED3F1AA6C"
                              style="OLC">
                  <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB0F504E00AA64C49871A2035DD3AF682"
                            qb-display-quote="yes"
                            section-type="subsequent-section">
                     744.
                     RESEARCH AND DEPLOYMENT OF CERTAIN AIRFIELD PAVEMENT TECHNOLOGIES
                     Using amounts made available under section 48102(a) of title 49, United States Code, the Secretary may carry out a program for the research and development of airfield pavement technologies under which the Secretary makes grants to, and enters into cooperative agreements with, institutions of higher education (as defined in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001)) and nonprofit organizations that—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HE00EA3A163244E78A0D15FF52711C812"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        research concrete and asphalt pavement technologies that extend the life of airfield pavements;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC942A3CD356641D3900156788E972A62"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        develop sustainability and resiliency guidelines to improve long-term pavement performance;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H6ED8988588684A8EB94CA22433702ADC"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        develop and conduct training with respect to such airfield pavement technologies;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1F29B67561A44726B3177A9E226DA7D0"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        provide for demonstration projects of such airfield pavement technologies; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H65CAB2964B474618AFA25510B8750808"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        promote the latest airfield pavement technologies to aid the development of safer, more cost effective, and more resilient and sustainable airfield pavements.
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H252AF0DED9F64582BC1EAB828FDFE7B0"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1015.
               REVIEW OF FAA MANAGEMENT OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H2F1770A1CF24467EAF3960AB2746498C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall conduct a review of the management of research and development activities of the FAA, and the insight of the Administrator into, and coordination with, other Federal government research and development activities relating to civil aviation.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9A09AE36522D4CABA021FA56C2E885EB"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Review of FAA management
                  The review of the Comptroller General under subsection (a) shall include an assessment of how the Administrator—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H523A4E4394D7478D96FB6C25D5960D19"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     plans, manages, and tracks progress of research and development projects and activities and how FAA processes and procedures compare with leading practices related to research and development management and collaboration, as determined by the Comptroller General;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H46097F1F90DD4AFC9143F992344EEECB"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     prioritizes research and development objectives;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H82745DEE33A04A1C8519F3F2D59DB0E3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     applies leading practices related to management of research and development, enhancement of collaboration and cooperation, and minimization of duplication, waste, and inefficiencies, in conducting activities—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H107B2378081E48F0A8896A1381A0BE22"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        among FAA research and development programs;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HAEF09F1E804F48A7B166B4D231DBD130"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        with NASA, including—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD58AC13EDAA14FA7848BAF4179E8C620"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           the extent to which NASA and the FAA leverage each other’s laboratory and testing capabilities, facilities, resources, and subject matter expert personnel in support of aeronautics research and development programs and projects;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H9A1EB6D3EB294D219C59262A00ADEF7F"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           an assessment of—
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HC13D8C6E50D041FE94E6A1B37FED7701"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (I)
                              the fiscal year in which the review is conducted, and the 3 fiscal years prior to such year, of Federal expenditures and any applicable fluctuation in the appropriated funds, for FAA and NASA research and development programs and projects and the impact of any funding changes on agency programs and projects; and
                           
                           <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H9487D3D532064467A0C493FE45ACEF7F"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (II)
                              the extent to which other Federal agencies, industry partners, and research organizations are involved in such programs and projects; and
                           
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD2969E9E24CB4DE0857C3F9C18E15647"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           recommendations, as appropriate, for the improvement of such coordination and collaboration with NASA;
                        
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF1F327F6958D43AA8A07CB1080478077"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        with other relevant Federal agencies;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEBD8369AEFF04FE49706434C714A89F7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        with international partners; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H5E00A0ABE2814DAAA91384B3F2BB2647"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        with academia, research organizations, standards groups, and industry;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCFFEACAA726C493FBFCABF0540D97D0D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     interacts with the private sector, including by examining the extent to which FAA—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HED13425E771B4A65B4947D19DDEBD656"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        takes into account private sector research and development efforts in the management and investment of the research and development activities and investments of the FAA; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HF8107D45EDF24E029CFD4DE6DBF5DCB2"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        assesses the impact of FAA research and development on U.S. private sector aeronautics research and development investments;
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H3449FD0A63A74674BED25B63E4BE71FE"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     transitions the results of research and development projects into operational use;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H69072D0DAC56438DAC8D2604E68A5791"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     has implemented the recommendations in the report issued by the Comptroller General titled <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">Aviation Research and Development issued April 2017 (GAO report 17–372) and the results of the efforts to implement such recommendations; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H9ED46BA83EE94FBDB46BF2C7A9835B46"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (7)
                     can improve management of research and development activities and any recommendations as the Comptroller General determines appropriate based on the results of the review.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HB5598D4633C9442B8EA1991881031042"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Report
                  Not later than 180 days after completing the review under required under subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall submit to the covered committees of Congress—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H06C97B32101C40E8A3DD6B9A54A4F1A9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     a report on such review and relevant findings; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1D34934E17D449E88AADCD056AB09DD9"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     recommendations, including the recommendations developed under paragraphs (3)(B)(iii) and (7) of subsection (b).
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA299E04F82AF45159053712B1E01C35A"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1016.
               RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF FAA’S AERONAUTICAL INFORMATION SYSTEMS MODERNIZATION ACTIVITIES
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H953C7ED54CF54634A50D0B588A1A7710"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Using amounts made available under section 48102(a) of title 49, United States Code, and subject to the availability of appropriations, the Administrator, in coordination with the John A. Volpe National Transportation Systems Center, shall establish a research and development program, not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, to inform the continuous modernization of the aeronautical information systems of the FAA, including—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HA778C37BB6364DF9A1BE9AA5C9BDFB44"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     the Aeronautical Information Management Modernization, including the Notice to Air Missions system of the FAA;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD952AC4019EF409C83AF910E061757E3"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     the Aviation Safety Information Analysis and Sharing system; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8173B13D5BD64E6FA54A3D39625F2E0D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     the Service Difficulty Reporting System.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H9D8FA4328AC54AC4A1AD704A7EE7E04C"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Review and report
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCDCEA43B8EB94F49AA6B46EEC42DEC91"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Review
                     Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall seek to enter into an agreement with a federally funded research and development center to conduct and complete a review of planned and ongoing modernization efforts of the aeronautical information systems of the FAA. Such review shall identify opportunities for additional coordination between the Administrator and the John A. Volpe National Transportation Systems Center to further modernize such systems.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4E1012825A5B40B8A7613EB04064628F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Report
                     Not later than 1 year after the Administrator enters into the agreement with the center under paragraph (1), the Center shall submit to the Administrator, the covered committees of Congress, and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report on the review conducted under paragraph (1) and such recommendations as the Center determines appropriate. 
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H5EBD06B742724899BE07F6D34C54A8A6"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1017.
               CENTER OF EXCELLENCE FOR ALTERNATIVE JET FUELS AND ENVIRONMENT
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA6EB547E66264BB094A7DEC90B48351E"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  
                     Chapter 445 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H74DB41A4661E4650A0E4C52B25600AA5"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H33A8FF7556CC4CC08147A92CA7959D88"
                               qb-display-quote="yes"
                               section-type="subsequent-section">
                        44520.
                        CENTER OF EXCELLENCE FOR ALTERNATIVE JET FUELS AND ENVIRONMENT
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H8FC39C06EDB34B23ACC1630B03F7C089"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (a)
                           In general
                           The Administrator shall continue operation of the Center of Excellence for Alternative Jet Fuels and Environment (in this section referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">Center).
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H5DFBE5D5921849B3B6FFC1E33881E3A4"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (b)
                           Responsibilities
                           The Center shall—
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HB4F2D37B3C9B4A3988A6E4E89B8DBE95"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              focus on research to—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H2D9703DD3D1D446ABA8A63896D515627"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 assist in the development, qualification, and certification of the use of aviation fuel from alternative and renewable sources (such as biomass, next-generation feedstocks, alcohols, organic acids, hydrogen, bioderived chemicals and gaseous carbon) for commercial aircraft;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H3F300A67C585430DBF88540DAFD2C07B"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 assist in informing the safe use of alternative aviation fuels in commercial aircraft that also apply electrified aircraft propulsion systems;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H988FF4A668F04729A2F96348E313A2F0"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 reduce community exposure to civilian aircraft noise and pollutant emissions;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H00D387321196455583E5891A3550CC19"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 inform decision making to support United States leadership on international aviation environmental issues, including the development of domestic and international standards; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="HC7CB6308E4D8414382922757C6E48763"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (E)
                                 improve and expand the scientific understanding of civil aviation noise and pollutant emissions and their impacts, as well as support the development of improved modeling approaches and tools;
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H85EF82CA0B3846B18EC3500266650DA7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              examine the use of novel technologies and other forms of innovation to reduce noise, emissions, and fuel burn in commercial aircraft; and
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H0B537DB1A79046E390FB09FACE0D6B77"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (3)
                              support collaboration with other Federal agencies, industry stakeholders, research institutions, and other relevant entities to accelerate the research, development, testing, evaluation, and demonstration programs and facilitate United States sustainability and competitiveness in aviation.
                           
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="H24819CD3772142E2A3AA7ADE175ADEC7"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (c)
                           Grant authority
                           The Administrator shall carry out the work of the Center through the use of grants or other measures, as determined appropriate by the Administrator pursuant to section 44513, including through interagency agreements and coordination with other Federal agencies.
                        
                        <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                     id="HB2930C1A807944CDB68E8DC280C96A3A"
                                     qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (d)
                           Participation
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H03ECB4169D624B84A218DFDF61BDEB53"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (1)
                              Participation of educational and research institutions
                              In carrying out the responsibilities described in subsection (b), the Center shall include, as appropriate, participation by—
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H466346BA2F2844DE863D52F71070A4F2"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (A)
                                 institutions of higher education and research institutions that—
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HDECEABD4F3174740981CE5E2F31F2B90"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (i)
                                    have existing facilities for research, development, and testing; and
                                 
                                 <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H1AED5728E27B40DA8406AE246286022E"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                                    (ii)
                                    leverage private sector partnerships;
                                 
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H8B30CEB6A1614069B935C2FE4EA43EED"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (B)
                                 other Federal agencies;
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H481533C162E847CF9104EF20FB717A50"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (C)
                                 consortia with experience across the alternative fuels supply chain, including with research, feedstock development and production, small-scale development, testing, and technology evaluation related to the creation, processing, production, and transportation of alternative aviation fuel; and
                              
                              <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                             id="H5B07A3D9B20E47D99C23EF659FE5AF9A"
                                             qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (D)
                                 consortia with experience in innovative technologies to reduce noise, emissions, and fuel burn in commercial aircraft.
                              
                           
                           <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H44F9408DBAD244359584BECFEC8FD4E7"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (2)
                              Use of NASA facilities
                              The Center shall, in consultation with the Administrator of NASA, consider using, on a reimbursable basis, the existing and available capacity in aeronautics research facilities at the Langley Research Center, the NASA John H. Glenn Center at the Neil A. Armstrong Test Facility, and other appropriate facilities of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
                           
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H23568B8DE8494028BEA8276DA63D9792"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Clerical amendment
                  The analysis for chapter 445 of such title, as amended by section 817, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 44519 the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HAB31624B475040A9AD7657A2F1F3D8E6"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        44520. Center of Excellence for Alternative Jet Fuels and Environment.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="H9006931FF7914BC28823904DF0AA4ED9"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1018.
               NEXT GENERATION RADIO ALTIMETERS
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HD313D8495E8F4D578C194771AC5D5497"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  In general
                  Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator, in coordination with the aviation and commercial wireless industries, the National Telecommunications and Information Administration, the Federal Communications Commission, and other relevant government stakeholders, shall carry out an accelerated research and development program to inform the development and testing of the standards and technology necessary to ensure appropriate FAA certification actions and industry production that meets the installation requirements for next generation radio altimeters across all necessary aircraft by January 1, 2028.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HBC715D7C5DF74DC787194D2C4BCAAECF"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Grant program
                  Subject to the availability of appropriations, the Administrator may award grants for the purposes of research and development, testing, and other activities necessary to ensure that next generation radio altimeter technology is developed, tested, certified, and installed on necessary aircraft by 2028, including through public-private partnership grants (which shall include protections for necessary intellectual property with respect to any private sector entity testing, certifying, or producing next generation radio altimeters under the program carried out under this section) with industry to ensure the accelerated production and installation by January 1, 2028.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HE9291D344C2B49949E0845E66768326D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Review and report
                  Not later than 180 days after the enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall submit to the covered committees of Congress and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report on the steps the Administrator has taken as of the date on which such report is submitted and any actions the Administrator plans to take, including as part of the program carried out under this section, to ensure that next generation radio altimeter technology is developed, tested, certified, and installed by 2028.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5440B621D3DB4C15A0820E37237981B8"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Rule of construction
                  Nothing in this section shall be construed to apply to efforts to retrofit the existing supply of altimeters in place as of the date of enactment of this Act.
               
            
            <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                      id="HA2E718CB2ADF4E87B9A0EA5EAE3DA4A2"
                      qb-display-quote="yes"
                      section-type="subsequent-section">
               1019.
               HYDROGEN AVIATION STRATEGY
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDD540A003F344847BF7E897C434A9618"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (a)
                  FAA and Department of Energy leadership on using hydrogen to propel commercial aircraft
                  The Secretary, acting through the Administrator and jointly with the Secretary of Energy, shall exercise leadership in and shall conduct research and development activities relating to enabling the safe use of hydrogen in civil aviation, including the safe and efficient use and sourcing of hydrogen to propel commercial aircraft.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HA3934506A99A47ADA427D8E35903F860"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (b)
                  Research strategy
                  Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator, in consultation with the Administrator of NASA and other relevant Federal agencies, shall complete the development of a research and development strategy on the safe use of hydrogen in civil aviation.
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDEE3FB5863A741439B61C2F0330B614B"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (c)
                  Considerations
                  The strategy developed under subsection (b) shall consider the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD1CA37E63D334E38ADD7C93006E18586"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     The feasibility, opportunities, challenges, and pathways toward the potential and safe uses of hydrogen in civil aviation.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8838232E24E34F45896471CD3012A442"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     The use of hydrogen in addition to electric propulsion to propel commercial aircraft and any related operational efficiencies.
                  
               
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H6A35894795A9459F9AD2C8F8FF83C9A3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (d)
                  Exercise of leadership
                  The Secretary, the Administrator, and the Secretary of Energy shall carry out the research activities consistent with the strategy in subsection (b), and that may include the following:
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H27D303464FF044A89DCC76520454736D"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     Establishing positions and goals for the safe use of hydrogen in civil aviation, including to propel commercial aircraft.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H8D96EC65FBF54997926E91019643C288"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Understanding of the qualification of hydrogen aviation fuel, the safe transition to such fuel for aircraft, the advancement of certification efforts for such fuel, and risk mitigation measures for the use of such fuel in aircraft systems, including propulsion and storage systems.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H662A95CCB8254BA3B7A116A2EBF723E7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Through grant, contract, or interagency agreements, carrying out research and development to understand the contribution that the use of hydrogen would have on civil aviation, including hydrogen as an input for conventional jet fuel, hydrogen fuel cells as a source of electric propulsion, sustainable aviation fuel, and power to liquids or synthetic fuel, and researching ways of accelerating the introduction of hydrogen-propelled aircraft.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HCE398E5885774F62BE5A541253909663"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Reviewing grant eligibility requirements, loans, loan guarantees, and other policies and requirements of the FAA and the Department of Energy to identify ways to increase the safe and efficient use of hydrogen in civil aviation.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H49667FF7CA9149199A6C01982B40CE22"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Considering the needs of the aerospace industry, aviation suppliers, hydrogen producers, airlines, airport sponsors, fixed base operators, and other stakeholders in creating policies that enable the safe use of hydrogen in civil aviation.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE6FB386CB16F4BF5A6C0F702EC5EFBB6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Coordinating with NASA, and obtaining input from the aerospace industry, aviation suppliers, hydrogen producers, airlines, airport sponsors, fixed base operators, academia and other stakeholders regarding—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4C4007C5ED6C43428FF141F61E8EA0D5"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the safe and efficient use of hydrogen in civil aviation, including—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H1812D054D51143D3B519B07103DC76AD"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           updating or modifying existing policies on such use;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H912C3EBC05B84D35998F902F8868E611"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (ii)
                           assessing barriers to, and benefits of, the introduction of hydrogen in civil aviation, including aircraft propelled by hydrogen;
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCF49C7A55D8D4552A46E1931FC4D6DAF"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iii)
                           the operational differences between aircraft propelled by hydrogen and aircraft propelled with other types of fuels; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H181A395F8B8A4655A939CA4AB4A4EF29"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (iv)
                           public, economic, and noise benefits of the operation of commercial aircraft propelled by hydrogen and associated aerospace industry activity; and
