                     Availability
                     Amounts authorized under paragraph (1) shall remain available until expended. 
                  
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H210DAB49D05F43CBA475F34F6A03CE0D"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1203.
            CLARIFICATION OF TREATMENT OF TERRITORIES
            Section 1101 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="H298B63698E2F481F8332EF0981381E42"
                           style="OLC">
               <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HECFEBE6F63444AEE8E5A9176FD3464E2"
                         qb-display-quote="yes"
                         section-type="subsequent-section">
                  1101.
                  DEFINITIONS
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H128AA869553C4DE29BA5D80A6193B296"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (a)
                     In general
                     In this chapter:
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA64D12DB67094958AEE3EE1D6FC18E59"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        Accident
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">accident includes damage to or destruction of vehicles in surface or air transportation or pipelines, regardless of whether the initiating event is accidental or otherwise.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H774730DB6ED0461BB58F014EA36FF001"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        State
                        The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">State means a State of the United States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, American Samoa, the Northern Mariana Islands, and Guam.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H9A8A9E8EA90446BDA03C7F9018B6193D"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (b)
                     Applicability of other definitions
                     Section 2101(23) of title 46 and section 40102(a) of this title shall apply to this chapter.
                  
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H85B2498418CC4692A9428C30AC045DAE"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1204.
            ADDITIONAL WORKFORCE TRAINING
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H40F942CFCF9140F3BC6367DE57817927"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Training on emerging transportation technologies
               Section 1113(b)(1) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                             quote-display-start="auto"

               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HD483E0381D004C77B88D0A1D7FC5A99E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  in subparagraph (J) by striking the period and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">; and; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H3509A14B757B4609912F1F23AAB30069"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (3)
                  by adding at the end the following: 
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H6B574E0B2FE241E09DCA52C1D67525D2"
                                 style="OLC">

                                    id="H1B408ABCD9D447F2B678F53200CB493B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (K)
                        notwithstanding section 3301 of title 41, acquire training on emerging transportation technologies if such training—
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HFFFA27C6ED04422F9C3DCFA31B2317A2"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (i)
                           is required for an ongoing investigation; and
                        
                        <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H3769E9AAB8AB43E69C20F37E381EAF6D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">

                           meets the criteria under section 3304(a)(7)(A) of title 41.
                        
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H7A670F79682143FFA337EA287A1E222D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Additional training needs
               Section 1115(d) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">and in those subjects furthering the personnel and workforce development needs set forth in the strategic workforce plan of the Board as required under section 1113(h) after <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">of accident investigation. 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HF2AF5B75CFBB430085C8977846718D5B"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1205.
            OVERTIME ANNUAL REPORT TERMINATION
             Section 1113(g)(5) of title 49, United States Code, is repealed.
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H6DCD21207E884235A1D150D0B29D380B"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1206.
            STRATEGIC WORKFORCE PLAN
            Section 1113 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="H7D641E521EB44CEA87E3BC0C32917B17"
                           style="OLC">
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H34BA29A03A0043DFB7597ADA888887D3"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (h)
                  Strategic workforce plan
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H1780A002F0B441DD9E3713E9588C22B6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     In general
                     The Board shall develop a strategic workforce plan that addresses the immediate and long-term workforce needs of the Board with respect to carrying out the authorities and duties of the Board under this chapter.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5DCF6B79E55A44BFA394789C355FD9E7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     Aligning the workforce to strategic goals
                     In developing the strategic workforce plan under paragraph (1), the Board shall take into consideration—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H270F5FA565474A2A974DD7F6169D3DE1"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        the current state and capabilities of the Board, including a high-level review of mission requirements, structure, workforce, and performance of the Board;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9F3357465A554321B5C1C535D9058586"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        the significant workforce trends, needs, issues, and challenges with respect to the Board and the transportation industry;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD27B5A1D1AE04F1991E988645F5C3FD8"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (C)
                        with respect to employees involved in transportation safety work, the needs, issues, and challenges, including accident severity and risk, posed by each mode of transportation, and how the Board’s staffing for each transportation mode reflects these aspects;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD81EE3D9DEF641C2909245F59806C755"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (D)
                        the workforce policies, strategies, performance measures, and interventions to mitigate succession risks that guide the workforce investment decisions of the Board;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H6B03A12EC42A4A02BBC9874080E9A10D"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (E)
                        a workforce planning strategy that identifies workforce needs, including the knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to recruit and retain skilled employees at the Board;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H8C200C8EBD4042C8ADDF3CE12C83A259"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (F)
                        a workforce management strategy that is aligned with the mission of the Board, including plans for continuity of leadership and knowledge sharing;
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9DD781D4D04240078AC72DC02819089B"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (G)
                        an implementation system that addresses workforce competency gaps, particularly in mission-critical occupations; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H32D06FB814044F269BDC86CE95579704"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (H)
                        a system for analyzing and evaluating the performance of the Board’s workforce management policies, programs, and activities.
                     
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H4AB2C4FCA51843C6AC1229209B71808F"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     Planning period
                     The strategic workforce plan developed under paragraph (1) shall address a 5-year forecast period, but may include planning for longer periods based on information about emerging technologies or safety trends in transportation.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HB33847243BEE49469F6D4272AB4F4DB4"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (4)
                     Plan updates
                     The Board shall update the strategic workforce plan developed under paragraph (1) not less than once every 5 years.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H6B21DC3E715A49409AEE562CDF07410C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (5)
                     Relationship to strategic plan
                     The strategic workforce plan developed under paragraph (1) may be developed separately from, or incorporated into, the strategic plan required under section 306 of title 5.
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HC5BDEC6A30E24C2784AC8ECEC87173DC"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (6)
                     Availability
                     The strategic workforce plan under paragraph (1) and the strategic plan required under section 306 of title 5 shall be—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HE9359D0FAB4D410391804B5794D750C7"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        submitted to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H9C3DE9A8734A4D88A003133D08A6536A"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        made available to the public on a website of the Board.
                     
                  
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H4A1F06E1243C4BDDACAEA82FD2633A60"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1207.
            TRAVEL BUDGETS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H463DE110FEAE478CA4852554D3A3EDF6"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Section 1113 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by adding at the end the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H0B19AE4C487F4EE589A3F8C3C8DB4FE3"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H05C3AA5F8EA34E658B1D92E7EC3D3228"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (i)
                     Non-accident-related travel budget
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H587BC4E32CBB4507930E217684809C37"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        In general
                        The Board shall establish annual fiscal year budgets for non-accident-related travel expenditures for each Board member.
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HDFDF062847EF42D6B430F0C6CD80DBEB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        Notification
                        The Board shall notify the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate of any non-accident-related travel budget overrun for any Board member not later than 30 days of such overrun becoming known to the Board.
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H58B8955F89384669AF91A2A6762708B1"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Conforming amendment
               Section 9 of the National Transportation Safety Board Amendments Act of 2000 (49 U.S.C. 1113 note) is repealed.
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HFE7CFF24FDEB4639A3F63A70444E5EB5"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1208.
            NOTIFICATION REQUIREMENT
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H8D71E85981FC474B8F4943688534CE2B"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Section 1114(b) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H958A986D119E489385C8438F97F1E8F5"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in the subsection heading by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">
                        Trade secrets
                      and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">
                        Certain confidential information
                     ; and 
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HF7B29DAEAAC749509D19C1254D946392"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  in paragraph (1)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HC8072F8677AD4E818EF44DC02BB1660C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">The Board and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">
                           In general.—The Board; and 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H57002F1AE9C044EE88FFDA72A9943922"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">information related to a trade secret referred to in section 1905 of title 18 and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">confidential information described in section 1905 of title 18, including trade secrets,.
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H6F6C5F9FB9754E1884B2E380E529939A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Aviation enforcement
               Section 1151 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H6E81422786D54695B89F94B54DF3182B"
                              style="OLC">
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="HBFC38C0AF9364820A95C41975E245495"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (d)
                     Notification to Congress
                     If the Board or Attorney General carry out such civil actions described in subsection (a) or (b) of this section against an airman employed at the time of the accident or incident by an air carrier operating under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, the Board shall immediately notify the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate of such civil actions, including—
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HF1A471653DB948C7AF2FF21AA32038CB"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (1)
                        the labor union representing the airman involved, if applicable;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H277817AD19BD46CFB43B8274BB04532B"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (2)
                        the air carrier at which the airman is employed;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA4F14CE00A0D4D3EBEA4AEBFFC448BF9"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (3)
                        the docket information of the incident or accident in which the airman was involved;
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H30115326866C497C800B21B92DC4B00E"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (4)
                        the date of such civil actions taken by the Board or Attorney General; and
                     
                     <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HCC6BD443AE2E4DFF972E1445C2DB390C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (5)
                        a description of why such civil actions were taken by the Board or Attorney General.
                     
                  
                  <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                               id="H055DD5BEEE2348B9B99B1DEE3785E03D"
                               qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (e)
                     Subsequent notification to Congress
                     Not later than 15 days after the notification described in subsection (d), the Board shall submit a report to or brief the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate describing the status of compliance with the civil actions taken.
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HF2C9FA8DD05F4A11BDA07F4ABED5E6DD"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1209.
            BOARD JUSTIFICATION OF CLOSED UNACCEPTABLE RECOMMENDATIONS
            Section 1116(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HBCC15D323E044EB4BDD9350B3B151AC0"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (1)
               by redesignating paragraphs (3) through (6) as paragraphs (4) through (7), respectively; and
            
            <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                        id="HD945D232D02B4C46BC60CD26914E52ED"
                        qb-display-quote="yes">
               (2)
               by inserting after paragraph (2) the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HB9517F5D239843238E2F8D60B4F955F4"
                              style="OLC">
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H5EDEE91C71C64081A134508AE6EBDAB6"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     a list of each recommendation made by the Board to the Secretary of Transportation or the Commandant of the Coast Guard that was closed in an unacceptable status in the preceding 12 months, including—
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HEB2D1983B57447DEA47DE4A39257B187"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (A)
                        any explanation the Board received from the Secretary or Commandant; and
                     
                     <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H0285606BB8A149D3BAF0CE36FB4F49B4"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (B)
                        any explanation from the Board as to why the recommendation was closed in an unacceptable status, including a discussion of why alternate means, if any, taken by the Secretary or Commandant to address the Board’s recommendation were inadequate; 
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H3E0EDA4A8254407D8521B018B28FFE7A"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">

                         qb-display-quote="yes">

               Section 1131(a)(1)(B) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">selects in cooperation with a State and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">selects, concurrent with any State investigation, in which case the Board and the relevant State agencies shall coordinate to ensure both the Board and State agencies have timely access to the information needed to conduct each such investigation, including any criminal and enforcement activities conducted by the relevant State agency.

            1211.
            PUBLIC AVAILABILITY OF ACCIDENT REPORTS
            Section 1131(e) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                       quote-display-start="auto"
                       quote-type="text">public at reasonable cost. and inserting the following:
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="HE5C5989E3BF84DD6A198FECDBEFB87F2"
                           style="OLC">
               public—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5C4C4BE27123454B95B7D94D1772A79B"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  in electronic form at no cost in a publicly accessible database on a website of the Board; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5482F9DE2B02464C9B7C0C2928D158C3"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  if the electronic form required in paragraph (1) is not printable, in printed form upon a reasonable request at a reasonable cost. 
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H9EC8ACD9C1924340A79FC23A2E339496"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1212.
            ENSURING ACCOUNTABILITY FOR TIMELINESS OF REPORTS
            Section 1131 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="HF22981EC7D194498AD6CBC9B57C6A5AE"
                           style="OLC">
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="H5DB3EB8853BE46AAAD8E516FFC2971AC"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (f)
                  Timeliness of reports
                  If any accident report under subsection (e) is not completed within 2 years from the date of the accident, the Board shall submit to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate a report identifying such accident report and the reasons for which such report has not been completed. The Board shall report progress toward completion of the accident report to each such Committees every 90 days thereafter, until such time as the accident report is completed.
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H5E2D95DEAD8543D99B7EBA1AC9DBD3CD"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1213.
            ENSURING ACCESS TO DATA
            Section 1134 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
            <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                           display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           display-quotes="yes"
                           id="HC01AAB7DB0CE4260A5B4C059D89D69DA"
                           style="OLC">
               <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                            id="HDA110E5C361E49248EEEC98CEDBCD94D"
                            qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (g)
                  Recorders and data
                  In investigating an accident under this chapter, the Board may require from a transportation operator or equipment manufacturer or the vendors, suppliers, subsidiaries, or parent companies of such manufacturer, or operator of a product or service which is subject to an investigation by the Board—
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HE9B0192C7A2649C3AEEF65E9F599D3D7"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (1)
                     any recorder or recorded information pertinent to the accident;
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HD772E9380BFD40D7B56C144064AB1422"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (2)
                     without undue delay, information the Board determines necessary to enable the Board to read and interpret any recording device or recorded information pertinent to the accident; and
                  
                  <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="H889D6CD4700A45978B9880BB9BC751E2"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (3)
                     design specifications or data related to the operation and performance of the equipment the Board determines necessary to enable the Board to perform independent physics-based simulations and analyses of the accident situation.
                  
               
               .
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HCF187228C5C84306BCA5417F86F74C64"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"

                                quote-type="text">families; 
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H02FCA5BDEE5344A69FDF5898B7E29BD1"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (4)
                  by amending subsection (d) to read as follows:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H9B54CD514C06475E9B0B305A65383993"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HB4D89383FB0341A7AB82C832E4E9E913"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Passenger lists
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H83CC433D499E41A5BB3C436A308671CF"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Requests for passenger lists by the director of family services
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HDF4084B6F092450D86D9D2004BDD9B59"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Requests by director of family support services
                              It shall be the responsibility of the director of family support services designated for an accident under subsection (a)(1) to request, as soon as practicable, from the air carrier or foreign air carrier involved in the accident a passenger list, which is based on the best available information at the time of the request.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCAB7E1A142214D7194328428EF2CAFE9"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Use of information
                              The director of family support services may not release to any person information on a list obtained under subparagraph (A), except that the director may, to the extent the director considers appropriate, provide information on the list about a passenger to—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="HF869252B65F54DDEBF7A5CABFF1B5E0D"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 the family of the passenger; or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H2F1B6D5EF3BB417793AC1B09FB63BA50"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 a local, Tribal, State, or Federal agency responsible for determining the whereabouts or welfare of a passenger.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H467753461AF74466B2A8D1604C47DCBC"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              Limitation
                              A local, Tribal, State, or Federal agency may not release to any person any information obtained under subparagraph (B)(ii), except if given express authority from the director of family support services.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HFFC86A785092428E806DF289B0A0CF6C"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Rule of construction
                              Nothing in subparagraph (C) shall be construed to preclude a local, Tribal, State, or Federal agency from releasing information that is lawfully obtained through other means independent of releases made by the director of family support services under subparagraph (B).
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H4DB6E2183788482492AF844F71610437"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Requests for passenger lists by designated organization
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HCC82EEFA8D944456A2B0FE72308410A2"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Requests by designated organization
                              The organization designated for an accident under subsection (a)(2) may request from the air carrier or foreign air carrier involved in the accident a passenger list.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HEBBADB12D041409989FDE9DE00569C82"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Use of information
                              The designated organization may not release to any person information on a passenger list but may provide information on the list about a passenger to the family of the passenger to the extent the organization considers appropriate.
                           
                        
                     
                     ; 
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HFE8119FC6E8F40A39D8FB93D453B6118"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  in subsection (g)(1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                             quote-display-start="auto"
                             quote-type="text">the families of passengers involved in the accident and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"

                             quote-type="text">passengers involved in the accident and the families of such passengers;
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)

                         and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"

                     (B)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="HCEAEE3ACCC244D12A16C390B8818101D"

                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                           Passenger list
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">passenger list means a list based on the best available information at the time of a request, of the name of each passenger aboard the aircraft involved in the accident.

            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HEF5D44BBA26B49558A7A52EF498C8F1D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Clerical amendment
               The analysis for chapter 11 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended by striking the item relating to section 1136 and inserting the following: 
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="HC64EEEF2A81A46AF9ED9F03133F0222B"
                              style="OLC">
                  
                     1136. Assistance to passengers involved in aircraft accidents and families of such passengers.
                  
                  .
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"

               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H7D868E22CD2B48169DADBD41E21A679E"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (5)
                  by amending subsection (d) to read as follows:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="HA0E4404E958D4F4AAE0D4949BBD2AD54"
                                 style="OLC">
                     <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                  id="HB17B2E64C1CA47D3B01B73BE81D97628"
                                  qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (d)
                        Passenger lists
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HD3771D4499D34C2A92D2B0197573FFAC"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (1)
                           Requests for passenger lists by the director of family services
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H10BDB2BE1F594AE598D7EB7BADF41951"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Requests by director of family support services
                              It shall be the responsibility of the director of family support services designated for an accident under subsection (a)(1) to request, as soon as practicable, from the rail passenger carrier involved in the accident a passenger list, which is based on the best available information at the time of the request.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HC0A81949BC874DFE9B44CC64B156C556"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Use of information
                              The director of family support services may not release to any person information on a list obtained under subparagraph (A), except that the director may, to the extent the director considers appropriate, provide information on the list about a passenger to—
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H8F2A328FEB7E4B14A2E910F33449EE76"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (i)
                                 the family of the passenger; or
                              
                              <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                       id="H5BD8CC2BD4AF43DE8F10793B32391AF1"
                                       qb-display-quote="yes">
                                 (ii)
                                 a local, Tribal, State, or Federal agency responsible for determining the whereabouts or welfare of a passenger.
                              
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H979BA9544AEF42359B0597DAF3C21E56"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (C)
                              Limitation
                              A local, Tribal, State, or Federal agency may not release to any person any information obtained under subparagraph (B)(ii), except if given express authority from the director of family support services.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="HAB3BCC94C496454092CE2151323CC508"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (D)
                              Rule of construction
                              Nothing in subparagraph (C) shall be construed to preclude a local, Tribal, State, or Federal agency from releasing information that is lawfully obtained through other means independent of releases made by the director of family support services under subparagraph (B).
                           
                        
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="H7D3FEDD8D76A4E2C939D865046793671"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (2)
                           Requests for passenger lists by designated organization
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H43D7312CC3C34F528151B9F877EF0383"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (A)
                              Requests by designated organization
                              The organization designated for an accident under subsection (a)(2) may request from the rail passenger carrier involved in the accident a passenger list.
                           
                           <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                          id="H30884695A64B4B7B9C0BB6AA546D5100"
                                          qb-display-quote="yes">
                              (B)
                              Use of information
                              The designated organization may not release to any person information on a passenger list but may provide information on the list about a passenger to the family of the passenger to the extent the organization considers appropriate.
                           
                        
                     
                     ; 
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H5B1C7BD838DF45D29E51D34266D05940"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (6)
                  in subsection (g)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H08D49ED33AA34294B9C75D77B21DAA4C"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     in paragraph (1) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">the families of passengers involved in the accident and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">passengers involved in the accident and the families of such passengers; and 
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HD8CAAEC6212B4E4F884DA42A5EA00B74"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     in paragraph (3)—
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HDC5F3D9DB16C4B59B1927D361CB1EB63"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (i)
                        in the paragraph heading by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">
                              prevent mental health and counseling
                            and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">
                              prevent certain care and support
                           ; 
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBEA6B5FBA3FA4B48B357E3E706E0773C"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (ii)
                        by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">providing mental health and counseling services and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">providing emotional care, psychological care, and family support services; and
                     
                     <clause display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              id="HBCFDA39291524C52881952C7BDB800AD"
                              qb-display-quote="yes">
                        (iii)
                        by inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                   quote-display-start="auto"
                                   quote-type="text">passengers and before <quote quote-display-end="auto"

                                   quote-type="text">families; and
                     
                  
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H61F5E26541C3418EBE5A46E545EA1ADE"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (7)
                  in subsection (h)—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H52DC2AC9A3514A3F8D21DA0F2631811D"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                quote-display-start="auto"
                                quote-type="text">National Transportation Safety; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="HA057079A502D4820A32EF643AC9273FE"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     by adding at the end the following:
                     <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                    display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    display-quotes="yes"
                                    id="H20A11219ACF84556A3A9A87FADA9F57E"
                                    style="OLC">
                        <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                    id="HCDF4E55397DC4E8E8C589E9E0FFFAD57"
                                    qb-display-quote="yes">
                           (4)
                           Passenger list
                           The term <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                                      quote-display-start="auto"
                                      quote-type="text">passenger list means a list based on the best available information at the time of the request, of the name of each passenger aboard the rail passenger carrier’s train involved in the accident. A rail passenger carrier shall use reasonable efforts, with respect to its unreserved trains, and passengers not holding reservations on its other trains, to ascertain the names of passengers aboard a train involved in an accident.
                        
                        .

               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"

         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H2C2CA6EC55024699A8599185174C284C"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1217.
            ELECTRONIC AVAILABILITY OF PUBLIC DOCKET RECORDS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H2481FE0EBEE74B34A8E62EE19E19600A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 24 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the National Transportation Safety Board shall make all records included in the public docket of an accident or incident investigation conducted by the Board (or the public docket of a study, report, or other product issued by the Board) electronically available in a publicly accessible database on a website of the Board, regardless of the date on which such public docket or record was created.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HAE0C35A3684B4AD98B98561A22A4DDD3"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Database
               In carrying out subsection (a), the Board may utilize the multimodal accident database management system established pursuant to section 1108 of the FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 (49 U.S.C. 1119 note) or such other publicly available database as the Board determines appropriate.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HDE5EC0DCBBF5480591D20DB2B43BB39A"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Briefings
               The Board shall provide the appropriate committees of Congress an annual briefing on the implementation of this section until requirements of subsection (a) are fulfilled. Such briefings shall include—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HA009481DB6004997AC73D7737ACCC129"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  the number of public dockets that have been made electronically available pursuant to this section; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="HE89BAC199C62427D89A70B2C3570C771"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  the number of public dockets that were unable to be made electronically available, including all reasons for such inability.
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H356D8B3479E24405BA50CC974B756320"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (d)
               Definitions
               In this section, the terms <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">public docket and <quote quote-display-end="auto"
                          quote-display-start="auto"
                          quote-type="text">record have the same meanings given such terms in section 801.3 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, as in effect on the date of enactment of this Act. 
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="HE9F35D95377244BC9E8F53B7A28FE3E7"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1218.
            DRUG-FREE WORKPLACE
            Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the National Transportation Safety Board shall implement a drug testing program applicable to Board employees, including employees in safety or security sensitive positions, in accordance with Executive Order No. 12564 (51 Fed. Reg. 32889).
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H0ABCCABB575E47D6AD2831901AF7F731"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1219.
            ACCESSIBILITY IN WORKPLACE
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H8A4FF42E73A44EAA96A39F4B816602B6"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               In general
               Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the National Transportation Safety Board shall conduct an assessment of the headquarters and regional offices of the Board to determine barriers to accessibility to facilities.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="HB80DBBAA99C94AF19AB5F503F48BC4A8"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Contents
               In conducting the assessment under subsection (a), the Board shall consider compliance with—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H79B869C7C365413CA1C592F0948CCE42"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  the Architectural Barriers Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 4151 et seq.) and the corresponding accessibility guidelines established under part 1191 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations; and
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H8A2011B0FFAC478EB51B3F14EA844769"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12101 et seq.).
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H9FF6D844E4794141A23ACB3702162DAB"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">

               The analysis for chapter 11 of title 49, United States Code, is further amended—
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"

                  (2)
                  by inserting after the item relating to section 1116 the following:
                  <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                                 display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 display-quotes="yes"
                                 id="H22C44BD42A4544BBB143021672A8EE0C"
                                 style="OLC">
                     
                        1117. Methodology.
                     
                     .
                  
               
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H331D3DB0264E405196A7E23A9D21531E"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (c)
               Surface transportation board
               The analysis for subtitle II of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to chapter 11 the following:
               <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes"
                              display-inline="no-display-inline"
                              display-quotes="yes"
                              id="H55EF08F4D541473BB380708751BB8B6F"
                              style="OLC">
                  
                     
                        13.
                        Surface Transportation Board
                        1301
                     
                  
                  .
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H72705D109C1E41A490F3A2A310CF1CEF"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1222.
            AIR SAFETY INVESTIGATORS
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H09602B481E0F4A08AD620B35799255D7"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (a)
               Removal of FAA medical certificate requirement
               Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Office of Personnel Management, in consultation with the Administrator and the Chairman of the National Transportation Safety Board, shall take such actions as may be necessary to revise the eligibility requirements for the Air Safety Investigating Series 1815 occupational series (and any similar occupational series relating to transportation accident investigating) to remove any requirement that an individual hold a current medical certificate issued by the Administrator.
            
            <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline"
                         id="H33EE7C348176453BA5FF95036B37AE4D"
                         qb-display-quote="yes">
               (b)
               Updates to other requirements
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H08DE19E40FF545B8BE2C724657069119"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (1)
                  In general
                  Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director, in coordination with the Administrator and Chairman, shall take such actions as may be necessary to update and revise experiential, educational, and other eligibility requirements for the Air Safety Investigating Series 1815 occupational series (and any similar occupational series relating to transportation accident investigating).
               
               <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                           id="H0946C4C0D1D34070AFC80C36FD47A927"
                           qb-display-quote="yes">
                  (2)
                  Considerations
                  In updating the requirements under paragraph (1), the Director shall consider—
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H5EB4A8A04A484F35AADBF28FCBC0EB99"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (A)
                     the direct relationship between any requirement and the duties expected to be performed by the position;
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H0CE550C6841C4C6790529DE44E85FA23"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (B)
                     changes in the skills and tools necessary to perform transportation accident investigations; and
                  
                  <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline"
                                 id="H7433C69753664A68AF5550EDFBFC0E28"
                                 qb-display-quote="yes">
                     (C)
                     such other considerations as the Director, Administrator, or Chairman determines appropriate.
                  
               
            
         
         <section display-inline="no-display-inline"
                   id="H9521EF060C24475F83FFFEBF01F128A6"
                   qb-display-quote="yes"
                   section-type="subsequent-section">
            1223.
            REVIEW OF NATIONAL TRANSPORTATION SAFETY BOARD PROCUREMENTS
            Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General shall, pursuant to section 1138 of title 49, United States Code, submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report regarding the procurement and contracting planning, practices, and policies of the National Transportation Safety Board, including such planning, practices, and policies regarding sole-source contracts.
